Name: U.S.S. Jupiter
Lore: Captained by Satelk. Helped U.S.S. Enterprise defend timeship Premonition from a Borg attack in 2376. Armed with experimental Chain Reaction Pulsar weapon.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam DL/ {Chain Reaction Pulsar}

Name: Betazoid Gift Box
Lore: Traditional device for presenting important gifts. Its sculpted face comes to life boisterously presenting its contents to the recipient.
Text: Immediately look through your draw deck for up to thirty seconds and choose three cards to place in your hand. Reshuffle draw deck and discard artifact.

Name: Horga'hn
Lore: Mysterious symbol of sexuality from the pleasure planet of Risa. To own one is to call forth its powers. To display one is to announce that the owner is seeking jamaharon.
Text: Immediately plays on table. Each turn, gain an additional normal card play OR at end of turn, draw an extra card.

Name: Interphase Generator
Lore: Experimental Romulan device that both cloaks and phases matter, allowing it to pass through normal matter.
Text: Use as Equipment card. Where present, nullifies {Chalnoth}, {Archer}, {Rebel Encounter}, {Impassable Door}, {Phased Matter}, {Crystalline Entity}, {Armus}, and {Nausicaans} dilemmas.

Name: Kurlan Naiskos
Lore: Statues which open to reveal a multitude of similar but smaller figurines inside, representing the belief that each person is a community of individual voices and desires.
Text: Place in hand until played on any ship as an Event card. If ship has all 7 personnel types aboard, its RANGE, WEAPONS and SHIELDS are tripled. (Not cumulative.)

Name: Thought Maker
Lore: Outlawed Ferengi mind control device. Transmits signals that implant sensory experiences and triggers emotions and memories.
Text: Place in hand until played once as an Interrupt card. Look at opponent's draw deck for ten seconds and rearrange as desired.

Name: Time Travel Pod
Lore: Craft from the future, stolen in the past by Berlinghoff Rasmussen for his own gain.
Text: Place in hand until played once as an Interrupt card on any ship. That ship travels into the future (disappears for up to 5 turns). Pre-announce the return time.

Name: Tox Uthat
Lore: Dangerous quantum phase inhibitor invented in the future by Kal Dano who hid it in the 22nd century for safekeeping.
Text: Place in hand until played on table as an event ({supernova} can be played on later turn) OR as an interrupt (prevents {supernova}). Discard after use.

Name: Varon-T Disruptor
Lore: Only five of these pistols were made before being banned by the Federation. These vicious weapons disrupt the body from the inside out, causing a slow and painful death.
Text: Use as Equipment card. Doubles your personnel's STRENGTH where present. (Not cumulative.)

Name: Vulcan Stone of Gol
Lore: Ancient Vulcan telepathic weapon. Kills by magnifying aggressive and violent thoughts, but can be blocked by peaceful thoughts.
Text: Place in hand until played as an Event card. Kills everyone in an Away Team without Youth OR CUNNING>7. Discard artifact.

Name: Alien Abduction
Lore: Solanagen-based aliens, existing in a subspace domain, can access our universe and abduct humanoids for study.
Text: Most CUNNING Away Team member (owner's choice if tie) is held atop mission. Cure with 3 Leadership. Nullified when mission completed.

Name: Alien Parasites
Lore: Intelligent parasites enter and take control of a humanoid. Their presence can be detected by a gill like protrusion on the back of a host's neck.
Text: Unless INTEGRITY>32, Away Team infected. They beam back and opponent immediately controls ship and crew until "stopped." Then turn resumes.

Name: Anaphasic Organism
Lore: A male non-corporeal life-form that lives inside a female host which he enchants, as in the case of Dr. Beverly Crusher's late grandmother.
Text: If Female(s) in Away Team, the one with highest total attribute numbers resigns (is discarded), unless SECURITY and MEDICAL present. Discard dilemma.

Name: Ancient Computer
Lore: Vital information can be retrieved from old or damaged computer systems like this one aboard a derelict Promellian battlecruiser.
Text: Cannot get past unless 2 Computer Skill OR 3 SCIENCE OR 3 ENGINEER present.

Name: Archer
Lore: Indigenous inhabitants, such as this Mintakan bowman, often attack an Away Team out of fear.
Text: Away Team member with highest total attribute numbers is shot and dies unless SECURITY and MEDICAL present. Discard dilemma.

Name: Armus - Skin of Evil
Lore: A malevolent being was formed when the inhabitants of Vagra II rid themselves of all the evil they had inside.
Text: Kills one Away Team member (random selection). Discard dilemma.

Name: Barclay's Protomorphosis Disease
Lore: Contagious affliction which causes animals to de-evolve into ancestral forms. Disease named for Lieutenant Reginald Barclay.
Text: Entire crew or Away Team (except androids) de-evolves (dies) unless MEDICAL, SCIENCE and SECURITY present. Discard dilemma.

Name: Birth of "Junior"
Lore: Large infant spaceborne life-form. Attached itself to the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2368, sucking energy from the ship.
Text: Place on ship. End of each turn, RANGE reduced by 1; if reduced to 0, ship destroyed. Nullify with 3 ENGINEER.

Name: Borg Ship
Lore: Gigantic cubic ship of the Borg collective. Possesses powerful weapons and remarkable regenerative abilities.
Text: Place at furthest spaceline end. End of every turn: Attacks all ships, then moves. Worth points if destroyed in battle.

Name: Chalnoth
Lore: Anarchistic lupine race of humanoids with the reputation of violent responses to a variety of situations.
Text: Kills one Away Team member (opponent's choice) unless 3 SECURITY OR STRENGTH>40 present. Discard dilemma.

Name: Cosmic String Fragment
Lore: A long space object as thin as a proton but with the gravitational attraction of a hundred stars.
Text: Ship is sucked in and destroyed unless Astrophysics OR ENGINEER OR Navigation aboard. Discard dilemma.

Name: Crystalline Entity
Lore: Spaceborne life-form strips biological energy from planets and ships. Sensitive to modulation much like crystal can shatter from a high pitch note.
Text: Space mission: kills all life on ship unless SHIELDS>6 OR Music aboard. Planet mission: kills entire Away Team unless SCIENCE and MEDICAL present. Discard dilemma.

Name: Cytherians
Lore: Race which explores the galaxy by giving other species the temporary ability and strong compulsion to come to them.
Text: Place on ship. Ship must do nothing but travel to far end of spaceline at normal speed. When reached, discard dilemma. Score points.

Name: El-Adrel Creature
Lore: Nearly invisible predatory electromagnetic creature. First encountered by Dathon and Captain Jean-Luc Picard on El-Adrel IV.
Text: Attacks two strongest members in Away Team (owner's choice if tie). Kills one of them (random selection) unless their combined STRENGTH>16. Discard dilemma.

Name: Female's Love Interest
Lore: A genetically-engineered leader. Once romantically involved with Deanna Troi.
Text: Female Away Team member (random selection) runs off with lover to furthest planet. Discard dilemma.

Name: Firestorm
Lore: With advanced technology, personnel can work together to survive natural phenomenon such as the firestorms on Bersallis III.
Text: Kills all Away Team members with INTEGRITY<5 unless {thermal deflectors} present (but Away Team may escape using {Emergency Transporter Armbands}). Discard dilemma.

Name: Gravitic Mine
Lore: Free-floating weapon used against space vehicles. The U.S.S. Denver struck such a mine, which caused it to crash in the Mericor System.
Text: Ship damaged unless SCIENCE and Navigation aboard. Discard dilemma.

Name: Hologram Ruse
Lore: Holograms can be used to create realistic fantasy worlds.
Text: To get past requires INTEGRITY>30 and CUNNING>30.

Name: Hyper-Aging
Lore: Disease created accidentally at the Darwin Genetic Research Station on Gagarin IV. Causes rapid aging and death.
Text: Entire Away Team is quarantined (dies when countdown expires). Cure with SCIENCE and 2 MEDICAL.

Name: Iconian Computer Weapon
Lore: Highly destructive virus from the ancient extinct Iconians. Transmitted to target vessels via a probe.
Text: Unless SCIENCE present, re-boot by discarding all non-personnel cards in hand and replenish from top of draw deck. Discard dilemma.

Name: Impassable Door
Lore: Forcefields across door or hallway openings are commonly used to bar entry.
Text: To get through this door, Away Team must have Computer Skill present.

Name: Ktarian Game
Lore: Psychotropically, mesmerizingly addictive game device. One by one, its players are made susceptible to complete mental control.
Text: Place on ship. Now and start of each of your turns, one person aboard (random selection) is disabled. Cured when non-disabled CUNNING>30 OR android aboard.

Name: Male's Love Interest
Lore: One of the many beautiful women who reside on the paradise planet of Risa.
Text: Male Away Team member (random selection) runs off with lover to furthest planet. Discard dilemma.

Name: Matriarchal Society
Lore: The planet Angel One was dominated by its women who were intolerant of dealing with men.
Text: Cannot get past unless at least two female Away Team members are present.

Name: Menthar Booby Trap
Lore: Relic from ancient Menthar-Promellian war. Aceton assimilators trap passing ships, drain power, then emit deadly radiation.
Text: Place on ship; it cannot move. Unless MEDICAL present, one crew member killed (random selection). Cure with 2 ENGINEER.

Name: Microbiotic Colony
Lore: Rare subatomic spaceborne life-form that can cause severe damage to a starship's hull.
Text: Ship damaged unless SCIENCE, ENGINEER and OFFICER aboard. Discard dilemma.

Name: Microvirus
Lore: Genetic weapon designed to attack humanoids who have specific DNA sequences.
Text: Kills one Away Team member (opponent's choice), unless MEDICAL and SECURITY present. Discard dilemma.

Name: Nagilum
Lore: Extra-dimensional entity willing to kill in order to understand the concept of mortality.
Text: Half of crew is killed (random selection, round down) unless 3 Diplomacy OR STRENGTH>40 aboard. Discard dilemma.

Name: Nanites
Lore: Originally, submicroscopic robots used for medical therapy. Now, self-replicating sentient life-forms who can disable computer systems.
Text: Damages afflicted ship unless 2 SCIENCE OR Diplomacy present. Discard Dilemma.

Name: Nausicaans
Lore: Tall humanoid species with a quick temper. A Nausicaan once stabbed Jean-Luc Picard through the heart with a knife.
Text: Three Nausicaans pick a fight. One Away Team member is killed (random selection) unless STRENGTH>44. Discard dilemma.

Name: Nitrium Metal Parasites
Lore: Microscopic life-forms that normally live in asteroids but can infest and damage ships by ingesting nitrium.
Text: Place on ship. Ship is destroyed when countdown expires. Cure with 2 SCIENCE OR 2 ENGINEER.

Name: Null Space
Lore: A rare, invisible pocket of space caused by turbulence during star formation. Absorbs all energy.
Text: Ship hits null space turbulence and is damaged unless 2 Navigation aboard. Discard dilemma.

Name: Phased Matter
Lore: Phased personnel vibrate out of sync with normal matter, rendering them undetectable. Phased people cannot interact with non-phased people.
Text: Away Team is split into two Away Teams (your choice). Larger team is phased and cannot beam until cured by ENGINEER and SCIENCE in another Away Team on planet.

Name: Portal Guard
Lore: Portal 63 is the last remaining protector of the Tkon Empire, which went extinct 600,000 years ago. Challenges those who awaken him.
Text: Unless at least one Away Team member has CUNNING>7 OR Honor, the entire Away Team must abort mission and beam up or die.

Name: Q
Lore: Incorrigible omnipotent being. Member of the Q Continuum. Q exhibits a child-like petulance and sense of playfulness.
Text: Unless 2 Leadership and INTEGRITY>60, opponent may download up to 2 [Q] cards and place them atop their Q-Continuum side deck; crew or Away Team has a Q-Flash of 4 cards, then is stopped. Discard dilemma.

Name: Radioactive Garbage Scow
Lore: Barges containing dangerous waste can be adrift for centuries. One such barge threatened Gamelon V in 2367.
Text: Place on mission; mission attempt ends. Mission can't be attempted here. Ship with Tractor Beam and 2 ENGINEER can tow Scow.

Name: Rebel Encounter
Lore: Belligerent rebels from war-torn worlds often hide out on other planets and can endanger an Away Team.
Text: Kills one Away Team member (random selection) unless STRENGTH>44 OR you bribe rebels first by discarding an Equipment card, if present. Discard dilemma.

Name: REM Fatigue Hallucinations
Lore: A crew can go insane from lack of REM (rapid eye movement) sleep.
Text: Personnel who encountered dilemma die when countdown expires unless cured by 3 MEDICAL OR boarding your outpost.

Name: Sarjenka
Lore: Alien child from Drema IV. Her radio pleas for help were answered by Lt. Commander Data in violation of the Prime Directive.
Text: Primitive alien begs for help. Ignore her (discard dilemma) OR help her and earn points, but all Away Teams here are "stopped."

Name: Shaka, When the Walls Fell
Lore: Shaka, when the walls fell, means inability to understand. The incomprehensible Tamarians spoke entirely in metaphors.
Text: Must have 2 Diplomacy and CUNNING>30 to communicate and proceed.

Name: Tarellian Plague Ship
Lore: Ship containing the survivors of a Tarellia war plague. Infected from biological weapons, they are now refused entry everywhere.
Text: Entire crew immediately dies from plague unless MEDICAL "beams over" (discarded) to Tarellians. Discard dilemma.

Name: Temporal Causality Loop
Lore: Localized distortion causes time to repeat ad infinitum. U.S.S. Bozeman was trapped for 90 years in a temporal loop that held the U.S.S. Enterprise for 17.4 days.
Text: Unless SCIENCE and CUNNING>35, undo your last two actions of this turn and end turn. Discard dilemma.

Name: Tsiolkovsky Infection
Lore: Variety of water-based Psi 2000 virus. Passed by perspiration. Creates dangerous intoxication-like instability among a crew.
Text: Place aboard ship. It is now infected. Mission continues, but all personnel, while aboard, lose their first-listed skill. Cure with 3 MEDICAL. (Not cumulative.)

Name: Two-Dimensional Creatures
Lore: Perfectly flat spaceborne creatures from a two-dimensional spatial continuum. Ensnared the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2367 and impeded Counselor Deanna Troi's empathic abilities.
Text: Place on ship. Empaths aboard are disabled. Ship can't move until SCIENCE and ENGINEER aboard, discarding dilemma and curing empaths.

Name: Wind Dancer
Lore: Sentry of the Parallax Colony. Only allows those whose hearts are joyous to pass.
Text: To get past, {Lwaxana Troi} must be present OR at least one Away Team member must have: Youth OR Music OR STRENGTH>9.

Name: Engineering Kit
Lore: Representative of specialized engineering instruments. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
Text: Gives all of your OFFICER-classification personnel the extra skill of ENGINEER where present.

Name: Engineering PADD
Lore: Representative of Personal Access Display Devices designed specifically for engineering functions. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
Text: Gives all of your SCIENCE-classification personnel the extra skill of ENGINEER where present.

Name: Federation PADD
Lore: Standard Federation Personal Access Display Device for computerized information.
Text: Federation use only. Each of your personnel CUNNING +2 where present. (Cumulative.)

Name: Klingon Disruptor
Lore: Phase-disruptor used by Klingons and other races. Similar to a phaser.
Text: Klingon and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel STRENGTH +2 where present. (Cumulative.)

Name: Klingon PADD
Lore: Standard Klingon Personal Access Display Device for computerized information.
Text: Klingon use only. Each of your personnel CUNNING +2 where present. (Cumulative.)

Name: Medical Kit
Lore: Representative of specialized medical equipment. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
Text: Gives all of your OFFICER-classification personnel the extra skill of MEDICAL where present.

Name: Medical Tricorder
Lore: Representative of a specialized tricorder optimized for medical use. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
Text: Gives all of your SCIENCE-classification personnel the extra skill of MEDICAL where present.

Name: Romulan Disruptor
Lore: Directed-energy weapon used by Romulans and other races. Disruptor fire can be identified by a high residue of antiprotons that linger for several hours.
Text: Romulan and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel STRENGTH +2 where present. (Cumulative.)

Name: Romulan PADD
Lore: Standard Romulan Personal Access Display Device for computerized information.
Text: Romulan use only. Each of your personnel CUNNING +2 where present. (Cumulative.)

Name: Starfleet Type II Phaser
Lore: Handheld weapon can be set for stun, heat and disruption. PHASER is an acronym for PHASed Energy Rectification.
Text: Federation and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Tricorder
Lore: Representative of a multipurpose handheld device combining sensors, computers, and recorders. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
Text: Gives all of your ENGINEER-classification personnel the extra skill of SCIENCE where present.

Name: Alien Probe
Lore: Space probes of unknown origin are frequently encountered by starships. Often such probes seek information and contact.
Text: Plays on table. Both players continue the game with their hands (cards) exposed, face up on the table.

Name: Anti-Time Anomaly
Lore: Q-created phenomena. Rift caused by anti-time particles in the future. Anomaly grows backward in time endangering all life in the past.
Text: Plays on table. Kills literally ALL personnel in play (both players' cards) at the end of your third full turn, unless anti-time anomaly destroyed first.

Name: Atmospheric Ionization
Lore: Charged particles in the atmosphere of planets which can disrupt transporter beams.
Text: Plays crosswise on any planet location. Maximum of three personnel per turn can be beamed up or down at this location. (Unique.)

Name: Bynars Weapon Enhancement
Lore: Binary race closely integrated with computers. Always work in pairs. Bynars have the ability to enhance specific computerized systems.
Text: Plays on ship. Ship is WEAPONS +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Distortion Field
Lore: Atmospheric phenomena that inhibits use of transporters, as on Nervala IV.
Text: Plays crosswise face up on any planet location. Once each turn, flip card over. While face up, prevents all beaming down/up here. (Unique.)

Name: Espionage: Federation on Klingon
Lore: Federation intelligence-gathering has often relied on sympathetic informants and electronic surveillance.
Text: Plays on any Klingon mission. Your Federation personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

Name: Espionage: Klingon on Federation
Lore: Klingon espionage against the Federation has included data stolen from Relay Station 47 by Morag.
Text: Plays on any Federation mission. Your Klingon personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

Name: Espionage: Romulan on Federation
Lore: Romulan spies are everywhere.
Text: Plays on any Federation mission. Your Romulan personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

Name: Espionage: Romulan on Klingon
Lore: Romulan espionage against Klingons has included efforts to de-stabilize the Klingon government by programming assassins and supporting rebel forces.
Text: Plays on any Klingon mission. Your Romulan personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

Name: Gaps in Normal Space
Lore: Pockets of space, such as those in the Mar Oscura nebula, dangerously phase out when coming in contact with a ship.
Text: Place between two Mission cards. Creates a gap with a span of 4. Ships stopping on the gap kill one personnel (random selection).

Name: Genetronic Replicator
Lore: Medical device invented by Toby Russell. Capable of growing replacements for damaged organs.
Text: Plays on table. When a personnel is targeted to die, you may stop 2 MEDICAL present (who are not also targeted to die) to return that personnel to hand instead.

Name: Goddess of Empathy
Lore: Lt. Reginald Barclay created a fantasy holodeck simulation of Counselor Deanna Troi. Her empathic abilities help other personnel anticipate danger.
Text: Plays on table until the end of your next turn. Neither you nor your opponent can play Interrupt cards (except {Kevin Uxbridge} or {Q2}). Discard after use.

Name: Holo-Projectors
Lore: The hologram projector on Minos is an example of planet-based interactive holographic technology.
Text: Plays on a planet mission. [Holo] cards may exist on this planet.

Name: Kivas Fajo - Collector
Lore: Treacherous collector of rare one-of-a-kind antiquities. Once tried to add Lt. Commander Data to his collection.
Text: Choose any player to immediately draw three new cards from the top of their draw deck. Discard event after use.

Name: Lore Returns
Lore: Data's charismatic android brother. Identical except has more emotional ability. Had a negative effect on Data. Became Borg leader known as The One.
Text: Plays where {Rogue Borg} have eliminated a ship's crew. With Lore, your {Rogue Borg} may now use ship to attack ships and/or beam to battle Away Teams.

Name: Lore's Fingernail
Lore: Circuitry in Lore's finger was used to control and manipulate Lt. Commander Data with emotions.
Text: Plays on table. While in play, all Soong-type androids (including Lt. Cmdr. {Data}) and {Exocomps} lose their affiliation and are non-aligned personnel.

Name: Masaka Transformations
Lore: Masaka attempted to transform the U.S.S. Enterprise into an ancient temple and grounds by rearranging its matter.
Text: Plays on any player. That player must shuffle entire hand, place on bottom of draw deck, then draw the same number of cards from the top. Discard event after use.

Name: Metaphasic Shields
Lore: Revolutionary shields using overlapping subspace fields. Invented by Ferengi Dr. Reyga.
Text: Plays on your ship. SHIELDS +2 for each SCIENCE classification personnel aboard.

Name: Neural Servo Device
Lore: Device which can be used to control a crew by activating pain causing implants.
Text: Plays on any non-aligned ship. Unless 2 SECURITY aboard, use ship and crew for one turn as your own. Discard event.

Name: Nutational Shields
Lore: Nutation adjusts the shield frequency phase rotation, thereby increasing shield efficiency. Used against the Borg in 2367.
Text: Plays on your ship. SHIELDS +2 for each ENGINEER classification personnel aboard.

Name: Pattern Enhancers
Lore: Devices which amplify transporter signals to enhance transporter beam power in hazardous areas.
Text: Plays on table. Allows your personnel and equipment unlimited beaming through {atmospheric ionization} or {distortion fields}.

Name: Plasma Fire
Lore: Intensely hot combustion of ionized plasma gas. Dangerous fire which can destroy a ship.
Text: Plays on any ship, except {Borg ship}. Fire damages ship at end of next turn and continues damaging each turn. SECURITY puts it out. Discard after use.

Name: Q-Net
Lore: Q used an enormous forcefield grid in space to stop the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2364.
Text: Plays between two adjacent spaceline locations. No ship may pass the Q-Net unless 2 Diplomacy aboard.

Name: Raise the Stakes
Lore: Weekly poker game aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise honed the tactical and bluffing skills of many officers.
Text: Your opponent must forfeit the game OR agree the eventual winner may randomly select and keep one card from loser's 60-card deck. (Cumulative.)

Name: Red Alert!
Lore: The state of maximum crew and systems readiness aboard starships.
Text: Plays on table. In place of your normal card play, you may report for duty any number of Ship, Personnel, and Equipment cards.

Name: Res-Q
Lore: Q once saved Captain Jean-Luc Picard's life following an injury from a compressed teryon beam.
Text: Regenerates a card. Exchange this event for any one card from your discard pile.

Name: Spacedock
Lore: Orbital repair and building facility for starships. Such facilities have been developed by many races.
Text: Plays on outpost. Instantly repairs your damaged ships if they stop here. Also repairs non-aligned ships.

Name: Static Warp Bubble
Lore: Dr. Beverly Crusher experienced a shrinking universe, shaped by her own thoughts, inside a static warp bubble created by Ensign Wesley Crusher.
Text: Plays on table. Opponent must discard one card before ending each turn. (Not cumulative.)

Name: Subspace Warp Rift
Lore: Dr. Serova proved in 2370 that disastrous rifts occur in the fabric of space due to the excessive use of warp drive. Discovery led to a Federation-wide speed limit of warp 5.
Text: Plays crosswise on any spaceline location. Any ship passing over here without stopping incurs damage.

Name: Supernova
Lore: The explosion of a star, usually caused by natural processes toward the end of its life cycle.
Text: You must have {Tox Uthat} on table. Place atop any mission. Everything there is destroyed (discarded), but leave Mission card underneath for span reference.

Name: Telepathic Alien Kidnappers
Lore: Unknown aliens abducted Captain Jean-Luc Picard for telepathic studies about authority in 2366.
Text: Plays on table. At end of each turn, guess a card type and point to a card in your opponent's hand. Card must be shown. If guessed correctly, card is discarded.

Name: Tetryon Field
Lore: Intense masses of subspace particles, unstable in normal space, which require ships to route through safe corridors.
Text: Plays crosswise on any spaceline location. All ships must stop here before proceeding on next turn, unless Navigation aboard.

Name: The Traveler: Transcendence
Lore: Benevolent humanoid from Tau Alpha C who could transcend space and time with thought.
Text: Place beside any player's draw deck. That player must draw one extra card at the end of each turn. Also, while in play, nullifies {Static Warp Bubble}. (Not cumulative.)

Name: Treaty: Federation/Klingon
Lore: Past treaties between these powers included the Treaty of Alliance creating mutual aid and defense without intervention.
Text: Plays on table. Your Federation and Klingon affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

Name: Treaty: Federation/Romulan
Lore: Past treaties between these powers include the Treaty of Algeron, which created a neutral zone and outlawed Federation cloaking devices.
Text: Plays on table. Your Federation and Romulan affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

Name: Treaty: Romulan/Klingon
Lore: Historically bitter enemies, these two powers had a brief, failed alliance to share technology around 2268.
Text: Plays on table. Your Romulan and Klingon affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

Name: Warp Core Breach
Lore: In warp propulsion systems, if the magnetic confinement field collapses, matter and antimatter collide causing the ship to explode.
Text: Plays on any ship, except {Borg ship}. Ship explodes at end of owner's next turn, unless ENGINEER aboard by then. Discard after use.

Name: Where No One Has Gone Before
Lore: The Traveler transcends space with thought. Took the U.S.S. Enterprise to Galaxy M-33, then to an even greater extragalactic distance.
Text: Plays on table. Allows all your ships to leave one end of the spaceline and enter the other end.

Name: Federation Outpost
Lore: Earth is a member of the United Federation of Planets. The Federation establishes outposts throughout its territory.
Text: Seed one OR build where you have a Federation ENGINEER.

Name: Klingon Outpost
Lore: The Klingon Homeworld is Qo'noS. The Klingon Empire establishes outposts throughout its territory.
Text: Seed one OR build where you have a Klingon ENGINEER.

Name: Romulan Outpost
Lore: Romulus is one of the two homeworlds for the Romulans. The Romulan Star Empire establishes outposts throughout its territory.
Text: Seed one OR build where you have a Romulan ENGINEER.

Name: Alien Groupie
Lore: Lanel, a Malcorian nurse, agreed to help Commander William T. Riker, but only if he would...
Text: Plays on any Away Team that just completed a planet mission. Female groupie delays beam up of one male (random selection) for one full turn.

Name: Amanda Rogers
Lore: Female Q raised as a human on Earth. Was taken to the Q continuum by Q after she could not resist the benevolent use of her powers.
Text: Nullifies any one Interrupt card just played OR any other card just played as an Interrupt card. (Immune to Amanda Rogers.)

Name: Asteroid Sanctuary
Lore: Hoping to avoid detection by a Romulan Warbird, the U.S.S. Enterprise entered a giant asteroid cavern in 2370.
Text: Plays on any ship. If 2 Navigation aboard, hides ship to prevent any battle initiated against that ship for this turn.

Name: Auto-Destruct Sequence
Lore: Computer controlled self-destruct countdown which can be set by the senior officers aboard a ship.
Text: Plays on your ship. Ship self-destructs at end of your turn. Explosion damages all other ships at same location that have SHIELDS<8.

Name: Crosis
Lore: Fanatical Borg lieutenant of Lore. Captured Lt. Commander Data with the lure of emotions.
Text: Plays on {Rogue Borg}. Doubles their STRENGTH, including himself. Two Borg = 4 STRENGTH each, three Borg = 6 STRENGTH each, etc. (Not cumulative.)

Name: Disruptor Overload
Lore: A directed-energy weapon can be set on overload and left to explode like a bomb.
Text: Plays on any ship or Away Team. Where present, destroys one Equipment card or one card used as an Equipment card (random selection).

Name: Distortion of Space/Time Continuum
Lore: Time effects can be caused by the unusual warping or rifting of space.
Text: Plays on any ship. "Unstops" ship, crew, and ship's Away Teams and restores any of this turn's RANGE already used by that ship.

Name: Emergency Transporter Armbands
Lore: Devices which allow quick remote activation of a transporter when in danger.
Text: Beam your Personnel up or down at any time, except during a dilemma (unless specifically permitted). May be used during battle before the winner is determined.

Name: Energy Vortex
Lore: Whirlpool-like space/time phenomena that can destroy a ship, as it nearly did the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2365.
Text: Plays immediately after opponent plays any non-Interrupt card from hand. That card returns to their hand and a different one must be played instead.

Name: Escape Pod
Lore: Angosian escape pod used by Roga Danar in 2366. Escape pods can be used in an emergency to save a crew.
Text: Plays on ship being destroyed. Escape pod saves entire crew. Unseen by enemy ships, crew remains in pod until personnel rescued. Discard after rescue.

Name: Full Planet Scan
Lore: Sensor instruments can make detailed scans of a planet surface and atmosphere.
Text: Plays at the start of your turn on your ship with at least two staffing icons at a [P] mission. Stop your Computer Skill and Geology aboard to examine the bottom seed card here.

Name: Honor Challenge
Lore: The call to glory inspires the Klingon warrior to maximum fierceness and honor, as symbolized by the Bat'telh championship trophy.
Text: Plays just after an Away Team battle is initiated. Each Klingon with Honor immediately kills one opponent with Treachery. Battle continues.

Name: Hugh
Lore: The Federation named a rescued Borg, Hugh. When he returned, his newly acquired self-aware personality collapsed the Borg collective.
Text: Nullifies attack by {Borg Ship} for this turn OR destroys (discard) all {Rogue Borg} at one location.

Name: Incoming Message - Federation
Lore: Messages and directives are sent, faster than light, on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of relay stations.
Text: Your ship must immediately return to the nearest Federation outpost, full speed. Place on one Federation ship until outpost reached, then discard.

Name: Incoming Message - Klingon
Lore: Messages and directives are sent, faster than light, on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of relay stations.
Text: Your ship must immediately return to the nearest Klingon outpost, full speed. Place on one Klingon ship until outpost reached, then discard.

Name: Incoming Message - Romulan
Lore: Messages and directives are sent, faster than light, on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of relay stations.
Text: Your ship must immediately return to the nearest Romulan outpost, full speed. Place on one Romulan ship until outpost reached, then discard.

Name: Jaglom Shrek - Information Broker
Lore: Yridian dealer of information who uncovered the Romulan prison camp in the Carraya system.
Text: Look at opponent's draw deck for twenty seconds, then replace unshuffled.

Name: Kevin Uxbridge
Lore: Immortal omnipotent being called a Douwd. Lived secretly as a human. Took a human wife who was killed by the Husnocks at Delta Rana IV.
Text: Nullifies any one Event card in play (except for {Treaty} cards) OR any other card played as an Event card. (Immune to {Amanda Rogers}.)

Name: Klingon Death Yell
Lore: Warning for the dead to beware; a Klingon warrior is about to arrive. In Klingon myth, killed warriors with honor go to Sto-Vo-Kor. Dishonored dead go to Gre'thor.
Text: Plays on any just killed Klingon with Honor. Yell to warn the dead and earn bonus points. May play only one death yell for each such Klingon.

Name: Klingon Right of Vengeance
Lore: Under Klingon law, Lieutenant Worf claimed right of vengeance against Duras in 2367.
Text: If any Klingon is killed in an away team battle, all other Klingons present may immediately re-attack with double STRENGTH.

Name: Life-form Scan
Lore: A special form of sensor scan capable of detecting life-forms on planets or in space.
Text: Glance at the cards in your opponent's hand for ten seconds.

Name: Long-Range Scan
Lore: Detects ships and phenomena at interstellar distances using ship sensors.
Text: Glance at the cards aboard any ship for ten seconds.

Name: Loss of Orbital Stability
Lore: If a ship's orbit decays, it can be drawn toward a planet and burn out in its atmosphere.
Text: Plays on any ship orbiting a planet. Ship has NO RANGE until end of turn, and is destroyed at end of its owner's next turn unless SHIELDS>4; then discard interrupt.

Name: Near-Warp Transport
Lore: Physically disconcerting transport at high-speed.
Text: Allows beaming from ship to a neighboring spaceline location. Transport a maximum of six of your personnel and/or your equipment.

Name: Palor Toff: Alien Trader
Lore: Rich merchant and trader from an unknown race. Friend of Kivas Fajo. Snappy dresser.
Text: Once each turn, remove this card from the game to take a card from your discard pile (except a personnel) into your hand.

Name: Particle Fountain
Lore: Experimental orbital station built by Dr. Farallon for mining a planet from space. Rumored to be effective for atmospheric depletion.
Text: If 2 ENGINEER present in Away Team, play particle fountain (maximum of one) on just completed planet mission for bonus points.

Name: Q2
Lore: Member of the Q who observed Q's act of self-sacrifice and re-instated him in the Q continuum.
Text: Nullifies {Amanda Rogers} OR {Kevin Uxbridge} OR a [Q] icon dilemma OR a dilemma with the word "Q" in title.

Name: Rogue Borg Mercenaries
Lore: Upon Hugh's return to the Borg collective, the Borg became self-aware. Soon, many unquestioningly followed their first leader, Lore.
Text: Plays on any occupied ship. Battles crew now and at start of every players' turn. Two Borg =2 STRENGTH each, three =3 each, etc. Surviving Borg remain.

Name: Scan
Lore: Sensor instruments can detect life signs and molecular signatures at a distance with accuracy.
Text: Plays at the start of your turn on your ship with at least two staffing icons at a [S] mission. Stop your Computer Skill and Stellar Cartography aboard to examine the bottom seed card here.

Name: Ship Seizure
Lore: Tractor beams are focused linear graviton beams which can be used to seize or tow objects in space.
Text: If your ship has tractor beams, tow away (discard) any empty ship in the same orbit as your own ship (except empty ships at their outpost).

Name: Subspace Interference
Lore: Disruptions of subspace communications can be caused by nebulae and other phenomena.
Text: Prevents (nullifies) reception of {Incoming Message} OR {Hail} OR {Subspace Schism}. Both cards are discarded.

Name: Subspace Schism
Lore: Solonagen-based aliens from another subspace domain accessed our space to abduct people for experiments.
Text: Plays within five seconds of either players' card draw. That player must discard that card and re-draw.

Name: Tachyon Detection Grid
Lore: Network of active tachyon beams between many ships. Devised by Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge in 2368 to detect cloaked vessels.
Text: Must have at least four of your ships in play to use. Play on any cloaked ship to detect its presence. Ship is forced to de-cloak for rest of turn.

Name: Temporal Rift
Lore: Time displacement caused by ultra high energy explosions such as that which affected the U.S.S. Enterprise-C at Narendra III.
Text: Plays on your ship. Ship disappears. When countdown expires, ship reappears here.

Name: The Devil
Lore: Ardra recreated the human mythical figure the Devil on Ventax II.
Text: Destroys any one {Treaty} card on table OR one {Horga'hn} on table OR one {Wind Dancer}.

Name: The Juggler
Lore: The Juggler hosted Lwaxana Troi and Alexander Rozhenko's visit to the Parallax Colony, all the time juggling his three worlds.
Text: Choose any player to re-shuffle the cards in their draw deck.

Name: Transwarp Conduit
Lore: New Borg technology which creates an artificial subspace tunnel that increases effective warp speed.
Text: Select a ship. It can move double range for this turn.

Name: Vulcan Mindmeld
Lore: Ancient Vulcan ritual which telepathically links minds to intimately share each other's thoughts and knowledge.
Text: Plays on your Mindmeld personnel. Personnel gains the skills of one of your other personnel present until end of turn. Discard interrupt.

Name: Wormhole
Lore: An unstable tunnel through subspace that links to locations in normal space/time.
Text: Requires two wormholes. Play one on your ship. Play the other at any location (even a time location). Ship relocates to that location (and then is "stopped").

Name: Avert Disaster
Lore: Aid project to delay solidification of the planet's core.
Text: Geology + Honor + INTEGRITY>35

Name: Cloaked Mission
Lore: Secretly escort covert operatives to the Romulan homeworld.
Text: Navigation + Diplomacy + Honor

Name: Covert Installation
Lore: Build hidden monitoring station in the Neutral Zone.
Text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Treachery

Name: Covert Rescue
Lore: Retrieve crashed scoutship in Federation territory.
Text: Diplomacy + Leadership + CUNNING>35

Name: Cultural Observation
Lore: Aid observation of primitive society.
Text: Anthropology + Leadership + STRENGTH>30

Name: Diplomacy Mission
Lore: Mediate dispute between civilizations on Peliar Zel's two moons.
Text: Diplomacy + INTEGRITY>30 + CUNNING>30

Name: Evacuation
Lore: Evacuate American Indian colony.
Text: Diplomacy x3 + STRENGTH>35

Name: Evaluate Terraforming
Lore: Evaluate progress of terraforming station.
Text: MEDICAL + Biology + Exobiology OR {Geordi La Forge} + MEDICAL x2

Name: Excavation
Lore: Assist new archaeological dig.
Text: Archaeology OR CUNNING>32

Name: Explore Black Cluster
Lore: Study and evaluate enormous cluster of collapsed proto-stars.
Text: Stellar Cartography + Leadership OR CUNNING>50

Name: Explore Dyson Sphere
Lore: Study gigantic structure completely enclosing a star.
Text: ENGINEER x3 + Navigation + Computer Skill + Physics

Name: Explore Typhon Expanse
Lore: Trace time distortion reported in this desolate region.
Text: Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography OR CUNNING>50

Name: Expose Covert Supply
Lore: Uncover covert supply lines supporting rebels on the Klingon Homeworld.
Text: Treachery x3 + Navigation

Name: Extraction
Lore: Secretly acquire age-reversal drug reportedly under development.
Text: Treachery + Biology + MEDICAL

Name: Fever Emergency
Lore: Coordinate aid for Correllium Fever outbreak.
Text: MEDICAL x3 OR Biology + OFFICER

Name: First Contact
Lore: Make initial contact with advancing civilization.
Text: Diplomacy + Empathy

Name: Hunt for DNA Program
Lore: Seek and secure last strand of DNA program on this desert planet.
Text: Archaeology x3 + Computer Skill + Biology + Leadership + STRENGTH>40

Name: Iconia Investigation
Lore: Investigate Federation incursion in the Neutral Zone.
Text: Archaeology + Computer Skill x2

Name: Investigate "Shattered Space"
Lore: Study fragments of distorted space/time reported in this sector.
Text: Leadership + Computer Skill + Astrophysics x2 + Stellar Cartography

Name: Investigate Alien Probe
Lore: Study and evaluate mysterious probe sighted in this sector.
Text: Anthropology + Biology + Computer Skill

Name: Investigate Anomaly
Lore: Trace radiation anomalies reported at this location.
Text: Exobiology + STRENGTH>35

Name: Investigate Disappearance
Lore: Trace disappearance of a medical transport ship.
Text: Physics + Navigation + CUNNING>40 OR Astrophysics x3

Name: Investigate Disturbance
Lore: Investigate disturbance at Boreth monastery.
Text: Honor + Leadership + INTEGRITY>30 OR {Gowron} + Biology

Name: Investigate Massacre
Lore: Initiate investigation into destruction of distant outpost.
Text: Diplomacy + INTEGRITY>35 + CUNNING>35

Name: Investigate Raid
Lore: Investigate report of Borg attack.
Text: Exobiology + Diplomacy

Name: Investigate Rogue Comet
Lore: Study unusual rogue comet sighted in this sector.
Text: Archaeology + Exobiology + Computer Skill

Name: Investigate Sighting
Lore: Investigate sighting of Gomtuu, an interstellar creature code-named, Tin Man.
Text: Empathy x3 OR Treachery + Exobiology + CUNNING>40

Name: Investigate Time Continuum
Lore: Trace mysterious time-traveling aliens living in a parallel time continuum.
Text: {Guinan} OR {Data} OR {Time Travel Pod}

Name: Khitomer Research
Lore: Reopen investigation into Khitomer massacre.
Text: Honor x3 + Computer Skill + Treachery

Name: Krios Suppression
Lore: Aid suppression of warring factions.
Text: Honor + Diplomacy + STRENGTH>35

Name: Medical Relief
Lore: Respond to reported medical emergency.
Text: Biology + Exobiology + MEDICAL

Name: New Contact
Lore: Seek contact with advanced civilization at this distant planet.
Text: Diplomacy + Leadership + Empathy + Anthropology

Name: Pegasus Search
Lore: Search for U.S.S. Pegasus, reported lost in this sector.
Text: Navigation + Diplomacy + Leadership + Treachery + INTEGRITY>40 OR {Interphase Generator}

Name: Plunder Site
Lore: Search ancient civilization site for treasures or artifacts.
Text: Treachery + Archaeology + STRENGTH>30

Name: Relief Mission
Lore: Alleviate planet of Ice Age conditions following type-C asteroid impact.
Text: Geology OR Physics

Name: Repair Mission
Lore: Investigate malfunction of subspace radio telescope.
Text: ENGINEER x3 + Computer Skill

Name: Restore Errant Moon
Lore: Restore moon knocked off orbit by passage of nearby black hole.
Text: ENGINEER + Astrophysics + Leadership

Name: Sarthong Plunder
Lore: Plunder rich ruins at this famous archaeological site.
Text: Archaeology x2 + STRENGTH>40

Name: Secret Salvage
Lore: Attempt retrieval of floating Federation wreckage at Borg massacre site.
Text: Treachery x4 OR Navigation x2 + Computer Skill

Name: Seek Life-form
Lore: Study new spaceborne life-form reported in this system.
Text: Exobiology + Astrophysics + ENGINEER

Name: Strategic Diversion
Lore: Aid preparations for an offensive invasion.
Text: Treachery x3 + STRENGTH>30

Name: Study "Hole in Space"
Lore: Investigate mysterious void.
Text: Leadership + Diplomacy + INTEGRITY>40

Name: Study Lonka Pulsar
Lore: Research vibrating neutron star.
Text: Navigation + Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography

Name: Study Nebula
Lore: Study and chart nebula.
Text: Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography + CUNNING>40

Name: Study Plasma Streamer
Lore: Study stream of plasma flowing between binary stars.
Text: Astrophysics + Youth

Name: Study Stellar Collision
Lore: Study rare collision between two gas giants.
Text: Stellar Cartography

Name: Survey Mission
Lore: Study and chart dark matter nebula.
Text: Stellar Cartography + Physics

Name: Test Mission
Lore: Provide aid for a helium ignition project attempting to revitalize dying sun.
Text: Physics + INTEGRITY>28

Name: Wormhole Negotiations
Lore: Study and negotiate for exclusive use of Barzan wormhole.
Text: Diplomacy x5 OR Honor x4 OR Treachery x4

Name: Albert Einstein
Lore: Re-creation of the famed 20th century human. Author of the theory of relativity.
Text: SCIENCE Physics x 2 Astrophysics

Name: Alexander Rozhenko
Lore: 3/4 Klingon, 1/4 Human male. Born on the 43rd day of Maktag. Son of Lieutenant Worf and K'Ehleyr.
Text: CIVILIAN Honor Youth

Name: Alidar Jarok
Lore: Conscientious admiral who questioned Romulan policy. Eventually stole a scout ship and defected to the Federation in 2366.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Leadership

Name: Alynna Nechayev
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Admiral; Female; Support Personnel; Vice-Admiral;
Lore: Vice-Admiral Alynna Nechayev is an antagonistic superior of Captain Jean-Luc Picard. Responsible for liaison with the Cardassians and the Maquis.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership

Name: Alyssa Ogawa
Lore: Nurse Alyssa Ogawa is a medical assistant and friend to Dr. Beverly Crusher.
Text: MEDICAL Biology

Name: Amarie
Lore: Four-armed pianist. Information broker. Ex-wife of arms smuggler. Four times widowed. Qualor II lounge performer. Knows Aktuh and Melota. Salt sucker.
Text: CIVILIAN Music

Name: Ba'el
Lore: 1/2 Klingon, 1/2 Romulan. Romantically involved with Lieutenant Worf. Born in Romulan prison camp in Carraya system.
Text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Youth

Name: Baran
Characteristics/ Keywords: Captain; Male; Stone of Gol-related personnel;
Lore: Male captain of a mercenary ship raiding archaeological sites to find the Stone of Gol.
Text: OFFICER Greed Archaeology Exobiology Computer Skill

Name: Batrell
Lore: Klingon trained as an officer for the Klingon Defense Force. Formerly in command of Narendra III outpost.
Text: OFFICER Honor

Name: Benjamin Maxwell
Lore: Captain Benjamin Maxwell of the U.S.S. Phoenix is a bitter enemy of the Cardassians.
Text: OFFICER Leadership

Name: B'Etor
Lore: Plotted with Lursa to seize power from Gowron with the support of the Romulans. Younger of the two Duras sisters. The pretty one.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery Leadership Physics Youth Greed

Name: Beverly Crusher
Lore: Dr. Beverly Crusher is the chief medical officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Dancer and thespian. Widow of Jack Crusher. Mother of Ensign Wesley Crusher.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Biology Exobiology

Name: B'iJik
Lore: Klingon male trained as an officer for the Klingon Defense Force. Served as junior adjutant to the diplomatic delegation for Gowron.
Text: OFFICER Navigation

Name: Bochra
Lore: Centurion serving the Romulan Star Empire. Once marooned on Galorndon Core with Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Youth

Name: Bok
Lore: Former Ferengi DaiMon. Son killed by Captain Jean-Luc Picard in battle. Seeks revenge at all costs.
Text: OFFICER Greed ENGINEER Treachery Computer Skill

Name: Calloway
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Female; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Ensign Calloway is representative of Starfleet medical technicians. Served aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2370.
Text: MEDICAL Youth

Name: Christopher Hobson
Lore: Lt. Commander Christopher Hobson is representative of staff officers in Starfleet. Served aboard the U.S.S. Sutherland in 2368.
Text: OFFICER Computer Skill

Name: Darian Wallace
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Male; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Ensign Darian Wallace is representative of Starfleet security officers. Held numerous positions aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.
Text: SECURITY Anthropology

Name: Data
Lore: Lt. Commander Data is a sentient android created by Dr. Noonien Soong. Has positronic brain. Desires to be human. Once left his head in San Francisco.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Music Astrophysics Exobiology

Name: Deanna Troi
Characteristics/ Keywords: Betazoid/Human; Counselor; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Lt. Commander Deanna Troi is a 1/2 Betazoid, 1/2 Human empath. Counselor for U.S.S. Enterprise. Imzadi to William T. Riker. Loves chocolate.
Text: OFFICER Empathy Diplomacy

Name: Devinoni Ral
Lore: 1/4 Betazoid 3/4 Human. Skilled negotiator. Abused his empathic powers to gain advantage. Had a dangerous liaison with Counselor Deanna Troi.
Text: V.I.P. Empathy Diplomacy Treachery

Name: Divok
Lore: Male trained in Klingon anatomy and medicine. Studied the effects of Tribbles on the Klingon nervous system.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Youth

Name: Dr. Farek
Lore: Dr. Farek is representative of male Ferengi trained in medicine. Seized control of the D'Kora class Ferengi Marauder, Krayton, in 2366.
Text: MEDICAL Greed

Name: Dr. La Forge
Lore: Dr. La Forge is a Starfleet specialist in xenology and exobiology. Father of Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge. Husband of Captain Silva La Forge.
Names: Captain Silva La Forge;Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge
Text: SCIENCE Exobiology

Name: Dr. Leah Brahms
Lore: Re-creation who said, "I'm with you every day, Geordi. Every time you look at this engine, you're looking at me. Every time you touch it, it's me."
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER

Name: Dr. Reyga
Lore: Ferengi male scientist. Inventor of the revolutionary, but controversial, metaphasic shield technology. Endured skepticism from the scientific community.
Text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Stellar Cartography Astrophysics

Name: Dr. Selar
Characteristics/ Keywords: Vulcan; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Dr. Selar is a female Vulcan medical doctor. Served aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise for many years.
Text: MEDICAL Computer Skill Mindmeld

Name: Dukath
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; I.K.S. Pagh-related personnel; Male; Mission Specialist;
Lore: Klingon trained in the field of science. Studied the effects of Berthold rays on plant life. Served aboard the I.K.C. Pagh.
Text: SCIENCE Archaeology

Name: Duras
Lore: Son of Ja'rod. Contender for leadership of the Klingon High Council. Member of a powerful political family.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Computer Skill Treachery Greed

Name: Eric Pressman
Lore: Captain Eric Pressman commanded the U.S.S. Pegasus before it was lost in space following a failed experiment.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Treachery

Name: Etana Jol
Lore: Ktarian female. Attempted to use a psychotropically addictive game to gain control of the Federation in 2368.
Text: SCIENCE Treachery Biology

Name: Evek
Lore: Gul Evek, Cardassian male officer. Administers area ceded to Cardassians in a treaty with the Federation.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Anthropology

Name: Exocomp
Lore: Sentient artificial life-form incorporating an advanced microreplication system. Specializes in repair tasks. Servomechanism designed by Dr. Farallon.
Text: ENGINEER If aboard ship, can repair damage in two of your full turns, without returning to outpost.

Name: Fek'lhr
Lore: Re-creation of mythical Klingon beast. Guardian of Gre'thor, where the dishonored go to die.
Text: V.I.P. Honor Treachery

Name: Fleet Admiral Shanthi
Lore: Fleet Admiral Shanthi authorized the blockade of Romulan forces covertly supporting the Klingon Civil War in 2368.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Diplomacy

Name: Galathon
Lore: Romulan officer representative of those serving the Romulan Star Empire. Pursuer of DNA program in 2369.
Text: OFFICER Archaeology Greed Treachery

Name: Geordi La Forge
Lore: Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge is chief engineer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Great sense of humor. Fortuitous holodeck programmer.
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Navigation Physics Computer Skill

Name: Giusti
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Female; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Ensign Giusti is representative of staff officers in Starfleet. Served at the Ops console aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2370.
Text: OFFICER Youth

Name: Gorath
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; High Council; Male; Mission Specialist;
Lore: Klingon trained in the field of security. Guarded the Klingon High Council chamber in the year of Maktag. Served as security chief for the Hegh'bat division.
Text: SECURITY Honor

Name: Gorta
Lore: Male of Dopterian race. Representative of non-aligned agents. An opportunist. Had an encounter with the sisters of Duras in 2370.
Text: ENGINEER Physics Greed

Name: Gowron
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; Duras-related; High Council; High Council Leader; Male;
Lore: Son of M'Rel. Leader of the Klingon High Council after defeating the Duras forces in the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Honor

Name: Hannah Bates
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Female; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Genetically engineered scientist from Moab IV. Granted asylum aboard U.S.S. Enterprise in 2368.
Text: SCIENCE Physics

Name: Ishara Yar
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Sister of Lieutenant Natasha Yar. Once betrayed the U.S.S. Enterprise crew in an attempt to aid the rebels on Turkana IV.
Text: CIVILIAN Treachery Youth

Name: Jaron
Lore: Romulan trained in the field of security. A former member of the Tal Shiar intelligence service.
Text: SECURITY Geology Youth

Name: J'Ddan
Lore: Klingon trained in the field of science. Smuggled Federation secrets to the Romulans in the form of amino acid codes.
Text: SCIENCE Exobiology Treachery

Name: Jean-Luc Picard
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Captain Jean-Luc Picard of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Born in LaBarre, France. Has an artificial heart. Reads Shakespeare. Something of a Renaissance man.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Honor Archaeology Navigation Music

Name: Jenna D'Sora
Lore: Lieutenant Jenna D'Sora had a brief, unsuccessful romantic relationship with Lt. Commander Data. Wooed by crystillia flowers from Telemarius III.
Text: SECURITY Stellar Cartography Music

Name: Jera
Lore: Re-creation of a female Romulan. Alien entity assumed this body in 2369.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Youth

Name: Jo'Bril
Lore: Takaran male. Attempted to steal Dr. Reyga's metaphasic shield technology to claim as his own.
Text: SCIENCE Treachery Astrophysics Physics Greed

Name: Kahless
Lore: Cloned reincarnation of Klingon spiritual leader Kahless the Unforgettable. Installed as ceremonial Emperor in 2369.
Text: V.I.P. Honor x 2

Name: Kareel Odan
Characteristics/ Keywords: Trill; Ambassador; Female; Support Personnel; Trill with symbiont;
Lore: Famous Trill Ambassador Kareel Odan. Romantically involved with Dr. Beverly Crusher. Symbiont transplant from male to female host in 2367.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Computer Skill

Name: Kargan
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; Captain; I.K.S. Pagh-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: Captain of the I.K.C. Pagh when Commander William T. Riker served as an exchange officer.
Text: OFFICER Honor Computer Skill

Name: K'Ehleyr
Lore: 1/2 Klingon, 1/2 Human female. Federation Ambassador to the K'mpec government. Mate of Lieutenant Worf. Mother of Alexander.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Honor

Name: Kell
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; High Council; Male; Mission Specialist;
Lore: Male High Council emissary. Covert Romulan agent. Attempted to use Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge to assassinate Klingon Governor Vagh.
Names: Governor Vagh;Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge
Text: V.I.P. Treachery

Name: Klag
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; I.K.S. Pagh-related personnel; Male; Mission Specialist;
Lore: Second Officer Klag, of the I.K.C. Pagh, is representative of Klingon warriors throughout the Klingon Empire.
Text: OFFICER Navigation

Name: Kle'eg
Lore: Klingon trained in the specific field of security. Guarded the House of K'mpec when K'mpec was poisoned in 2367.
Text: SECURITY Honor

Name: K'mpec
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; High Council; High Council Leader; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: Klingon High Council Leader prior to Gowron. Appointed Jean-Luc Picard as Arbiter of Succession in 2367.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy

Name: Konmel
Lore: Klingon warrior who destroyed the cruiser T'Acog and hijacked the Talarian ship, Batris, with Korris.
Text: OFFICER Navigation

Name: Koral
Lore: Tall Klingon male. Captain of a shuttle who traded with mercenaries in 2370.
Text: CIVILIAN Navigation Archaeology

Name: Koroth
Lore: Klingon high cleric at Boreth Monastery. Responsible for cloning Kahless the Unforgettable in 2369.
Text: SCIENCE Biology Archaeology Anthropology

Name: Korris
Lore: Klingon warrior who destroyed the cruiser T'Acog and hijacked the Talarian ship, Batris, with Konmel.
Text: OFFICER Honor

Name: Kromm
Lore: Klingon trained in the field of engineering. Reputed to have consumed fifteen rokeg blood pies at one sitting.
Text: ENGINEER Physics

Name: K'Tal
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; High Council; Male; Mission Specialist;
Lore: Senior member of the Klingon High Council. Presided over the installation of Gowron as head of the council in 2367.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy

Name: K'Tesh
Lore: Re-creation who assisted in the Age of Ascension ritual. Perfected current pain-stick design for ritual use.
Text: ENGINEER Stellar Cartography

Name: Kurak
Lore: Famed female Klingon scientist and warp-field specialist who evaluated the metaphasic shield.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Computer Skill Physics Honor

Name: Kurn
Lore: Son of Mogh. Brother of Lieutenant Worf. Member of the Klingon High Council.
Text: OFFICER Honor Computer Skill Navigation Diplomacy

Name: K'Vada
Lore: Captain K'Vada transported Captain Jean-Luc Picard and Lt. Commander Data on an undercover mission to Romulus.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation

Name: Leah Brahms
Lore: Dr. Leah Brahms was responsible for much of the warp engine design for Galaxy-class starships.
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER

Name: Linda Larson
Lore: Lieutenant Linda Larson is representative of staff engineers serving in Starfleet.
Text: ENGINEER Youth

Name: L'Kor
Lore: Klingon warrior. Believed killed at Khitomer massacre. Actually held prisoner by Romulans in Carraya system.
Text: CIVILIAN Leadership Music

Name: Lursa
Lore: Elder of the two Duras sisters. Plotted with Romulan Sela to start the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery Leadership Geology Greed

Name: Lwaxana Troi
Lore: Betazoid mother of Deanna Troi. Daughter of the Fifth House, Holder of the Sacred Chalice of Rixx, Heir to the Holy Rings of Betazed.
Text: V.I.P. Empathy x 2

Name: McKnight
Lore: Ensign McKnight is one of many helm officers serving aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Distant relative of a famous 20th century game designer.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Youth Music

Name: Mendak
Lore: Commander of the warbird Devoras. Aided the escape of Romulan operative Selok from the Federation.
Text: OFFICER Treachery Exobiology

Name: Mendon
Characteristics/ Keywords: Benzite; Male; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Ensign Mendon is a Benzite male representative of science specialists within Starfleet. Served aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2365. Looks like Mordock.
Text: SCIENCE Physics

Name: Mirok
Lore: Scientist in charge of developing and testing the interphase generator in 2368.
Text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics

Name: Morag
Lore: Klingon officer who stole Federation data from Relay Station 47.
Text: OFFICER Computer Skill Greed

Name: Morgan Bateson
Lore: Captain Morgan Bateson was in command of the U.S.S. Bozeman when it was caught in a temporal causality loop from 2278 to 2368.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Stellar Cartography

Name: Mot the Barber
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bolian; Male; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Bolian male. Convivial barber aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Snappy conversationalist.
Text: CIVILIAN Barbering

Name: Movar
Characteristics/ Keywords: Romulan; Duras-related; General; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: Romulan general who secretly provided military supplies to Duras family forces during the Klingon Civil War in 2368
Text: OFFICER Treachery Anthropology

Name: Narik
Characteristics/ Keywords: Male; Mission Specialist; Stone of Gol-related personnel;
Lore: Representative of male mercenaries operating throughout the galaxy. Worked with Baran to find the Stone of Gol.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill

Name: Neela Daren
Lore: Lt. Commander Neela Daren is a specialist in stellar cartography. Accomplished pianist. Romantically involved with Captain Jean-Luc Picard.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Music

Name: Neral
Lore: Proconsul Neral of the Romulan Senate plotted with Sela and Pardek to invade Vulcan.
Reports: Office of the Proconsul, Continuing Committee
Text: V.I.P. Treachery Youth

Name: Nikolai Rozhenko
Lore: Lieutenant Worf's human foster brother. Son of Sergey and Helena Rozhenko.
Text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Computer Skill Treachery

Name: Norah Satie
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Admiral; Female; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Admiral Norah Satie assigned Captain Jean-Luc Picard to the U.S.S. Enterprise. Zealous investigator who exposed the alien conspiracy of 2364.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership

Name: Nu'Daq
Lore: Captain of the I.K.C. Maht-H'a. Pursued DNA program in 2369.
Text: OFFICER Archaeology Navigation Exobiology

Name: N'Vek
Lore: Member of the Romulan underground. Spearheaded defection of Vice-Proconsul M'ret to the Federation.
Text: SCIENCE Honor Biology Computer Skill

Name: Ocett
Lore: Gul Ocett, Cardassian female officer. Commander of a Galor-class warship. Pursuer of DNA program.
Text: OFFICER Archaeology Navigation Honor

Name: Palteth
Lore: Romulan trained in the field of engineering. A specialist in artificial quantum singularity. Served aboard the Khazara in 2369.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill

Name: Pardek
Lore: Male senator from the Krocton Segment of Romulus. Delegate at the 2293 Khitomer conference. Betrayer of Spock.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Treachery

Name: Parem
Lore: Romulan officer accidently phased by interphase generator experiment.
Text: OFFICER Treachery

Name: Reginald Barclay
Lore: Lieutenant Reginald Barclay is a talented but socially shy systems diagnostic engineer. Former victim of holodiction. Has phobia of traveling by transporter.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill

Name: Richard Galen
Lore: Professor Richard Galen was a mentor to Captain Jean-Luc Picard. Greatest archaeologist of the 24th century. Discoverer of the DNA program.
Text: SCIENCE Archaeology x 2 Biology Exobiology

Name: Riva
Lore: Famed deaf mute mediator from Ramatis III. Spoke with a chorus of three telepaths.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2

Name: Ro Laren
Lore: Ensign Ro Laren is a Bajoran female. Protege of Captain Jean-Luc Picard. Sympathetic to the Maquis. A bit of a renegade.
Text: OFFICER Computer Skill Navigation Treachery

Name: Roga Danar
Lore: Angosian male. Biochemically altered into a formidable perfect warrior ranked Subhadar.
Text: SECURITY ENGINEER Computer Skill Biology Leadership

Name: Sarek
Lore: Illustrious Vulcan Federation ambassador. Over 200 years old. Married at least three times: to a Vulcan princess, to Amanda, and to Perrin. Father of Spock.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 3 Mindmeld

Name: Satelk
Lore: Captain Satelk is the Vulcan Starfleet officer who presided over the inquiry into Cadet Joshua Albert's death at the Academy Flight Range in 2368.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Mindmeld Diplomacy

Name: Sela
Lore: 1/2 Romulan, 1/2 Human female. Daughter of alternate timeline Lieutenant Natasha Yar. Powerful operative and key figure in the Romulan hegemony.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Treachery Youth

Name: Selok
Lore: Subcommander Selok is a female Romulan agent. Successfully posed as Vulcan Ambassador T'Pel.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery

Name: Shelby
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Lt. Commander Shelby is an ambitious Starfleet officer. Assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise as a specialist on the Borg.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Exobiology

Name: Simon Tarses
Lore: Crewman First Class Simon Tarses is representative of Starfleet medical technicians. He is 1/4 Romulan, 3/4 Human.
Text: MEDICAL Youth

Name: Sir Isaac Newton
Lore: Re-creation of the famous 18th century human. Originator of calculus and the classic laws of physics.
Text: SCIENCE Physics x 2

Name: Sirna Kolrami
Lore: Famed Federation strategist. Grandmaster of the game Stratagema.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership

Name: Sito Jaxa
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Ensign Sito Jaxa, a Bajoran, is one of a number of navigation officers aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.
Text: SECURITY Navigation Youth

Name: Soren
Characteristics/ Keywords: J'Naii; Androgynous; Female; Mission Specialist; Neuter;
Lore: Androgynous J'Naii. Illegally had female feelings. Once romantically involved with Commander William T. Riker. Underwent therapy for this perversity.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics

Name: Taibak
Lore: Scientist who developed a mind control device using E-band emissions. Controlled Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge through his VISOR.
Text: SCIENCE Treachery Biology Computer Skill

Name: Taitt
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Ensign Taitt is representative of science specialists from Starfleet Academy. Helped the U.S.S. Enterprise destroy a Borg ship in 2370.
Text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Geology

Name: Takket
Lore: Romulan male trained in Romulan anatomy and medicine. Extensively trained in exobiology.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology

Name: Tallus
Lore: Romulan officer representative of those serving the Romulan Star Empire. Former commander of private forces under Commander Sela.
Text: OFFICER Leadership

Name: Tam Elbrun
Lore: Betazoid male with exceptional empathic abilities. Participated in the notorious Ghorusda disaster. Specialist in first contact with new life-forms.
Text: V.I.P. Empathy x 2 Honor

Name: Tarus
Lore: Representative of male Romulans trained in the field of science. Specialist in the study of extra-dimensional life-forms.
Text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography

Name: Tasha Yar
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Female; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Lieutenant Natasha Yar served as chief of security on the U.S.S. Enterprise. Courageous orphan of Turkana IV. Proved Lt. Commander Data fully functional.
Text: SECURITY Honor Leadership

Name: Taul
Lore: Romulan male trained in the field of security. Assistant to Commander Konsab of the Romulan Intelligence Academy.
Text: SECURITY Treachery Archaeology

Name: Taurik
Lore: Lieutenant Taurik is a Vulcan male representative of engineering junior officers serving in Starfleet.
Text: ENGINEER Mindmeld

Name: Tebok
Lore: Commanding officer of the Romulan warbird that crossed the Romulan Neutral Zone in 2364.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Navigation

Name: Thei
Lore: Subcommander Thei is representative of officers serving in the Romulan Star Empire. Ally of the sisters of Duras during the Klingon Civil War.
Text: OFFICER Geology Physics

Name: Thomas Riker
Lore: Lt. Commander Thomas Riker is William Riker's double. Created during a transporter accident in 2361.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Geology Music

Name: Toby Russell
Lore: Dr. Toby Russell is a controversial neurogeneticist. Creator of the genetronic replicator therapy for spinal injury that saved Lieutenant Worf.
Text: MEDICAL Physics

Name: Tokath
Lore: Established a secret prison camp in the Carraya system for dishonored Klingon survivors of the Khitomer massacre.
Text: OFFICER Anthropology Honor

Name: Tomalak
Characteristics/ Keywords: Romulan; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Commander of a D'deridex-class warbird. Frequent nemesis of the U.S.S. Enterprise.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership

Name: Tomek
Lore: Re-creation of a male Romulan. Alien entity assumed this body in 2369.
Text: ENGINEER Astrophysics

Name: Toq
Lore: Klingon male, born in Romulan prison camp in Carraya system. Protege of Lieutenant Worf.
Text: CIVILIAN Leadership Computer Skill Youth

Name: Torak
Lore: Governor Torak served near the Federation border commanding Sector 2520 in 2369.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Geology

Name: Toral
Lore: Illegitimate son of Duras. Claimed leadership position on the High Council at bidding of Duras' sisters, Lursa and B'Etor.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Youth

Name: Toreth
Lore: Female captain of Imperial Romulan warbird, Khazara. Father killed by Tal Shiar. Uncovered M'ret defection plot.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Honor Navigation

Name: Torin
Lore: Klingon trained in the field of science. Studied the effects of warp propulsion on subspace.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics

Name: T'Pan
Lore: Vulcan female. Dr. T'Pan served as director of the prestigious Vulcan Science Academy. Preeminent expert in subspace morphology.
Text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Mindmeld

Name: Vagh
Lore: Klingon Governor of the Kriosian system. Target of an assassination attempt by Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge, acting under Romulan mind control.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Anthropology

Name: Varel
Lore: Representative of female Romulans trained in the field of science. Assigned to assist with interphase generator project.
Text: SCIENCE Physics Computer Skill Youth

Name: Vash
Lore: Extraordinary archaeology treasure hunter. Traveled with Q. Romantically involved with Captain Jean-Luc Picard. Lovable character, not to be trusted.
Text: CIVILIAN Archaeology x 2 Treachery Anthropology

Name: Vekma
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; Female; I.K.S. Pagh-related personnel; Mission Specialist;
Lore: Klingon female trained in Klingon anatomy and medicine. Propositioned Commander William T. Riker on the I.K.C. Pagh in 2365.
Text: MEDICAL Honor

Name: Vekor
Lore: Representative of female mercenaries operating throughout the galaxy. Worked with Baran to find the Stone of Gol.
Text: SCIENCE MEDICAL Navigation Geology

Name: Wesley Crusher
Lore: Ensign Wesley Crusher was a child prodigy. Prot g of the Traveler. Son of Dr. Beverly Crusher. Saved the U.S.S. Enterprise 3 1/2 times as a teenager.
Text: OFFICER Youth Computer Skill Navigation ENGINEER Astrophysics

Name: William T. Riker
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Cook; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Commander William T. Riker is the executive officer of U.S.S. Enterprise. Imzadi to Deanna Troi. Gourmet cook. Jazz musician.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Navigation Honor Music

Name: Worf
Lore: Lieutenant Worf is chief of security on the U.S.S. Enterprise. Klingon warrior and Starfleet officer. Son of Mogh. Raised on Earth by foster parents.
Text: SECURITY Honor x 2 Navigation Diplomacy

Name: Combat Vessel
Lore: A little-known class of attack craft. One such vessel attacked the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2368 at Surplus Depot Zed-15.

Name: D'deridex
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Imperial Romulan Warbird. A massive ship significantly larger than a Galaxy class starship.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: Devoras
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Warbird used to accomplish the escape of Romulan spy Selok from the Federation in 2367. Commanded by Admiral Mendak.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: Haakona
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Subcommander Taris' warbird. Responded to the Federation incursion of the Neutral Zone, near Iconia.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: Husnock Ship
Lore: With a single thought, Kevin Uxbridge killed the entire Husnock race (50 billion lives) everywhere in the universe. Their powerful ships remain.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.S. Bortas
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Flagship commanded by Gowron during the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68. Lieutenant Worf briefly served aboard as a weapons officer.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.S. Buruk
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Klingon Bird-of-Prey used to transport Gowron to rendezvous with the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2367.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.S. Hegh'ta
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Bird-of-Prey commanded by Kurn in support of Gowron during the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.S. K'Vort
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Class of ships identical in configuration to the classic B'rel class Klingon Bird-of-Prey, although much larger.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.S. Pagh
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Battle cruiser under the command of Captain Kargan. Commander William T. Riker served aboard as an exchange officer in 2365.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.S. Qu'Vat
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Attack cruiser that carried Governor Torak on an investigation into the death of a Starfleet officer at Relay Station 47.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.S. Vor'Cha
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Large attack cruiser. The modern mainstay of the Klingon Defense Force.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.S. Vorn
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Duras-related; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Klingon Bird-of-Prey used to transport Duras to meet with the Klingon Arbiter of Succession in 2367.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: Khazara
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Commander Toreth's Warbird. Covertly used by N'Vek and Counselor Deanna Troi to accomplish the defection of Vice-Proconsul M'ret in 2369.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: Mercenary Ship
Lore: Little-known ship. Difficult to track due to a unique hull design that renders it invisible to long-range scans. Baran captained one in 2370.
Text: Long-Range Scan Shielding

Name: Pi
Characteristics/ Keywords: No staffing requirement; Romulan ship; Scout;
Lore: Ship suspected of attempting a covert mission to Galorndon Core in Federation territory.

Name: Runabout
Lore: Resembles a large shuttle. Contains living accommodations. Modular design can be re-configured for different mission profiles.

Name: Science Vessel
Lore: Specialized science ship used for an Interphase Generator experiment in 2368.

Name: Scout Vessel
Characteristics/ Keywords: No staffing requirement; Romulan ship; Scout;
Lore: Class of small, versatile ships used by the Romulan Star Empire for reconnaissance and science missions.

Name: Type VI Shuttlecraft
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation ship; No staffing requirement; Shuttlecraft;
Lore: Modern Federation shuttle with warp capability. May be armed for special missions.

Name: U.S.S. Brittain
Lore: Starship found trapped in a Tyken's Rift in 2367. All but one of crew killed by REM sleep deprivation.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Enterprise
Lore: The fifth Starfleet ship named Enterprise, launched in 2363. Built at the Utopia Planetia shipyards orbiting Mars.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Excelsior
Lore: First launched in 2284 as a test for what proved to be the unsuccessful transwarp project. Now uses standard warp drive.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Galaxy
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation ship; Holodeck; Prototype; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Prototype in this elite class of ships was the U.S.S. Galaxy, after which the class was named.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Hood
Lore: Registry number NCC-42296. Named for the 20th century admiral, Sir Horace Hood. Commanded by Captain Robert DeSoto.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Miranda
Lore: Small ship class from the late 23rd century. Named for a character in Shakespeare's play, The Tempest.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Nebula
Lore: Modern class of ship featuring large upper equipment modules customizable for specific mission uses.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Oberth
Lore: Class of small ships often used for scientific missions. Named for 20th century rocket scientist Hermann Oberth.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Phoenix
Lore: Commanded by Captain Benjamin Maxwell. Last assigned to the Cardassian/Federation border.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Sutherland
Lore: Named for Horatio Hornblower's fictional flagship. Briefly commanded by Lt. Commander Data during the Klingon Civil War blockade.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Yamato
Lore: Named for a Japanese WWII battleship. Sister ship of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Commanded by Captain Donald Varley.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: Yridian Shuttle
Lore: Common shuttlecraft used by Yridian agents and others for covert activities.

Name: Zibalian Transport
Characteristics/ Keywords: Merchant vessel; No staffing requirement; Transport;
Lore: Common class of merchant vessel used by traders such as Kivas Fajo.

Name: Cryosatellite
Lore: An ancient sublight vessel. Designed to carry and store cryogenically frozen humanoids until a cure for their death could be found and used to regenerate them.
Text: Seed at a space location. May seed one additional artifact and up to 3 [AU] personnel here. They are earned when Cryosatellite earned; then discard Cryosatellite.

Name: Data's Head
Lore: An excavation under the Earth city of San Francisco in 2369 discovered that the head of Lt. Commander Data had been lying there undisturbed for centuries.
Text: Use as Equipment card. Head has CUNNING=10 and Computer Skill. While on a ship, RANGE, WEAPONS and SHIELDS are +2. (Not Cumulative.)

Name: Iconian Gateway
Lore: The now extinct Iconians were "Demons of Air and Darkness" due to their advanced technology such as this instant transport portal to farflung planets.
Text: Place in hand until played on a planet location as an Event card. While in play, anyone's personnel and equipment can move instantly from Iconian Gateway to any other planet(s).

Name: Ophidian Cane
Lore: Disguised serpentine alien device used by the Devidians. When irradiated with the correct energy, the head comes alive and allows Devidians to control their time travel.
Text: Place in hand until played as an Interrupt card to allow 3 through {Devidian Door} OR double {Devidian Foragers} (to four personnel) OR double {Empathic Touch}.

Name: Receptacle Stones
Lore: Ves Alkar, a Lumerian, used these mysterious objects in a ritual that would turn another person into a "receptacle" for all negative thoughts, causing rapid aging and death.
