Text: Place in hand until played as an Event on crew of an opponent's ship. Any space dilemmas you encounter this turn also apply to that ship and crew. Discard event.

Name: Ressikan Flute
Lore: Artifact from Kataan, a now-dead planet. 1,000 years after Kataan's demise, a space probe gave Jean-Luc Picard this flute and a lifetime of memories in less than an hour.
Text: Immediately score points; X=the number of different Music personnel present (limit 5). Then, play on table; points may be nullified by {The Devil}. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Samuel Clemens' Pocketwatch
Lore: This 19th century watch was discovered in a cave along with Data's head in 2369. After returning to the past, Clemens left the watch again to maintain the timeline.
Text: Place in hand until played as an Interrupt card. One action that must happen on your next turn (such as your card draw), happens now instead.

Name: Alien Labyrinth
Lore: Many planets, such as Mordan IV, have convoluted underground installations which require Away Teams to have specific technology or skills.
Text: To get through this maze-like structure and continue, Away Team must have {a Tricorder} OR 2 ENGINEER.

Name: Cardassian Trap
Lore: With rumors of a metagenic weapon on Celtris III, the Cardassians lured Jean-Luc Picard into a trap in Cardassian space. He was captured in 2369.
Text: Unless Empathy present, opponent captures one unique non-[Car] personnel present (random selection). Discard dilemma.

Name: Coalescent Organism
Lore: Rare colony of microscopic lifeforms which kill, absorb and then take the shape of other organisms. Must change form every few days.
Text: Unless Exobiology present, one personnel (random selection) dies at end of your next turn. If others present at the death, organism is passed on to one of them (random selection), etc.

Name: Conundrum
Lore: In 2368, U.S.S. Enterprise personnel were given amnesia by Satarrans, who then attempted to trick the crew into attacking Lysian ships and a Lysian command station.
Text: Unless INTEGRITY>40, this ship must do nothing but chase (at normal speed) and attack one of your opponent's ships on this spaceline (your choice). Discard dilemma.

Name: Edo Probe
Lore: When the Federation tried to contact the pre-industrial society on Rubicun III, the Edo Probe demanded in ship-shuddering tones that Jean-Luc Picard "State the purpose!"
Text: Abandon mission attempt until any player completes a different mission OR continue but lose points if you do not solve mission this turn.

Name: Empathic Echo
Lore: In 2370, following the suicide of partially empathic Lt. Daniel Kwan, Deanna Troi experienced visions of a past murder, reliving it through the participants' eyes.
Text: One personnel present with Empathy (random selection) is killed unless SECURITY and MEDICAL present.

Name: Ferengi Attack
Lore: Ferengi attacked a Federation Away Team on a planet in the Delphi Ardu system using "whips" which fire discharges of high-energy plasma.
Text: Kills one Away Team member (opponent's choice) unless total CUNNING + STRENGTH>68 OR Greed present. Discard dilemma.

Name: Frame of Mind
Lore: William Riker was captured in 2369 on Tilonus IV, tortured with neurosomatic techniques and made to believe he was someone else - until his illusions were shattered.
Text: One personnel present (random selection) now becomes Non-Aligned with attributes of 3-3-3 and only two skills (opponent's choice). Cure with 3 Empathy present.

Name: Hidden Entrance
Lore: Using his visor, Geordi La Forge discovered a doorway to an underground android laboratory hidden in a rock wall on Omicron Theta in 2364.
Text: To locate the concealed entrance and continue, Away Team must have {Geordi La Forge} OR ENGINEER + CUNNING>32.

Name: Hunter Gangs
Lore: On some planets, civilization has devolved into a bitter struggle for survival. Violent gangs search for prey, such as those which chased Natasha Yar on Turkana IV.
Text: Two Away Team members (random selection) are chased. Examine cards separately. Personnel escapes if CUNNING even, killed if odd. Discard dilemma.

Name: Interphasic Plasma Creatures
Lore: Organisms from just beyond the range of visual acuity sucked cellular peptides from the U.S.S. Enterprise crew, similar to the way Terran leaches consume hemoglobin.
Text: Unless 2 SCIENCE or Mindmeld present, play on table as an Event card. While in play, lowers STRENGTH of each of your personnel by 2. (Not cumulative.)

Name: Malfunctioning Door
Lore: At times, Away Teams must open obstructed doors in confined passageways by hand, as did Data on stardate 41503.7.
Text: To get past requires a Soong-Type android OR STRENGTH>27 from up to four personnel.

Name: Maman Picard
Lore: At the place where ideas and reality intermix, Jean-Luc Picard saw his mother Yvette Gessard Picard, who asked, "(Is this) the end of the universe, or... the beginning?"
Text: If this is a Federation ship, immediately transport it to any end of the spaceline (opponent's choice).

Name: Outpost Raid
Lore: Rogue Borg conducted a brief but deadly raid on the remote Federation outpost Ohniaka III in 2369. 274 personnel were lost.
Text: If at your outpost: two personnel are killed (opponent's choice) unless STRENGTH>81. Discard dilemma. OR Elsewhere: requires STRENGTH>18 to pass.

Name: Parallel Romance
Lore: Relationships in parallel universes take different courses. In one, Worf and Deanna Troi were married and had two children: Shanara, 2, and Eric Christopher, 3.
Text: Randomly select a male and a female. (If you cannot, discard dilemma.) Until countdown expires, each of them is stopped and has STRENGTH reduced by 2.

Name: Punishment Zone
Lore: On Rubicun III, mediators arrested Wesley Crusher when he fell into a garden. He was designated for death, which created a Prime Directive dilemma for Jean-Luc Picard.
Text: One Away Team member (random selection) is killed OR beam up that personnel at a penalty. Double penalty if Federation.

Name: Quantum Singularity Lifeforms
Lore: Sentient dimensional beings whose young incubate in black holes. When nesting in a Romulan ship's artificial singularity engine, a frozen-time effect occurs.
Text: If a Romulan ship present, all ships and personnel here are placed in stasis. Cure with {Emergency Transporter Armbands}, {Timepod Ring} or new ENGINEER arriving.

Name: Rascals
Lore: Passing through a molecular reversion field in a shuttle, Guinan, Ro Laren, Keiko O'Brien and Jean-Luc Picard reverted to children's bodies but retained adult knowledge.
Text: All unique crew members (maximum of 4, random selection) are kids. STRENGTH=2 and Youth replaces first-listed skill. Cure with 2 MEDICAL and Biology.

Name: Royale Casino: Blackjack
Lore: Lt. Commander Data played blackjack while trapped in the surreal casino of the Hotel Royale. Tex said, "Boy, you have got the brass..." Data said, "Hit me."
Text: Play one game of blackjack, using CUNNING numbers. Players must show entire hand. Closest to 21 without going over wins points. Others lose points. Ties=0.

Name: The Gatherers
Lore: Nomadic marauders and thieves from Acamar III. "We Gatherers value our freedom. We do what we want and we answer to no creature."
Text: Unless {Marouk} OR INTEGRITY>36 present, discard all Equipment and Artifacts in Away Team, plus one card (random selection) from your hand. Discard dilemma.

Name: The Higher... The Fewer
Lore: The Parallax Poet's cosmic lesson for Alexander was, "Every moment requires a purpose. Every purpose requires a plan. The Higher... The Fewer."
Text: Subtract X from your total score, where X=the number of personnel in this crew or Away Team.

Name: Thought Fire
Lore: In 2364, The Traveler took the U.S.S. Enterprise to a place where ideas and reality intermix. In such a place, one's own thoughts can be deadly.
Text: If {The Traveler: Transcendence} is affecting you, all crew or Away Team members with (CUNNING+INTEGRITY)<12 are killed unless Empathy present.

Name: Worshiper
Lore: Advanced technology often causes natives to believe personnel are divine, as occurred for the U.S.S. Enterprise crew on Mintaka III and other worlds.
Text: If Away Team's Greed>Honor, score bonus points. Otherwise, Away Team is stopped unless {Edo Vessel} or Anthropology present. Discard dilemma.

Name: Zaldan
Lore: Zaldans, who look human except for their webbed fingers, are infuriated by courtesy. They view it as insulting dishonesty.
Text: Unless 2 Treachery OR a {disruptor} OR {Wesley Crusher} OR Exobiology present, kills two Away Team members who have Diplomacy (random selection).

Name: Alternate Universe Door
Text: Place one on table during the seed phase. Door is now open, allowing your [AU] icon cards to enter play. OR Stock in deck and use as follows: Plays to nullify one {Revolving Door} or {Subspace Schism}. (Discard doorway.) OR Allows one ship to pass through {Q-Net}. (Discard doorway.) OR Nullify one {Temporal Rift}, and return doorway to your hand.

Name: Devidian Door
Text: Plays on table. While in play, allows you to play a card "from the future." Once each turn, you may say "Devidian Door" and play one Personnel or Equipment card to any planet. At any time during your next turn (or at game end, if sooner), you must show a Devidian Door from hand and place it out-of-play, or you lose the game.

Name: Echo Papa 607 Killer Drone
Lore: A deadly hovering anti-personnel device with the ability to fire phasers and to anticipate and adapt to its target's defenses. Created by the Arsenal of Freedom on Minos.
Text: Use during Away Team and Rogue Borg battles. First time used in battle, STRENGTH=10. Next time used in a separate battle, STRENGTH=20, etc.

Name: I.P. Scanner
Lore: The Interphasic Scanner has been used to detect signatures of phased matter, invisible interphasic creatures and beings from other subspace domains.
Text: Where present, nullifies {Interphasic Plasma Creatures}, {Brain Drain} and {Phased Matter}.

Name: Baryon Buildup
Lore: Baryon particles build up on a ship's hull after prolonged warp travel. Particles must be periodically removed with a baryon sweep, which requires evacuation of the ship.
Text: Plays on ship. RANGE is reduced by 2. (Cumulative.) Nullified if ship is empty and docked at your facility at the beginning of your turn.

Name: Captain's Log
Lore: A commanding officer's journal of events. While on the surface of El-Adrel IV, Tamarian Captain Dathon made entries into his log by hand.
Text: Plays on table. Each of your ships with its matching commander aboard is SHIELDS and WEAPONS +3. (Captain's Order.)

Name: Engage Shuttle Operations
Lore: Most major starships are outfitted with shuttle hangars and equipment necessary to launch and recover shuttlecraft.
Text: Plays on table. Your shuttlecraft may take off and land (using full RANGE) and be loaded, carried, and launched by your ships with Tractor Beam and ENGINEER aboard (uses 0 RANGE).

Name: Interrogation
Lore: In violation of the Seldonis IV convention, Gul Madred interrogated Jean-Luc Picard, seeking Starfleet strategic secrets. He kept asking, "How many lights do you see?"
Text: Plays on your captive (limit one; discard if released). Once each turn per copy, ask, "How many lights?" If opponent replies "Five," score 10 points; relocate captive anywhere (opponent's choice; released). Otherwise, score 1 point.

Name: Intruder Force Field
Lore: With one look from Jean-Luc Picard, the U.S.S. Enterprise crew captured two alien intruders in a force field on the bridge - turnabout for their own kidnapping activities.
Text: Plays on table. While in play, reverses {Telepathic Alien Kidnappers} affecting you AND {Rogue Borg} invading your ships must be 3 or more to be effective.

Name: Klim Dokachin
Lore: Zakdorn quartermaster controlling the Starfleet surplus depot at Qualor II. A typical bureaucrat of the type that delights in delays that make life difficult for officers.
Text: Plays on table. Opponent loses their regular card draw if they played a unique personnel this turn.

Name: Lower Decks
Lore: Junior officers aboard all starships cooperate in their duties while competing for promotion and advancement, such as Ensigns Taurik, Sito, Lavelle and Ogawa.
Text: Plays on table. Each of your non-holographic, universal personnel is attributes all +2. (Captain's Order.)

Name: Mot's Advice
Lore: Mr. Mot offered sage advice to his customers on a variety of subjects, but there was only one thing you could really learn from him.
Text: Plays on any one personnel. While in play, that personnel gains the skill of Barbering.

Name: Particle Scattering Field
Lore: A Tamarian Ship used a particle scattering field to change the atmosphere of El-Adrel IV, stranding Jean-Luc Picard and Dathon on the planet in 2368.
Text: Plays on one of your ships with a Particle Scattering Device. No beaming to or from a planet is allowed where ship present. You may discard Field at any time.

Name: Revolving Door
Lore: Surreal door created by unknown aliens, found on Theta 116 VIII. Open to entry but seemingly closed to exit.
Text: Plays on any non-[Shield][Doorway] or {Iconian Gateway}; it is closed while this card is face up. At start of any player's turn, that player may discard a non-personnel card from hand to "revolve" (flip) this card. (Unique.) OR Nullifies Revolving Door.

Name: Rishon Uxbridge
Lore: In his grief, the Douwd Kevin Uxbridge re-created his dead wife, Rishon. As if she were real, he responded to her stubborn tendency to keep him calm at tense moments.
Text: Plays atop one Event card in play; it is immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.

Name: The Charybdis
Lore: This wreckage was quickly dated to 2033-2079 due to its 52 star American flag, an example of the importance of such knowledge when dealing with ancient artifacts.
Text: Plays on table. Artifacts at completed missions cannot be acquired until Archaeology present. (If Charybdis destroyed, anyone present may acquire artifact.)

Name: The Mask of Korgano
Lore: In legend, Masaka was chased by Korgano across the sky like the Terran moon chases the sun. Jean-Luc Picard masked himself as Korgano to fool Masaka.
Text: Plays on one of your personnel. While in play, changes it from normal to [AU] icon personnel, or vice versa.

Name: Thermal Deflectors
Lore: Away Teams from the U.S.S. Enterprise used an array of Thermal Deflectors to delay Bersallis III firestorms long enough to allow evacuation of the population.
Text: Plays on table. While in play, nullifies {Firestorm}, {Thought Fire}, {Plasma Fire}, {Fire Sculptor}, and {Phaser Burns}.

Name: Wartime Conditions
Lore: In an alternate timeline caused by the events of Narendra III, the Federation entered into war against the Klingon Empire. 40 billion lives were lost.
Text: Plays on table only if a Federation ship is attacked by another ship. While in play, the Federation may battle the attacking ship's affiliation at will.

Name: Yellow Alert
Lore: State of increased readiness and watchfulness. Declared by a captain in anticipation of danger or when a crisis situation has lessened.
Text: Plays on table. While in play, cancels (discards) and prevents {Red Alert!} AND all your Personnel are each CUNNING +1 (Not cumulative.) (Captain's Order.)

Name: Neutral Outpost
Lore: A common space station design used by many races for research or trade. Personnel and ships from all affiliations are frequent visitors at such facilities.
Text: Seed one at any [S] mission OR build at any [S] mission where you have any ENGINEER. Does not repair ships.

Name: Anti-Matter Spread
Lore: Using harmless anti-matter explosives in a pyrotechnic display, acting-captain William Riker implemented a "brilliantly unorthodox" plan to confuse the Borg in battle.
Text: Plays at start of ship battle. For this battle, opposing ships' WEAPONS -1 for each personnel aboard with CUNNING<8 OR {Borg Ship} WEAPONS=16 this turn.

Name: Barclay Transporter Phobia
Lore: Lt. Reginald Barclay refused to transport out of fear. When forced to transport in 2369, he saw creatures in the beam and believed he had transporter psychosis.
Text: Plays during transport by beaming, {Dimensional Shifting} or {Iconian Gateway}. One personnel (random selection) refuses all transport until cured with {Plexing}.

Name: Brain Drain
Lore: In Lt. Commander Data's dream, his perception of the leech-like interphasic creatures aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise was symbolized by the surreal actions of his friends.
Text: Plays (once every turn) on any crew or Away Team. Remove all skills and CUNNING from one personnel present until end of turn. OR Plays on {Interphasic Plasma Creatures}, doubling effects.

Name: Countermanda
Lore: A Federation student intern when she discovered her true identity as a Q, Amanda took a dim view of the over-manipulative use of power upon other species.
Text: Nullifies {Telepathic Alien Kidnappers} OR if opponent just played {Res-Q} or {Palor Toff}, suspend that action, look through opponent's discard pile and put any three cards out-of-play.

Name: Dead in Bed
Lore: Astronaut Colonel Stephen Richey was found 283 years after his death on Theta 116 VIII. He was caught in an unchanging eternal trap created by well-meaning aliens.
Text: Kills any one personnel currently in stasis.

Name: Destroy Radioactive Garbage Scow
Lore: The U.S.S. Enterprise destroyed a radioactive garbage scow by towing it into a sun. It could have been destroyed in place, but the act would have contaminated Gamelan V.
Text: Plays to discard {Scow}. Kills all personnel at that location unless aboard ship or {Thermal Deflectors} present. If mission not done yet, reduce its points.

Name: Devidian Foragers
Lore: Disguised beings from Devidia II traveled to troubled times and squalid places to steal and consume neural energy from souls who would not be missed.
Text: Look through any one discard pile and place two personnel out-of-play. Add their attribute numbers to one of your [AU] icon personnel for this turn.

Name: Eyes in the Dark
Lore: Deanna Troi saved the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2367 by communicating through nightmarish visions with a telepathic species on the other side of a Tyken's Rift.
Text: Plays when facing a dilemma. If Empathy present, add the skills and attribute numbers of one personnel (random selection) from any opponent's ship (your choice).

Name: Fire Sculptor
Lore: Native of the Parallax Colony who created intricate and artistic designs in the air with fire.
Text: Plays on {Plasma Fire} or {Warp Core Breach} to move onto nearest opponent's ship. OR "Melt" (place out-of-play) one card in any discard pile.

Name: Hail
Lore: Using a universal translator and other communication technology, such as at Worf's station aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise, starships can greet any ships they encounter.
Text: Plays on any ship "flying by" one of your ships; it must stop at your location. OR Select two ships; they cannot battle each other this turn.

Name: Howard Heirloom Candle
Lore: The anaphasic organism appearing as Ronin lived in and drew power from this special candle.
Text: Plays to double effects of {Anaphasic Organism} or {Empathic Echo} OR nullifies {Coalescent Organism} OR prevents {Anya} or {Salia} from morphing this turn.

Name: Humuhumunukunukuapua'a
Lore: A reef triggerfish, Rhinecamthus aculeatus, found near Earth's tropical islands. An animated version is a symbolic "guide" on the U.S.S. Enterprise schoolroom computers.
Text: Plays on any location. For this turn: Your personnel with Youth are CUNNING +4 and STRENGTH +4. Opponent's non-aligned personnel are CUNNING -4 and STRENGTH -4.

Name: Incoming Message: Attack Authorization
Lore: On several occasions, for purposes of Federation security, Starfleet Command has reluctantly or mistakenly ordered captains to attack certain enemy or rogue ships.
Text: Plays on any Federation ship. If Treachery aboard, "This ship must immediately attack one ship (your choice) at this location." May ignore if V.I.P. aboard.

Name: Isabella
Lore: At the FGC-47 nebula, the U.S.S. Enterprise encountered an energy being who took the form of a child's imaginary friend. It judged the crew from that perspective.
Text: Plays on any non-Borg ship at a nebula; it is destroyed unless Youth aboard by end of your next turn. OR Kill any one Greed personnel who just exploited a {Worshiper}.

Name: Jamaharon
Lore: A mysterious sexual ritual from Risa. One signifies desire for Jamaharon by displaying a Horga'hn, as Jean-Luc Picard did accidentally in 2366, thereby attracting Joval.
Text: Nullifies {Horga'hn} OR nullifies {Parallel Romance} OR if planet {Risa} is on spaceline, immediately move any one male personnel alone on a planet to Risa.

Name: Kevin Uxbridge: Convergence
Lore: A Douwd, a race of sentient energy beings of "disguises and false surroundings." He is capable of using his enormous powers to stop threats with a single thought.
Text: Destroys all Event cards in play at any one spaceline location (including those on ships).

Name: La Forge Maneuver
Lore: When attacked by a powerful cloaked drone at Minos, acting-captain Geordi La Forge used atmospheric turbulence to locate and target the hidden enemy.
Text: Plays to expose any one cloaked ship at a planet location. It is vulnerable (as if it were decloaked) if the next action is an attack against that ship.

Name: Latinum Payoff
Lore: Gold-pressed latinum, which cannot be replicated, is a valuable metal used as currency in many less-developed sectors, primarily outside Federation space.
Text: Plays if Greed aboard your ship when it destroys another ship in battle (once per destroyed ship). X=3 for each OFFICER aboard destroyed ship.

Name: Phaser Burns
Lore: Even on stun settings, phased energy weapons can cause severe injuries and burns if not fired judiciously in bursts.
Text: If you have {phasers} or {disruptors} present during a personnel battle, before a winner is determined randomly select two opposing stunned cards to die.

Name: Rescue Captives
Lore: Away Teams led by Security Chiefs like Tasha Yar have at times been sent to rescue captured personnel, as on this occasion at Mordan IV in 2364.
Text: All your personnel currently held captive are returned to your outpost(s), nullifying {Interrogation}, {Brainwash} and {Torture}, if any or all are in progress.

Name: Romulan Ambush
Lore: In 2367, Geordi La Forge was captured by a Romulan ship while piloting a shuttle to Risa. He was brainwashed into an assassination plot against Klingon Governor Vagh.
Text: Destroys opponent's ship with SHIELDS<6 present with your D'deridex-class ship. Crew killed, except one personnel (your choice) is made captive.

Name: Security Sacrifice
Lore: Charged with ship and mission safety, security personnel are willing to voluntarily expose themselves to hazards or threats, as Tasha Yar did on many occasions.
Text: One SECURITY personnel present may sacrifice (substitute) for another personnel who has been randomly selected to die.

Name: Seize Wesley
Lore: Influenced by the Ktarian Game, the crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise chased and captured the last unaffected human crew member... Wesley Crusher.
Text: Plays on opponent's ship under influence of {Ktarian Game} dilemma. All remaining personnel are disabled. If {Wesley Crusher} aboard, he is made your captive.

Name: Senior Staff Meeting
Lore: Standard operating procedure on starships is to call a meeting of senior officers or department heads to help find solutions of paramount problems.
Text: Plays on ship with OFFICER, ENGINEER, MEDICAL, SCIENCE and SECURITY aboard, just before the initial attempt of a space mission. First dilemma encountered is discarded. (Captain's Order.)

Name: Temporal Narcosis
Lore: Debilitating disorientation caused by prolonged exposure to a temporal disturbance, similar to nitrogen narcosis ("the bends"). Jean-Luc Picard experienced this in 2369.
Text: Plays when opponent is using {Horga'hn}, {Revolving Door}, {Emergency Transporter Armbands} or {Energy Vortex}. Your next turn take a double turn.

Name: Thine Own Self
Lore: Attempting a mission with only a few personnel is dangerous. Lt. Commander Data suffered amnesia while alone on Barkon IV. He was lost and eventually "killed."
Text: Plays on opponent's one- or two-person Away Team on a planet (unless in a facility). Away Team is "lost" (place under mission). Capture (or opponent rescues) by solving mission.

Name: Vorgon Raiders
Lore: In 2366, two Vorgons from the 27th century attempted to steal the Tox Uthat artifact uncovered on Risa by Jean-Luc Picard and Vash.
Text: If you have {Ajur} and {Boratus} together in play, discard them and "steal" (use as your own) any one artifact in play or just played as an Interrupt card.

Name: Vulcan Nerve Pinch
Lore: Vulcans are the only species known to use this method of rendering an opponent unconscious. However, Lt. Commander Data was able to master the technique.
Text: Plays at start of personnel battle. Your Vulcans and Soong-Type Androids may each place one opposing personnel or {Rogue Borg} (random selection) in stasis until end of your next turn.

Name: Wolf
Lore: Lwaxana Troi suffered a collapse as a Betazoid defense from psychic trauma. The wolf symbolized a barrier in her metaconscious mind.
Text: Saves any personnel with Empathy who has been randomly selected to die or to be captured. OR Nullifies {Barclay Transporter Phobia}.

Name: Brute Force
Lore: Suppress Kriosian rebels seeking foothold here.
Text: STRENGTH>10 x number of Away Team members (minimum 3 personnel).

Name: Compromised Mission
Lore: Rush to plug information leaks occurring from this remote border sector.
Text: Treachery x 2 + Computer Skill + STRENGTH>35 Opponent's side: [fed] Treachery x2 + Computer Skill + STRENGTH>35

Name: Diplomatic Conference
Lore: Participate in historic interstellar conference at this neutral diplomatic site.
Text: One V.I.P. from each of four different affiliations Personnel on planet may mix to attempt.

Name: FGC-47 Research
Lore: Study interior of nebula filled with energy strands that obstruct navigation.
Text: Diplomacy + Youth x2 X = 6 minus each Navigation aboard ship.

Name: Fissure Research
Lore: Investigate quantum fissure between parallel universes reported here.
Text: Astrophysics + Physics + 3 {[AU] icon Personnel}

Name: Qualor II Rendezvous
Lore: Rendezvous with nefarious merchants at squalid camp.
Text: Treachery + Greed OR {Amarie} Aligned personnel on planet in stasis until mission solved.

Name: Quash Conspiracy
Lore: Negate Vulcan underground operation here.
Text: Tal Shiar + INTEGRITY<21 No ship-to-ship beaming at this location.

Name: Reunion
Lore: Transport famous officers to a reunion
Text: Miracle Worker OR Cantankerousness OR {Spock} X = 15 points if one present, 40 if all three.

Name: Risa Shore Leave
Lore: Have a good, relaxing holiday on the pleasure planet.
Text: Music + Youth + CIVILIAN x2 + Female + Male

Name: Warped Space
Lore: Investigate gravity wells in globular cluster.
Text: SCIENCE x2 + Navigation + Astrophysics Opponent's side: Span: 1

Name: Ajur
Lore: A female Vorgon criminal from the 27th century who ruthlessly sought artifacts with partner Boratus. Hunted the Tox Uthat by returning to 2366.
Text: SECURITY Once per game, if alone with Archaeology on a planet, may peek at all but 3 seed cards here (opponent's choice).

Name: Berlingoff Rasmussen
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Male; Thief; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: A thief from 22nd century New Jersey. Stole a time travel pod. Tried to pass as a 26th century historian to the crew of the 24th century U.S.S. Enterprise.
Text: CIVILIAN Treachery Archaeology Greed May nullify {Time Travel Pod} if present. (Discard both.)

Name: Beverly Picard
Lore: Captain of medical ship U.S.S. Pasteur in 2395 in an alternate timeline. Although divorced from Jean-Luc Picard, she never could say no to him.
Text: OFFICER MEDICAL x 2 Leadership Biology

Name: Boratus
Lore: Male Vorgon criminal from the future. Aims to steal artifacts with partner Ajur. Once hunted the Tox Uthat discovered by Jean-Luc Picard on Risa.
Text: SECURITY Once per game, if alone with Archaeology on a planet, may peek at all but 3 seed cards here (opponent's choice).

Name: Commander Tomalak
Characteristics/ Keywords: Romulan; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: In an alternate future, the nemesis of the U.S.S. Enterprise confronted Captain Picard but cooperated to investigate an anomaly in the Neutral Zone.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership

Name: Dathon
Lore: Darmok and Jalad at Tanagra. The beast of Tanagra. Rosani, his army. Picard and Dathon at El-Adrel. Sokath, his eyes uncovered!
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Honor Nullifies Tamarian-related dilemmas where present.

Name: D'Tan
Lore: Romulan boy. A bright and active member of Spock's underground. Once showed Spock Romulan artifacts depicting the syllabic nucleus of the Vulcan alphabet.
Text: CIVILIAN Youth Archaeology Where present, Romulans without Treachery are INTEGRITY +1.

Name: Governor Worf
Lore: Former member of the Klingon High Council in an alternate timeline in which, by 2395, the Klingons had taken over the Romulan Empire.
Text: V.I.P. SECURITY Honor x 2 Navigation Diplomacy Leadership

Name: Ian Andrew Troi
Lore: Human husband of Lwaxana. Father of Deanna. Seen in Lwaxana's surreal vision of home at Lake El'nar, Betazed. Friend of Steven Miller and Reittan Grax.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Music Computer Skill

Name: Jack Crusher
Lore: Lt. Commander aboard U.S.S. Stargazer under best friend Jean-Luc Picard. Husband of Beverly Crusher. Advised their son Wesley to seek his own way.
Text: OFFICER Honor Archaeology Music Leadership Computer Skill

Name: K'mtar
Lore: Worf's son Alexander returned from 40 years in the future to influence his younger self to embrace the way of the warrior and avoid life as a peacemaker.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Honor Attributes all +5 if with {Alexander Rozhenko}.

Name: Lakanta
Lore: Male of American Indian descent. Actually The Traveler in disguise. Wesley Crusher left Starfleet Academy to study transcendence of thought with him.
Text: CIVILIAN Ship he is on can leave one end of spaceline and enter other end. {Wesley Crusher} attributes +4, if present.

Name: Lt. (j.g.) Picard
Lore: Jean-Luc Picard regretted his reckless youth until Q's alternate timeline antics revealed that he would have been a mere assistant astrophysics officer.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Navigation

Name: Major Rakal
Lore: Physically altered, the half-Betazoid, half-human Deanna Troi was coerced to assume the identity of a Tal Shiar major in the 2369 M'ret defection plot.
Text: V.I.P. Romulan: Tal Shiar, Empathy, Treachery Federation: Empathy, Diplomacy, INTEGRITY +4, CUNNING -1

Name: Maques
Lore: Male leader of the Cairn, a telepathic species who had no concept of spoken language until Federation contact was initiated by Lwaxana Troi in 2370.
Text: V.I.P. Empathy x 2 Diplomacy

Name: Mickey D.
Lore: Villain of Hotel Royale, an early 21st century pulp novel written by Todd Matthews about shady casino characters. Made real by unknown intelligence.
Text: CIVILIAN Treachery Automatically wins {Royale Casino} side games, if present.

Name: Montgomery Scott
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; any Scotty; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Chief Engineer of the Starship Enterprise. Scotty was rescued by the U.S.S. Enterprise after he spent 75 years in the pattern buffer of the U.S.S. Jenolen.
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Astrophysics Honor Miracle Worker Transporter Skill

Name: Paul Rice
Lore: A highly regarded risk-taker. Captained the U.S.S. Drake, lost at Minos in 2364. Former classmate of William Riker. Re-created by the Arsenal of Freedom.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Computer Skill Nullifies one {Echo Papa 607} where present.

Name: Rachel Garrett
Lore: Captain of U.S.S. Enterprise-C when it entered a temporal rift during the Battle of Narendra III in 2344. Ordered a return to the historic battle from 2366.
Text: OFFICER Honor ENGINEER Leadership Diplomacy Astrophysics

Name: Richard Castillo
Lore: Lieutenant and helm officer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-C. In 2366, served as liaison with U.S.S. Enterprise-D. Romantically involved with Tasha Yar.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation

Name: Stefan DeSeve
Lore: Former Federation officer who defected to Romulus in 2349. Later, apparently had second thoughts. Joined Spock's Romulan underground in 2369.
Text: CIVILIAN Romulan: Treachery, Greed Federation: OFFICER, Treachery, INTEGRITY -1

Name: Targ
Lore: Horned, furry, ferocious boar-like animal. A popular Klingon pet. Lieutenant Worf had one as a child. Heart of Targ is a Klingon delicacy. This one is male.
Text: ANIMAL All non-Targ Klingons STRENGTH +1 where present. Nullifies one just-played {Rogue Borg} where present.

Name: Tasha Yar - Alternate
Lore: Traveled to 2344 and helped prevent a disastrous war. Survivor of the Battle of Narendra III. Consort of Romulan general. Mother of Sela.
Text: SECURITY Honor Leadership DL/ {Starfleet Type II Phaser}

Name: Decius
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Powerful ship created in Barash's illusion. Commanded by Tomalak. Transported Admiral Picard and Deanna Troi to a Romulan peace conference.
Text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: Edo Vessel
Lore: A ship discovered in 2364 by the U.S.S. Enterprise to be protecting the peaceful society on Rubicun III. It was described as "half in, half out of our universe."
Text: X=8 However, there is always a 50/50 chance any attack is nullified.

Name: Future Enterprise
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; future-related ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Commanded by Admiral Riker in an alternate future. U.S.S. Enterprise-D was fitted with a third warp engine nacelle, greatly enhancing its speed and power.
Text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: Gomtuu
Lore: Lifeform that normally exists in symbiotic empathic connection with its crew. Gomtuu's crew died prior to its discovery in 2366. Commanded by Tam Elbrun.
Text: If staffed, immune to {Supernova}. *If target has SHIELDS<9, hurl it up to 9 span.

Name: I.K.C. Fek'lhr
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; future-related ship; Holodeck; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Destroyed U.S.S. Pasteur in an alternate future, only to be thwarted by the future Enterprise. Named for the ferocious guardian of Gre'thor.
Text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.C. K'Ratak
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Bird-of-Prey named in honor of the author of the classic work of Klingon literature, The Dream of the Fire.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: Tama
Lore: Children of Tama. Vorath's sword raised high. Dathon, speaking first. Tama and Enterprise at El-Adrel. Tama's tears, shivering in the wind.
Text: Particle Scattering Device

Name: U.S.S. Enterprise-C
Lore: Predecessor of U.S.S. Enterprise-D. Famous for heroic action in Battle of Narendra III, where it also entered a temporal rift. Commanded by Rachel Garrett.
Text: Enters play damaged at any location. Tractor Beam

Name: Blade of Tkon
Lore: The Tkon Empire was so advanced that it possessed the ability to move planets at will. The empire became extinct some 600,000 years ago during the Age of Makto.
Text: Immediately relocate one planet location, and all cards there, to a different place on the spaceline. Discard artifact.

Name: Canar
Lore: A glowing device used by the Haliians to focus thoughts in a limited empathic form. Especially used to strengthen an emotional link during love.
Text: Immediately play on one female personnel. Specify one male personnel at a different location. If those two personnel are ever present together, discard both.

Name: Mona Lisa
Lore: Priceless original oil painting by ancient Earth scientist Da Vinci. Stolen from the Louvre in 2243. Recovered from the collection of Kivas Fajo in 2366.
Text: Use as Equipment card. If destroyed, the player directly causing the destruction (if any) loses points. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Android Nightmares
Lore: An infestation of interphasic creatures caused Lt. Commander Data to experience surreal dreams and hallucinations, resulting in his attack on Deanna Troi.
Text: If android present, one non-android personnel (random selection) killed (three if {Interphasic Plasma Creatures} affecting you) unless Empathy OR {Dr. Soong} present.

Name: Bendii Syndrome
Lore: Rare disease which affects aging Vulcans. A profound loss of mental control leads to emotional outbursts, elicits violence in others and eventually kills its victim.
Text: One Vulcan without Youth present (opponent's choice) dies the next time you score points. Until then, all your personnel are INTEGRITY -2 where present.

Name: Chinese Finger Puzzle
Lore: An ancient novelty which baffled Lt. Commander Data. The solution to the puzzle, which involves relaxation of effort, he called "fascinating."
Text: If android present, crew or Away Team is stopped until end of turn and androids are stopped for X full turns, where X = number of androids present. Discard dilemma.

Name: Q's Vicious Animal Things
Lore: Wearing Napoleonic uniforms and firing musket-shaped energy weapons, Q's creatures attacked William Riker and his away team. Worf gave them their colorful moniker.
Text: Unless 22 < STRENGTH < 55, one Away Team member is killed (random selection) and opponent re-seeds dilemma under a different unsolved planet mission.

Name: Royale Casino: Craps
Lore: An away team from the U.S.S. Enterprise was trapped in the illusionary Hotel Royale until they won enough money in the casino to buy the bank and their way out.
Text: Show a personnel from hand. If CUNNING = 7 or 11 OR opponent cannot match your number, win points. Otherwise, opponent wins points.

Name: Security Precautions
Lore: Dr. Manheim's laboratory deep inside a remote planetoid used a system of forcefields and targeting laser to bar entry and protect a revolutionary experiment.
Text: To get past, Away Team must have {Jenice Manheim} OR android OR {phaser} OR {disruptor} OR 3 SECURITY.

Name: System-Wide Cascade Failure
Lore: Lal was affected by a positronic matrix failure. Lt. Commander Data's incomplete knowledge of Dr. Soong's work led to subtle design flaws in the matrix.
Text: Mission continues, but one android present (your choice) dies at end of turn unless {Dr. Soong} OR {Ira Graves} present. Discard dilemma.

Name: The Sheliak
Lore: Reclusive race of strict legalists. Consider humanoids inferior. The Treaty of Armens ceded several planets to the Sheliak.
Text: Place at furthest spaceline end. End of every turn: If at [P] where encountered, destroys all outposts and Away Teams here; mission worth -10 points; discard dilemma. Otherwise: moves.

Name: Yuta
Lore: An Acamarian of the clan Tralesta. Carrier of a microvirus engineered to instantly kill anyone with a particular genetic makeup.
Text: Opponent chooses a number X. Randomly examine crew or Away Team one by one. If (INTEGRITY + CUNNING - STRENGTH) = X, discard that personnel and dilemma.

Name: Manheim's Dimensional Door
Text: Plays on any planet. Affects all players. While in play, whenever any player has a card in hand matching one just played by the opponent, the Manheim Effect (a temporal "hiccup") may occur. Opponent's card is suspended while player shows matching card, returns it to hand and plays any card from hand as if played normally. (Not duplicatable.) Nullify with {Anti-Matter Pod}.

Name: Q-Flash
Text: Seeds on (opens) Q-Continuum side deck (any number of [Q] cards). When opponent's crew or Away Team has a Q-Flash, draw cards from here, one at a time, discarding duplicates. Dilemmas drawn are encountered (while personnel present only). Opponent plays other cards drawn (if possible). When [Q] cards leave play, place them face up here only (even if closed); when side deck empty, shuffle to replenish it.

Name: Q's Tent
Text: Seeds on (opens) Q's Tent side deck (up to 13 different cards). You may examine cards in this side deck. OR Once each turn, plays to take a card from your Q's Tent into your hand, either your choice (discard doorway) or random selection (place doorway on top of your draw deck). Must show card to opponent. Draw no cards this turn.

Name: Anti-Matter Pod
Lore: Magnetic anti-matter containment vessel used by the U.S.S. Enterprise crew to shut down the Manheim Effect and to mine Cardassian ships in the McAllister C-5 nebula.
Text: May be left at any space mission. Damages next ship to stop here without 3 Navigation (discard pod). May be nullified by Transporter Skill. (Not cumulative.)

Name: Plasmadyne Relay
Lore: Device designed by Geordi La Forge to improve warp engine quantum efficiency. Wesley Crusher opined that it was obsolete and needed a subprocessor matrix overhaul.
Text: While on a ship, RANGE and SHIELDS are +2. While on a station or outpost, SHIELDS are +4. (Cumulative.)

Name: Barber Pole
Lore: The U.S.S. Enterprise features a fully equipped barber shop, including the traditional helical pole.
Text: Plays on table.

Name: Brainwash
Lore: Geordi La Forge was mentally reprogrammed to do the Romulans' bidding by a machine that accessed his mind through his VISOR's direct neural implants.
Text: Plays on one personnel you've captured. Captive reports to your outpost, is under your control and may mix with your personnel regardless of affiliation.

Name: Calamarain
Lore: An intelligent species that exists as ionized gas and can travel in space. Penetrated the shields of the U.S.S. Enterprise seeking revenge on Q in 2366.
Text: Plays at location of opponent's choice. Moves like a ship (RANGE=6). May damage (not destroy) one ship OR kill {Mortal Q} at same location (discard event). (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

Name: Discommendation
Lore: naDHa'ghach. Klingon ritual of shame. A disgraced warrior (and his descendants for seven generations) are shunned and declared non-existent to the rest of Klingon society.
Text: Plays on any Klingon who survived a losing battle. That Klingon is now Non- Aligned, has no Honor and loses points.

Name: Doppelganger
Lore: On stardate 42679.2, the U.S.S. Enterprise encountered a duplicate of Jean-Luc Picard from six hours in the future. He was eventually killed by Jean-Luc Picard.
Text: Plays on table. While in play, if a unique personnel moves to the same location as its duplicate, the duplicate is discarded unless {Clone Machine} in play.

Name: Drag Net
Lore: When the U.S.S. Enterprise attempted to evade Q's energy net, the net collapsed into a sphere and chased the vessel at high warp.
Text: Plays on table. At the end of each of your turns you may move any one {Q-Net} in play one location in either direction.

Name: Drought Tree
Lore: This sapling is planted as an affirmation of life, in defiance of the drought, and with expectations of long life. Whatever comes, we will keep it alive as a symbol of our survival.
Text: Plant on a planet mission you completed to score bonus points. Points may be nullified by any unopposed Away Team.

Name: Heisenberg Compensators
Lore: Transporter subsystem designed to circumvent the "uncertainty principle" of subatomic physics, allowing the derivation of quantum vector data required for beaming.
Text: Plays on table. While in play, nullifies {Alien Probe} and all draw decks are turned face up. OR Nullifies another Heisenberg Compensators card (discard both).

Name: I Am Not a Merry Man!
Lore: I will not play the fool for Q's amusement!
Text: Plays on any one Klingon. While in play, once per turn that Klingon may nullify one [Q] icon interrupt, event or dilemma where present. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Immortal Again
Lore: Following Q's "selfless act," Q2 reluctantly restored his powers. He warned Q to try to stay out of trouble - just in time to save the Calamarain from further torment.
Text: Nullifies {Mortal Q} (plus any {Calamarain}). Q-Continuum is active again. Discard event. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.) OR Exchange for one {Amanda Rogers} or {Q2} card from your discard pile.

Name: Klingon Civil War
Lore: Powerful political "houses" in Klingon society can form factions that vie for control. Gowron and his supporters defeated the forces of Duras in the civil war of 2367-68.
Text: Plays on table. While in play, when a Klingon ship destroys any opponent's Klingon ship, winner scores points = loser's WEAPONS + SHIELDS. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

Name: Transfiguration
Lore: John Doe was persecuted by other Zalkonians who did not understand his evolution into a higher form. He is now a benevolent energy being with metaphysical powers.
Text: Plays on {John Doe} after he has prevented a death. Each turn he may nullify one Event card (except Transfiguration) where present. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

Name: Zalkonian Storage Capsule
Lore: Alien information storage device salvaged from John Doe's escape pod. Uses a chemically based system for molecular energy encoding.
Text: Plays on table. Each turn, you may store one hand card here (may be returned to hand at any time). If destroyed, shuffle stored cards and place group on top or bottom of draw deck.

Name: Colony
Lore: Communities are commonly founded on uninhabited planets. Many are not charted by the Federation.
Text: Build on any planet mission you completed. Each unopposed CIVILIAN inside at start of its owner's turn scores 1 point.

Name: Terraforming Station
Lore: Planets such as Velara III can be transformed to support life. The process takes many decades.
Text: Seed on any planet mission. If still in play at end of game, redefine that mission's requirements for next game with same opponent.

Name: Arbiter of Succession
Lore: Jean-Luc Picard was chosen to administer the Klingon Rite of Succession to select a new High Council Leader. The ritual concluded when one challenger was killed in battle.
Text: Two strongest Klingon leaders at one location battle. Place on winner to score points and nullify {Klingon Civil War}. If killed, points transfer to opponent. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Data's Medals
Lore: Lt. Commander Data's citations include Starfleet Command Declaration for Valor and Gallantry, Medal of Honor with Clusters, Legion of Honor and Star Cross.
Text: Plays on any leader in a battle you just won to score bonus points. Stays on that leader. Points lost if leader killed. (Not cumulative.)

Name: End Transmission
Lore: Subspace communications are sometimes abruptly terminated by the transmitter.
Text: Play on table. Immediately end your turn. (Unique.)

Name: Klingon Painstik
Lore: Device employed to verify death in the Sonchi ritual. Also used in the nentay (Rite of Ascension) to test courage. Can make a two-ton Rectyne monopod jump 5 meters.
Text: Return your {Arbiter of Succession} to your hand at any time, nullifying its points. OR One unique personnel just killed may not be reported for duty again by any player.

Name: Off Switch
Lore: Lt. Commander Data has a deactivation switch hidden in his back. Reluctantly, he informed Dr. Crusher of its existence to aid in the re-assembly of Lore.
Text: Place any android in stasis until end of turn. While in stasis, immune to {Android Nightmares}, {Chinese Finger Puzzle} and {Dead in Bed}. OR Nullifies another Off Switch.

Name: Parallax Arguers
Lore: At the Parallax Colony, one couple spent their lives endlessly contradicting each other, despite Alexander's reminding them about the higher... the fewer.
Text: If that was cool, X=5. OR If you just argued, play an Event card now (X=0). OR Nullifies Parallax Arguers (X=opponent's Arguers points +5).

Name: Plexing
Lore: A Betazed relaxation method taught to Reginald Barclay by Deanna Troi. Stimulating a nerve cluster behind the ear releases natural endorphins and helps to reduce anxiety.
Text: Nullifies {Empathic Echo} OR {Parallax Arguers} OR {Frame of Mind} OR {System-Wide Cascade Failure} OR {Thought Maker}. (May not be nullified.)

Name: Wrong Door
Lore: Jean-Luc Picard had intended to step through an Iconian Gateway to the U.S.S. Enterprise, but lack of time forced him to settle for a nearby Romulan Warbird instead.
Text: If opponent just used {Iconian Gateway}, redirect the exit to another planet. OR Nullifies one {Q's Tent} played from hand. OR Move {Revolving Door} to a different non-[Shield][Doorway].

Name: Investigate Legend
Lore: Verify existence of fabled utopian planet hidden by powerful cloaking device.
Text: Youth x3 + (Diplomacy x2 OR Discard 2 Youth) Cloaks or decloaks each time any points scored.

Name: Nebula
Lore: Representative of nebulae.
Text: Seeds in any quadrant. You must play {Scan} to initiate battle here. When opponent scores points, your ship here encounters next seed card.

Name: Paxan "Wormhole"
Lore: Investigate M-class planet and wormhole reported near T-tauri-type star.
Text: Diplomacy + CUNNING>30 + Android Relocate opponent's ship if no android aboard.

Name: Plague Planet
Lore: Investigate origin site of famous deadly plague.
Text: MEDICAL + Biology + Archaeology If you solve, you automatically overcome {Plague Ships}. Opponent's side: If you solve, all Plague Ships score no points.

Name: Samaritan Snare
Lore: Respond to distress call from Pakled ship.
Text: ENGINEER + Discard one Equipment card Federation must attempt mission if present.

Name: Space
Lore: The final frontier...
Text: Counts as 1/2 card. Limit 4. May insert into spaceline. X = 3 + Number of adjacent [Univ] locations.

Name: Tarchannen Study
Lore: Aid investigation of outpost that disappeared on this planet.
Text: ENGINEER x2 + {I.P. Scanner} + Holodeck No outposts or stations allowed here.

Name: Data's Body
Lore: Soong-type android body recovered from Devidia II.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER, Computer Skill, Music, Astrophysics, Exobiology During seed phase, may report for duty at your outpost.

Name: Galen
Lore: Jean-Luc Picard went undercover in 2370 posing as a mercenary and artifact smuggler.
Text: SCIENCE Archaeology Computer Skill Treachery Leadership Navigation Music

Name: Gibson
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Female; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Ensign Gibson served aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise as helm specialist during the 2364 diplomatic mission to Daled IV.
Text: OFFICER Navigation x 2

Name: Ira Graves
Lore: A mentor of Dr. Soong and thus Lt. Commander Data's "grandfather." Arguably one of the greatest minds of the age. Has Darnay's Disease.
Text: CIVILIAN Cybernetics Computer Skill SCIENCE Treachery and Biology if {Kareen Brianon} in play.

Name: Jenice Manheim
Lore: Dedicated wife of Paul Manheim. Once romantically involved with Jean-Luc Picard.
Text: CIVILIAN {Ressikan Flute} is limited to 4 Music personnel. One male present is attributes +2 (+4 if {Paul Manheim}).

Name: John Doe
Lore: A Zalkonian male with amnesia and the ability to heal by touch alone. Romantically involved with Dr. Crusher. Later evolved into a pure energy being.
Text: CIVILIAN Once per turn, may prevent one other personnel from being killed on a ship where present.

Name: Juliana Tainer
Lore: Dr. Juliana O'Donnell Soong Tainer. Data's co-creator and "mother." Unaware that Dr. Soong stored her mind in a Soong-type android to prolong her life.
Names: Data;Dr. Soong;Dr. Juliana O'Donnell Soong Tainer
Text: SCIENCE Geology, Computer Skill, Cybernetics, Music After first use as an android, X=4 but "stopped."

Name: Kahlest
Lore: Female ghojmok to young Worf in the employ of the House of Mogh prior to the Khitomer Massacre. Spurned K'mpec because "he was too fat."
Text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Honor Music Klingons with Honor are STRENGTH +2 where present.

Name: Kareen Brianon
Lore: Technical assistant to Dr. Ira Graves. Admitted to having been attracted to him, despite decades of age difference.
Text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill ENGINEER Youth May nullify {Male's Love Interest} where present.

Name: Katherine Pulaski
Lore: Chief Medical Officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2365. Dislikes transporters and turbolifts.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL SCIENCE Suspends effects of {Doppelganger} where present.

Name: K'chiQ
Lore: William Riker, vested with the powers of Q, created an "ideal mate" for Lieutenant Worf.
Text: CIVILIAN When reporting for duty, select any skill. May change that skill at the start of each of your turns.

Name: Keiko O'Brien
Lore: Botanist. Vegetarian. Keiko Ishikawa married Miles O'Brien aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2367. Lt. Commander Data served as father of the bride.
Text: SCIENCE Exobiology Biology Attributes all +2 if with {Miles O'Brien}.

Name: Kitrik
Lore: A Klingon physician. Has a research laboratory and clinic at the Klingon outpost on Maranga IV. Plays the part of "Molor" in the annual Kot'baval Festival.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology SCIENCE Cybernetics Music

Name: K'nera
Lore: Pursued the criminals Korris and Konmel in 2364 until their deaths on the U.S.S. Enterprise. Offered Worf a position in the Klingon Defense Force.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Transporter Skill Honor Scores 5 points when {Korris} or {Konmel} killed in battle.

Name: Kova Tholl
Lore: A male from Mizar II. Mizarians value peace above all else and employ passive resistance. They have been conquered six times in 300 years.
Text: CIVILIAN Scores bonus points if killed by an attack in which you do not retaliate. Diplomacy

Name: Lal
Lore: Soong-type android "daughter" of Lt. Commander Data, created by replication of his own positronic pathways. Lal is the Hindi word for "imzadi."
Text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill Youth When reporting, select any two skills present.

Name: Madam Guinan
Lore: Adventurous El-Aurian who spent time exploring worlds such as Earth. Met a time-traveling crew from the U.S.S. Enterprise in the 19th century.
Text: CIVILIAN Once per turn, may nullify any [AU] icon interrupt, event or dilemma where present. Anthropology

Name: Madred
Lore: Gul Madred, Cardassian officer in the Obsidian Order. Specializes in prisoner interrogation. Tortured Jean-Luc Picard time after time in 2369.
Text: OFFICER Each time you score points from {Interrogation}, score 1 additional point. SECURITY x 2

Name: Marouk
Lore: Chancellor of Acamar III. With the help of Captain Picard, she completed an amnesty agreement to return the Gatherers to Acamar in 2366.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy May nullify {Yuta} where present, scoring 3 points.

Name: Mirasta Yale
Lore: Malcorian scientist befriended by Jean-Luc Picard. Departed Malcor III aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.
Text: SCIENCE Physics Astrophysics Worth bonus points to you while in play.

Name: Mordock
Lore: Developer of the "Mordock Strategy." Became first Benzite in Starfleet, outscoring Wesley Crusher for appointment to the Academy. Looks like Mendon.
Text: SCIENCE Missions you solve are +5 points. Bonus points lost if you ever battle in this game. Computer Skill Physics

Name: Mortal Q
Lore: Q was made human and evicted from the Continuum due to antics. Retained his other fine qualities.
Text: CIVILIAN Physics x 10 Geology x 10 Leadership x -1 Nullify each dilemma named {Q} you encounter. Once in play, your {Q-Continuum side deck} is closed.

Name: Mr. Homn
Lore: Silent, imbibing, lurching, uttaberry-eating, faithful servant of Lwaxana Troi. The only words he was known to speak were, "Thanks for the drinks."
Text: CIVILIAN Empaths may report for duty where present. May nullify {Empathic Echo} where present.

Name: Nick Locarno
Lore: Natural leader kicked out of Starfleet Academy after the Nova Squadron accident and cover-up of 2368.
Text: CIVILIAN Navigation x 2 Computer Skill Leadership Youth Transporter Skill

Name: Paul Manheim
Lore: Reclusive scientist who experimented with nonlinear time. Traveled to other dimensions, of which he said words paled "because the images are so vibrant."
Text: SCIENCE Where present, may nullify {Manheim's Dimensional Door} OR double its effect. Astrophysics x 2

Name: Rager
Lore: Ensign Rager is an experienced conn officer. Served on the U.S.S. Enterprise from 2367 to 2369. Piloted the ship inside a Dyson Sphere found near Norpin V.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Stellar Cartography Youth Scores 5 points if helps solve {Explore Dyson Sphere}.

Name: Robin Lefler
Lore: Ensign transporter specialist. Romantically involved with Wesley Crusher, Lefler's Laws include "You gotta go with what works" and "Life isn't always fair."
Text: ENGINEER Where present, nullifies {Ktarian Game} and {Wesley Crusher} is CUNNING +2. Youth Transporter Skill

Name: Sakkath
Lore: Vulcan male assistant of Sarek. Attempted to use his telepathic skills to repress Sarek's Bendii Syndrome during the crucial Legaran Conference of 2366.
Text: V.I.P. Mindmeld Diplomacy Youth Suspends {Bendii Syndrome} where present.

Name: Samuel Clemens
Lore: Crotchety 19th Century author popularly known as Mark Twain. Visited the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2369 during the Devidian time travel incident.
Text: CIVILIAN Once per game, may leave play when {Devidian Door} is "shown" and score points. Diplomacy

Name: Sirol
Lore: Commander of the Imperial Romulan Warbird Terix during the Pegasus incident of 2370.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Navigation ENGINEER Treachery

Name: Sonya Gomez
Lore: Ensign Sonya Gomez is an anti-matter specialist. Snappy conversationalist. Once spilled hot chocolate on Captain Picard. Has total recall.
Text: ENGINEER Physics Youth Suspends {Anti-Matter Pod} where present.

Name: Soong-type Android
Characteristics/ Keywords: Android; Female; Male; Neuter; Soong-type android;
Lore: A recently produced Soong-type android ready to select its gender and appearance. Replicated using a method developed by Lt. Commander Data.
Text: * Computer Skill Youth * Select classification and gender (male, female, or genderless) when reporting.

Name: Taris
Lore: Female subcommander. Captain of the warbird Haakona. Investigated the Federation incursion of the Neutral Zone in the vicinity of Iconia.
Text: OFFICER Archaeology MEDICAL Music Transporter Skill

Name: Tarmin
Lore: An Ullian "telepathic historian" who uses empathic skills to recall detailed historical information from his volunteers' memories.
Text: V.I.P. Once per game, may glance at the cards in any one side deck for 10 seconds. Empathy

Name: Telak
Lore: Male bodyguard of Sela. Stationed on Romulus. Lieutenant operative in the Tal Shiar's new Android Research section.
Text: SECURITY Treachery Tal Shiar Cybernetics

Name: Timicin
Lore: Kaelonian. Romantically involved with Lwaxana Troi. Must submit to The Resolution at age 60.
Text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics Scores 10 points if helps solve {Test Mission}.

Name: T'Shanik
Lore: Vulcan female from Vulcana Regar. Competed against Wesley Crusher, Mordock, and Oliana Mirren for acceptance to Starfleet Academy.
Text: SCIENCE Mindmeld Computer Skill Youth

Name: Ves Alkar
Lore: Treacherous Lumerian ambassador. Uses receptacle stones to deposit his negative emotions in others in order to enhance his negotiation skills.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x2 if female empath(s) at same location (they are Empathy -1). Empathy Treachery

Name: Zon
Lore: Nausicaan officer who stabbed young Jean-Luc Picard through the heart in a brawl at Starbase Earhart in 2327. Dom-jot player.
Text: SECURITY OFFICER Treachery Guramba May nullify {Nausicaans} dilemma where present.

Name: Go Back Whence Thou Camest
Lore: Thou art notified that thy kind has infiltrated the galaxy too far already. Thou art directed to return to thy own solar system immediately.
Text: If INTEGRITY < 10 OR INTEGRITY > 50, at the end of your turn opponent may relocate any one of your ships at this location to one of your facilities.

Name: Guilty - Provisionally
Lore: You will now answer to the charge of being a grievously savage race... Soldiers, you will press those triggers if this criminal answers with any word other than 'guilty.'
Text: Randomly select one personnel present. If you say "guilty - provisionally," plays on table; opponent may cancel the next battle you initiate, then discard dilemma. Otherwise, personnel killed.

Name: His Honor, The High Sheriff of Nottingham
Lore: Yes, but what about your merry men? Are you willing to jeopardize their lives as well?
Text: If any of your personnel are held captive, you must either lose points OR return one such captive here (released). If, just after relocation, opponent shows SECURITY from hand, opponent captures two of your personnel present (random selection). (Immune to {Miss Q}.)

Name: Mandarin Bailiff
Lore: Criminal! How plead you?
Text: Opponent captures one personnel present (random selection). You may prevent this by "posting bail": you lose points and opponent gains points. X = number of [*] icons on that personnel.

Name: Pla-Net
Lore: Damn it all to Hell!
Text: Immediately choose whether or not to nullify the next seed card at this location. If you choose to nullify, lose points. Otherwise, if that seed card turns out to be a dilemma and it "stops," disables or puts in stasis any of your personnel, lose points.

Name: Aldebaran Serpent
Lore: You will abandon that mission, Captain. My business with you takes precedence.
Text: If personnel are present, and the number of personnel in this crew or Away Team > lowest attribute present, discard event. Otherwise, place on mission; after this Q-Flash ends, crew or Away Team is stopped and you must attempt a different mission before attempting this one again.

Name: Amanda's Parents
Lore: They had assumed human form... in vulgar human fashion they proceeded to conceive a child. And like mockish humans they became attached to it.
Text: Plays on table until any Q-Flash. Each time you play an {Amanda Rogers} card (except to nullify a [Q] icon card), opponent may take that Amanda Rogers (and any two other cards) from your discard pile and place all three out-of-play.

Name: Door-Net
Lore: Stay where thou art.
Text: Plays on one of your non-[Shield][Doorway] cards in play (your choice) until any Q-Flash; it is now closed. May be nullified by Alternate Universe Door OR by showing 2 Diplomacy from your hand during your turn.

Name: Frigid
Lore: SILENCE!
Text: Plays on table. The next time you play an Interrupt card during opponent's turn, opponent may place this event on any one of your SECURITY personnel in play. Personnel is in stasis until any Q-Flash, then discard event. May be nullified by {Fire Sculptor}.

Name: Into the Breach
Lore: Ooh!
Text: Plays on table until any Q-Flash. While in play, nullifies all {Warp Core Breach} cards and immediately repairs all damaged ships in play, except {Borg Ship}. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Jealous Amanda
Lore: Do you love me?
Text: Plays on table. The next time any Away Team encounters a {Love Interest}, {Parallel Romance} or {Alien Groupie}, your opponent may override that card's normal result by relocating the affected personnel to any planet location. Discard event. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Military Privilege
Lore: Starfleet Admiral Q, at your service!
Text: Plays on table until any Q-Flash. All Federation and Non-Aligned personnel in play with OFFICER classification are now CIVILIAN instead, and vice versa.

Name: Penalty Box
Lore: Unfortunately there's only one penalty box. If any of you should be sent there, dear Tasha must give up the box to you... and go into nothingness.
Text: If any Penalty Box already in play, put its occupant out-of-play and replace with new victim (random selection). Discard event. Otherwise, place on table and put one personnel present (random selection) here. (If nullified, return occupant to owner's hand.)

Name: Scottish Setter
Lore: Crusher gets more shrill with each passing year.
Text: If no ANIMAL present, play on one personnel present (random selection) until any Q-Flash. That personnel's classification changes to ANIMAL. May be nullified by {Amanda Rogers}.

Name: Tijuana Crass
Lore: My brothers and sisters of the Continuum have taken me back! ... I feel like celebrating!
Text: Plays on table. (May not be nullified.) While in play, any points derived from {Ressikan Flute} count for all players AND opponent's {Data Laughing} cards are converted to Event cards to be played on the table when used.

Name: Trust Me
Lore: You can do it, Amanda... close your eyes... remember them.
Text: Plays on table until any Q-Flash. Each time you play an {Amanda Rogers} card (except to nullify a [Q] icon card), opponent may place two non-Artifact cards from outside the game into opponent's own discard pile.

Name: You Will in Time
Lore: If I return you to your ship, will you agree to give my request a full hearing?
Text: If you began this mission attempt with only one personnel, opponent may name one of your unique personnel in play. That personnel is in stasis. On every turn, opponent may make a request of you; if you comply, remove personnel from stasis. (May not be nullified.)

Name: Are These Truly Your Friends, Brother?
Lore: You have the power to leave each one of them with a gift proving your affection.
Text: If you have more cards in your discard pile than personnel in this crew or Away Team, examine one card in your discard pile (random selection). If it has a point box with a number, give it to your opponent who immediately scores those points. Otherwise, place it out-of-play. (May not be nullified.)

Name: Dr. Q, Medicine Entity
Lore: Well, well, well. What seems to be the problem?
Text: Diagnosis: One of your Event cards on the spaceline (opponent's choice) is the problem. Treatment: Opponent must move the "problem card" to a different appropriate spaceline location.

Name: Gift of the Tormentor
Lore: We have offered you a gift beyond all other gifts.
Text: If your current score is zero, score bonus points. Otherwise, place this card in your discard pile. (May be nullified only by {Countermanda}.)

Name: Incoming Message - The Continuum
Lore: Your progress, Q? "As anticipated, there are some problems. I need time."
Text: Opponent may end current Q-Flash now (no more [Q] icon cards are drawn) and immediately seed the card that started it under any other mission (it has no further effects now; mission continues).

Name: Lemon-Aid
Lore: Wasn't it your own Hardy that said 'Nothing reveals humanity so well as the games it plays?' ... Actually, you reveal yourself best in how you play.
Text: If you are at least 20 points ahead of your opponent, graciously give this card to opponent, who scores bonus points. (May not be nullified.)

Name: Subsection Q, Paragraph 10
Lore: There will be no legal trickery.
Text: Every player with more than ten cards in hand loses 1 point for each card in excess of ten. (May not be nullified.)

Name: The Higher... The Q-er
Lore: You want to review your rapid progress? To where humans learned to control their military with drugs?
Text: If no CIVILIAN present, add X additional [Q] icon cards to this Q-Flash, where X = number of personnel present with a [Cmd] icon.

Name: The Issue is Patriotism
Lore: You slaughtered millions in silly arguments about how to divide the resources of your little world.
Text: You must immediately initiate a battle at one location that has opposing ships or Away Teams (if any). Stopped cards are unstopped long enough to battle. No leaders are required and no affiliation restrictions apply. (Immune to {Miss Q}.)

Name: The Naked Truth
Lore: Red Alert!
Text: Opponent may play a unique personnel from hand to your crew or Away Team. That personnel is under your control (compatible with your cards regardless of affiliation; assimilated if playing Borg) and is stopped. (Opponent may not report the same personnel more than once per game in this manner.)

Name: Wesley Gets the Point
Lore: You have only one chance to save them now. Send them back to the ship.
Text: If you have {Wesley Crusher} present or on any planet, he scores bonus point and dies.

Name: Where's Guinan?
Lore: This creature is not what she appears to be. She's an imp, and where she goes trouble always follows.
Text: If {Guinan} or {Madam Guinan} is in your crew or Away Team, relocate each El-Aurian present to any planet of your opponent's choice. (May be nullified only by {Guinan} if she has not already nullified a card this turn.)

Name: Q's Planet
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: This is the dressing for a game that we will play.
Text: Any unique personnel Owner inserts anywhere on spaceline. Each player may place up to 3 seed cards here from hand, discard pile, or {Q's Tent}. Until solved, an additional 40 points are needed for any player to win. May also be stocked in Q's Tent. (May not be nullified. Not duplicatable.)

Name: I.K.C. Maht-H'a
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Commanded by Nu'Daq during the chase for clues to a four-billion-year-old genetic message in 2369.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.S. T'Ong
Lore: A Klingon sleeper ship from the 23rd century, an era when Klingons despised humans and attacked them on sight. Commanded by K'Temoc.
Text: Cloaking Device. Must report with up to 3 personnel at end of spaceline.

Name: Terix
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Warbird commanded by Sirol. "Accidentally" sealed the U.S.S. Enterprise inside an asteroid in 2370.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: T'Pau
Characteristics/ Keywords: Merchant vessel; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam; Vulcan ship;
Lore: Vulcan merchant vessel named for the only person to ever turn down a seat on the Federation Council. Stolen from Surplus Depot Zed-15 at Qualor II.
Text: May report for duty at {Qualor II}. Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Stargazer
Lore: Captained by Jean-Luc Picard on a historic 22-year mission of exploration. Thought destroyed in 2355 at Maxia Zeta until returned by DaiMon Bok.
Text: Tractor Beam. Once each game, may be taken from discard pile to hand.

Name: Zalkonian Vessel
Lore: Typical Zalkonian defense vessel. One commanded by Sunad traveled at warp 9.72, hunting the fugitive known as John Doe in the Zeta Gelis Cluster.
Text: Kills untransfigured {John Doe} if at same location at end of your turn.

Name: Data Laughing
Lore: When Lt. Commander Data rescued the temporarily mortal Q from the Calamarain in 2366, Q awarded him with the gift of laughter.
Text: Nullifies {Calamarain}. OR Doubles {Data's Head} this turn. OR Plays on a ship affected by {Lore Returns}; you gain control of that ship and all {Rogue Borg Mercenaries} aboard.

Name: A Good Place to Die
Lore: Study harsh planet where Klingon criminals are exiled "to die on their feet with honor."
Text: Physics + STRENGTH>33 OR Biology + Honor

Name: Avert Danger
Lore: Aid colony threatened with destruction by a stellar core fragment.
Text: Stellar Cartography + CUNNING>35 OR Astrophysics + CUNNING>35

Name: Cargo Rendezvous
Lore: Appointed meeting to deliver cargo at this major commercial center.
Text: ENGINEER + Physics + INTEGRITY>30 OR Greed + Treachery + CUNNING>32

Name: Distress Mission
Lore: Respond to distress call and beware of Ferengi activity this sector.
Text: Youth x3 + CUNNING>32 OR Honor x3 + STRENGTH>36

Name: Gault
Lore: Open secret inquiry on early history of Klingon foster child raised on this Federation planet.
Text: Exobiology + OFFICER + Honor x2

Name: Gravesworld
Lore: Investigate distress call received from lab of Dr. Ira Graves here.
Text: MEDICAL + OFFICER + Physics

Name: Homeward
Lore: Aid study of primitive culture on planet threatened by intense radiation storms.
Text: Anthropology + Computer Skill

Name: Hostage Situation
Lore: Coordinate with local authorities to free captives held hostage.
Text: SECURITY x2 + MEDICAL + INTEGRITY>32

Name: Reopen Dig
Lore: Revive excavation and seek rumored clues to Iconian artifacts.
Text: Archaeology + OFFICER x2

Name: Reported Activity
Lore: Probe reports of mysterious Ferengi activity in this sector.
Text: Navigation + Honor x2 OR Navigation + ENGINEER x2

Name: Sensitive Search
Lore: Investigate reports of politically "sensitive" activities by an information dealer in sector.
Text: Computer Skill + CUNNING>28

Name: Survey Instability
Lore: Study this "live fast, die hard" volcanic planet in this sector.
Text: Geology + STRENGTH>35

Name: Admiral McCoy
Lore: Not a psychiatrist, mechanic, coal miner, bricklayer, scientist, physicist, moon shuttle conductor, escalator, magician or fish peddler. Just an old country doctor.
Text: V.I.P. MEDICAL Exobiology Cantankerousness Other MEDICAL are CUNNING +3 where present.

Name: Admiral Picard
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Admiral; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: The former captain of the U.S.S. Enterprise pursued an unprecedented treaty with the Romulans in Barash's illusion.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Honor Navigation

Name: Commander Data
Lore: In Barash's illusion, Data was second in command of the U.S.S. Enterprise under Captain Riker.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Computer Skill Music Astrophysics

Name: Commander Troi
Characteristics/ Keywords: Counselor; Female; Human; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: In Barash's illusion, Deanna Troi left the U.S.S. Enterprise to take a position at Starfleet Command as Admiral Picard's diplomatic counselor.
Text: V.I.P. Empathy Diplomacy Honor Anthropology

Name: Gi'ral
Lore: Survivor of Khitomer massacre. Wife of Tokath. Mother of Ba'el. Raised her daughter at a Romulan prison camp in the Carraya system.
Text: CIVILIAN May build {Colony} at unsolved planet mission if present there with {Tokath}. {Ba'el} scores double points there.

Name: Ja'rod
Lore: Father of Duras, Lursa and B'Etor. Disappeared shortly after transmitting security codes to the Romulans, precipitating the Khitomer massacre.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership ENGINEER Computer Skill Attributes all +5 if with {Toral}.

Name: Mogh
Lore: Father of Worf and Kurn. Followed the traitor Ja'rod to Khitomer, suspecting him of conspiring with Romulans. Rumored to have survived the massacre.
Text: V.I.P. SECURITY Leadership Honor x 2 Computer Skill Archaeology Music

Name: Spock
Lore: 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 Human son of Sarek and Amanda Grayson. Over 140-year-old ambassador. On private mission to Romulus. Mindmelded with Picard.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Computer Skill Leadership SCIENCE Mindmeld

Name: 1962 Roger Maris Baseball Card
Lore: One-of-a-kind trading card. Collectible icon of an ancient professional sport once played on Earth. Owned by Kivas Fajo. Still retains its original bubble gum aroma.
Text: Immediately play on table. During your turn, you may trade this artifact for any opponent's artifact in play. Players must immediately play traded cards as their own. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Persistence of Memory
Lore: Surreal 1931 Salvador Dali painting stolen by Kivas Fajo.
Text: Place in hand until played at any time on {Horga'hn} OR {Thought Maker} OR {Mona Lisa} OR {Static Warp Bubble} OR {Kivas Fajo - Collector} OR {The Traveler: Transcendence} OR "{Devidian Door}" OR {Supernova} OR {Black Hole} OR {Anti-Time Anomaly}. Reverses that card. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: DNA Metamorphosis
Lore: Geordi La Forge was infected with alien DNA. Transformed into an invisible reptilian humanoid, he was observable only when scanned with ultraviolet light.
Text: Place on one personnel present (random selection). At the end of your next turn, that personnel is placed in stasis. Cure, before then, with MEDICAL and {I.P. Scanner}.

Name: Black Hole
Text: Plays between two adjacent [Univ] missions named {Space}. Creates a location (span 1). End of every turn, destroys all cards here. Also, when countdown would expire, instead destroy an adjacent location and all cards there (left first, then alternating, while possible), then countdown resets. Does not count down the turn it is played. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Qapla'!
Lore: When threatened, fight. When in doubt, surprise them. Brute strength is not the most important asset in a fight. Real power is in the heart. A Klingon does not run away from his battles.
Text: If an opponent attacks you, during that battle your Klingons with Honor add INTEGRITY to STRENGTH. (Not cumulative.)

Name: Dixon Hill's Business Card
Text: [Interrupt] If any mug (what ain't Swedish) just got iced and there weren't no witnesses, finger any udda mug what's woikin' for da same boss. Put da bag on 'im. [Event] Plays on da table. The udda boss' next mug what shows up has gotta be univoisal or hologrammatical, den put dis card outta commission. (No duplicatin' dis here event.)

Name: Dr. Soong
Lore: Reclusive genius who perfected the positronic brain originally proposed in the 20th century. Ex-husband of Juliana. "Father" of the androids Data and Lore.
Text: SCIENCE Cybernetics x 2 Computer Skill ENGINEER Once each turn, may reprogram any androids present.

Name: Guinan
Characteristics/ Keywords: El-Aurian; Bartender; Female; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: 500-year-old El-Aurian. U.S.S. Enterprise bartender. Trusted advisor and confidant of Jean-Luc Picard.
Text: CIVILIAN Once per turn, may nullify any [AU] or [Q] icon interrupt, event or dilemma where present. If on {any Enterprise}, doubles {Captain's Log} there.

Name: Kivas Fajo
Lore: Unscrupulous, murderous, conceited Zibalian trader. Collector. Notorious member of Stacius Trade Guild.
Text: CIVILIAN Greed x 2 Acquisition Treachery Each unduplicated artifact present is worth 5 points. Makes parallel use of opponent's {Palor Toff} cards.

Name: Locutus of Borg
Lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Federation. "The knowledge and experience of the human - Jean-Luc Picard - is part of us now."
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Honor Navigation Archaeology Music While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Fed].

Name: Lore
Lore: Evil Soong-type android. Data's "elder brother."
Text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Computer Skill Treachery x 2 SECURITY Transporter Skill Leadership Doubles all {Rogue Borg} and {Crystalline Entities} in play.

Name: Miles O'Brien
Lore: Transporter chief. Conn and Tactical expert. Loathes "Cardies." Loves Keiko. Begat Molly. He plays cello.
Text: ENGINEER SECURITY Transporter Skill x 2 Music Navigation DL/ {Near-Warp Transport}

Name: Sisters of Duras
Lore: Lursa and B'Etor, like their father before them, collaborated with the Romulan Star Empire.
Text: V.I.P.+V.I.P. Lursa: Treachery Leadership Geology Greed B'Etor: Treachery Physics Youth Greed

Name: Spot
Lore: Female cat who lives aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Sometimes mistaken for a male. Finicky gourmet. Has refused over 74 different feline supplements.
Text: ANIMAL Has 9 lives ("stopped" when killed first 8 times). * Once every turn, may "pounce" to disable until end of turn any one personnel present (and herself).

Name: Tallera
Characteristics/ Keywords: Vulcan/Romulan; Female; Stone of Gol-related personnel;
Lore: Female Romulan mercenary. In reality a physically altered Vulcan isolationist seeking the Stone of Gol.
Text: SECURITY Computer Skill SCIENCE Mindmeld Leadership Treachery

Name: Picard's Artificial Heart
Lore: You might have lived if you'd had a real one, instead of this unreliable piece of technology.
Text: Immediately seed under this mission (even if a space mission). When mission completed (or scouted), owner places in hand until played as an Interrupt card, once per game, on any one personnel in play. That personnel dies whenever that personnel's STRENGTH is used. (May be nullified only by {Katherine Pulaski}, if present.)

Name: I.K.S. Chang
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
