Lore: Patrolled the Devron system with sister ship I.K.S. Fek'lhr. Formerly commanded by Governor Worf.
Text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam If your {I.K.S. Fek'lhr} in play, it has a <L) icon and both ships reduce staffing by one [AU] icon.

Name: U.S.S. Pasteur
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation ship; future-related ship; Holodeck; Ship with a Skill; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Medical relief vessel. Starfleet registry NCC-58928. Captained by Beverly Picard in an alternate future.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam, MEDICAL If your {Future Enterprise} in play, it has a (L> icon and reduces its staffing by one [AU] icon.

Name: Antique Machine Gun
Lore: 21st century automatic weapon. Developed for faction wars against ECON in World War III. No stun setting. Rapid-fires small-caliber bullets. Owned and often used by Lily Sloane.
Text: Use as Equipment card. At start of personnel battle, may target two opposing personnel or {Rogue Borg} (random selection). Mortally wounds targets (only stuns androids).

Name: Magic Carpet Ride OCD
Lore: High-res encoding of 20th century rock 'n' roll, known for its enervating rhythms and unbearable volume. "You don't know what we can find... on a Magic Carpet Ride."
Text: May seed at a space location. Owner may relocate any ship at this location (and ship's Away Teams, if any) to any planet location on spaceline. Discard artifact.

Name: Zefram Cochrane's Telescope
Lore: Gazing at the celestial harmony, Zefram Cochrane escaped the squalor of his time and dreamed of the conquest of space. And how much money he could make.
Text: Use as Equipment card. Once each turn, if on a planet with your personnel, allows you to glance at bottom seed card at one adjacent non-planet location.

Name: Balancing Act
Lore: Deadly plasma coolant flooded main engineering through a rupture opened by Data. Survival depended upon balance and strength. Resistance was futile.
Text: Each player whose missions with point boxes were mostly [S] or mostly [P] (by a difference of 3 or more), when seeded, loses 50 points (even if playing Borg).

Name: Blended
Lore: Sometimes obtaining information from locals requires consuming beverages of dubious nutritional value. It's best not to criticize such "counseling techniques."
Text: To get past requires Empathy, Diplomacy, {Morn} or {any Scotty}. All such personnel are "stopped," but if two or more present, one must continue (random selection).

Name: Borg Servo
Lore: Borg nanotechnological servomechanism. Can remain dormant and undetected until activated. Typical first evidence of assimilation. Rapidly takes over its victim.
Text: Unless Cybernetics and MEDICAL present, opponent (if playing Borg) assimilates one personnel present (random selection). Discard dilemma.

Name: Dead End
Lore: A Borg force field prevented Data from accomplishing his first goal, and caused him to seek another option.
Text: Unless you have at least 50 points, cannot get past; place dilemma atop mission; it may not be attempted by a player with less than 50 points. (Unique.)

Name: Don't Call Me Ahab
Lore: Jean-Luc Picard had an Ahab-like obsession with his revenge against the Borg. If his chest had been a cannon, he would have shot his heart upon them.
Text: Stops one OFFICER with INTEGRITY>6 AND any number of /Ent-E personnel present (opponent's choice).

Name: Lack of Preparation
Lore: An Away Team that is unprepared to complete its mission will undoubtedly experience delays. Mission progress may be impossible until additional personnel arrive.
Text: Non-Borg: Cannot get past (lose 10 points) unless you could have met mission requirements at start of attempt. Borg: Must have [Com], [Nav] and [Def] personnel to proceed.

Name: Maglock
Lore: Maglocks such as those securing the U.S.S. Enterprise-E deflector dish require triple-input authorization. The need for coordinated effort prevents accidental activation.
Text: To get past, crew must have at least 3 OFFICER with STRENGTH>5 each.

Name: My First Raygun
Lore: An intruder with a stolen phaser can pose an unpredictable threat, especially if she doesn't know the difference between "stun" and "maximum."
Text: Immediately probe (then discard probe card): [Event], [Interrupt], [AU], /Ent-E: Kills a personnel (random selection). Otherwise: "Stops" a personnel (random selection).

Name: Ooby Dooby
Lore: Well, you wiggle to the left, you wiggle to the right; you do the Ooby Dooby with all your might; Ooby Dooby; Ooby Dooby; Ooby Dooby Ooby Dooby, Dooby Dooby doo wah, doo wah, doo wah.
Text: Draw one card for each non-android Youth present, then discard one card for each Music present. All Youth, Music and {Zefram Cochrane} present are "stopped."

Name: Primitive Culture
Lore: First contact requires caution, subterfuge or force. Solkar's historic visit to Earth was peaceful, but Federation/Klingon contact in 2218 would ignite a century of hostilities.
Text: To get past, requires 3 Vulcans OR Anthropology and CIVILIAN OR Vorta and 4 Jem'Hadar OR 2 Tal Shiar OR 2 Obsidian Order OR Acquisition and 2 Greed OR 6 Klingons OR 4 [Def] Borg.

Name: Scout Encounter
Lore: Many species send specially designed scout ships into unexplored sectors of space. If the species is aggressive, the arrival of a scout ship is a harbinger of trouble.
Text: Opponent may download to this location one scout ship with one or two [Univ] crew members. That ship may (if possible) initiate battle against you or move away.

Name: Shot in the Back
Lore: Data protected his Away Team from machine gun fire by taking a few bullets from behind, then simply waiting until the magazine was empty. No vital systems were damaged.
Text: Stops SECURITY androids and OFFICER androids, if any present. Otherwise, kills one non-android Away Team member (opponent's choice).

Name: Strict Dress Code
Lore: If the holographic ma tre d' hadn't delayed the Borg, they would have killed Jean-Luc Picard before he could have completed his plan.
Text: Sacrifice one Diplomacy, one [Holo] or two [Def] personnel present (killed); otherwise, one personnel present is killed (opponent's choice). Mission continues.

Name: Theta-Radiation Poisoning
Lore: Damage to warp drive components, such as the throttle assembly of the Phoenix, can result in subspace-related theta particle emissions. Deadly if not inoculated quickly.
Text: Play on any ship or outpost here (opponent's choice). End of each turn, one personnel present without {Medical Kit} killed (random selection). Cure with 6 ENGINEER.

Name: Undetected Beam-In
Lore: Borg refugees from a destroyed spherical vessel were able to beam aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-E without being detected. This led to a nasty surprise for Inge Eiger.
Text: Opponent may download to this location up to 4 Borg drones or {Rogue Borg Mercenaries} (they do not battle now). Nullify dilemma with {Shelby} OR 4 SECURITY.

Name: Launch Portal
Requires: Borg Sphere; Scout; Shuttlecraft; Tractor Beam;
Text: Suspends play to do any or all of the following: download {Engage Shuttle Operations} or {Escape Pod}; download (once per game) a scout ship, shuttle or Borg Sphere to your ship with Tractor Beam; and (except during a mission attempt) launch any or all of your carried ships with crew. Discard, or place on Engage Shuttle Operations to protect it from nullification and extend its effects to scout ships.

Name: Ready Room Door
Text: Once per turn, plays to download to one of your ships its matching commander (draw no cards this turn) OR to download one Captain's Order. After any use, discard doorway; place it atop your draw deck; or place it atop one of your Captain's Order events to protect that event from nullification.

Name: Temporal Vortex
Text: Plays on a time location. While in play, any ships may time travel between here and corresponding spaceline location. OR Suspends play while you place doorway on {Borg Ship} dilemma or {The Sheliak}. While in play, dilemma disappears. OR Plays on table. While in play, nullifies {Distortion of Space/Time Continuum}. OR Relocates one of your ships at a time location to spaceline location of opponent's choice.

Name: Transwarp Network Gateway
Text: Seed one during facility phase on any spaceline end OR play on any spaceline location where you have a [Nav] Borg. Any player may play a {Transwarp Conduit} (or another copy of this doorway) to allow moving any or all of that player's ships from this Transwarp Network Gateway to another. OR Downloads Transwarp Conduit (discard doorway).

Name: Assimilation Table
Lore: Functions: Equip drone initiates with specialized adaptive implants. Access counterpart biological data; encode heuristic pathways. Augment collective distinctiveness.
Text: Holds one personnel (occupant killed if table destroyed). Once per turn, in place of one card draw, you may download to occupant {an Implant} card.

Name: Starfleet Type III Phaser Rifle
Lore: More powerful than other hand-held Federation energy weapons and has longer-lasting charge. Rotatable beam modulation. Stored aboard ship in armory racks.
Text: Federation and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

Name: Tommygun
Lore: Holographic weapon. Version of Thompson submachinegun, model 1921. Can empty a 100-round drum in 4 seconds. "Pinched" from Nicky the Nose's henchman by Dixon Hill.
Text: Use at start of personnel battles. May stun one {Rogue Borg} or personnel present (random selection) OR erase up to 100 [Holo] personnel present (your choice).

Name: Abandon Mission
Lore: Jean-Luc Picard felt compelled to ignore his assigned patrol duties in the neutral zone and instead join the attack against the Borg.
Text: Plays on any ship with its matching commander or any /Ent-E personnel aboard. Crew may not attempt missions or beam off. Nullified if ship battles. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

Name: Activate Subcommands
Lore: The Borg have huge numbers of available drones which normally perform internal functions for the collective. When a task is pending, some of these drones are activated.
Text: Downloads one [Com] Borg drone, one [Nav] Borg drone and one [Def] Borg drone. Discard event and draw no cards this turn.

Name: Disengage Safety Protocols
Lore: Jean-Luc Picard overrode the holodeck safety protocols during the Borg invasion of the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Without those protocols, even a holographic bullet can kill.
Text: Plays on table. While in play, suspends Holographic Safety Protocols ([Holo] personnel may mortally wound). Also, [Holo] weapons mortally wound instead of stun.

Name: Intermix Ratio
Lore: Zefram Cochrane struggled to maintain the optimum balance of matter and anti-matter injection for the Phoenix warp systems. The proper ratio, of course, is 1 to 1.
Text: Plays on table. If any player's ratio of bonus points to non-bonus points exceeds 1:1, the excess bonus points do not count toward winning. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

Name: Mirror Image
Lore: Jean-Luc Picard reflected upon introducing an unstable element into a critical situation.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. All {Red Alert}, {Kivas Fajo - Collector}, {Masaka Transformations} and {The Traveler: Transcendence} cards affect all players. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

Name: Mission Debriefing
Lore: Bureaucracies require field commanders to submit a complete "after action report" on any mission. Though necessary, the process can be time consuming.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Whenever any crew or Away Team finishes a mission attempt (whether successful or not), it is "stopped." (Captain's Order.)

Name: Ocular Implants
Lore: In 2371, Geordi La Forge received implants allowing him to see without his VISOR. They include enhanced capabilities such as infrared and zoom focus over 500 meters.
Text: Plays on your Borg, android or {any Geordi}. Once each turn where present, may glance for 10 seconds at either one Away Team OR bottom seed card of mission.

Name: Regenerate
Lore: The Borg use neural energy to collectively repair damaged biological and technological components. The Queen often serves as the focal point.
Text: Plays to fully repair and "stop" any {Borg Ship} dilemma or Borg ship (nullifying any cards reducing its attributes) OR to shuffle your discard pile into draw deck. Discard event.

Name: Retask
Lore: Even a Borg cube ship can lose contact with the collective consciousness and begin marauding through space. Proper protocol re-establishment reintegrates it into the collective.
Text: Downloads [Univ] {Borg Cube} and seven drones ([Bor], [Bor], [Bor], [Com], [Nav], [Nav], [Def]) to replace any {Borg Ship} dilemma in play. Discard event and dilemma. Draw no cards this turn.

Name: The Line Must Be Drawn Here
Lore: ... And I will make them PAY for what they've done!
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Any player who plays {Amanda Rogers}, {Kevin Uxbridge} or {Q2} loses 5 points, even if playing Borg. (Cumulative. Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

Name: Wall of Ships
Lore: A wall display of all ships to bear the name Enterprise is a tradition built into each new ship of the line. This exhibit is in the observation lounge aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-E.
Text: Downloads {any Enterprise}. Discard event. OR Plays on table. Adds 1 to RANGE, WEAPONS and SHIELDS of each of your Enterprises. (Cumulative.)

Name: Borg Outpost
Lore: Identification: BORG OUTPOST Task: Construct Borg vessels. Disseminate resources.
Text: Seed one at any [S] mission with no affiliation icons OR build at such a mission (or at an assimilated planet) where you have a Borg ENGINEER. DL/ {Transwarp Network Gateway}

Name: A Change of Plans
Lore: Sensing that her plans for the interplexing beacon had been thwarted, the Borg Queen immediately implemented a new goal for the hive.
Text: Plays to do any or all of the following: discard your current objective; return it to your hand if you have {Borg Queen} in play; and download one [BO] Objective card.

Name: Adapt: Modulate Shields
Lore: Borg quickly adapt countermeasures, such as drone energy shields, to foil any new weapon used against them. Remodulating an energy weapon helps only briefly.
Text: Plays and remains on a {phaser} or {disruptor} just used to stun or mortally wound one of your [Com] Borg. Your Borg are immune to all weapons with that exact card title.

Name: Adapt: Negate Obstruction
Lore: The first experience of a hazard can be as dangerous to a Borg drone as to anyone. However, the Borg soon adapt and learn how to nullify it.
Text: Nullifies a dilemma (except a Q-related dilemma) just encountered by your [Com] Borg if your Borg encountered that dilemma (or a copy) on a previous turn.

Name: Alas, Poor Queen
Lore: Like all cybernetic life forms, the Borg cannot survive without their organic components. Loss of the Queen brings chaos to order.
Text: Plays if {Borg Queen} (or Bluegill Queen) was just killed. All Borg (or Bluegills) in play of same player also die. (Immune to {Amanda Rogers}.) OR Nullifies {Regenerate}.

Name: Android Headlock
Lore: Although drones are physically stronger than humanoids, they cannot always overcome Soong-type androids. Data has strangled, thrown and "disarmed" various Borg.
Text: Mortally wounds a Borg drone, Jem'Hadar, {Rogue Borg} or [Holo] personnel who just engaged your android in combat. (Android engages next adversary.) OR Nullifies {Borg Kiss}.

Name: Assimilate This!
Lore: Proving that resistance is not always futile, Worf gave the Borg something else to assimilate.
Text: Nullifies {Build Interplexing Beacon} OR {Crosis} OR {Orbital Bombardment}. (Also, owner of that card loses points, even if playing Borg.)

Name: Assimilation Tubules
Lore: Specially equipped drones use tubule-shaped talons capable of penetrating any known alloy or energy field. Nanoprobes in the bloodstream recode the victim's DNA.
Text: Plays during battle after a winner is determined. Your {Talon Drone} may select one opposing mortally wounded personnel present to instead be assimilated.

Name: Awaken
Lore: Each Borg drone is tied into a sophisticated subspace communications network, allowing quick activation in response to a threat.
Text: Downloads one [Com] or [Nav] drone. OR Plays at start of battle to download to one of your ships at that location one [Def] drone (two if opponent initiated the battle).

Name: Borg Kiss
Lore: It had been eight years, seven months, sixteen days, four minutes and twenty-two seconds since Data last experienced physical forms of pleasure.
Text: Plays if you just probed for {Assimilate Counterpart}. Ignore result, draw probe card and probe again. OR Plays to draw one card for each [*] on a male you've abducted.

Name: Borg Neuroprocessor
Lore: Picard used a tricorder to decode the memory chip implanted in the chest of a Borg drone. This chip records all instructions the drone has received from the collective.
Text: Glance at one face-down [HA] card. OR Plays if a Borg or {Rogue Borg} has died and you have {any tricorder} in play. Nullifies a [BO] interrupt or all Rogue Borg in play.

Name: Deactivation
Lore: Command codes, known only to key personnel, are needed to disable many system-level instructions.
Text: Nullifies {Auto-Destruct Sequence} (unless {Fractal Encryption Code} present), {Red Alert} or {Static Warp Bubble}. OR Erases an Away Team of only [Holo] personnel. (Captain's Order.)

Name: Fractal Encryption Code
Lore: Nearly unbreakable code. Based on infinitely recursive fractal algorithms. Data used one to isolate the main computer, storing the decryption codes in his neural net.
Text: Plays on your ship or outpost if your android aboard. It may not be assimilated or commandeered and may not use RANGE or WEAPONS. Same android may nullify interrupt if aboard.

Name: He Will Make an Excellent Drone
Lore: Having apparently seduced a new counterpart to join the collective with temptations of flesh, the Queen had no further use for her old "equal."
Text: Converts your counterpart to a drone. (Discard any {Assimilate Counterpart} objective placed on that Borg.)

Name: I'm a Doctor, Not a Doorstop
Lore: Interactive holograms sometimes balk at instructions not compatible with their programming. Dr. Crusher activated an unwilling E.M.H. program to delay a group of Borg.
Text: Plays to "stop" any one [Holo] personnel. OR Plays to cancel a personnel battle by sacrificing (discarding) one of your [Holo] personnel present.

Name: Mercy Kill
Lore: Assimilation is considered by many to be a fate worse than death. "Don't hesitate to fire. Believe me, you'll doing them a favor."
Text: Plays to immediately kill one of your personnel just abducted, captured or assimilated as a drone. OR "Kills" (nullifies) any one of your Event cards in play.

Name: Remodulation
Lore: With Borg intruders overrunning every defensive checkpoint, Jean-Luc Picard struggled with modifications to make resources more effective.
Text: Nullifies {Adapt: Modulate Shields}. OR "Remodulates" your hand. Discard one or two cards and draw an equal number from the bottom of your draw deck.

Name: Scorched Hand
Lore: Plasma gas from the ruptured coolant tank liquified all the organic skin grafted onto Data's endoskeletal structure.
Text: Plays to cause each player who has more than 12 cards in hand to shuffle all but 6 (random selection) and place beneath draw deck. (Immune to {Amanda Rogers}.)

Name: Sense the Borg
Lore: Yes, I know - the Borg.
Text: Plays if a Borg ship, Borg personnel, {Borg Ship} dilemma or {Rogue Borg} just entered play. Download to hand {Weak Spot} OR {Hugh} OR {Borg Neuroprocessor} OR {Ready Room Door}.

Name: Shipwreck
Lore: Lily was stunned when Jean-Luc Picard, in a rage against the Borg, destroyed the traditional Enterprise exhibit in the observation lounge. "You broke your little ships."
Text: Suspends ALL ship attribute enhancements for the rest of this turn. (May be played at start of battle.) OR Nullifies all {Wall of Ships} cards in play.

Name: Temporal Wake
Lore: The Borg sphere used chronometric particles to create a temporal vortex. The pursuing U.S.S. Enterprise-E was pulled in when it flew through the wake of the anomaly.
Text: Plays if any ship or Away Team just time traveled. Choose your other ship or Away Team which was present; it follows. OR Nullifies {Anti-Time Anomaly}.

Name: Three-Dimensional Thinking
Lore: The Borg Queen was also on the first cube to attack Earth, even though all Borg on it were destroyed. "You think in such three-dimensional terms. How small you've become."
Text: Plays if you have {Borg Queen} or a counterpart aboard one of your ships being destroyed. Immediately relocate any or all crew to another of your ships in play.

Name: Weak Spot
Lore: Sensing the hive's thoughts, Jean-Luc Picard ordered all ships to fire on a critically vulnerable point, even though it did not appear to be a vital system.
Text: Plays on a ship being targeted by two or more ships. For this battle, reduces its SHIELDS by 4 (not cumulative) OR suspends its SHIELDS enhancement from any one card.

Name: Espionage Mission
Affil: Any 'Espionage... on Federation' card may play here.  Also, mission may be attempted if {Selok} in Away Team.
Requires: Espionage... on Federation; Founder; Sector 001 Region;
Lore: Infiltrate Starfleet HQ; compile intelligence dossier on the Federation homeworld.
Text: Tal Shiar x2 OR Obsidian Order x2 OR FCA x2 OR Klingon Intelligence x2 OR 2 Founders

Name: Patrol Neutral Zone
Lore: Prevent incursions along border of Federation/Romulan Neutral Zone.
Text: Leadership + No opposing ships in Neutral Zone X = number of Neutral Zone locations in play.

Name: Planet
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Investigate unsurveyed habitable planet with nitrogen-oxygen atmosphere.
Text: Landed ship + (Geology OR Greed)

Name: Assign Mission Specialists
Text: Seeds or plays on table. You may download to one of your outposts up to two different mission specialists (personnel whose only skill is a regular skill) if no copies you own are in play. Once each mission, your mission specialist may score 5 points when they use their skill to meet a mission requirement. You may voluntarily discard objective at start of any of your turns. (Unique.)

Name: Assimilate Counterpart
Text: Plays on table. Target an opponent's unique male personnel. Your Borg may beam to and battle target's crew or Away Team. One of your Borg who engages target in combat may abduct target. If target is occupying an {Assimilation Table}, you may probe: [Com], [Nav], [Def]: Assimilated as a counterpart. Place on target. Worth 5 points per [*] while objective on target.

Name: Assimilate Homeworld
Text: Plays on table. Target both a homeworld with no [BO] objective on it and your matching counterpart. Your Borg may scout that homeworld. After scouting complete, if your matching counterpart is at that location, you may probe: [Com]: Assimilated. Place on mission. Cards of that affiliation (except [AU] cards) may not report to any outpost for rest of game.

Name: Assimilate Planet
Text: Plays on table. Target a non-homeworld planet mission showing at least 35 points and with no [BO] objective on it. Your Borg may scout that planet. After scouting complete, if you have Borg at that location, you may probe: [Com], [Def]: Assimilated. Place on mission. May download one Objective card.

Name: Assimilate Starship
Text: Plays on table. Target an opponent's ship. Your Borg may scout that ship. (Whenever no active Borg aboard target during your turn, you may beam one scout aboard.) After scouting complete, if your Borg have Computer Skill aboard that ship, you may probe: [Com], [Def]: Assimilated. Place on ship. May download one Objective card.

Name: Build Interplexing Beacon
Text: Suspends your {Assimilate Homeworld} targeting {Earth}, if your {Stop First Contact} was nullified. Target a ship. Your Borg may scout target. If your Borg are aboard target orbiting {2063 Earth}, you may probe: [Com], [Def]: Transponder rods are now set in place. [Nav]: If transponder rods set, place on ship; Timeline disrupted in 2063 and suspended objective completed.

Name: Eliminate Starship
Text: Plays on table. Target an opponent's ship at a mission you seeded. Your Borg may battle that ship. If they destroy it in battle, immediately probe (draw probe card, discard objective): [Bor]: Wreckage. You may download {Salvage Starship}. [AU]: Energy distortion. You may download {Temporal Rift}. [BO]: Collateral damage. One other opposing ship present is damaged (random selection).

Name: Establish Gateway
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Target a space mission with no [BO] objective on it. Your Borg may scout that location. After scouting complete, if you have Borg at that location, you may probe: [Com], [Nav]: Sector cleared. Place on mission. Download to here one {Transwarp Network Gateway} (if possible). May download one Objective card.

Name: Prepare Assault Teams
Text: Plays on table. You may download to one of your crews or Away Teams one hand weapon. While in play, your SECURITY may function as leaders. Also, at start of personnel battle, you may split your cards into two assault teams (face down). Attacker chooses one team to participate in the battle. (The other team does not participate and is not "stopped.")

Name: Salvage Starship
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Target a space mission with a point box where an opponent's ship was destroyed (or {Wolf 359}), if no [BO] objective on it. Your Borg may scout that location. If you have Borg there, you may probe: [Nav], [Def]: Place on mission. May search opponent's discard pile for one ship to place underneath objective. Add its special equipment to all of your ships.

Name: Stop First Contact
Text: Suspends your {Assimilate Homeworld} targeting {Earth}, if scouting complete. Target {Montana Missile Complex} (downloading as necessary). If you have a staffed ship orbiting that location, you may probe: [Def]: Phoenix destroyed here. Timeline disrupted in 2063. Discard objective. Suspended objective completed. May download one Objective card.

Name: Visit Cochrane Memorial
Text: Seed or plays on {Earth}. (Unique.) When your unopposed [Ent-E] personnel or human ENGINEER personnel present, you may probe (once per game per persona): [Fed], [Sta]: "Oooh." Draw one card. [Event], [Interrupt]: "Aaaaah." Play one personnel to planet. [Fajo], [Equipment]: "Wow!" Download probe card (or a copy). [Non], [Doorway]: "I thought it'd be bigger." Discard one card.

Name: Admiral Hayes
Lore: Admiral in charge of coordinating Starfleet's anti-Borg forces. Led a fleet in defense of a Borg cube attack on Earth in 2373.
Text: V.I.P. Each of your Federation ships at same location is WEAPONS +1 and SHIELDS +2. Leadership

Name: Alyssa Ogawa (First Contact)
Lore: Lieutenant (j.g.) Alyssa Ogawa married shipmate Andrew Powell in 2370. A nurse assistant to Dr. Beverly Crusher, she is studying to be a doctor.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Exobiology DL/ {Medical Kit}

Name: Beverly Crusher (First Contact)
Lore: Dr. Beverly Crusher is the U.S.S. Enterprise-E chief medical officer. Swore she'd never use an E.M.H.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Exobiology MEDICAL DL/ {Medical Tricorder} OR {E.M.H. Program}

Name: Borg Queen
Lore: I am the beginning; the end; the one who is many. I am the Borg.... I am the collective.
Text: When reported, selects any skill; may change skill at start of each turn. May download {A Change of Plans} or a Borg drone in place of one card draw.

Name: Data (First Contact)
Lore: Lt. Commander Data had an emotion chip installed in 2371. Cries yellow tears. Soong-type android who, for 0.68 seconds, almost joined the Borg.
Text: OFFICER Astrophysics Computer Skill x 2 ENGINEER Exobiology DL/ {Fractal Encryption Code}

Name: Deanna Troi (First Contact)
Lore: Commander Deanna Troi is ship's counselor aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. 1/2 Betazoid, 1/2 Human. Complained there wasn't time to argue about time.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Empathy Navigation Once per game, may "unstop" her Away Team.

Name: Dr. Royse
Lore: Male Bolian. Representative of Starfleet scientists. Molecular archaeologist on sabbatical from Daystrom Institute annex on Galor IV. Friend of Vash.
Text: SCIENCE Archaeology

Name: E.M.H. Program
Lore: Generic interactive Emergency Medical Hologram. Programmed by Dr. Zimmerman. For short-term use.
Text: MEDICAL May download from hand (suspending play) to your ship or outpost.

Name: Eight of Nineteen
Lore: Identification: ASSAULT DRONE Task: Supply enhanced combat apparatus. Patrol. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid
Text: SECURITY Where present, your Borg are each STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Eighteen of Nineteen
Lore: Identification: ASTROGATION DRONE Task: Calibrate warp matrix. Increase efficiency. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species.
Text: Navigation Computer Skill While on your ship, RANGE is +1. (Cumulative.)

Name: Eleven of Nineteen
Lore: Identification: BIO-MED DRONE Task: Reabsorb damaged biological components. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Once every turn where present, may "reabsorb" (place beneath draw deck) another of your Borg just killed. Biology MEDICAL

Name: Fifteen of Seventeen
Lore: Identification: COUNTERMEASURE DRONE Task: Nullify resistance to scout operations. Biological Distinctiveness: Klingon species.
Text: ENGINEER Exobiology May download any one {Adapt} card in place of one card draw.

Name: Five of Eleven
Lore: Identification: CYBER DRONE Task: Analyze suspended animation principles. Biological Distinctiveness: Klingon species.
Text: SCIENCE Cybernetics Wherever [Com] Borg present in the same hive, may prevent your Borg from being placed in stasis.

Name: Four of Eleven
Lore: Identification: GUARD DRONE Task: Compute defense effectiveness. Maximize. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: MEDICAL Computer Skill While on your ship, SHIELDS are +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Geordi La Forge (First Contact)
Lore: In 2371, Chief Engineer Geordi La Forge received ocular implants that surpassed the functions of his old VISOR. Attended Zefram Cochrane High School.
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Computer Skill Physics Leadership DL/ {Ocular Implants}

Name: Hawk
Lore: Helm officer of the U.S.S Enterprise-E. Lieutenant Hawk piloted the ship through a temporal vortex. Member of Picard's zero-G assault team.
Text: OFFICER When aboard, your ship may treat each nebula as if its span were reduced by 1. Navigation x 2

Name: Inge Eiger
Lore: Typical diagnostic engineer on U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Assistant to Paul Porter. Female seismologist from Tycho City, Lunar Colony.
Text: ENGINEER Geology

Name: Jean-Luc Picard (First Contact)
Lore: Captain of the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Once assimilated by the Borg. Became obsessed with their destruction. Still hears echoes of the collective.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Diplomacy Archaeology DL/ {Sense the Borg} DL/ {Make It So}

Name: Joseph Travis
Lore: Representative of the brave security personnel in Starfleet. Ensign Travis stood his ground against Borg intruders at defensive checkpoint 3 on deck 4.
Text: SECURITY Honor Youth

Name: Kathleen Tonell
Lore: Inspired in 2063 with a new view of humanity's place in the cosmos, her work helped end post-atomic horror and led to world government in 2113.
Text: CIVILIAN Anthropology

Name: Lightner
Lore: Lieutenant (j.g.) Lightner is an expert marksman. Member of the winning team in the 2369 Starfleet Academy Parrises Squares Championship.
Text: SECURITY Youth Astrophysics DL/ {Starfleet Type III Phaser Rifle}

Name: Lily Sloane
Lore: Structural design engineer of Phoenix. Took first steps into the new frontier. Helped overcome Borg in 2063. Said, "Jean-Luc, blow up the damned ship!"
Text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Physics DL/ {Auto-Destruct Sequence} If on {Phoenix}, meets two [Stf] staffing requirements.

Name: Lisa Azar
Lore: Ex-wife of a coalition arms merchant on Turkana IV. Misses her old lifestyle, but likes the opportunities offered by the Federation.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Greed

Name: Nine of Eleven
Lore: Identification: INTERLINK DRONE Task: Expedite aptitude dissemination. Enhance. Biological Distinctiveness: Cardassian species.
Text: Allows all Borg in this hive present with a [Com] Borg to share skills. Each such Borg has every shared skill at its highest level.

Name: Nine of Seventeen
Lore: Identification: MULTIPLEXOR DRONE Task: Monitor multiple threat acquisition. Target. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species.
Text: When on your ship during battle, that ship may use total WEAPONS against X different targets, where X=number of [Def] Borg aboard.

Name: Obarakeh
Lore: Ensign Obarakeh is typical of Starfleet security personnel. She monitors and administrates computer encryption safeguards. Plays the Algolian chimes.
Text: SECURITY Music Computer Skill

Name: One of Eleven
Lore: Identification: PROCUREMENT DRONE Task: Add technological distinctiveness to collective. Biological Distinctiveness: Bolian species.
Text: May "steal" unattended Equipment cards present. May download any one [BO] Equipment card in place of one card draw. ENGINEER

Name: Paul Porter
Lore: Senior systems engineer aboard U.S.S Enterprise-E. Amateur geologist, studying with friend Inge Eiger. In command during Geordi La Forge's absence.
Text: ENGINEER Physics Geology DL/ {Any PADD} Computer Skill

Name: Reginald Barclay (First Contact)
Lore: Lieutenant Reginald Barclay helped repair the Phoenix in time for its historic flight. Member of Alpha Team. Hypochondriac. Hero worshiper.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill DL/ {Plexing} Doubles {Visit Cochrane Memorial} where present.

Name: Richard Wilkins
Lore: Typical scientist. Ordered to scan the Neutral Zone on stardate 50893. Found 20 particles of space dust per cm , 52 UV radiation spikes, and a class 2 comet.
Text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography

Name: Sevek
Lore: Male Vulcan scientist. An expert in planetary development and ecological systems. Served on Solkar's survey vessel.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Geology Mindmeld

Name: Six of Eleven
Lore: Identification: QUANTUM DRONE Task: Investigate parallel space/time. Analyze. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species.
Text: Physics Navigation SCIENCE When on your ship, may download an {Alternate Universe Door} in place of one card draw.

Name: Six of Seventeen
Lore: Identification: SABOTAGE DRONE Task: Scan navigation/defense systems. Attenuate. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Physics Computer Skill Once every turn, if on a ship, may reduce RANGE or WEAPONS by 2 until end of turn. (Not cumulative.)

Name: Sixteen of Nineteen
Lore: Identification: SURVEY DRONE Task: Identify exorelics. Examine. Classify. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Archaeology Geology May acquire artifact(s) if on same planet or aboard a ship at same space location.

Name: Solkar
Lore: Initiated Vulcan/Earth contact in 2063. The first Vulcan to wish Zefram Cochrane peace and long life.
Text: OFFICER Honor Archaeology Exobiology Mindmeld DL/ {Live Long and Prosper}

Name: Ten of Nineteen
Lore: Identification: TACHYON DRONE Task: Neutralize concealment systems. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Astrophysics Navigation Once each turn, if on your ship, may force one opponent's ship at same location to decloak.

Name: Thirteen of Nineteen
Lore: Identification: TACTICAL DRONE Task: Control offensive capabilities. Coordinate. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: SECURITY While on your ship, WEAPONS are +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Thomas McClure
Lore: Senior security officer aboard U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Led the ship's internal defense during the Borg attack of 2373. Transferred from U.S.S. Hood.
Text: SECURITY Leadership Exobiology

Name: Three of Nineteen
Lore: Identification: TALON DRONE Task: Add biological distinctiveness to collective. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Just after stunning an opposing personnel, may abduct and assimilate that adversary. SECURITY DL/ {Assimilation Tubules}

Name: T'Shonra
Lore: Vulcan scientist. In 2063, on an extended survey far from Vulcan, her scanning instruments detected a warp signature emanating from an uncharted system.
Text: SCIENCE Navigation Mindmeld Music Stellar Cartography

Name: Two of Eleven
Lore: Identification: TRANSPORT DRONE Task: Determine defensive screen harmonics. Adapt. Biological Distinctiveness: Klingon species.
Text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill Where present, allows your transporters to beam through opponent's SHIELDS.

Name: Two of Nineteen
Lore: Identification: TRANSWARP DRONE Task: Expand transportation network. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Navigation Stellar Cartography When on your ship, may download one {Transwarp} doorway or interrupt in place of one card draw.

Name: Two of Seventeen
Lore: Identification: UNITY DRONE Task: Study biological organisms. Analyze. Correlate. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Your Borg present with any [Com] Borg in this hive may add their CUNNING to total wherever there is another [Com] Borg in same hive. Anthropology

Name: William T. Riker (First Contact)
Lore: Commander Will Riker led Earth's first defeat of the Borg in 2367. In 2063, led the secret effort to repair the Phoenix and reinstate Earth's first warp flight.
Text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Honor Music DL/ {Anti-Matter Spread}

Name: Worf (First Contact)
Lore: Lt. Commander Worf was promoted in 2371. Klingon commander of U.S.S. Defiant during the Borg attack of 2373.
Text: OFFICER Honor x 2 Leadership Navigation DL/ {Assimilate This!}

Name: Zefram Cochrane
Lore: Inventor of warp drive. Reluctant hero. First human to make contact with an alien species. Likes tequila, rock 'n' roll, money and naked women.
Text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER x 2 Computer Skill Astrophysics May play {Visit Cochrane Memorial} on same planet.

Name: Borg Cube
Lore: Identification: BORG CUBE Task: Explore galaxy for biological and technological distinctiveness. Assimilate.
Text: Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard. Tractor Beam

Name: Borg Scout Vessel
Lore: Identification: BORG SCOUT VESSEL Task: Search for assimilation targets. Establish transwarp connections.
Text: May report with up to 4 personnel to a {Transwarp Network Gateway} (download doorway if necessary) at any spaceline end.

Name: Borg Sphere
Lore: Identification: BORG SPHERE Task: General-purpose vessel. Provide contingency option when meeting resistance.
Text: May be reported aboard, carried aboard and launched from any of your Borg cubes.

Name: Phoenix
Lore: Earth's first faster-than-light ship. Launched via a Titan missile. Commanded by Zefram Cochrane.
Text: May take off and land once per game. Worth points while in orbit.

Name: Queen's Borg Cube
Lore: Identification: BORG CUBE Task: Assimilate human homeworld by direct attack, Earth date 2373. Borg Queen commands.
Text: WEAPONS and SHIELDS +3 at {Earth}. Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard. Tractor Beam

Name: Queen's Borg Sphere
Lore: Identification: BORG SPHERE Task: Contingency for Borg Cube - Bombard Earth in the past; stop first contact. Borg Queen commands.
Text: May be reported aboard, carried aboard and launched from any of your Borg cubes. DL/ {Temporal Vortex}

Name: U.S.S. Bozeman
Lore: Starship from the 23rd century. Registry NCC-1941. Modernized to defend against Borg technology. Captained by Morgan Bateson.
Text: WEAPONS and SHIELDS +2 vs. Borg ships and {Borg Ship} dilemma. Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Enterprise-E
Lore: Commissioned in 2372. Sixth starship in the Enterprise line. Optimized to battle the Borg. 700 meters long. Infiltrated by Borg in 2373.
Text: WEAPONS +3 vs. Borg ships and {Borg Ship} dilemma. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: Vulcan Lander
Lore: Tri-lateral symmetry. Entered the Sol system at 11 a.m. on April 5th, 2063. Commanded by Solkar.
Text: May take off or land (uses 1 RANGE). Your Vulcans may report for duty here.

Name: Montana Missile Complex
Lore: Historic time of Earth's first warp flight and contact with extraterrestrials.
Text: Plays on table. Seed {Phoenix} beneath this location from outside the game ({any Zefram Cochrane} may acquire it later); Borg player may download {Stop First Contact}. Once Phoenix has taken off or {Vulcan Lander} has landed here, nullifies Stop First Contact. Native to this timeline: Zefram Cochrane, {Lily Sloane}, Phoenix, Vulcan Lander, {Solkar}, {Sevek}, {T'Shonra} and {Kathleen Tonell}.

Name: The Emissary
Lore: Benjamin Sisko discovered the Celestial Temple in 2369. Reluctantly accepts Bajoran reverence.
Text: V.I.P. All other Bajorans in play are INTEGRITY +2. Your Bajorans may report for duty where present. Diplomacy DL/ {Bajoran Wormhole}

Name: The Traveler
Lore: Tau Alpha C native able to transcend space. Phases out from exertion. Appeared to Wesley as Lakanta.
Text: V.I.P. If aboard your ship with Youth, allows ship to move from one spaceline location to any other spaceline location, then "phases out" (returns to hand).

Name: Abandon Ship!
Lore: Krenim attacks repeatedly damaged the U.S.S. Voyager. Failing life support systems led Kathryn Janeway to order the evacuation of all personnel except senior staff.
Text: If ship damaged or RANGE reduced, personnel not needed for staffing are placed with dilemma atop mission. Rescue (opponent may capture) personnel with different ship here.

Name: Armus: Sticky Situation
Lore: Armus, a remnant of the Vagrans, engulfed William T. Riker in his skin of evil. Only the finesse and skillful negotiation of Jean-Luc Picard resulted in his release.
Text: Away Team member with highest STRENGTH is stopped if another personnel present has Diplomacy and CUNNING>7, killed otherwise. To get past requires any personnel remaining.

Name: Hippocratic Oath
Lore: On stardate 49066.5, rogue Jem'Hadar detained Julian Bashir on Bopak III. He was compelled to seek a cure to their genetically engineered addiction to the drug ketracel-white.
Text: To get past, most CUNNING MEDICAL must relocate with dilemma to nearest planet at another location (must still have MEDICAL upon arrival); stopped until countdown expires.

Name: Make Us Go
Lore: We are Pakleds. We look for things...things to make us go. You are smart. Can you make our ship go? Do not try to trick us. We can tell.
Text: To get past, place most CUNNING ENGINEER present atop mission with dilemma. At the end of your next turn, place both out of play if you do not have CUNNING>24 here.

Name: Unscientific Method
Lore: As part of his plan to steal the newly developed metaphasic shield technology, Jo'Bril sabotaged the initial testing, faked his own death and killed the inventor.
Text: Most CUNNING SCIENCE personnel present without Greed or Treachery is killed. To get past requires CUNNING>24 remaining.

Name: Spacedoor
Text: Seeds on your outpost during facility phase. Outpost is SHIELDS -8 (cumulative). In place of your normal card play, you may return your empty ship docked here (and all cards played on it) to owners' hands, nullifying any {Static Warp Bubble} targeting you OR download {Spacedock} or one compatible [Univ] ship to outpost. Flip Spacedoor over after either use.

Name: Space-Time Portal
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [AU] cards may seed and (once per turn) play. At any time, discard doorway to download {Alternate Universe Door} (except to table) OR play {Wormhole} on a location to relocate your ship there (stopped) OR nullify {Temporal Rift} OR return one of your ships to owner's hand OR (once per game) report with up to four [AU] personnel an [AU] ship to any location.

Name: Treaty: Federation/Romulan/Klingon
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation treaty; Klingon treaty; Romulan treaty;
Lore: Three major Alpha Quadrant powers, in an uncharacteristic show of solidarity in 2373, focused their resources against the Dominion threat in a united stand at station Deep Space 9.
Text: Plays on table. While you have no open side decks, your [Fed], [Rom], and [Kli] affiliations are compatible and ignore affiliation attack restrictions. They may not attempt opponent's missions.

Name: Husnock Outpost
Lore: The sudden eradication of the entire Husnock race left its many outposts vacant. Various affiliations take advantage of these available facilities.
Text: Seed at any [NON] location. You may seed one [Univ] {Husnock Ship} face up here. Extends only 25% of its SHIELDS to ships.

Name: Establish Relations
Lore: Conduct negotiations to establish peaceful rapport and cultural exchange.
Text: Diplomacy + INTEGRITY>32 + (Leadership OR V.I.P.) When you solve, you may download a [Non] personnel here.

Name: Explore Interstellar Matter
Lore: Gather data on newly encountered phenomenon.
Text: SCIENCE + (Astrophysics OR Stellar Cartography) Your {Subspace Warp Rift} and {Tetryon Field} play for free here. Opponent's side: Opponent's {Calamarain} plays at this mission (or a copy).

Name: Impose Order
Lore: Unify diverse nation-states via coercion and occupation.
Text: Diplomacy + Treachery + STRENGTH>40 * Unopposed OFFICER on planet may steal points.

Name: Investigate Incursion
Affil: Any crew may attempt mission. Your {Salvage Starship} objective may target this location.
Lore: Investigate reports of Borg presence in this sector.
Text: SECURITY + ({Shelby} OR Leadership + OFFICER x2) X=30 (45 if [Bor] or [BO] card or {Borg Ship} dilemma here). Opponent's side: Your [Bor] ships may report with staffing here. Points: [30]

Name: Mineral Survey
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Survey planetoid with minimal atmosphere to determine value of mineral deposits.
Text: Geology + SCIENCE + CUNNING>28 When you solve, draw up to two cards.

Name: Test Propulsion Systems
Lore: Test upgrades to faster-than-light drive components.
Text: Navigation + Physics + ENGINEER + % ship Solving player's ships are RANGE +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Open Diplomatic Relations
Text: Seeds on table during doorway phase; you may seed one {Treaty} during this phase (cumulative). At any time, you may exchange two cards in hand for a Treaty in your discard pile. OR Plays on opponent's ship. Your Away Teams which have a V.I.P. may beam to and from that ship, and it may not voluntarily move while your V.I.P. aboard. Discard objective if your personnel battle aboard that ship.

Name: Reflection Therapy
Text: Plays on a personnel (except {Suna}) if your Treachery > Honor present. Replace one regular skill with one level of another regular skill (discard if skill lost). Any player may nullify with 3 Empathy present. OR Plays on an opponent's personnel affected by {Frame of Mind}; personnel is captured. Discard objective if rescued or (on a later turn) to download {Brainwash} or {Interrogation} to this captive.

Name: Suna
Lore: Military official of Tilonus IV. He twisted William T. Riker's mind using neurosomatic techniques. Typical of treacherous Tilonian government interrogators.
Text: SECURITY MEDICAL Treachery Once per game, may download {Reflection Therapy}.

Name: Hide and Seek
Lore: Why don't we play a little game? I'll hide... you find me.
Text: Shuffle Hide and Seek together with crew or Away Team. Randomly select cards until a [Univ] personnel or Hide and Seek selected. All selected personnel are stopped; discard dilemma. (May be seeded as a [S/P] dilemma.)

Name: Darmok
Characteristics/ Keywords: Holodeck; Particle Scattering Device; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Typical Tamarian vessel. "Picard and Dathon, trading knives at El-Adrel. Children at Tama's knee. Sokath, forging knives for his brothers."
Text: When reporting, choose Tractor Beam OR Holodeck OR Particle Scattering Device.

Name: Alien Gambling Device
Lore: Gaming device of unknown origin which alters the laws of probability. Martus Mazur replicated several of the devices for use in Club Martus. Many found the game irresistible.
Text: Use as Equipment card. Once every turn, you may cause any one random selection at same or adjacent location to be canceled and re-selected. (Cumulative.)

Name: Mysterious Orb
Lore: In 2369, Jadzia Dax was transported from the Bajoran wormhole to Deep Space 9 by one of the objects Bajorans call "Tears of the Prophets."
Text: May seed at a space location. Place in hand until played at any time to relocate any one personnel to anywhere in play, then discard artifact.

Name: Orb Fragment
Lore: Shard of Bajoran Orb from the Celestial Temple. The fragment was set in a bracelet and used by the Sirah to create and control the Dal'Rok.
Text: Use as Equipment card. May keep {Dal'Rok} from killing at same location. Also, any player may play Dal'Rok from hand as an Event card at same mission. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Saltah'na Clock
Lore: Benjamin Sisko constructed a clock while being affected by the energy matrix of Saltah'na telepathic spheres. The spheres were storing the energy of an ancient power struggle.
Text: Place on ship or facility here (opponent's choice). Personnel aboard must initiate battle whenever possible (no leader is required and affiliation attack restrictions do not apply).

Name: Altonian Brain Teaser
Lore: To solve this holographic puzzle, its challenger must turn a multicolor sphere a solid hue using neural theta waves. The symbiont Dax tried unsuccessfully for over 140 years.
Text: Most CUNNING personnel present is "stopped." If their CUNNING<15, bonus points scored at this spaceline location do not count toward winning. Discard dilemma.

Name: Angry Mob
Lore: When Odo was under suspicion for murder, Bajoran nationals led by Zayra demanded that the changeling be handed over to them. Benjamin Sisko spared the constable from their "justice."
Text: Kills a SECURITY or shape-shifter present (random selection) unless remaining Away Team has INTEGRITY>27 from up to four personnel OR STRENGTH>50. Discard dilemma.

Name: Aphasia Device
Lore: Terrorist device developed by Dekon Elig and Surmak Ren to fight the Cardassian occupation. When activated, releases a deadly virus which interferes with language processing abilities.
Text: Place on ship. Quarantined. Now and end of each turn, disables one personnel aboard (random selection). If all crew disabled, all die. Cure with 2 MEDICAL and 2 Biology.

Name: Arms Deal
Lore: In 2370, Quark was approached by Sakonna to arrange a covert arms deal to deliver weapons to the Maquis.
Text: Unless Acquisition OR Vulcan with Treachery OR Smuggling OR [Maq] personnel present, crew or Away Team "stopped." Discard dilemma.

Name: Assassin's Blade
Lore: The technological advances of the 24th century offer a wide variety of state-of-the-art weaponry. Nevertheless, some still prefer the simple charm of the assassin's blade.
Text: Unless CUNNING>36 OR 2 SECURITY present, assassin kills one personnel present (opponent's choice) except a shape-shifter or android.

Name: Brief Romance
Lore: Jadzia Dax became romantically involved with Meridian native Deral. Dax was so enamored she attempted to follow Deral when Meridian returned to its non-corporeal state.
Text: Opponent specifies "male" or "female." Place on one personnel present of that gender (random selection). That personnel is "stopped" until countdown expires.

Name: Clan People
Lore: In 2369, the U.S.S. Yangtzee Kiang crashed on a moon in the Gamma Quadrant. The crew members found themselves caught between enemy clans locked in a never-ending war.
Text: To get past, must have {Kai Opaka} present OR CUNNING>38 from up to five Away Team members.

Name: Common Thief
Lore: When Odo confronted a minor thief on the Deep Space 9 promenade, the cutthroat attempted to kill the constable.
Text: If any equipment present, discard one (random selection). Otherwise, kills a personnel present (opponent's choice) who has STRENGTH+CUNNING<15. Discard dilemma.

Name: Dal'Rok
Lore: Terrifying energy creature created and manipulated using an Orb fragment. The controller of the Dal'Rok channels the fears of Bajoran villagers into a powerful destructive force.
Text: Place on mission. Now and start of each turn, kills personnel with lowest total attributes at this location. May be nullified by INTEGRITY+CUNNING+STRENGTH>150 at this location.

Name: DNA Clues
Lore: Although a thorough analysis of a DNA sample can be a time-consuming endeavor, it can also provide information crucial to successfully dealing with biomedical hazards.
Text: Place on mission. Further dilemmas requiring any MEDICAL here require 2 more if you continue OR 2 less if crew or Away Team has Exobiology and "stops" now to investigate.

Name: Duonetic Field Generator
Lore: Device designed to interfere with electromagnetic radiation flow. Inhibits the use of transporter annular confinement beams and the electrical systems of most ships.
Text: Place on planet. No beaming up or taking off from planet. Nullify with 3 ENGINEER OR Miracle Worker.

Name: Extradition
Lore: In 2370, Cardassian legal authorities coerced Miles O'Brien to lower his vessel's shields. They abducted him without explanation and forced him to stand trial on false charges.
Text: If opponent's Law or Treachery here, up to four opponent's SECURITY personnel may beam to one of your ships here, capture a crew member of lower STRENGTH and/or beam off.

Name: Flaxian Assassin
Lore: Valued for their professionalism, Flaxian assassins are often employed by the Tal Shiar. Retaya was sent to eliminate Garak using a combinant poison disguised as perfumes.
Text: Unless 2 SECURITY and Biology present, kills one personnel (two if opponent has Tal Shiar in play) with three or more [*] icons (random selection).

Name: Framed for Murder
Lore: The convicted murderer Ibudan planted evidence implicating his prosecutor, Odo. To avoid a possible conflict of interest, Odo was relieved of duty during the investigation.
Text: Place on a unique personnel present (opponent's choice). That personnel cannot use skills or staff ships. Nullify with any personnel who has CUNNING>9 and Biology OR Law.

Name: Garak Has Some Issues
Lore: Exposed to a psychotropic compound on Empok Nor, Elim Garak lost control. He hunted down and killed members of his away team because it seemed like "fun."
Text: Place on ("stops") a personnel present (random selection). Start of each turn, they kill another personnel present with lower CUNNING (opponent's choice). Cure with 2 Exobiology.

Name: Garanian Bolites
Lore: As a prank, Jake Sisko and Nog released Garanian bolites in the Replimat. Though harmless, the bolites caused temporary pigmentation fluctuations and severe itching.
Text: Two personnel (random selection) are "stopped" unless their combined CUNNING>15 OR {Hypospray} present. Mission continues.

Name: Harvester Virus
Lore: Nanobiogenic weapon used by both sides in the T'Lani-Kellerun war. Julian Bashir and Miles O'Brien developed a method for neutralizing the virus using muon frequencies.
Text: Place on planet. End of every player's turn, one personnel on planet killed (random selection). Cure with 2 MEDICAL, Exobiology and Computer Skill.

Name: Hate Crime
Lore: Outraged by a crime on Deep Space 9, Bajorans defaced Odo's security office. The xenophobic vandals were quick to judge the "shifter" simply because he was different.
Text: Place on a non-Borg personnel who is the only member of its species present (opponent's choice). That personnel may not use any of its skills.

Name: Isolinear Puzzle
Lore: Jake Sisko and Nog felt compelled to override the autopilot system of the U.S.S. Rio Grande. Unfortunately, they found it easier to take apart than to put back together.
Text: Place on ship. Reduces RANGE by 4 and WEAPONS by 4. Nullify with 2 ENGINEER.

Name: Kidnappers
Lore: While visiting Bajor, Kira Nerys was captured by the Alliance for Global Unity, also known as the Circle. The Alliance sought to overthrow the Bajoran provisional government.
Text: Place on a female present (random selection). Until end of opponent's turn, she is "stopped" and may be captured by opponent's SECURITY present; then discard dilemma.

Name: Lethean Telepathic Attack
Lore: Altovar tried to steal biomimetic gel from the Deep Space 9 infirmary. When interrupted by Julian Bashir, he assaulted the doctor telepathically. Such attacks are usually fatal.
Text: Unless 2 Empathy present, place on one personnel ({Julian Bashir} if present, otherwise random selection). Personnel is disabled (killed if CUNNING+STRENGTH<16).

Name: Lockbox
Lore: Quark's greed led him to critical evidence in a lockbox which ultimately solved a five-year-old murder case.
Text: Unless Greed present, Away Team "stopped" (discard dilemma). Otherwise, score points if you solve mission this turn.

Name: Misguided Activist
Lore: Indoctrinated by Vedek Winn, Neela attempted to assassinate Vedek Bareil. She might have succeeded if not for the intervention of her superior officer, Miles O'Brien.
Text: One V.I.P. or [Cmd] personnel present (random selection) is killed (only "stopped" if 2 SECURITY OR {Miles O'Brien} present). Mission continues.

Name: No Loose Ends
Characteristics/ Keywords: Harvester Virus-related card; MEDICAL-related dilemma; SCIENCE-related dilemma; Virus-related dilemma;
Lore: Seeking to purge all knowledge of the harvester virus, E'Tyshra captured Julian Bashir and Miles O'Brien. Keiko's persistence led to their rescue moments before they were to be killed.
Text: Unless SCIENCE, OFFICER and Computer Skill OR {Keiko O'Brien} OR Resistance OR any [Def] drone present, kills all MEDICAL and ENGINEER present. Discard dilemma.

Name: None Shall Pass
Lore: Some natives are highly suspicious of outsiders. The Ennis and Nol-Ennis rejected Benjamin Sisko's efforts to end their longstanding feud.
Text: To get past requires STRENGTH>53 OR 3 Diplomacy OR 2 Anthropology OR Guramba.

Name: Odo's "Cousin"
Lore: In 2370, a Bajoran science probe revealed a life-form on L-S VI with DNA patterns similar to those of Odo. Tests indicated that the entity had some shape-shifting properties.
Text: To get past requires 2 Exobiology and Geology. If you overcome, one SCIENCE may stay behind ("stopped") to score points.

Name: Punishment Box
Lore: Correctional technique used on Orellius. Colonists who commit crimes are imprisoned in the box to suffer from heat and dehydration.
Text: Place on planet. Now and start of each mission attempt here, cannot get past unless one OFFICER is "placed in the box" ("stopped") until end of turn.

Name: Pup
Lore: An alien probe housing a playful software life-form exited the Bajoran wormhole in 2369. Miles O'Brien dubbed the program "Pup" after it disrupted computer systems to get attention.
Text: Place on ship. Disables RANGE until start of your next turn; then WEAPONS until start of your next turn; then SHIELDS; then repeats. Nullify with 4 Computer Skill OR {any Miles}.

Name: Seismic Quake
Lore: While on a scientific mission to planet L-S VI, Dr. Mora Pol's away team experienced a volcanic disturbance. The quake released noxious gases which cut short their research.
Text: One Away Team member (random selection) is "stopped" if opponent's score is odd, killed otherwise. Cannot get past (shuffle back into seed cards here) unless Geology present.

Name: Skullduggery
Lore: Quark was "encouraged" to help Rao Vantika commandeer a shipment of deuridium arriving at Deep Space 9.
Text: One personnel (random selection) is killed (only "stopped" if that personnel has Treachery OR Acquisition OR Greed OR Smuggling OR INTEGRITY<5). Mission continues.

Name: Subspace Seaweed
Lore: In 2370, a runabout piloted by Jadzia Dax collided with a protouniverse. The "subspace seaweed" lodged in the ship's warp nacelle until it was transferred to DS9's science lab.
Text: Unless 3 Navigation aboard, place on ship. Reduces RANGE by 3 (cumulative). Your Transporter Skill may subsequently beam dilemma to your {Science Lab} at same location.

Name: The Three Vipers
Lore: A shattered comet created a danger to ships and the Bajoran wormhole. The three silithium-laden "vipers" had to be guided through to the other side, fulfilling a Bajoran prophecy.
Text: Ship damaged unless ENGINEER and 2 Navigation present. Even if not damaged, crew "stopped" unless SCIENCE, OFFICER and Astrophysics present. Discard dilemma.

Name: Trauma
Lore: Emotional trauma, such as the Prophets' first interrogation of The Sisko, can cause disability or even death. Others face the grim choice of lending aid or completing their mission.
Text: Place on personnel present with the most [*] icons (your choice if tie). That personnel is disabled. If you solve this mission before countdown expires, that personnel dies.

Name: Untrustworthy Associate
Lore: Pretending to be upset over Rom's departure from Deep Space 9, Quark disabled docking ring security sensors. His treachery allowed intruders to board and control the station.
Text: Unless CUNNING>40, opponent places on any one ship or facility here. Opponent's cards may beam, dock, and undock with ship or facility (as appropriate). Nullify with 4 SECURITY.

Name: Vantika's Neural Pathways
Lore: The dying criminal Rao Vantika used a microscopic generator to transfer his consciousness into Julian Bashir. Eventually Vantika's essence was beamed out of the possessed doctor.
Text: Place on a non-changeling present (random selection). Loses skills, classification and INTEGRITY; gains Treachery x2. Cure at {Infirmary} site with MEDICAL and Transporter Skill.

Name: Vendetta
Lore: Grieving over the dead body of his brother Ro-Kel, Ah-Kel swore vengeance against the killer of his twin.
Text: Unless Law present, place on one crew or Away Team member (opponent's choice). If that personnel dies, opponent scores points.

Name: Vole Infestation
Lore: If gone unchecked, Cardassian voles quickly multiply. Chewing through power conduits, the prolific rodents pose a serious and widespread threat to computer systems.
Text: Unless hand weapon OR ANIMAL OR {Guard Drone} present, place on ship. Disables special equipment; all attributes -2. To nullify, evacuate ship at your outpost until end of turn.

Name: Airlock
Text: Plays on a ship (with at least one staffing icon), outpost or docking site. Once each turn, any personnel present who has Computer Skill and either Treachery or Greed may target one opposing personnel (or {Rogue Borg}) present of lower STRENGTH or CUNNING. Target is "tossed out the airlock" (Borg, Rogue Borg and androids float in space until beamed; others die). Target's owner may counter-attack next turn.

Name: Bajoran Wormhole
Text: Requires two Bajoran Wormhole cards; each inserts into a spaceline to create a location (span 1). Play one in Alpha Quadrant (Bajor Region); download the other to Gamma Quadrant. Limit one per quadrant. While in play, any ship may move from one end to the other, then is "stopped." OR Plays at any time to nullify any card which is closing or destroying Bajoran Wormhole (discard doorway).

Name: Secret Compartment
Text: Plays on a ship or facility. (Unique.) If it is controlled by opponent and your Acquisition is present, you may probe: [Interrupt], [Doorway]: Alarm. Opponent may capture one of your personnel present (random selection); discard doorway. [Event], [Equipment]: Success. Download to here up to two Equipment cards or one "use as Equipment card" artifact (as if earned from a mission attempt); discard doorway.

Name: Bajoran PADD
Lore: Standard Bajoran Personal Access Display Device for computerized information.
Text: Bajoran use only. Each of your personnel present is CUNNING +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Bajoran Phaser
Lore: Standard-issue phased energy weapon of the Bajoran Militia. Provides firepower equivalent to that of the Starfleet type II phaser.
Text: Bajoran and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Bajoran Phaser Rifle
Lore: Enhanced energy rifle used by the Bajoran Militia. Popular among members of the resistance during the Cardassian occupation of Bajor.
Text: Bajoran and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

Name: Cardassian Disruptor
Lore: Phase-disruption weapon used by Cardassian military and civilian personnel.
Text: Cardassian and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Cardassian Disruptor Rifle
Lore: Rifle version of the Cardassian phase disruptor. Has a 4.7 megajoule power capacity, 3 millisecond recharge and two beam settings.
Text: Cardassian and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

Name: Cardassian PADD
Lore: Standard Cardassian Personal Access Display Device for computerized information.
Text: Cardassian use only. Each of your personnel present is CUNNING +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Engineering Tricorder
Lore: Representative of specialized tricorders optimized for engineering use. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
Text: Gives all of your MEDICAL-classification personnel the extra skill of ENGINEER where present.

Name: Hypospray
Lore: Uses an aerosuspension delivery system to administer subcutaneous or intramuscular medication. Can also be used to sedate an adversary.
Text: During personnel battle, one of your MEDICAL present may stun their adversary OR change one personnel from mortally wounded to disabled. (Does not affect androids.)

Name: Medical PADD
Lore: Representative of Personal Access Display Devices designed specifically to facilitate medical diagnoses. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
Text: Gives all of your ENGINEER-classification personnel the extra skill of MEDICAL where present.

Name: Science Kit
Lore: Representative of specialized scientific analytical apparatus. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
Text: Gives all of your OFFICER-classification personnel the extra skill of SCIENCE where present.

Name: Science PADD
Lore: Representative of Personal Access Display Devices designed specifically for scientific analysis functions. Such equipment has been deployed by many races.
Text: Gives all of your MEDICAL-classification personnel the extra skill of SCIENCE where present.

Name: Automated Security System
Lore: A hidden security subroutine on Deep Space 9 triggered an old Cardassian counterinsurgency program. It was designed to quell any uprising of non-Cardassian workers.
Text: Plays on {Ops}. End of every turn, targets one personnel present (random selection). That personnel is killed unless its species is Cardassian. May be nullified by 3 ENGINEER.

Name: Bajoran Civil War
Lore: The xenophobic Alliance for Global Unity attempted to overthrow the Bajoran provisional government in 2370.
Text: Plays on table. Your Bajoran leaders may initiate battle against other Bajorans. OR Downloads two [Univ] Bajoran OFFICER, SECURITY or Resistance personnel. Discard event.

Name: Computer Crash
Lore: Rao Vantika accessed the Deep Space 9 computer system through a temperature control panel. He sabotaged the data network by purging everything in active memory.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. No player may play a {Q's Tent} doorway, download any card or play any card that requires downloading. Discard event at end of your next turn.

Name: Defiant Dedication Plaque
Lore: Commemorative inscription mounted on the bridge of the U.S.S. Defiant. Serves as an inspiration to the Defiant crew.
Text: Plays on table. Each of your ships with its matching commander aboard is RANGE +2, or +3 if ship is Defiant class. (Not cumulative. Captain's Order.)

Name: Duranja
Lore: Ceremonial Bajoran lamp lit in memory of a recently deceased loved one. The ornate candle burns continually, entreating the Prophets to guide the dead to the afterlife.
Text: Guides your Bajoran who died on your previous turn from discard pile to point area (worth points equal to INTEGRITY; "in play" for uniqueness only). Discard event.

Name: Espionage: Bajoran on Cardassian
Lore: Bajorans have investigated Cardassian activities before, during and after the 30-year occupation. In 2371, Odo contacted an old Cardassian acquaintance to investigate the Obsidian Order.
Text: Plays on any Cardassian mission (for free if you have a Resistance personnel there). Your Bajoran personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

Name: Espionage: Cardassian on Bajoran
Lore: Since withdrawing from Bajor in 2369, Cardassians have kept a watchful eye on Bajoran activities.
Text: Plays on any Bajoran mission. Your Cardassian personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

Name: Espionage: Cardassian on Federation
Lore: Cardassian spies are masters of undercover operations. In 2371 Miles O'Brien was framed by a surgically altered Cardassian posing as retired Starfleet officer Raymond Boone.
Text: Plays on any Federation mission. Your Cardassian personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

Name: Espionage: Cardassian on Klingon
Lore: Cardassians have long been suspicious of the Klingon Empire. The unprovoked Klingon invasion of 2372 demonstrated the need to step up the Union's intelligence-gathering activities.
Text: Plays on any Klingon mission. Your Cardassian personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

Name: Espionage: Romulan on Bajoran
Lore: Romulan spies are still everywhere.
Text: Plays on any Bajoran mission. Your Romulan personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

Name: Espionage: Romulan on Cardassian
Lore: Romulan infiltration of Cardassian facilities has gone largely undetected for decades.
Text: Plays on any Cardassian mission. Your Romulan personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

Name: Establish Landing Protocols
Lore: Diligent adherence to landing procedures is crucial to the successful operation of runabouts, shuttles and other small spacecraft.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Each of your ships which has no staffing requirements may use 1 RANGE to land or take off once each turn. (Captain's Order.)

Name: HQ: War Room
Lore: During the Bajoran civil war of 2370, General Krim charted troop movements for the Bajoran Militia from his fortified map room.
Text: Plays on a homeworld. Your OFFICER, SECURITY, Leadership and Resistance personnel of same affiliation as that homeworld are CUNNING +2 and STRENGTH +2.

Name: Reaction Control Thrusters
Lore: In 2369, thrusters and subspace field technology were used to relocate Deep Space 9 near the Bajoran Wormhole. This move guarded Bajor's claim to the Celestial Temple.
Text: Plays for free to move your space facility, if your 2 ENGINEER aboard, to an adjacent location in same region OR plays to add 2 to each of your ships' RANGE this turn. Discard event.

Name: Recruit Mercenaries
Lore: Quark hired mercenaries in 2369 to help Rao Vantika steal a deuridium shipment. Individuals of questionable character are easily found for this kind of illegal operation.
Text: Downloads [Non] and/or [Fer] Treachery personnel with up to 7 total [*] icons to where you have Treachery present. "Pay" them (lose points).

Name: Renewal Scroll
Lore: During the Bajoran Gratitude Festival, participants inscribe their troubles on small scrolls. Burning the renewal scrolls in a special brazier symbolically turns their problems to ash.
Text: Plays if you have three or more Bajorans in play. "Burn" (discard from hand) any number of cards and "renew" (draw) an equal amount, plus two more. Discard event.

Name: System 5 Disruptors
Lore: The Groumall was jury-rigged with large planetary disruptors salvaged from the destroyed outpost on Korma. The upgrade required emptying the cargo bay, which cost Dukat his profits.
Text: Plays on your freighter, transport or merchant vessel. Ship is WEAPONS +4, but is SHIELDS -1 and no longer qualifies as a freighter, transport or merchant vessel.

Name: Treaty: Bajoran/Klingon
Lore: The Klingon Empire established a permanent military presence on the Bajoran station Deep Space 9 when Chancellor Gowron reinstated the Khitomer Accords in 2373.
Text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Chancellor Gowron} in play). Your Bajoran and Klingon affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

Name: Treaty: Federation/Bajoran
Lore: In 2369, the Bajoran provisional government applied for Federation membership. That same year, Bajor invited Starfleet to administer the recently acquired space station Terok Nor.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Your Federation and Bajoran affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

Name: Treaty: Federation/Cardassian
Lore: The Federation and the Cardassian Union concluded three years of negotiation in 2370. The resulting treaty brought an end to hostilities and established the Demilitarized Zone.
Text: Plays on table. Your Federation and Cardassian affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate. (May be seeded if you have {Klaestron outpost} in play.)

Name: Treaty: Romulan/Cardassian
Lore: Responding to the Dominion threat, Romulans and Cardassians became secret allies in 2371 and assembled a joint Tal Shiar/Obsidian Order strike force in the Orias system.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Your Romulan and Cardassian affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

Name: Weapons Locker
Lore: Arms storage compartment used aboard a space station or starship. Accessible only with the proper authorization codes.
Text: Plays on {Ops}, {Security Office}, {Cargo Bay} or any ship. If your personnel present are unopposed, your hand weapons may report there (for free if at a site).

Name: Bajoran Outpost
Lore: The Bajoran homeworld is Bajor. The Bajorans establish outposts throughout their territory.
Text: Seed one OR build where you have a Bajoran ENGINEER.

Name: Cardassian Outpost
Lore: Cardassia Prime is the homeworld of the Cardassians. The Cardassian Union establishes outposts throughout its territory.
Text: Seed one OR build where you have a Cardassian ENGINEER.

Name: Central Command
Lore: The Central Command controls every Cardassian ship, outpost and space station from its great War Room.
Text: Seeds or plays on {Cardassia Prime}. Once per turn, one Cardassian Gul or Legate OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Chamber of Ministers
Lore: Legislative body of Bajoran provisional government. Established following Cardassian withdrawal in 2369.
Text: Seeds or plays on {Bajor}. A Nor may coexist here. Once per turn, one Bajoran Minister, Vedek or Kai OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Klaestron Outpost
Lore: Klaestron IV is a member of the United Federation of Planets. Its inhabitants also maintain a strong alliance with the Cardassian Union.
Text: Seed one OR build where you have a Klaestron ENGINEER.

Name: Nor
Lore: Ore mining and processing station representative of facilities throughout Cardassian territory.
Text: Seeds or plays at any [CAR] location (except a Bajor Region location).

Name: Terok Nor
Lore: Mining station built in Bajoran system. Operated by Cardassians using Bajorans in forced-labor conditions.
Text: Seeds at a Bajor Region location. If commandeered by any personnel who is [Baj] or [Fed], flip card over.

Name: Activate Tractor Beam
Lore: Tractor Beam is the common term for the focused linear graviton force beam installed on most starships.
Text: Plays on your ship with Tractor Beam; it may tow any ship present which is yours or is empty. OR Plays on your outpost or ship; adds Tractor Beam (but may not carry ships aboard).

Name: Baseball
Lore: Benjamin Sisko was forced to abandon Deep Space 9 to spare Bajor from the Dominion's wrath. He left his prized baseball behind as a message to Gul Dukat that he would return.
Text: Plays to score points if you just commandeered opponent's facility. Lose points if opponent regains control.

Name: Docking Procedures
Lore: While comprehensive docking procedures are crucial for safeguarding life and property, proceeding "by the book" can also cause delays.
Text: Plays on any ship just as it begins to dock or undock at any facility. Ship and crew are "stopped." Docking or undocking complete at end of turn.

Name: Dropping In
Lore: Ships and facilities are vulnerable to unwanted quests when their shields are lowered.
Text: Plays if any SHIELDS are less than 4 or were just lowered for beaming. Your Transporter Skill may beam your cards through those SHIELDS. OR Nullifies your {Dead End}.

Name: Extraordinary Methods
Lore: Using unorthodox procedures, Julian Bashir was able to briefly prolong the life of Vedek Bareil. The process allowed Bareil to complete critical negotiations.
Text: If 3 MEDICAL OR MEDICAL and Cybernetics present, plays on one of your personnel just selected to die. Death is delayed until the end of your next turn.

Name: Going to the Top
Lore: Kira Nerys went directly to Admiral Rollman when she disagreed with one of Benjamin Sisko's command decisions. Sisko and Rollman were not exactly pleased with her action.
Text: Plays if you have two [Cmd] personnel together on a facility. Download a compatible personnel with Leadership x2 to them (once per game per affiliation).

Name: Hidden Fighter
Lore: The resistance concealed small spacecraft throughout the Bajor system during the occupation. A decade later, Kira Nerys and Jadzia Dax recovered one from the abandoned Lunar V base.
Text: Downloads one ship with no staffing requirements to your Away Team on a planet. (You may also download {Establish Landing Protocols} or {Engage Shuttle Operations}.)

Name: Incoming Message - Bajoran
Lore: Messages and directives are sent, faster than light, on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of relay stations.
Text: Your ship must immediately return to the nearest Bajoran outpost, full speed. Place on one Bajoran ship until outpost reached, then discard.

Name: Incoming Message - Cardassian
Lore: Messages and directives are sent, faster than light, on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of relay stations.
Text: Your ship must immediately return to the nearest Cardassian outpost, full speed. Place on one Cardassian ship until outpost reached, then discard.

Name: Magnetic North
Lore: Miles O'Brien used the polar magnetic field of Parada IV to shield his runabout from the sensors of pursuing ships.
Text: Plays on your ship that has no staffing requirements if it is orbiting a planet. Prevents battles from being initiated against that ship. Discard interrupt when ship moves.

Name: Oof!
Lore: Surprised by Benjamin Sisko's rather unconventional response to Q's antagonism, the allegedly omnipotent being protested, "You hit me! Picard never hit me!"
Text: Nullifies {Fightin' Words}. OR Place each {Amanda Rogers}, {Kevin Uxbridge} and {Q2} in opponent's point area out of play; opponent loses 5 points for each. (Immune to Amanda Rogers.)

Name: Orb Experience
Lore: In 2369, Benjamin Sisko encountered the Orb of Prophecy and Change. This contact caused him to experience a flashback to his first meeting with his wife-to-be, Jennifer.
Text: Plays on any personnel with INTEGRITY>6. Adds [Orb] icon. OR Plays if your [Orb] personnel is present with an Orb. Examine any one card in the game (once per game per Orb).

Name: Preparation
Lore: Mission briefings with senior staff are important for information and planning. Lack of preparation can be costly in some instances.
Text: Plays on your unexamined mission if you control personnel with four different classifications there. Examine bottom seed card. OR Nullifies {Lack of Preparation} (but still lose points).

Name: Protouniverse
Lore: An unknown anomaly brought from the Gamma Quadrant was actually a protouniverse in its early stages. Its growth would have destroyed DS9 had it not been returned to space.
