Text: Plays on {"Subspace Seaweed"}; ship or facility destroyed when countdown expires. Nullify with Astrophysics, SCIENCE and 2 ENGINEER aboard, but ship or facility damaged.

Name: Reclamation
Lore: Cardassians sabotaged much of Terok Nor during their evacuation. The new Federation and Bajoran occupants salvaged and repaired what they could.
Text: Plays to take into hand from your discard pile up to two Equipment or Site cards OR one previously earned "use as Equipment card" artifact (for re-use).

Name: Smoke Bomb
Lore: Small, hand-held device used to create a diversion. DS9 personnel employed this to evade occupying Circle forces.
Text: Plays at start of personnel battle. You may exclude any or all of your non-[Bor] personnel from that battle. OR Once every turn, plays to stop a crew or Away Team where you have personnel present (limit once per game per location).

Name: The Walls Have Ears
Lore: Deep Space 9 was besieged by the Alliance for Global Unity in 2370. Odo used his shape-shifting abilities to monitor the intruders' activities and report back to Commander Sisko.
Text: Once each turn, plays on opponent's occupied ship or facility. Report a changeling there OR score points if you have an intruder aboard.

Name: Time to Reconsider
Lore: Gul Jasad paused for a moment on the brink of an assault against Deep Space 9. He eventually called off the attack and withdrew his ships.
Text: Plays to "stop" your ship and crew. Prevents opponent (unless playing Borg) from initiating a counter-attack this turn at that location.

Name: Unnatural Causes
Lore: A murder in the holosuite puzzled the Deep Space 9 authorities. How could someone have entered a room to commit the crime without leaving a trace?
Text: Plays on any crew or Away Team if one of its members was just killed other than in battle. One personnel present (random selection) is "stopped" to investigate.

Name: Wormhole Navigation Schematic
Lore: The Bajoran Wormhole is the only one known to be stable. One terminus is in the Alpha Quadrant near Bajor; the other, in the Gamma Quadrant near the Idran system.
Text: Allows your ship with SCIENCE and Navigation aboard to travel through {Bajoran Wormhole} without being "stopped." (Immune to {Amanda Rogers}.) OR Nullifies {The Three Vipers}.

Name: Access Relay Station
Lore: Analyze automated subspace relay station for information on the Dominion.
Text: OFFICER + SCIENCE + ENGINEER + Computer Skill x2 + CUNNING>34

Name: Acquire Illicit Explosives
Lore: Purchase bilitrium from Klingon outcasts for delivery to Bajoran insurgents.
Text: Physics + CIVILIAN + Treachery OR Physics + Smuggling

Name: Aid Fugitives
Affil: Any non-Dominion Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Search for the cure to Jem'Hadar addiction to ketracel-white
Text: MEDICAL x3 + Exobiology + ENGINEER {Hippocratic Oath} relocates here from any quadrant.

Name: Alter Records
Lore: Create false documents on Bajoran homeworld pertaining to Cardassian occupation.
Text: Computer Skill x2 + Obsidian Order x2 OR Computer Skill x2 + Treachery x4

Name: Camping Trip
Lore: Escort students for botany experiment on presumably uninhabited world.
Text: SCIENCE + Youth x2 + CUNNING>35 [GQ] Vorta and Jem'Hadar may report here.

Name: Changeling Research
Lore: Investigate possible changeling life signs on highly volcanic planet.
Text: SCIENCE x3 + Exobiology x2 + Geology Each {Seismic Quake} here affects two personnel.

Name: Characterize Neutrino Emissions
Lore: Study and catalog neutrino discharge from charged plasma field.
Text: Navigation + SCIENCE x2 + Astrophysics + Physics Any number of Orb artifacts may seed here.

Name: Colony Preparations
Lore: Survey uninhabited class-M world for possible colonization.
Text: SCIENCE + Geology + Biology + SECURITY When you solve, may download {Colony} here.

Name: Cure Blight
Lore: Develop vaccine for Teplan Blight deliberately introduced here by the Dominion.
Text: MEDICAL x3 + SCIENCE + Anthropology * +5 if MEDICAL-related Equipment card present.

Name: Deliver Supplies
Lore: Take provisions and equipment to settlers.
Text: (CIVILIAN x2 OR {Kasidy Yates}) + freighter or transport in orbit with Transporter Skill aboard

Name: Eliminate Virus
Lore: Return to analyze and destroy last traces of deadly nanobiogenic weapon accidentally re-released.
Text: MEDICAL + Exobiology + Computer Skill * Points do not count when {Harvester Virus} in play.

Name: Establish Station
Lore: Build remote station on this planet located in a cloak-disrupting emission nebula.
Text: SCIENCE + ENGINEER + SECURITY + CUNNING>35 Cloaking Devices do not function here.

Name: Intercept Maquis
Lore: Prevent attack on secret Cardassian weapons depot.
Text: OFFICER + SECURITY + CUNNING>24 May attempt only if your total WEAPONS>14 here.

Name: Intercept Renegade
Lore: Intercept hijacked Starfleet vessel reportedly attacking facilities in Cardassian space.
Text: Obsidian Order + Tal Shiar + Treachery x3 OR OFFICER x2 + CUNNING>40

Name: Investigate Rumors
Lore: Search nebula for clues to origin of changelings.
Text: Navigation + SCIENCE x2 + SECURITY OR Navigation + {Odo}

Name: Kressari Rendezvous
Lore: Complete covert weapons transfer to agents supplying the Circle.
Text: OFFICER + (Treachery x2 OR Smuggling) * Discard up to four hand weapons for +5 each.

Name: Orb Negotiations
Lore: Negotiate for return of stolen Orbs still on Cardassian homeworld.
Text: Diplomacy x3 + [Baj] V.I.P. OR {[Orb] personnel} Any number of Orb artifacts may seed here.

Name: Refuse Immigration
Lore: Prevent Skrreean refugee vessel from landing on Bajor.
Text: Vedek + Leadership + Diplomacy + CUNNING>28 OR Leadership x2 + INTEGRITY<30 + WEAPONS>10

Name: Reignite Dead Star
Lore: Use protomatter to re-initiate fusion process of this dead stellar core.
Text: SCIENCE x2 + ENGINEER + Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography OR {Gideon Seyetik}

Name: Relocate Settlers
Lore: Relocate settlers before moon becomes uninhabitable due to core tapping project.
Text: V.I.P. + Diplomacy + SECURITY x2 OR SECURITY x2 + Treachery OR {Kira Nerys}

Name: Rescue Prisoners
Lore: Free Bajoran prisoners held secretly at Hutet labor camp.
Text: STRENGTH>40 + (Transporter Skill OR landed ship) May seed [Univ] [Baj] personnel under here.

Name: Search and Rescue
Lore: Search for officer kidnapped from Deep Space 9 by Maquis.
Text: Navigation x2 + Honor + OFFICER + CUNNING>35

Name: Search for Survivors
Lore: Investigate possible crash location of Cardassian prisoner transport Ravinok.
Text: OFFICER x2 + Computer Skill x2 + STRENGTH>30 May seed [Univ] [Car] and [Univ] [Baj] personnel under here.

Name: Study Badlands
Lore: Chart region of intense plasma activity.
Text: Navigation x2 + Stellar Cartography x2

Name: Study Plasma Storm
Lore: Observe violent disturbance and compensate for disruption of computer operations.
Text: SCIENCE + ENGINEER + Astrophysics + CUNNING>30 Computer Skill required to use any equipment here.

Name: Survey Star System
Lore: Scan uncharted system for inhabited, habitable and resource-rich worlds.
Text: Navigation + Stellar Cartography + Diplomacy + SCIENCE

Name: Symbiont Diagnosis
Lore: Identify treatment options for ailing Trill host and assess status of symbiont.
Text: Trill with symbiont + MEDICAL x3 + OFFICER + Diplomacy x2 + Anthropology + CUNNING>45

Name: Verify Evidence
Lore: Substantiate report of information broker working here.
Text: Navigation x2 + (CUNNING>24 OR {any tricorder}) + (Leadership x2 OR hand weapon OR Smuggling)

Name: Beware of Q
Text: Seeds on table during doorway phase. Your [Q] dilemmas may seed like [S/P] dilemmas. OR Seeds or plays on your Q-Flash. Once per mission location, if opponent just revealed your dilemma there, you may exchange it with a dilemma named {Q} from your {Q's Tent} or hand (discard original dilemma). OR Plays to download and seed a dilemma named Q under a mission; discard objective.

Name: Establish Tractor Lock
Text: Plays on your Nor with Tractor Beam and your personnel unopposed in {Ops} OR on your staffed ship with Tractor Beam. Immediately target another ship at same location. That ship may not move or initiate battle. You may discard objective at any time. You must discard objective if your ship or Nor moves, battles or has SHIELDS < target's RANGE.

Name: Explore Gamma Quadrant
Text: Seeds or plays on table. At any time, place on your ship docked at a facility in the Alpha Quadrant. If ship's crew or Away Team solves a Gamma Quadrant mission, then ship returns and docks at that facility, draw three cards and score points (discard objective).

Name: File Mission Report
Text: Seeds or plays on table. When one of your personnel has used a classification or skill to meet a mission requirement, and you have not yet attempted another mission, that personnel may "file a mission report" if unopposed at a site which allows this. Score points (discard objective). Limit one per mission.

Name: HQ: Defensive Measures
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Your personnel with any Intelligence gain 1 Leadership and may initiate battle against their own affiliation. Also, opponent may not attempt any of your missions with more than one affiliation icon on each end unless opponent attempted to seed a copy of that mission OR opponent is using an appropriate {Espionage} card.

Name: HQ: Return Orb to Bajor
Text: Plays on your [Orb] personnel. Where present, that personnel may earn Orb artifacts just encountered and may "reclaim" (steal) any Orb artifacts in play. If that personnel is on {Bajor} with Orb artifacts present, draw up to three cards for each one, discard objective and score points. (Each artifact may be "returned" only once per game.)

Name: HQ: Secure Homeworld
Text: Seeds or plays on a homeworld. Your Away Teams which include a personnel who matches homeworld's affiliation may attempt the mission using these requirements: Leadership x2 + SECURITY + (Honor OR Treachery) + any one attribute total > point value of mission When you solve mission, capture all opposing personnel on planet who do not match affiliation of homeworld.

Name: Navigate Plasma Storms
Text: Seeds or plays on table. End of every player's turn, if any ship is in the Badlands Region (even [MU]), that player must probe: [Interrupt], [Doorway]: Flare-up. All ships and facilities in space in that region without 3 Navigation aboard are damaged. [Objective]: Maelstrom. All ships and facilities in space in that region without 5 Navigation aboard are destroyed. [Event]: Plasma storms subside. Discard objective.

Name: Plans of the Obsidian Order
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Wherever you have an Obsidian Order personnel in play, your Cardassian espionage cards play at any time (for free) and may not be nullified. Also, once each turn, you may discard one of your Cardassian espionage cards from hand or table, then draw one card. At any time you may discard this objective from table to download one Cardassian espionage card.

Name: Plans of the Tal Shiar
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Wherever you have a Tal Shiar personnel in play, your Romulan espionage cards play at any time (for free) and may not be nullified. Also, once each turn, you may discard one of your Romulan espionage cards from hand or table, then draw one card. At any time you may discard this objective from table to download one Romulan espionage card.

Name: Process Ore
Text: Plays on an {Ore Processing Unit}. Start of each turn, if you control this Nor at a planet location and you have a matching ENGINEER or SECURITY personnel unopposed here, you may "process ore." Discard one card from hand, place bottom card of discard pile beneath draw deck or out-of-play, then draw up to two cards.

Name: Rescue Personnel
Text: Plays on your ship docked at a facility in the Alpha Quadrant. Target your Away Team on a planet which is either in a different quadrant or at a time location. If ship travels there, beams up Away Team and returns to facility, draw one card per personnel "rescued" (up to 5) and score points (discard objective). Limit one such "rescue" per location. (Unique.)

Name: Aamin Marritza
Lore: Former file clerk. He served under and impersonated Gul Darhe'el, the infamous "Butcher of Gallitep," in an attempt to force Cardassia to atone for war crimes.
Text: CIVILIAN Honor x 2 Computer Skill Archaeology Scores points if killed.

Name: Altovar
Lore: Lethean male. Attempted to steal biomimetic gel from Deep Space 9 infirmary in 2371. Attacked Julian Bashir, causing telepathically induced coma.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology Empathy Greed

Name: Amaros
Lore: Maquis terrorist. Cal Hudson's co-pilot. Helped abduct Gul Dukat, blaming him for supplying illegal weapons to Cardassians in the Demilitarized Zone.
Text: ENGINEER Navigation Physics

Name: Anara
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Support Personnel;
Lore: Representative of Bajoran engineering apprentices serving on Deep Space 9. Assisted Miles O'Brien with computer "pup" in 2369.
Text: ENGINEER Physics Transporter Skill

Name: Ari
Lore: Dissident. Typical member of Cardassian underground. Loyal to Ghemor. Helped Kira Nerys escape Obsidian Order in 2371. Has hopes for a better Cardassia.
Text: OFFICER Honor Transporter Skill Computer Skill

Name: Bareil Antos
Lore: Vedek. Follows springball religiously. Romantically involved with Kira Nerys. Began spiritual service as a gardener; still enjoys tending the grounds.
Text: V.I.P. Anthropology Diplomacy x 2 Honor SCIENCE Biology

Name: Benjamin Sisko
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Captain; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
Lore: Captain Benjamin Sisko commands Deep Space 9. Fought in Federation-Tzenkethi war. Helped design U.S.S. Defiant. Father of Jake. Loves baseball.
Text: OFFICER Leadership ENGINEER Honor Navigation Diplomacy DL/ {Baseball}

Name: Boheeka
Lore: Glinn. Cardassian biotechnology expert. Jeopardized his career when he was bribed by Quark to order a classified cranial implant for Elim Garak.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Cybernetics Smuggling Greed

Name: Borad
Lore: Male trained in science and exoarchaeology. Studied the effects of stolen Bajoran Orbs on the Cardassian nervous system. Had an unpleasant Orb experience.
Text: SCIENCE Exobiology Archaeology Youth

Name: Bo'rak
Lore: Operative sent to Deep Space 9 in 2371 to spy on Romulan delegates. Modified a replicator to beam a surveillance device near the Romulans' quarters.
Text: ENGINEER Cybernetics Transporter Skill Astrophysics Klingon Intelligence

Name: Colonel Day
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Colonel; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; The Circle-related personnel;
Lore: Member of Bajoran Militia and the Circle. Participated in DS9 siege of 2370. Deceived General Krim, under orders from Jaro Essa. Tried to kill Benjamin Sisko.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Treachery Navigation

Name: Coutu
Lore: Male from Parada II. Typical of rebels who supported peace talks with the Paradan government. Rescued Miles O'Brien from government forces in 2370.
Text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Honor Exobiology

Name: Dakol
Lore: Representative of Cardassian military security guards. Glinn assigned to guard prisoners at Hutet labor camp. Wanted to be intimately involved with Major Kira.
Text: SECURITY Navigation Leadership Treachery

Name: Danar
Lore: Gul. Commander of the Galor-class warship Aldara. Pursued the Bajoran terrorist Tahna Los in 2369. Enjoys vole fights.
Text: OFFICER Navigation x 2 ENGINEER Astrophysics

Name: Derell
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Representative of Cardassian medical personnel. Assigned to Terok Nor infirmary in 2358. Frequent patron of Quark's bar prior to the 2369 evacuation.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology Anthropology

Name: D'Ghor
Lore: Crafty but dishonored head of wealthy Klingon House. Tried to acquire the assets of the House of Kozak - using money. Former member of High Council.
Text: CIVILIAN Treachery Acquisition Greed Computer Skill

Name: Dr. Nydom
Characteristics/ Keywords: T'Lani; Harvester Virus-related card; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: Male T'Lani. Typical medical technician. Worked on harvester virus elimination project in 2370.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Honor

Name: Dukat
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Gul; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Gul. Ex-prefect of Bajor. Commander of the Prakesh. Father of Ziyal. Cardassian Union liaison with Dominion. Desires to regain command of Terok Nor.
Text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Navigation x 2 Treachery Diplomacy Computer Skill

Name: Elim Garak
Lore: Former member of Obsidian Order. Exiled to Terok Nor in 2368. Maintains some contact with Cardassian intelligence. Distrusts Dukat. Son of Enabran Tain.
Text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill Obsidian Order Treachery Anthropology May avoid any random selection.

Name: Enabran Tain
Lore: Estranged father of Elim Garak. Former head of the Obsidian Order. Led covert Obsidian Order/Tal Shiar raid on the Founders' homeworld.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership SECURITY Treachery Computer Skill Obsidian Order x 2

Name: Entek
Lore: Trains Obsidian Order operatives. Enemy of Ghemor. Had Kira Nerys surgically altered to appear Cardassian in 2371. Rather liked by Garak.
Text: SECURITY Treachery Exobiology Biology Obsidian Order

Name: E'Tyshra
Characteristics/ Keywords: T'Lani; Ambassador; Female; Harvester Virus-related card;
Lore: Female T'Lani ambassador. Worked with Sharat to end war with the Kellerun. Schemed to eliminate everyone with knowledge of the harvester virus.
Text: V.I.P. MEDICAL Leadership Treachery

Name: General Krim
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; General; Male; The Circle-related personnel;
Lore: High-ranking Bajoran Militia leader. Member of the Circle. Took over Deep Space 9 in 2370, but returned the station when informed of Cardassian involvement.
Text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Navigation Honor Stellar Cartography

Name: Ghoren
Lore: Male Cardassian characteristic of medical personnel in military service. Treated survivors of Klingon attack on Cardassia Prime in 2372.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Music Geology

Name: Gilora Rejal
Lore: Cardassian Ministry of Science member. Worked on the 2371 subspace relay project. Mistook Miles O'Brien's irritation with her as a Cardassian mating ritual.
Text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Astrophysics Honor Attributes all +2 if {Miles O'Brien} in play.

Name: Graham Davis
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: Representative of Starfleet engineers stationed aboard Deep Space 9. Assisted Miles O'Brien during repair and retrofit of the station.
Text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Computer Skill

Name: Grilka
Lore: Klingon female. Leader of her own House due to special dispensation granted by Chancellor Gowron. Briefly married to Quark, Son of Keldar.
Text: V.I.P. Honor x 2 Leadership Biology Attributes all +3 if with {any Quark}.

Name: Hogue
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Dissident; Male;
Lore: Student of Natima Lang. Dissident. Member of Cardassian underground sentenced to death by Central Command. Sought refuge at Deep Space 9.
Text: CIVILIAN Youth SCIENCE Navigation Honor

Name: Jabara
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Nurse; Support Personnel;
Lore: Bajoran nurse representative of medical assistants on Deep Space 9. Helped Dr. Julian Bashir extend the life of Bareil Antos in 2371.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology Youth

Name: Jace Michaels
Lore: Representative of first officers serving in Starfleet. Assigned to the U.S.S. Odyssey. Courageously fought against the Jem'Hadar in 2370.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Physics Honor

Name: Jadzia Dax
Lore: Lt. Commander Jadzia Dax is the eighth Trill host of the Dax symbiont. Underwent zhian'tara closure rite in 2371. Level 3 pilot. Married to Worf. Likes tongo.
Text: SCIENCE Archaeology Astrophysics Exobiology Navigation x 2 Anthropology

Name: Jaheel
Characteristics/ Keywords: Humanoid; Captain; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
Lore: Male humanoid. Typical transport captain operating around Deep Space 9. Attempted to violate the aphasia virus quarantine issued in 2369.
Text: CIVILIAN Navigation Computer Skill SCIENCE

Name: Jake and Nog
Lore: Jake Sisko and Nog are best friends. Loiterers. Frequently chased away from "their spot" by Odo. Briefly owned 100 gross of self-sealing stem bolts.
Text: CIVILIAN+CIVILIAN Jake: Youth Biology ENGINEER Nog: Youth Acquisition ENGINEER

Name: Jaro Essa
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Male; Minister; The Circle-related personnel;
Lore: Ambitious member of Chamber of Ministers. Leader of Alliance for Global Unity, a.k.a. the Circle. Minister Jaro was allied with Vedek Winn until exposed as a traitor.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Greed Treachery x 2 CUNNING +3 if with {Vedek Winn}.

Name: Jasad
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Gul; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: Representative Gul in the Seventh Order. In 2369, unsuccessfully attempted to reclaim Deep Space 9 for the Cardassian Union.
Text: OFFICER Physics Stellar Cartography

Name: Julian Bashir
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; genetically enhanced; Male;
Lore: Lt. Julian Bashir. Genetically enhanced. Salutatorian at Starfleet Medical. Requested assignment to DS9 so he could practice "frontier medicine." Likes tennis.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL x 2 Exobiology Biology DL/ {Kukalaka}

Name: Jural
Lore: Typical Cardassian officer. Proud, dedicated and constantly seeking to advance his rank. Posted to Cardassian Central Command in 2370.
Text: OFFICER Astrophysics SCIENCE

Name: Kai Opaka
Lore: Revered Kai of Bajor. Lost her son in the Kendra Valley Massacre. First recognized Benjamin Sisko as the Emissary of the Prophets.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership x 3 Diplomacy Honor Anthropology Orb artifacts may not be nullified.

Name: Kalita
Lore: Longtime Maquis member. Helped Thomas Riker commandeer the U.S.S. Defiant. Helped Ro Laren steal medical supplies from the U.S.S. Enterprise.
Text: OFFICER Anthropology Computer Skill Navigation

Name: Kallis Ven
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: One of the Bajoran deputies serving on Deep Space 9. During Cardassian occupation, helped chart Badlands and served as pilot on raids against Cardassian forces.
Text: SECURITY Navigation Computer Skill

Name: Karen Loews
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Support Personnel;
Lore: Starfleet psychiatrist representative of Federation medical personnel. Came to Deep Space 9 in 2374 with a group of genetically engineered misfits.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Anthropology

Name: Karina
Lore: Female Romulan "delegate" and saboteur. Assistant to Ruwon. Planned to help him sabotage the Bajoran wormhole and Deep Space 9.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery Transporter Skill SCIENCE

Name: Kira Nerys
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Shakaar Resistance Cell;
Lore: Outspoken Major in Bajoran Militia. Assigned as first officer of Deep Space 9. Former member of Shakaar resistance cell. Romantically involved with Odo.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Resistance SECURITY Navigation x 2 Computer Skill X=3 vs. [Car].

Name: Korinas
Lore: High-ranking female intelligence operative. Often assigned by the Obsidian Order to keep a close watch on the Central Command.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Treachery Obsidian Order

Name: Kotran Pa'Dar
Lore: Powerful civilian leader. Former exarch of Cardassian settlement on Bajor. Believed his son Rugal was killed in 2362 terrorist attack.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Geology

Name: Kovat
Lore: One of the finest public conservators on Cardassia. Assigned to defend Miles O'Brien. Deeply disturbed when he "won" the case and O'Brien was freed.
Text: CIVILIAN Honor Diplomacy Law Anthropology

Name: Lenaris Holem
Lore: Colonel. Former member of Ornathia resistance cell. Part of historic Pullock V raid. Grateful to Shakaar for liberating his brother from Gallitep prison camp.
Text: OFFICER Honor Leadership Physics Resistance

Name: Li Nalas
Lore: Hero of the Bajoran resistance. Cardassian prisoner at Hutet labor camp. Temporary first officer of Deep Space 9. Titled Navarch by provisional government.
Text: V.I.P. OFFICER Resistance Honor Geology May seed under {Cardassia IV}.

Name: Lojal
Lore: Ambassador Lojal is typical of Vulcans dispatched to represent the Federation. Agreed to recommended Julian Bashir for a commendation in 2369.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Mindmeld Anthropology Navigation

Name: Makbar
Lore: Chief archon in Cardassian Judiciary. Presided over trial of Miles O'Brien. Outraged when human intervention forced her to acquit him. Tried to resist the Dominion.
Text: V.I.P. Law x 2 Anthropology MEDICAL Treachery Doubles {Extradition} here.

Name: Martus Mazur
Lore: El-Aurian con artist. Proprietor of Club Martus. Rival of Quark. Replicated a gambling device which changes the laws of probability. Always knows when they're bluffing.
Text: CIVILIAN Greed Astrophysics Anthropology If {Alien Gambling Device} in play, duplicates its text here.

Name: Minister Rozahn
Lore: Typical member of the Chamber of Ministers. Has background in the sciences. Led Bajoran delegates in talks with Skrreean refugees.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Stellar Cartography SCIENCE

Name: Mora Pol
Lore: Member of Bajoran Institute of Science. Odo's foster father. Dr. Mora encouraged Odo to adopt humanoid form. Reconciled with his estranged "son" in 2373.
Text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Exobiology x 2

Name: Morka
Lore: Klingon agent sent by the High Council to keep Ruwon and Karina under surveillance. Accused Odo of insulting his honor. Threatened retribution.
Text: OFFICER Computer Skill Klingon Intelligence Geology Stellar Cartography

Name: Nalan Bal
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: Astrophysicist. Characteristic of Bajoran scientists now free of Cardassian rule. Had a brief encounter with Jem'Hadar on Deep Space 9 in 2371.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Navigation

Name: Natima Lang
Lore: Professor of Political Ethics. Dissident. Romantically involved with Quark. Member of Cardassian underground. Likes Samarian Sunsets.
Text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Honor Leadership Attributes all +2 if with another Cardassian dissident.

Name: Neela
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Assassin; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female;
Lore: Religious activist. Assassin. Sabotaged systems and planted a bomb on Deep Space 9 in 2369. Believed she was following the will of the Prophets.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Archaeology Treachery DL/ {Bajoran Phaser}

Name: Odo
Characteristics/ Keywords: Changeling; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Shape-shifter;
Lore: Changeling security chief of Deep Space 9. Not very good at pretense. Always investigates Quark.
Text: SECURITY SECURITY Computer Skill x 2 Honor x 2 Law Once per turn, may "stop" {any Quark} present.

Name: Orren Ran
Lore: Male representative of Klaestron engineers. Associate of Ilon Tandro. Aided in attempted kidnapping of Jadzia Dax in 2369.
Text: CIVILIAN Geology ENGINEER

Name: Pallra
Lore: Resident of Terok Nor during Cardassian occupation of Bajor. Wife of collaborator. Extortionist. Hired Quark to steal hidden list of other collaborators.
Text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Greed Treachery Your {Trazko} may report where present (for free).

Name: Parn
Lore: Legate. Member of Central Command. Tried to conceal Cardassian effort to supply weapons to Demilitarized Zone colonists in 2370.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery Archaeology Diplomacy

Name: Paxton Reese
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: Stellar cartographer characteristic of Starfleet science personnel. Served aboard Deep Space 9 in 2372. Studied effects of the wormhole on the Denorios Belt.
Text: SCIENCE Navigation Stellar Cartography

Name: Perak
Lore: Characteristic of Cardassian security personnel. Helped provide protection for Detapa Council prior to its 2372 evacuation from Cardassia Prime.
Text: SECURITY ENGINEER Greed Treachery

Name: Plain, Simple Garak
Lore: Tailor. Merchant. Elim Garak is suspected of being a spy by his friend Julian Bashir. Raises Edosian orchids as a hobby. Haggled with the Sisters of Duras.
Text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Acquisition Biology May be replaced by another version at any time.

Name: Prylar Mond
Lore: Representative of Bajoran Prylars. Interested in science. Escorted Benjamin Sisko to see Kai Opaka in 2369.
Text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Exobiology

Name: Rano Dake
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: Characteristic of young, eager Bajorans serving on Deep Space 9. Assigned to security detachment under command of Odo.
Text: SECURITY Geology Youth

Name: Rase Norvan
Lore: Representative of Bajorans entering science and medical studies after the Cardassian occupation. Serves in the infirmary on Deep Space 9.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Music Youth

Name: Rax'Na
Lore: Typical male Kressari. Trader of botanical DNA. Aspires to become a weapon supplier.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Biology Treachery

Name: Razka Karn
Lore: Ex-resistance fighter pilot. Down on his luck. Deals in scrap metal. Sometime smuggler. Enjoys listening to classical Bajoran music such as Varani.
Text: ENGINEER Navigation x 2 Smuggling Music Resistance

Name: Rekelen
Lore: Young dissident. Forced to flee Cardassia with Natima Lang and Hogue because of her political views. Member of Cardassian underground.
Text: CIVILIAN Youth Computer Skill Geology

Name: Retaya
Lore: Flaxian. Posed as a perfume salesman. In reality an assassin who mixes his "fragrances" to create deadly toxins. Hired to kill Garak in 2371.
Text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Biology Treachery Physics

Name: Rinnak Pire
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Captain; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
Command: Assault Vessel;Bajoran Freighter;Bajoran Interceptor;Bajoran Scout Vessel;Bajoran Raider;Alliance Interceptor;Bajoran Warship
Lore: Captain of a Bajoran transport that docked at Deep Space 9 in 2369. Commanded all manner of Bajoran vessels during his long and successful career.
Text: OFFICER Computer Skill Navigation May be matching commander of any [Univ] [Baj] ship.

Name: Rionoj
Lore: Female Boslic freighter captain. Delivered the earring of Li Nalas to Quark in 2370. Suspected of trafficking in stolen Falangian diamonds.
Text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Greed Navigation

Name: Ruwon
Lore: Led Romulan delegation to DS9 to receive Starfleet's intelligence dossier on the Dominion. Had secret orders to destroy the station and nearby wormhole.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Anthropology Treachery SECURITY

Name: Sakonna
Lore: Female Vulcan. Gunrunner. Bought weapons from Quark in 2370. Helped the Maquis abduct Gul Dukat, but failed to establish a forced mindmeld with him.
Text: ENGINEER Treachery Mindmeld Physics Acquisition

Name: Selveth
Lore: Female Romulan. Piloted a warbird in the secret Tal Shiar/Obsidian Order operation to destroy Dominion homeworld in 2371. Served under Colonel Lovok.
Text: ENGINEER Navigation x 2 Stellar Cartography Geology

Name: Shakaar Edon
Lore: Leader of Shakaar resistance cell. Farmer. He refused to return soil reclamators to provisional government in 2371. Old friend of Kira Nerys.
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Resistance x 2 Leadership Geology Other Bajorans present are STRENGTH +2.

Name: Sharat
Characteristics/ Keywords: Kellerun; Ambassador; Harvester Virus-related card; Male;
Lore: Kellerun ambassador. Helped negotiate cease fire with the T'Lani. Worked on project to eliminate harvester virus and associated technology in 2370.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Exobiology Treachery Computer Skill

Name: Sorus
Lore: Technician who accompanied a Romulan delegation, led by Ruwon and Karina, to Deep Space 9 in 2369.
Text: ENGINEER Cybernetics Computer Skill Physics Treachery

Name: Surmak Ren
Lore: Chief administrator of Ilvian Medical Complex. Former Bajoran resistance member. Helped develop an aphasia virus which years later would infect Deep Space 9.
Text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Biology Resistance May nullify {Aphasia Device} where present.

Name: Tahna Los
Lore: Member of Kohn-Ma terrorist group. Wanted for crimes against the Cardassian people. Tried to collapse the entrance to the Bajoran wormhole in 2369.
Text: CIVILIAN Resistance Treachery Physics ENGINEER

Name: Taylor Moore
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: Typical of Federation security specialists serving aboard Deep Space 9. Had an encounter with an alien entity personifying Rumpelstiltskin. Likes dabo.
Text: SECURITY Leadership Archaeology

Name: Tekeny Ghemor
Lore: Legate. Exposed his status as a dissident to protect Kira Nerys. Has Yarim Fel syndrome. Knows more about the Cardassian government than anyone alive.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Honor x 2 May glance at any Cardassian player's [HA] card(s).

Name: T'Kar
Lore: Klingon mercenary used by Verad. Helped capture Jadzia in an attempt to steal the Dax symbiont.
Text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 ENGINEER Treachery

Name: T'Lor
Characteristics/ Keywords: Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: Male geologist from Tiburon. Typical of science personnel stationed aboard Deep Space 9. Guarded a Jem'Hadar warship salvaged in Gamma Quadrant.
Text: SCIENCE Geology Computer Skill

Name: Tora Ziyal
Lore: Half-Bajoran daughter of Tora Naprem and Dukat. Survived crash of the Ravinok on Dozaria. Rescued in 2372. Talented artist. Fond of Elim Garak.
Text: CIVILIAN Youth May seed under {Dozaria}. Geology {Dukat} is INTEGRITY +3 if present.

Name: Toran
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Gul; Male;
Lore: Gul. Sent to Deep Space 9 to kill Natima Lang and other dissidents. Political enemy of Garak.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Navigation Treachery Stellar Cartography

Name: Trazko
Lore: Hireling used by Pallra during her extortion plan. Assassin. Recovered secret list of collaborators. Attempted to kill Quark - twice.
Text: CIVILIAN Greed Computer Skill Stellar Cartography

Name: Turrel
Lore: Legate. Politician and diplomat. Negotiated historic 2371 treaty between Cardassia Prime and Bajor with Bareil Antos and Kai Winn.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Anthropology Astrophysics Protects your Cardassian treaties from nullification.

Name: Ty Kajada
Lore: Female Kobliad security officer. Representative of law enforcement agents found on non-aligned worlds. Pursued the criminal Rao Vantika for 20 years.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership

Name: Ulani Belor
Lore: Representative of Cardassian scientists. Member of Ministry of Science. Worked on subspace radio relay project in 2371 with her associate, Gilora Rejal.
Text: SCIENCE Physics Stellar Cartography

Name: Vakis
Lore: Tal Shiar agent. Aware of assassination plot against Elim Garak. Unhappy to discover that her records mischaracterized him as a cobbler, not a tailor.
Text: V.I.P. Tal Shiar MEDICAL Biology Treachery

Name: Varis Sul
Lore: Orphan of parents killed by Cardassians. Succeeded her father as tetrarch of the Paqu. Compromised with rival village of Navot. Friend of Jake Sisko and Nog.
Text: V.I.P. Youth Leadership Diplomacy Geology

Name: Vedek Sorad
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Support Personnel; Vedek;
Lore: Bajoran Vedek. Typical member of Vedek Assembly. Accompanied Minister Rozahn to Deep Space 9 in 2370 to deny Skrreean request to settle on Bajor.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy MEDICAL

Name: Vedek Winn
Lore: Religious leader who protested scientific teachings of Bajoran wormhole origins. Orchestrated assassination attempt on Bareil. Aspires to be Kai - by any means.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery Leadership Diplomacy Once every turn, may "stop" one personnel present.

Name: Weld Ram
Lore: Typical of Bajorans studying the geosciences. Part of Dr. Mora Pol's research mission to L-S VI in 2370.
Text: SCIENCE Geology Archaeology

Name: Yeto
Lore: Particularly brusque Klingon who aided Verad's takeover of Deep Space 9 in 2370. Immobilized Odo in a containment device.
Text: SCIENCE Treachery Stellar Cartography Transporter Skill

Name: Zef'No
Lore: Kressari male. Commader of the Calondon. Agent who supplied Cardassian weapons to the Circle in 2370.
Text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill SECURITY Treachery Smuggling Stellar Cartography

Name: Fightin' Words
Lore: Go on. Take a poke at me. That is what you want to do, isn't it?
Text: Place on table. All your personnel with three or more [*] icons lose their first two listed skills. Nullified only by {Oof!} or if you initiate personnel battle.

Name: I Tried to Warn You
Lore: You're making a terrible mistake.
Text: If you began this mission with only one non-Borg personnel, or if all your missions have the same icon ([S] or [P]), opponent places dilemma on any one mission in play. Q makes that mission unattemptable and unscoutable; destroys any points already gained from solving that mission or completing an objective targeting that mission. (May not be nullified.)

Name: Rhetorical Question
Lore: Still chasing your own tail?
Text: If crew or Away Team completes mission on this attempt, discard dilemma. Otherwise, opponent may place dilemma on any one of your non-Borg ships in play (at this location if possible). While dilemma in play, you may not re-attempt this mission and ship must do nothing but return to one of your facilities; then discard dilemma. (Immune to {Q2}.)

Name: Risky Business
Lore: Remember that bug bite? ... The galaxy can be a dangerous place when you're on your own.
Text: If only one personnel in crew or Away Team, that personnel dies (erased if [Holo]); seed dilemma beneath mission to be encountered again. Otherwise, if you have any one-person crews or Away Teams anywhere in play, choose one of them to die OR lose points. (Dilemma does not affect Borg.)

Name: Aldara
Lore: Warship commanded by Danar. Destroyed a scout vessel piloted by Bajoran terrorist Tahna Los after he stole a Cardassian antimatter converter.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Assault Vessel
Lore: Mainstay of the Bajoran Militia. During the 2370 coup attempt by the Circle, assault vessels commanded by General Krim and Colonel Day invaded Deep Space 9.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Bajoran Freighter
Lore: Typical freighter used by merchants and military. Based on a standard Bajoran hull design. Frequently hauls goods and passengers to Bajoran settlements.

Name: Bajoran Interceptor
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran ship; Interceptor; No staffing requirement;
Lore: Patrols high orbit of Bajor and surrounding region. Used by the Circle to shoot down a subimpulse raider during the attempted coup of 2370.
Text: May take off or land once each turn. X=4 if moving within a region.

Name: Bajoran Scout Vessel
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran ship; No staffing requirement; Scout;
Lore: Used for scouting and scientific tasks. Bears a resemblance to other Bajoran vessels, although much smaller in size. Tahna Los stole and commanded one.

Name: Cardassian Shuttle
Lore: Small ship configured for both military and civilian use. Ferried prisoners from Bajor to Terok Nor during the occupation. Natima Lang commanded one.

Name: Cha'Joh
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Duras-related; Klingon ship; No staffing requirement; Romulan ship; Scout;
Lore: Small, obsolete, twenty-year-old Bird-of-Prey commanded by Lursa and B'Etor, the Sisters of Duras.
Text: May benefit from two matching commanders. Cloaking Device

Name: Flaxian Scout Vessel
Lore: Scout ship of Flaxian registry. Retaya commanded one in 2371 during a Tal Shiar assignment to assassinate Garak.

Name: Galor
Lore: Military spacecraft used by the Cardassian Union. The Type-3 Galor-class warship is the backbone of the Cardassian fleet.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Groumall
Lore: Commanded by Dukat following his demotion over the Ziyal scandal. Armed with jury-rigged system 5 disruptors scavenged from Korma.
Text: Tractor Beam DL/ {System 5 Disruptors}

Name: I.K.C. Toh'Kaht
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Klingon cruiser dispatched to the Gamma Quadrant on a biosurvey mission. Commanded by first officer Hon'Tihl after its captain was killed in battle.
Text: Attributes all +1 in Gamma Quadrant. Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: Military Freighter
Lore: Large, moderately armed freighter vessel. Used by the Cardassian military to ferry troops and maintain supply lines.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Miradorn Raider
Lore: Representative of Miradorn vessels. Alternately commanded by Ah-Kel and Ro-Kel. Hull design impervious to most scans.
Text: Long-Range Scan Shielding

Name: Prakesh
Lore: Type-3 Cardassian warship. Rescued the Detapa Council from Cardassia Prime just prior to the 2372 Klingon invasion. Commanded by Dukat.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Rigelian Freighter
Lore: Large-volume ship typically used by various planetary consortiums. Primary energy supply optimized for defensive shielding.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Danube
Lore: Class of runabout often named for Terran rivers. First commissioned in 2368. The following year, the U.S.S. Enterprise delivered three Danube-class vessels to DS9.
Text: Reports for free to {Docking Pads}.

Name: U.S.S. Yangtzee Kiang
Characteristics/ Keywords: Duras-related; Federation ship; No staffing requirement;
Lore: Starfleet runabout commanded by Kira Nerys during Tahna Los' 2369 encounter with the Sisters of Duras. Registry number NCC-72453.
Text: May be used by Bajoran affiliation.

Name: Xepolite Freighter
Characteristics/ Keywords: Freighter; Long-Range Scan Shielding; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Xepolite merchants are suspected as fronts for secret Cardassian operations. They maintain their privacy via particle-diffusing hull alloys.
Text: Long-Range Scan Shielding, Tractor Beam

Name: Commander's Office
Text: Once each turn, any player who has a matching [Cmd] OFFICER unopposed here may, in place of one card draw, download to hand one Captain's Order card ({Captain's Log}, {Lower Decks}, {Yellow Alert}, {Senior Staff Meeting} or any card so marked). Matching OFFICER personnel may {file mission reports} here. This site is always the "innermost" site of any Nor (may not separate {Ops} from any other site). Any Nor: Ops Module

Name: Docking Pads
Text: Any ship with no staffing requirements may report, dock (land) and undock (take off) here if ship is compatible with station's affiliation OR crew includes a V.I.P. OR player controlling ship has a Computer Skill personnel present at this site unopposed (just before undocking, that personnel may board ship). Player controlling station may, once per game, download {Establish Landing Protocols}. Capacity: 6 ships. Tractor Beam. Any Nor: Habitat Ring

Name: Docking Ports
Text: Any ship with fewer than three staffing icons may report, dock and undock here if ship is compatible with station's affiliation OR crew includes a V.I.P. OR player controlling ship has a Computer Skill personnel present at this site unopposed (just before undocking, that personnel may board ship). Freighters and transports report for free here. Capacity: 9 ships. Tractor Beam. Any Nor: Docking Ring

Name: Docking Pylons
Text: Any ship with fewer than five staffing icons may dock and undock here if ship is compatible with station's affiliation OR crew includes a V.I.P. OR player controlling ship has a Computer Skill personnel present at this site unopposed (just before undocking, that personnel may board ship). Ships may not report here but may repair here. Capacity: 6 ships. Tractor Beam. Any Nor: Docking Ring

Name: Garak's Tailor Shop
Text: Obsidian Order personnel may report here (for free if {any Garak}). Once each turn, any player who has a personnel unopposed here who has both Obsidian Order and Treachery may glance at top card of opponent's draw deck. Also, any player who doesn't control station but has Obsidian Order unopposed here may report Cardassian personnel and Cardassian-compatible Equipment cards here. {Terok Nor} OR {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

Name: Guest Quarters
Text: If unoccupied, any non-Borg V.I.P. may report here regardless of affiliation. Once each turn, any player who has a V.I.P. unopposed here may, in place of one card draw, draw two cards and place one of them beneath draw deck. (Not cumulative.) Any Nor: Habitat Ring

Name: Infirmary
Text: Compatible MEDICAL-classification personnel, MEDICAL-related Equipment cards and {I.P. Scanner} may report here. Once each turn, any MEDICAL personnel unopposed here may "revive" a personnel present who was disabled by a {Hypospray} (revived personnel is no longer disabled). Matching MEDICAL personnel may {file mission reports} here. Any Nor: Promenade

Name: Ops
Text: Compatible OFFICER-classification personnel may report here. Any player may, in place of their normal card play, download to an unopposed site on this station one card which may play there (if reporting a ship or personnel, must be of matching affiliation); player draws no cards that turn. Any Computer Skill personnel unopposed here may commandeer station. Any Nor: Ops Module

Name: Ore Processing Unit
Text: Compatible ENGINEER-classification personnel and ENGINEER-related Equipment cards may report here. If {Automated Security System} on {Ops} at this station, personnel may not move to here from an adjacent site, or vice versa. This unit does not {process ore} when station is under Federation or Bajoran control. Any Nor: Docking Ring

Name: Promenade Shops
Text: Non-Borg CIVILIAN personnel may report here regardless of affiliation. Any player who has a non-Borg personnel present may probe: [Event], [Interrupt], [Equipment]: Shopping. Draw probe card. [Objective], [Car], [Kli]: Brawl. Must immediately initiate a personnel battle (if opposed by non-Borg at this site). Any Nor: Promenade

Name: Science Lab
Text: Compatible SCIENCE-classification personnel, SCIENCE-related Equipment cards, {I.P. Scanner} and {PADDs} may report here. Once each turn, if station at a [S] mission and player who controls station has a SCIENCE personnel unopposed here, that player may scan bottom seed card under the mission. Matching SCIENCE personnel may {file mission reports} here. Any Nor: Docking Ring

Name: Security Office
Text: Compatible SECURITY-classification personnel and hand weapons may report here. Whenever a personnel battle was just initiated on this station, any player's personnel here, if one has SECURITY, may move there (if possible) and join the battle. Matching SECURITY personnel may {file mission reports} here. Any Nor: Promenade

Name: Memory Wipe
Lore: Satarran operatives use biolelectric fields to cause selective memory suppression. Victims retain basic skills and aptitudes, but lose their sense of identity and affiliation.
Text: Seeds on table; your opponent's cards may mix regardless of affiliation. OR Plays on a non- [Bor] ship; ship, crew and ship's Away Teams lose affiliation and become [Non].

Name: Ferengi Trading Post
Lore: Ferengi commercial centers are frequented by many races for trade, information, repair and resupply.
Text: Seed one (you may also seed one [Univ] D'Kora face up here) OR build where you have a Ferengi ENGINEER. Each player's non-Borg cards may report and mix aboard regardless of affiliation.

Name: Botanical Research
Lore: Gather plant life for medical research from planet with highly ionized atmosphere.
Text: SCIENCE + MEDICAL + CUNNING>35 {Atmospheric Ionization} may seed here.

Name: Geological Survey
Lore: Assess value of rich mineral deposits on planet near edge of explored space.
Text: SCIENCE + Geology + Computer Skill * +10 if 3 Geology OR 3 Greed present.

Name: Military Exercises
Lore: Conduct flagship efficiency drills in remote sector of Alpha Quadrant.
Text: SECURITY + Leadership + CUNNING>28 + ship with two or more staffing icons

Name: Search for Weapons
Lore: Search planet for illegal Maquis arms cache.
Text: OFFICER + Navigation + Treachery May seed hand weapons under here.

Name: Study Cometary Cloud
Lore: Research gaseous comet trail in this system's Oort cloud for military or commercial use.
Text: Navigation + SCIENCE + Physics + Computer Skill

Name: Study Pulsar
Lore: Characterize radio and optical emissions from rapidly rotating neutron star.
Text: Navigation + Astrophysics + Computer Skill

Name: We Are the Borg
Lore: Lower your shields and surrender your ships. We will add your biological and technological distinctiveness to our own. Your culture will adapt to service us. Resistance is futile.
Text: Downloads two [Def] drones; discard event. OR Plays on table. Each turn, report one of your [Bor] cards for free or make an additional end-of-turn draw (immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}).

Name: Add Distinctiveness
Text: Seeds or plays on table. X varies, where X = number of [*] icons on personnel you've assimilated as drones. Also, if you are behind by 40 or more points, once per game you may open a sealed First Contact expansion pack. Play or place in hand any or all non-seed cards in that pack (non-Borg cards are assimilated or stolen, as appropriate), then place the others out-of-play.

Name: Nightmare
Text: Plays on non-Borg opponent if you have a [Bor] card or {Borg Ship} dilemma in play. Each turn, peek at one to three cards in opponent's hand (random selection) and store at least one of them beneath incident. Nullified only by {Plexing} or when stored cards exceed cards in opponent's hand. (When nullified, choose one stored card to place beneath opponent's draw deck; return others to opponent's hand.)

Name: Population 9 Billion - All Borg
Text: Seeds or plays on table. If your Borg have completed {Stop First Contact} (or {Build Interplexing Beacon}), place incident on {Earth}; you may download a {Borg outpost} there. Your [Bor] cards may subsequently report on Earth or to that outpost; and your subsequently completed [BO] objectives targeting missions in the Alpha Quadrant score double points.

Name: Service the Collective
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Whenever your current objective targets either a homeworld OR your mission that has an affiliation icon matching your counterpart there, your Borg are not restricted from probing on same turn they complete scouting. Also, while a personnel you've assimilated as a counterpart is on your ship, that ship is WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against counterpart's former affiliation(s).

Name: Sphere Encounter
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Each of your {Borg spheres} is RANGE +4. Also, whenever opponent initiates an attempt of one of your [S] missions with your [BO][Obj] on it, you may download there any number od personnel, equipment and/or Borg Spheres each may initiate battle (regardless of your current objective) or move away.

Name: Bareil of Borg
Lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Bajorans in a parallel universe. "The knowledge and experience of the Bajoran - Bareil Antos - is part of us now."
Text: V.I.P. Anthropology Diplomacy x 2 Honor SCIENCE Biology While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Baj].

Name: Dukat of Borg
Lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Union in a parallel universe. "The knowledge and experience of the Cardassian - Dukat - is part of us now."
Text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Navigation x 2 Treachery Diplomacy Computer Skill While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Car].

Name: Eleven of Seventeen
Lore: Identification: COMPLINK DRONE Task: Ensure network data continuity. Augment. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: May seed (limit one) face up at your outpost. Computer Skill SCIENCE Nullifies all {Computer Crash} cards in play.

Name: Gowron of Borg
Lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Empire in a parallel universe. "The knowledge and experience of the Klingon - Gowron - is part of us now."
Text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Honor Once per game, allows his hive to initiate battle. While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Kli].

Name: Six of Nineteen
Lore: Identification: REASSIMILATION DRONE Task: Repair and reintegrate defective drones. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Just before {Rogue Borg} present initiate battle, may download a [Univ] drone to replace (discard) one of them. Exobiology DL/ {Intruder Alert!}

Name: Tomalak of Borg
Lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Star Empire in a parallel universe. "The knowledge and experience of the Romulan - Tomalak - is part of us now."
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership For rest of game, all your ships have Cloaking Device. While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Rom].

Name: Croden's Key
Lore: Unusual necklace containing a shape-shifting key reminiscent of changelings. Used to secure a hidden stasis chamber protecting Croden's daughter, Yareth, in the Chamra Vortex.
Text: Seeds only in Gamma Quadrant. Use as Equipment card. Where present, allows docking/undocking at, and walking into/out of, any player's ship or facility (as appropriate).

Name: Orb of Prophecy and Change
Lore: Third of the nine mysterious energy vortices called Tears of the Prophets by the Bajorans. Grants visions of the future. Only Orb not stolen by Cardassians during the occupation.
Text: Use as Equipment card. Once each turn, you may glance at the top card of your draw deck. Insert it anywhere within your draw deck if you wish. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: The Earring of Li Nalas
Lore: Quark acquired a Bajoran earring in 2370. Kira Nerys quickly identified it as that of Bajoran resistance hero Li Nalas, leading to the rescue of Li and others from the Hutet labor camp.
Text: Use as Equipment card. Once in play, if {Li Nalas} then earned from {Rescue Prisoners}, doubles its point box. Also, Resistance personnel present are attributes all +3. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Berserk Changeling
Lore: Changelings can be hyper-sensitive to certain environmental hazards, such as the poison gas encountered on planet LS-VI. Progressive degradation causes uncontrollable outbursts.
Text: Unless 2 hand weapons OR 3 SECURITY OR {Changeling Sweep} OR {Shape-Shift Inhibitor} OR {Interphase Generator} OR {Mora Pol} present, kills a non-changeling present (random selection).

Name: Chula: Pick One to Save Two
Lore: In the game of chula, thialo is a decision point which requires the player to select one participant to be lost so that the others can continue.
Text: To get past requires three personnel present (random selection) to face thialo. Choose one of those three to return to your hand, or all three are "stopped."

Name: Chula: The Chandra
Lore: The Chandra is part of an elaborate Wadi game which requires players to advance through several shaps, or levels. To get past this shap, players must precisely mimic the Chandra.
Text: One person (random selection) continues, along with all crew or Away Team members who have at least one attribute number matching that personnel. Others are "stopped."

Name: Chula: The Dice
Lore: The throw of the dice is the foundation of chula. Each combination of Wadi symbols determines which challenge next awaits the game's participants.
Text: To get past requires one personnel with INTEGRITY>6, another with CUNNING>7 and a third with STRENGTH>8.

Name: Crisis
Lore: The crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise-E faced concurrent problems in 2063. The Borg required Picard's attention on the ship while Riker and the away team worked with Cochrane on Earth.
Text: To get past requires Leadership (or [Com] and [Def] icons) in Away Team and an OFFICER-classification personnel (or 2 [Def] Borg) aboard your ship at this location.

Name: Founder Secret
Lore: Searching for the source of a jamming signal, Kira Nerys discovered a secret door on the Founders' homeworld. The lock was designed to be worked by changeling physiology.
Text: To get past requires a changeling OR {Interphase Generator} OR {Croden's Key} OR CUNNING>40 and {any tricorder} OR STRENGTH>70 OR 4 [Def] drones OR {Breen CRM114}.

Name: Friendly Fire
Lore: Ferengi lack of leadership resulted in the untimely demise of the Vorta Keevan aboard Empok Nor. His death was a major setback in Quark and Rom's mission to rescue their Moogie.
Text: Unless 2 Leadership and 2 SECURITY present, kills one personnel (random selection); place dilemma on this mission (or this {Empok Nor}); it cannot be attempted or scouted.

Name: Mission Fatigue
Lore: When under extreme stress, even highly trained veterans can experience lapses in judgment. Miles O'Brien and Worf fought each other while they were besieged by Jem'Hadar in 2373.
Text: Unless Empathy and Leadership present, place on mission; each subsequent dilemma seeded here stops one non-Borg personnel present (random selection) when revealed.

Name: Navigational Hazards
Lore: Successful completion of a mission in deep space requires proper charting and navigational skills. Maps of the known universe can be essential to a crew in unfamiliar territory.
Text: To get past requires Stellar Cartography and 2 Navigation.

Name: Sleeper Trap
Lore: Stasis chambers holding homicidal Cardassians infected with a biogenic compound. Left aboard the abandoned Empok Nor and rigged to activate should anyone come aboard.
Text: Opponent may download to one site or planet here up to three different [Univ] Cardassians and one hand weapon. They may (if possible) initiate personnel battle. Discard dilemma.

Name: Surprise Assault
Lore: Jem'Hadar soldiers have the capability to "shroud," or cloak themselves. This allows them to hide virtually anywhere, and they frequently take their adversaries by surprise.
Text: Unless Leadership, 2 OFFICER and 2 SECURITY present OR 2 hand weapons present, kills two personnel (lowest CUNNING first, then lowest STRENGTH). Discard dilemma.

Name: Dominion PADD
Lore: Standard Personal Access Display Device for computerized information. This PADD was taken by Jem'Hadar from the New Bajor colony destroyed in 2370.
Text: Dominion use only. Each of your personnel present is CUNNING +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Jem'Hadar Birthing Chamber
Lore: Incubation module used to breed Jem'Hadar warriors. Each infant grows at a greatly accelerated rate, and is able to fight within days of emergence.
Text: Where present, each of your Jem'Hadar Birthing Chambers allows you to report one [Univ] {Young Jem'Hadar} (for free) each turn, regardless of quadrant.

Name: Jem'Hadar Disruptor
Lore: Standard-issue Jem'Hadar sidearm. Energy from a tritium microfusion reaction is accumulated in a phased polaron source, then pulse-discharged through a parabolic arkenium emitter.
Text: Dominion and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Jem'Hadar Disruptor Rifle
Lore: Jem'Hadar weapons have nonvariable energy settings, but their polaron beams can be enhanced with chemicals such as anticoagulants, nerve agents and osteosolvents.
Text: Dominion and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

Name: Ketracel-White
Lore: Isogenic enzyme controlled by the Vorta. Genetically addicted Jem'Hadar need a constant supply of "the white" to stay alive. Withdrawal prevents shrouding and leads to killing rampages.
Text: Where present, prevents "white deprivation." Counts down only if you have [KW] personnel present. (Your Vorta may "ration" just one Ketracel-White present to count down.)

Name: Crew Reassignment
Lore: In 2063, U.S.S. Enterprise-E crew member William T. Riker participated in Zefram Cochrane's historic warp flight. He and Geordi La Forge substituted for the missing Phoenix crew.
Text: Plays on table. Your /Ent-E personnel may staff ships as [Stf]. Also, each of your personnel with a special staffing icon may report to your ship with same icon. (Captain's Order.)

Name: Espionage - Dominion on Federation
Lore: Dominion intelligence operations conducted against the Federation have included the initial Eris ruse, Borath's virtual invasion scenario and even changeling infiltration of Earth.
Text: Plays on any Federation mission (for free if your <Fed> personnel is there). Your Dominion personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

Name: Espionage - Dominion on Klingon
Lore: A changeling impersonating General Martok manipulated Gowron so craftily that the Chancellor abandoned the Khitomer Accords and declared war on its long-time ally the Federation.
Text: Plays on any Klingon mission (for free if your <Kli> personnel is there). Your Dominion personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

Name: Espionage - Dominion on Romulan
Lore: Romulan counter-espionage protocols are second to none. The vigilance of the Tal Shiar protected the Star Empire from enemy spies for decades - until the Dominion arrived.
Text: Plays on any Romulan mission (for free if your <Rom> personnel is there). Your Dominion personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

Name: Fair Play
Lore: When Miles O'Brien discovered his publicized racquetball match was unfairly influenced by an alien gambling device, he refused to take advantage of an unfair situation.
Text: Seeds or plays on table; may not be nullified. No player may solve an opponent's unique mission unless its point box shows at least 40 points OR both players have a copy of it in play.

Name: Invasive Beam-In
Lore: Dominion transporter technology is optimized for combat operations. The ability to breach enemy shields allows rapid deployment of Jem'Hadar warriors in most battle scenarios.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Each of your ships with Invasive Transporters and Transporter Skill aboard may beam your personnel matching that ship through opponent's SHIELDS.

Name: Sisko 197 Subroutine
Lore: In anticipation of a Cardassian takeover in 2373, Benjamin Sisko sabotaged the Deep Space 9 central computer. The resulting damage hampered Terok Nor for quite some time.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Place on your Nor's {Ops}. Nor may not be moved or commandeered. Any player may nullify with 4 Computer Skill present. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

Name: Tactical Console
Lore: Standard display on most modern starships. Combines weapons control with target acquisition and analysis subroutines. Highly effective in the hands of a trained tactical officer.
Text: Plays on your ship docked at your facility. While you have {Miles O'Brien} or a SECURITY-classification personnel aboard, ship is weapons +3. (Captain's Order.)

Name: Treaty: Bajoran/Dominion
Lore: Bajor's non-aggression pact with the Dominion, signed in 2373, was endorsed by the Emissary himself. He hoped to spare Bajor from the inevitable Federation/Dominion war.
Text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Kai Winn} or {The Emissary} in play). Your Bajoran and Dominion affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

Name: Treaty: Cardassian/Dominion
Lore: Gul Dukat's secret negotiations with the Dominion in 2373 secured a strong ally for the Cardassian Union, and positioned Dukat as the new head of the Cardassian government.
Text: Seeds or plays on table (plays for free if you have {Dukat} in play). Your Cardassian and Dominion affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

Name: Treaty: Romulan/Dominion
Lore: On Proconsul Neral's authority, Senator Vreenak negotiated a strategic non-aggression pact with the Dominion, forcing the humans and Klingons to bear the brunt of Dominion aggression.
Text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Senator Vreenak} in play). Your Romulan and Dominion affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

Name: Empok Nor
Lore: Cardassian mining station abandoned in 2372.
Text: Seeds (uncontrolled) during mission phase at a % mission. Dilemmas with "Empok Nor" in gametext or lore may seed beneath station; may not be commandeered while dilemmas remain. No reporting aboard. Flip over if commandeered.

Name: Office of the President
Lore: From his office in Paris, the President of the United Federation of Planets leads the representative council.
Text: Seeds or plays on {Earth}. Once per turn, one Federation Ambassador, Admiral, Vice-Admiral or President OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Office of the Proconsul
Lore: The Proconsul heads the Romulan Senate. Neral was Proconsul during the 2368 Vulcan Unification ruse.
Text: Seeds or plays on {Romulus}. Once per turn, one Romulan General, Admiral, Senator or Proconsul OR {Sela} or {Tomalak} OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Primary Supply Depot
Lore: Gamma quadrant space facility. Long-time source of ketracel-white for Jem'Hadar troops.
Text: Seeds at any non-homeworld Gamma Quadrant mission. Your non-weapon equipment may seed aboard (limit three). Resets countdowns of {Ketracel-White} aboard. Does not repair ships.

Name: Remote Supply Depot
Lore: Recently constructed space facility designed to support Dominion expansion into other quadrants.
Text: Build where you have a Dominion ENGINEER. Your equipment may report aboard, for free, regardless of quadrant. Resets countdowns of {Ketracel-White} aboard. Does not repair ships.

Name: The Great Hall
Lore: The Great Hall of Qo'noS is the seat of power for the entire Klingon Empire.
Text: Seeds or plays on {Qo'noS}. Once per turn, one Klingon Emperor, Chancellor or personnel with "High Council" in lore OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: The Great Link
Lore: Changelings intermingle in the Great Link, merging form and thought into one communal entity.
Text: Seeds or plays on {Founders' homeworld}. {Ketracel-White} on planet does not count down. Once per turn, one Founder OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Caught Red-Handed
Characteristics/ Keywords: Capturing-related card; Infiltration-related card; Morph card;
Lore: Odo used his instincts as both an investigator and a shape-shifter to expose a Founder spy masquerading as Admiral Leyton on Earth in 2372.
Text: Exposes (may capture) an opponent's infiltrator present with your shape-shifter OR prevents a changeling from morphing this turn OR nullifies {Common Thief}. (May not be nullified.)

Name: Flight of the Intruder
Lore: When the changeling impersonating Admiral Leyton on Earth was caught red-handed by Odo, the Founder quickly made a winged escape.
Text: Except during the destruction of a location, ship or facility, suspends play while any or all of your shape-shifters present together morph into birds (return to your hand).

Name: In the Bag
Lore: While investigating a Tallonian crystal smuggler, Odo took the form of a latinum-filled satchel. He was forced to abort the sting operation when Worf interfered.
Text: Allows your Equipment card in play and your shape-shifter in hand to morph (exchange). May be played at the start of battle (may also download {Strike Three} there).

Name: Jem'Hadar Sacrifice
Lore: Injured by phaser fire, Meso'Clan could no longer contribute to his unit. He requested that he be put to death rather than continue to consume ketracel-white.
Text: Plays on your [KW] personnel. He sacrifices (dies) to keep all your {Ketracel-White} present from counting down this turn OR to substitute for a Founder present who is about to die.

Name: Shape-Shift
Lore: From the Great Link, the Founders manipulate their expanding empire. The ability to appear as members of any species has proven invaluable to their success.
Text: Allows your Founder in play to morph into a different Founder (exchange it with one in hand OR discard it to download one there). (Immune to {Amanda Rogers}.)

Name: Strike Three
Lore: Bearing a striking resemblance to a bag of explosives, Odo surprised three Jem'Hadar warriors on Vandros IV.
Text: Plays at start of personnel battle. Each of your shape-shifters present may stun up to three opposing non-shape-shifters (random selection) and is exposed if infiltrating.

Name: You Dirty Rat
Lore: On more than one occasion, Odo has assumed the form of a rodent in order to remain undercover during an investigation or conceal himself from a potential threat.
Text: Plays on your shape-shifter. It morphs into a rat (treated as disabled and may not be targeted or participate in battle). May morph back (discard interrupt) at any time.

Name: Archanis Dispute
Lore: Force the Federation to forfeit claim to planet relinquished a century ago by the Klingon Empire.
Text: OFFICER x2 + Strength>45 + (VIP x3 OR {<Kli> personnel} OR {any Gowron})

Name: Betazed Invasion
Lore: Strike deep into Federation territory and take control of this strategically important planet.
Text: OFFICER x3 + SECURITY x5 + 2 hand weapons + STRENGTH>100

Name: Bioweapon Ruse
Lore: Install signal generator and leak rumors about metagenic weapon production on this barren planet.
Text: ENGINEER + Strength>35 + no Honor + (SECURITY x3 + Obsidian Order OR {Madred})

Name: Construct Depot
Lore: Build ketracel-white production facility in the Alpha Quadrant.
Text: Navigation x2 + Physics + Vorta + ENGINEER When you solve, download {Remote Supply Depot} here. Opponent's side: Not attemptable, no gametext, no pointbox.

Name: Intelligence Operation
Lore: Covertly compile data on current Dominion homeworld in the Omarion Nebula.
Text: Navigation x2 + (Tal Shiar OR Obsidian Order) + Anthropology + (SECURITY x3 OR {any Odo})

Name: Investigate Coup
Lore: Investigate alleged coup that threatens to change the balance of power in this sector.
Text: OFFICER + Leadership x2 + SECURITY + Navigation OR {Benjamin Sisko} OR {Tomalak} OR {General Krim}

Name: Mining Survey
Affil: Any crew may attempt mission (if same player controls a Nor with an Ore Processing Unit here).
Lore: Scan system for mineral resources suitable for processing by mining station located here.
Text: ENGINEER + SCIENCE + Geology + Physics {Nor} or {Empok Nor} may seed and {Process Ore} here.

Name: Protect Shipment
Lore: Guard medical shipments to colony suffering from outbreak of Rudellian plague.
Text: Leadership + SECURITY x2 + MEDICAL + Honor + WEAPONS>9

Name: Quest for the Sword
Lore: Search ancient vault for the Sword of Kahless and other artifacts plundered centuries ago.
Text: Archaeology + SCIENCE + {any tricorder} + STRENGTH>32 + (Honor OR Treachery)

Name: Rescue Founder
Lore: Negotiate with Federation survey team to recover injured Founder from shipwreck.
Text: Diplomacy x2 + MEDICAL + Strength>45 + Cunning>35

Name: Security Briefing
Lore: Attend joint intelligence exchange on this Cardassian world regarding Klingon military movements.
Text: SECURITY + Diplomacy x2 + V.I.P. x3 You may play {System 5 Disruptors} for free here.

Name: Uncover DNA Clues
Lore: Investigate genetic research conducted here by Federation scientist Dr. Richard Galen.
Text: SCIENCE + Archaeology + (Leadership x2 OR {Ocett}) {Hunt for DNA Program} adds [CAR][BAJ][FER].

Name: Engage Cloak
Text: Seeds or plays on table. When your staffed ship cloaks or phases, it may relocate here (capacity one ship). Just before that ship decloaks or dephases, return it to its former location; it may immediately move (up to its full RANGE) once for each of your full turns it was on this objective. (If ship returns to spaceline on your turn, it may also use that turn's RANGE).

Name: Establish Dominion Foothold
Text: Seeds or plays on a mission in Alpha or Delta Quadrant if none of your [Dom] cards have been in that quadrant yet this game. If your Dominion personnel subsequently complete that mission, you may download a Dominion facility with up to five different Equipment cards there; score points (discard objective). You may complete this objective only once in each quadrant.

Name: Install Autonomic Systems Parasite
Text: Plays on opponent's ship if your Founder is aboard. That ship may not engage or disengage its special equipment, transporters and WEAPONS until your next turn; then you may use ship to move and/or battle opponent's other cards (ignore staffing and affiliation restrictions); then discard objective. May be nullified by {Miles O'Brien} OR {Odo} OR 3 ENGINEER and 3 SECURITY aboard. (Unique.)

Name: Issue Secret Orders
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Place on your V.I.P. or OFFICER who has been infiltrating opponent's ship since start of opponent's last turn. Target any opponent's mission in same quadrant. Ship and crew must do nothing but go to that mission (with infiltrator aboard) and attempt it if possible (any infiltrators may decline); then infiltrator is exposed. Discard objective whenever infiltrator exposed.

Name: Operate Wormhole Relays
Text: Seeds or plays on table. once each turn, your staffed ship with two or fewer staffing icons and SCIENCE, Physics x2, and Astrophysics aboard may move through {Barzan} or {Bajoran Wormhole} (or between two {Transwarp Network Gateways} by using RANGE equal to twice the span of the destination location, and is not stopped.

Name: Post Garrison
Text: Plays on any mission. Opponent may not attempt, scout or complete a [BO] objective targeting that mission, but may battle your cards at that location regardless of affiliation attack restrictions. If on a planet, objective nullified if you have fewer than three Jem'Hadar or SECURITY personnel on planet; otherwise, nullified if you have fewer than two staffed ships at that location.

Name: Subjugate Planet
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Place on a non-homeworld, non-[DOM] planet mission you seeded. You may attempt mission using these requirements: Vorta + Treachery + 4 Jem'Hadar + STRENGTH>(point value of mission x2) When you solve mission, you may download {Remote Supply Depot} (plus one {Ketracel-White}) here; discard objective.

Name: 10 and 01
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bynar; Dual Personnel; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Paired Bynars from the planet Bynaus. In the year 100100111100, upgraded weapons and holodeck systems of U.S.S. Enterprise at Starbase 01001010.
Text: ENGINEER+ENGINEER 10: Computer Skill x 2 DL/ {Any Bynars} card 01: Nullifies all {Computer Crash} cards in play.

Name: Admiral Leyton
Lore: Chief of Starfleet Operations. Misguided paranoid. Faked evidence of impending Dominion invasion and urged Jaresh-Inyo to place Earth under martial law.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership SECURITY Treachery Allows your cards here to initiate battle against [Dom].

Name: Amat'igan
Lore: Jem'Hadar bodyguard of Founder Leader. Third. Took the conn of the U.S.S. Defiant to navigate the ship to the Founders' homeworld.
Text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 Stellar Cartography Computer Skill DL/ {Security Sacrifice}

Name: Anya
Lore: Female allasomorph. Shape-shifting guardian of Salia. Scouts ahead before declaring environment safe. Will do anything to protect Salia and the hope she represents.
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Honor DL/ {Salia} If present, must replace {Salia} just randomly selected.

Name: Arak'Taral
Lore: Jem'Hadar Second under Goran'Agar. Disapproved of Goran'Agar's use of Julian Bashir and Miles O'Brien in search for cure to ketracel-white addition.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Transporter Skill Physics DL/ {Invasive Beam-In}

Name: Atul
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Mission Specialist;
Lore: Typical Klingon Intelligence specialist. Dispatched to Deep Space 9 with Morka and Bo'rak to investigate Romulan activity.
Text: SECURITY Klingon Intelligence

Name: Azet'izan
Lore: Third serving under Omet'iklan. Representative of Jem'Hadar officers. Participated in eradication of dishonorable Jem'Hadar renegades on Vandros IV.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Computer Skill

Name: Borath
Lore: Vorta analyst. Subjected the captured crew members of the U.S.S. Defiant to a simulated invasion of the Alpha Quadrant in order to study their response.
Text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Exobiology Cybernetics Treachery

Name: Ch'Pok
Lore: Klingon advocate. Skilled negotiator. Prosecuted a contrived hearing against Worf in 2372 to manipulate Federation involvement in the Klingon/Cardassian war.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Treachery Law Computer Skill Biology

Name: Damar
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Glinn; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Ambitious Glinn. Reports to Dukat. Witnessed his commanding officer's triumphal retaking of Terok Nor. Oversees engineering operations aboard the station.
Text: OFFICER Physics ENGINEER Treachery Computer Skill May report where your {Dukat} is present.

Name: Daro
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Glinn; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Glinn. Aide to Gul Macet. Attempted to discuss transporter technologies with Miles O'Brien aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise, but was rebuffed.
Text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Transporter Skill

Name: Dejar
Lore: Female Obsidian Order operative. Sabotaged weapons systems of the U.S.S. Defiant in an attempt to ruin the joint scientific project between Bajor and Cardassia.
Text: ENGINEER Obsidian Order Stellar Cartography Treachery

Name: Eris
Lore: Duplicitous female agent. First Vorta to contact the Federation. Posed as an oppressed fugitive in order to win sympathy - and opportunities for espionage.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery Diplomacy MEDICAL

Name: Founder
Lore: Female member of the Dominion. Changeling. Characteristic of the members of the Great Link. Adept at mimicking the solids.
Text: V.I.P. SCIENCE Exobiology May morph (exchange with your Founder in hand).

Name: Founder Leader
Lore: Female changeling. Center of power for the entire Dominion. Key figure in the Great Link. Told Odo of his origin; greatly desires his return to the Link.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership Exobiology SCIENCE Law DL/ {Shape-Shift}

Name: Garak
Lore: Cardassian male. Virtual player in the Vorta scenario testing the resolve of Alpha Quadrant species. Risked his life in the defense of his comrades.
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Computer Skill Honor May replace anyone present randomly selected to die.

Name: General Hazar
Lore: Typical high-ranking officer in Bajoran militia. Familiar with Bajoran defense technology. Issued the order to refuse landing privileges to Skrreean ships in 2370.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Astrophysics If aboard {Assault Vessel}, its {Tactical Console} is +1.

Name: Goran'Agar
Lore: First. Jem'Hadar soldier who overcame addiction to ketracel-white. Brought group of Jem'Hadar to Bopak III seeking freedom from the white and the Vorta.
Text: OFFICER Honor x 2 Leadership Navigation Biology Nullifies {Hippocratic Oath} where present.

Name: Gurat'urak
Lore: Typical Jem'Hadar navigator. Fifth under Omet'iklan. Responsible for safeguarding devices assigned to his unit.
Text: SECURITY Navigation Transporter Skill Protects one card present from {Disruptor Overload}.

Name: Jaresh-Inyo
Lore: Male Grazerite. President of the United Federation of Planets. Reluctantly imposed martial law on Earth in 2372 at the urging of Admiral Leyton.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Biology Law DL/ {HQ: Secure Homeworld}

Name: Kai Winn
Lore: Vedek Winn became Kai of Bajor in 2370. Concluded Cardassian treaty negotiations by Bareil Antos. Finally accepted Benjamin Sisko's role as the Emissary.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Treachery Honor (if {The Emissary} in play). DL/ Any Bajoran treaty

Name: Keevan
Lore: Devious, aloof Vorta. Extorted a Federation Away Team into destroying his marooned, white-starved Jem'Hadar unit before it could turn on him. Hates Ferengi.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Anthropology Diplomacy Geology DL/ {Hostage Trade}

Name: Keeve Falor
