Lore: Typical leader of Bajoran colonists who fled Bajor during the Cardassian occupation. Resides on Valo II. Helped Jean-Luc Picard locate the terrorist Orta.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Biology Honor Your [Baj] CIVILIANs present are attributes all +2.

Name: Keogh
Lore: Captain of the U.S.S. Odyssey. In 2370, ordered to investigate the Jem'Hadar threat and rescue Benjamin Sisko. Knew Jadzia Dax, but not on friendly terms.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Honor Physics Geology DL/ {Attack Pattern Delta}

Name: Kilana
Lore: Female Vorta field operative. Dispatched to rescue an injured Founder shipwrecked on Torga IV. Distrusted Benjamin Sisko long enough to fail her mission.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Treachery SCIENCE Archaeology

Name: Kira Founder
Lore: Changeling who, under the guise of Kira Nerys, attempted to understand Odo's loyalty to the solids. Discovered he had feelings for Kira.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Resistance SECURITY Navigation Computer Skill Treachery

Name: Koret'alak
Lore: Fifth. Representative of Jem'Hadar soldiers serving under Goran'Agar. Escorted Federation prisoners taken captive on Bopak III.
Text: SECURITY Physics Stellar Cartography

Name: Leyton Founder
Characteristics/ Keywords: Changeling; Admiral; Founder; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
Lore: Dominion changeling appearing as Admiral Leyton. Exposed by Odo outside Starfleet headquarters; escaped using his shape-shifting abilities.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership SECURITY Treachery May report on {Earth}. DL/ {Flight of the Intruder}

Name: Limara'Son
Lore: Typical Jem'Hadar soldier. Reports to Remata'Klan. Demoted to Sixth for firing his weapon against orders.
Text: SECURITY Astrophysics Navigation

Name: Lovok
Lore: High-ranking colonel in the Tal Shiar. Proponent of a temporary alliance with the Obsidian Order to destroy the foundation of the Dominion.
Text: OFFICER Tal Shiar Computer Skill Navigation SCIENCE Transporter Skill

Name: Lovok Founder
Characteristics/ Keywords: Changeling; Colonel; Founder; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
Lore: Changeling. Impersonated Colonel Lovok during the 2371 attack on the Dominion homeworld. Led the Romulan/Cardassian fleet into a Jem'Hadar ambush.
Text: OFFICER Tal Shiar Computer Skill Navigation SCIENCE Transporter Skill Treachery

Name: Macet
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Gul; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Cardassian observer on board the U.S.S. Enterprise during the Phoenix incident of 2367. High-ranking Gul in the Central Command. Strict disciplinarian.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Honor MEDICAL

Name: Makla'Gor
Lore: Sixth. Typical Jem'Hadar guard and soldier. Assigned to station Terok Nor recently liberated by Dominion and Cardassian forces. Posted to security section.
Text: SECURITY Astrophysics Exobiology Honor

Name: Martok
Lore: Highly decorated general and High Council member. Accepted Worf, Alexander and Jadzia into the House of Martok. Lost his left eye battling the Jem'Hadar.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Honor Navigation x 2 DL/ {D'k Tahg} Your [Kli] ships at same location are each WEAPONS +2.

Name: Martok Founder
Characteristics/ Keywords: Changeling; Founder; General; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
Lore: Changeling who posed as General Martok. Advised Chancellor Gowron to end the Empire's long-standing alliance with the Federation.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Treachery DL/ {Treacherous Advice} OR {Dial Martok for Murder}

Name: Meso'Clan
Lore: Jem'Hadar Fourth under Goran'Agar. Injured by discharge from Miles O'Brien's crude phaser. Willing to be sacrificed to preserve dwindling supply of the white.
Text: SECURITY Honor Stellar Cartography DL/ {Jem'Hadar Sacrifice}

Name: Michael Eddington
Lore: Lt. Commander Eddington. Security officer assigned to Deep Space 9 because of Starfleet concerns about Odo. Defected to the Maquis.
Text: SECURITY ENGINEER Treachery Honor Computer Skill

Name: O'Brien Founder
Lore: Changeling posing as Miles O'Brien. Infiltrated Earth in 2372 with three other Founders. Gloated about their disruptive activities to Benjamin Sisko.
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Transporter Skill Physics Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Homefront}

Name: Omet'iklan
Lore: First assigned to Weyoun. Sought to destroy rebel Jem'Hadar and their Iconian Gateway on Vandros IV. Killed the Weyoun 4 clone for questioning his loyalty.
Text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Astrophysics Computer Skill Allows your cards here to initiate battle against [Dom].

Name: Ornithar
Lore: Typical male Karemma official. Broker of tulaberry wine for the Dominion. Well versed in valuable metals. One-time business partner of Quark.
Text: CIVILIAN Greed SCIENCE Geology

Name: Orta
Lore: Bajoran terrorist leader. Has an intense hatred for Cardassians as a result of being tortured while in captivity. Speaks with the aid of a voice synthesizer.
Text: CIVILIAN Resistance Leadership SCIENCE Opposing personnel STRENGTH -1 where present.

Name: Remata'Klan
Lore: Jem'Hadar Third who was marooned with Keevan on a deserted planet. Took charge of his men after the First and Second were lost during the incident.
Text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Honor Physics DL/ {No Way Out}

Name: Salia
Lore: Allasomorph leader of Daled IV. Shape-shifter. Parents killed in civil war. Raised by Anya on Klavdia III. Expected to unite her people. Likes Wesley Crusher.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Anthropology Youth Exobiology

Name: Senator Vreenak
Lore: Vice-Chairman of the Tal Shiar. Secretary of the War Plans Council. Key Romulan senator for over 14 years. Negotiated the non-aggression pact with the Dominion.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Tal Shiar x 2 Anthropology Leadership Law DL/ Any Romulan treaty

Name: Silaran Prin
Lore: Twisted male Cardassian living in exile. Disfigured in a terrorist attack during the occupation of Bajor. Nurtures a great hatred for the Bajorans who injured him.
Text: CIVILIAN Smuggling Treachery ENGINEER Exobiology Each Shakaar resistance cell member in play has <P).

Name: Soto
Lore: Typical Lethean mercenary. Telepathically extracted Kor's knowledge of the Shroud of the Sword. Tried to help Toral steal the Sword of Kahless.
Text: SECURITY Empathy Treachery May nullify {Lethean Telepathic Attack} where present.

Name: Talak'talan
Lore: Jem'Hadar Third. Delivered the proclamation that Alpha Quadrant species were no longer welcome in the Gamma Quadrant... and would be destroyed.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Transporter Skill Astrophysics DL/ {Ultimatum} OR {Dominion PADD}

Name: Telle
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Glinn; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Glinn who accompanied Gul Macet aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2367. Confined to his quarters by Macet for attempting to access Federation tactical data.
Text: SECURITY Computer Skill MEDICAL

Name: Temo'Zuma
Lore: Soldier under the command of Goran'Agar. Third. Typical of Jem'Hadar warriors trained to operate shield-penetrating transporter systems.
Text: SECURITY ENGINEER Transporter Skill

Name: Toman'torax
Lore: Jem'Hadar Second. Served under Omet'iklan for three years. In defiance of the First's orders, fought Worf during preparations for the joint Vandros IV mission.
Text: OFFICER Leadership ENGINEER Stellar Cartography May pair first when in personnel battle.

Name: T'Rul
Lore: Romulan female assigned to install, safeguard and operate the cloaking device loaned to Starfleet for use aboard the U.S.S. Defiant.
Text: ENGINEER Physics SECURITY Exobiology Ship she is aboard is RANGE +1 when cloaked.

Name: Virak'kara
Lore: Jem'Hadar soldier. Fourth reporting to Omet'iklan. Eight years old. Amazed at the longer lifespans of other species, especially Trill.
Text: SECURITY Physics Navigation

Name: Weyoun
Lore: Vorta field supervisor. Skilled negotiator. Key figure in the war effort. Reports directly to the Founder Leader. Self-proclaimed expert at telling - and spotting - lies.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Treachery Law Biology

Name: Yak'Talon
Lore: Seventh serving under Remata'Klan. Assigned to repair communication equipment damaged when his Jem'Hadar unit was marooned in 2374.
Text: SECURITY ENGINEER Computer Skill

Name: Yelgren
Lore: Matter-of-fact Vorta. Met a disorganized group of Ferengi aboard Empok Nor. Agreed to release Ishka in exchange for Keevan. Got less than he bargained for.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Anthropology Music DL/ {Prisoner Exchange}

Name: Young Jem'Hadar
Lore: Jem'Hadar youth. Typical juvenile recently emerged from birthing chamber.
Text: CIVILIAN At end of any of your turns, may be exchanged with one of your [Univ] Jem'Hadar in hand. Youth

Name: Zayra
Lore: Bajoran male who operates the Transit Aid Center on Deep Space 9. Stirred xenophobic sentiment against Odo during the Ibudan murder investigation.
Text: CIVILIAN Treachery Archaeology Transporter Skill May play {Hate Crime} as an interrupt where present.

Name: Zyree
Lore: Representative female member of the Dosi, a physically aggressive merchant race aligned with the Dominion. Tulaberry wine expert.
Text: CIVILIAN Biology Greed Archaeology

Name: D'deridex Advanced
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; D'deridex Class; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Upgraded by the Tal Shiar near Orias III. Used in Tal Shiar/Obsidian Order attack of the Dominion 2371.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.C. Rotarran
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Bird-of-prey stationed at Deep Space 9 during the war against the Dominion. Commanded by Martok. Led many raids into Cardassian and Dominion space.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: Jem'Hadar Attack Ship
Characteristics/ Keywords: Dominion ship; Invasive Transporters; Jem'hadar Attack Ship; Jem'Hadar Ship;
Lore: Nimble attack fighter used by the Dominion. Has ion propulsion drive and ventral impellers. Virtual display technology. Polaron beam weapons.
Text: May avoid being targeted by {Establish Tractor Lock}. Invasive Transporters

Name: Jem'Hadar Warship
Characteristics/ Keywords: Dominion ship; Invasive Transporters; Jem'Hadar Ship; Tractor Beam; Warship;
Lore: Mainstay battle cruiser of the Jem'Hadar fleets. Capable of serving as a mobile base for attack ships. Equipped with shield-penetrating transporters.
Text: Invasive Transporters, Tractor Beam

Name: Keldon Advanced
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian ship; Cloaking Device; Keldon Class; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Faster than standard Keldon-class vessels. Secretly upgraded by Obsidian Order. Staged in Orias System.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: Trager
Lore: Commanded by Macet. Dispatched to intercept U.S.S. Phoenix, reportedly attacking Cardassian vessels in violation of the 2366 peace treaty.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Defiant
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: NX-74205. Built to battle Borg. Recommissioned to oppose the Dominion. First ship to test ablative armor and quantum torpedoes. Captained by Benjamin Sisko.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard except shuttlepods)

Name: U.S.S. Odyssey
Lore: NCC-71832. Starship sent into Gamma Quadrant to investigate the Dominion. Victim of Jem'Hadar suicide tactics. Commanded by Keogh.
Text: Attributes all +1 in Gamma Quadrant. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Rio Grande
Lore: First runabout assigned to Deep Space 9. Towed the Prakesh through the Bajoran Wormhole. Commanded by Benjamin Sisko.
Text: DL/ {Activate Tractor Beam}

Name: Sword of Kahless
Lore: Legendary first bat'leth. 1500-year-old blade weapon forged by Kahless the Unforgettable. Used to slay the tyrant Molor. Discovered by Worf, Kor and Jadzia Dax in 2372.
Text: Use as Equipment card. Where present, your Klingons with Honor are attributes all +3; {Kahless} is STRENGTH +7 more and may not be killed in personnel battle. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Chula: The Abyss
Lore: In shap six of chula, players can fall into a deep crevasse. Three Deep Space 9 senior officers fell in, but landed in Quark's bar and learned that it was only part of an elaborate game.
Text: To get past, three personnel present (random selection) must face the abyss. If their total CUNNING is odd, they are "stopped" and, if possible, relocated to {Quark's Bar}.

Name: Chula: The Lights
Lore: Players face several perils throughout the game of chula. In shap four of the game played in Quark's Bar, Julian Bashir was singled out and "eliminated" by a burst of energy.
Text: Crew or Away Team member with total attributes closest to 22 (your choice if tie) returns to hand. To get past requires CUNNING>24 remaining.

Name: Drumhead
Lore: In 2367, suspected sabotage to the warp core of the U.S.S. Enterprise led to an investigation of the crew. Suspicions ran rampant before Jean-Luc Picard put an end to the "witch hunt."
Text: If present, discard one crew member of INTEGRITY<5 ({Norah Satie}'s choice if in play, or random selection); otherwise, to get past requires {Jean-Luc Picard} OR Law. Nullify with {Plexing}.

Name: Ferengi Ingenuity
Lore: Quark's refusal to spend latinum resulted in some creative holosuite repairs. Rom once used a copper-ytterbium composite spatula as a spare part - the perfect plasma conductor.
Text: If one personnel present has 2 Computer Skill, discard dilemma. Otherwise, to get past, place on most CUNNING Computer Skill present ("stopped" during countdown).

Name: Gravimetric Distortion
Lore: Gravimetric fluctuations sometimes accompany interruptions in the normal flow of space and time. Spatial distortion phenomena can cause a wide range of problems.
Text: Ship damaged unless 4 ENGINEER OR 2 Astrophysics OR a personnel who has 2 Navigation OR {Guinan} aboard.

Name: Hazardous Duty
Lore: Jake Sisko was exposed to the horrors of war when caught in the Klingon attack on Ajilon Prime. Not a soldier, he was unprepared for the hazards he faced with the colonists.
Text: To get past requires 2 OFFICER; then place on mission until solved. If any non- OFFICER dies here, its owner loses points (discard dilemma).

Name: New Essentialists
Lore: The New Essentialists Movement asserts that decadence and complacency are eroding the foundations of the Federation. Worf was temporarily swayed by this group while on Risa.
Text: Unless INTEGRITY>40 and 2 Honor OR CUNNING>40 and 2 Treachery present, place one non-Borg Away Team member (random selection) atop draw deck. Nullify with {Jamaharon}.

Name: Stellar Flare
Lore: Stellar flares release tremendous amounts of energy and emit radiation across the entire electromagnetic spectrum. Large flares can cause severe damage throughout a star system.
Text: Damages and "stops" all ships at this location except those that are docked, landed, or carried OR have 2 Navigation and Astrophysics aboard OR have SHIELDS>11. Discard dilemma.

Name: Under Fire
Lore: While on a medical mission to Ajilon Prime in 2373, Julian Bashir found himself in the middle of a live combat situation.
Text: Immediately probe (then place probe card atop draw deck): [Doorway], [Interrupt], DL/ , [Bor]: Kills two personnel (random selection). Otherwise: "Stops" one personnel (random selection).

Name: Battle Bridge Door
Text: Place one atop Battle Bridge side deck during the seed phase. Battle Bridge is now open and in play (immune to cards which close doorways). OR Stock in deck and play at start of ship battle (even during opponent's turn) if you have Leadership in that battle. Allows you to draw two extra Tactic cards (cumulative) or enhances each of your ships' and facilities' WEAPONS +1; then discard doorway.

Name: Holding Cell Door
Text: Seeds (during facility phase) or plays on your ship or facility (except a Nor). Adds a Brig. OR Downloads {Brainwash}, {Interrogation} or {Torture} to a captive in your Brig, if you have Tal Shiar, Obsidian Order, Resistance or Section 31 (or a personnel who has SECURITY and Treachery) present; discard doorway or place atop draw deck. OR Nullifies any card closing another Holding Cell Door; discard doorway.

Name: Bat'leth
Characteristics/ Keywords: blade weapon; hand weapon; Klingon-related Equipment;
Lore: Traditional blade weapon of the Klingon warrior. According to legend, the first bat'leth, or "sword of honor," was forged by Kahless the Unforgettable some fifteen centuries ago.
Text: Each of your Klingons present is STRENGTH +2, and in each battle one of them may mortally wound one adversary they just stunned. (Cumulative.)

Name: D'k Tahg
Characteristics/ Keywords: blade weapon; hand weapon; Klingon-related Equipment;
Lore: Fearsome, three-bladed weapon. Ubiquitous in Klingon society. Favored knife of the warrior. Has ceremonial, combat and culinary applications. Easily concealed.
Text: Klingon use only. Reports for free. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +1. (Cumulative.) May report to a just-initiated personnel battle involving your [Kli] card(s).

Name: Kar'takin
Lore: Blade weapon used by the Jem'Hadar and Dominion allies. Similar to the Klingon bat'leth in function and effectiveness.
Text: Each of your Jem'Hadar, Breen and Dosi present is STRENGTH +2, and in each battle one of them may mortally wound one adversary they just stunned. (Cumulative.)

Name: Klingon Disruptor Rifle
Lore: Standard phase disruptor fitted with attachable shoulder stock. Rifle components include extended-charge capacitance cell, high-energy augmented accelerator and requisite induction coil.
Text: Klingon and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

Name: Mek'leth
Characteristics/ Keywords: blade weapon; hand weapon; Klingon-related Equipment;
Lore: Blade weapon favored by many Klingons for close-combat situations. Typically made of baakonite. The mek'leth's size and perfect balance make it an excellent offensive weapon.
Text: May report wherever you have a Klingon present. Each of your Klingons present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Romulan Disruptor Rifle
Lore: Enhanced energy rifle used throughout the Romulan Star Empire. Generates an elevated level of residual anti-protons which are detectable for several hours after firing.
Text: Romulan and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

Name: Starfleet Type I Phaser
Lore: Least powerful of the standard hand-held Federation defensive weapons. Low profile favored by Starfleet captains. Smaller in size than the type II phaser, and easily concealed.
Text: Federation use only. Reports for free. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +1. (Cumulative.) May report to a just-initiated personnel battle involving your [Fed] card(s).

Name: Defense System Upgrade
Lore: Wartime upgrades to Deep Space 9's defensive systems in 2372 included enhanced shield emitters, rotary phasers, microtorpedo launchers and 5,000 new torpedoes.
Text: Plays on your space facility. WEAPONS=6 (or WEAPONS +4) and SHIELDS +6. (Cumulative.) OR Fully repairs a damaged facility if your compatible ENGINEER aboard; discard event.

Name: Dial Martok for Murder
Lore: While infiltrating the Klingon Empire, a changeling posing as Martok killed two guards in an isolated corridor. They never expected such treachery from an honorable warrior.
Text: Plays to allow your infiltrator to initiate battle, with +4 STRENGTH, against up to two opposing personnel present (your choice). Infiltrator is not exposed. Discard event.

Name: E-Band Emissions
Lore: Taibak and Kell used E-band emissions transmitted to Geordi La Forge's VISOR to influence the engineer's actions. La Forge was being programmed to assassinate Governor Vagh.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. May not be nullified if {Kell}, {Taibak} or {Entek} in play. {Brainwash} is immune to {Kevin Uxbridge} and gives captive infiltration icons for its own affiliation(s).

Name: Engage Shuttle Operations: Dominion
Requires: Battleship; Jem'Hadar Attack Ship; Shuttlecraft; Tractor Beam; Warship;
Lore: Jem'Hadar warships are designed as mobile bases for attack ships, allowing the Dominion to quickly mobilize and maintain a massive strike fleet.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Your shuttlecraft and Jem'Hadar attack ships may be loaded aboard and launched from your Dominion warships and battleships with Tractor Beam.

Name: Fajo's Gallery
Lore: Kidnapped by Kivas Fajo, Data became part of an impressive collection of rare and one-of-a-kind items. Fajo had no problem with the morality of Data's imprisonment.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. You may draw two cards each time you capture a unique personnel, and one card each time one of your [Fajo] cards or your {Mona Lisa} enters play.

Name: The Big Picture
Lore: Jean-Luc Picard had to convince Lily Sloane that she was on a starship orbiting Earth. To defeat the Borg, Captain Picard's crew had to succeed on the ship as well as on the planet.
Text: Plays on table. Each player who has not solved (or scouted) at least two missions with point boxes (one [S] and one [P]) needs an additional 40 points to win. (May not be nullified.)

Name: Torture
Lore: Jean-Luc Picard was captured by Cardassians in 2369. He was subjected to intense physiological and psychological torture in an effort to obtain strategic Federation information.
Text: Plays on your captive (discard if released). When countdown expires, captive dies, then owner loses points (loses 3 more if you control [Non] {Madred}).

Name: Access Denied
Text: Seeds or plays on table. While in play, nullifies all {Establish Gateway} objectives targeting your missions. You may suspend play while you discard incident to download {Fractal Encryption Code}.

Name: Blood Oath
Text: Plays on a non-Borg personnel who has INTEGRITY<8 and no Honor. Adds <R) icon beginning at start of your next turn. OR Plays on table. While you have two (R> personnel present together, all <R) personnel lose their first-listed skill and, in place of your normal card draw, you may download to that location {I.K.C. Ning'tao}, {I.K.C. Lukara}, {I.K.C. Gr'oth}, {Bat'leth}, {Blood Oath} or one (R> personnel.

Name: Captured
Text: Seeds or plays on table. During your turn, your non-[Bor] crew or Away Team may capture one opposing personnel present (random selection) if you have more SECURITY present than opponent, or more hand weapons present than opponent. OR During any player's turn, you may capture one personnel just stunned in battle by your non-[Bor] SECURITY. Discard incident after either use.

Name: Intruder Alert!
Text: Seeds or plays on table; nullifies all seeded {Memory Wipe} cards. At any time, you may capture a one- or two-person Away Team in your {Ops} or assimilate one personnel intruder on your Borg ship or facility if your {Talon Drone} is present (discard incident) OR download {Intruder Force Field} (place incident atop event to protect it from nullification and extend its effects to all intruders on your ships).

Name: Long Live the Queen
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Reveal (then discard) incident to do one of the following: If your {Borg Queen} was just killed, download another Borg Queen. OR Prevent your Borg Queen present with your [Def] drone from being captured (drone is captured instead). OR Suspend any {Regenerate} while you place out-of-play from targeted discard pile up to six cards without a [BO] or [Bor] icon.

Name: Prisoner Exchange
Text: Seeds or plays on table. During your turn, you may release a personnel you hold captive (relocate to owner's ship or facility at same location). Release any or all of your own personnel held captive at that location (relocate them to your ship or facility there), or instead download any one personnel there; then discard incident.

Name: Scanner Interference
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Nullifies each {Scan} and {Full Planet Scan} unless owner has 2 Computer Skill aboard a staffed ship at targeted mission. Just after opponent scans mission (after seed cards are replaced) you may discard incident to seed one card there from hand, discard pile or {Q's Tent}. At any time you may discard incident to download {Atmospheric Ionization}, {Distortion Field} and/or {Particle Scattering Field}.

Name: Sniper
Text: Seeds or plays on table. At start of each battle you initiate on a planet, if you have a {phaser} or {disruptor} present, target one personnel present. (Cumulative.) Immediately probe (then place probe card beneath draw deck): [Stf], [KW], [Equipment], [Maq]: Hit. Target(s) mortally wounded. [Objective], [Interrupt], [Doorway], [AU]: Glancing blow. Target(s) stunned. [Fed], [Fer], [Bor], [Cmd]: Sniper spotted. Discard incident.

Name: Ultimatum
Text: Seeds or plays on table; you may download {Bajoran Wormhole}. Once per game, you may download {Remote Supply Depot} and up to two Equipment cards to a {[DOM] Alpha Quadrant mission} where your [Dom] ENGINEER present. Also, you may discard incident to place in your point area one ship just destroyed by your {[Dom] ship}; score points equal to highest attribute printed on that ship card.

Name: Attack Pattern Delta
Lore: Upon encountering Dominion ships during a rescue attempt in 2370, Captain Keogh ordered the U.S.S. Odyssey and two runabouts to execute a predetermined attack pattern.
Text: Plays at start of ship battle. Doubles one {Tactical Console} until end of battle OR draw up to X additional Tactic cards, where X = the number of your ships in this battle.

Name: Counterintelligence
Lore: The Founder posing as Julian Bashir used his position as chief medical officer to gain valuable information for the Dominion, while secretly undermining the efforts of his enemies.
Text: Plays on your infiltrator. Until end of turn, subtract (rather than add) infiltrator's classification, skills and attributes from infiltrated crew's or Away Team's totals.

Name: Inside Operation
Lore: The changeling impersonating Lovok compromised the mission to destroy the Founders' homeworld. His participation in the battle plans led the attacking fleet into a Jem'Hadar ambush.
Text: Plays at start of ship battle. Each opposing ship and facility in the battle is WEAPONS and SHIELDS -3 if your personnel is infiltrating one of them. Infiltrator exposed.

Name: Outgunned
Lore: On a mission inside Dominion space, the U.S.S. Defiant was surrounded by Jem'Hadar vessels. In the face of superior firepower, Benjamin Sisko elected to surrender.
Text: Plays at start of battle against opponent's only ship here. If undocked and your total WEAPONS involved > its SHIELDS x3: battle cancelled; ship commandeered and crew captured.

Name: Phaser Array Power Cell
Lore: In times of war, it is not unusual for a crew to adopt rituals recognizing its accomplishments in battle. In 2374, the crew of the U.S.S. Defiant ceremonially displayed used phaser cells.
Text: Once per turn, plays to score points if your ship survived a battle in which it and an opponent's card both fired WEAPONS.

Name: Prisoner Escort
Lore: Captured by a Hunter, Tosk was led through the corridors of Deep Space 9 to show that he had been apprehended - the ultimate humiliation for a Tosk.
Text: Plays on a personnel you just captured. If you place captive in your Brig, its owner loses points (once per persona per game).

Name: The Guardian
Lore: The allasomorph Anya could appear in many forms. In 2365, while escorting Salia aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise, Anya took the form of a monstrous guardian to protect her charge.
Text: Suspends play while you place interrupt on your shape-shifter. It morphs (STRENGTH +6; exposed if infiltrating). Discard interrupt if shape-shifter morphs again.

Name: The Wake of the Borg
Lore: The New Providence colony on Jouret IV was scooped up by the Borg in 2366, just as Federation and Romulan outposts along the Neutral Zone had been destroyed in 2364.
Text: Plays on opponent's Neutral Zone Region mission if they seeded 4 or more. End of opponent's next turn, all non-[Bor] ships, facilities, and personnel there are returned to hand.

Name: Victory Is Life
Lore: I am First Omet'iklan. And I am dead. As of this moment we are all dead. We go into battle to win back our lives. This we do gladly, because we are Jem'Hadar. Remember... victory is life.
Text: Once per turn, downloads an Equipment card to a Jem'Hadar who just helped solve a mission or win a personnel battle against opponent's cards.

Name: A Good Day To Live
Lore: Seek revenge on notorious criminal who used a genetic virus to murder Klingon children.
Text: ({Kor} OR {Kang} OR {Koloth}) + STRENGTH>40 * +5 for each (R> personnel in Away Team.

Name: Bat'leth Tournament
Lore: Participate in bat'leth competition held at this Klingon settlement.
Text: Honor + {any bat'leth} *+10 if bat'leth is {Sword of Kahless}.

Name: Chart Stellar Cluster
Lore: Perform long-distance overview survey of this region of the Gamma Quadrant.
Text: SCIENCE x2 + Computer Skill x2 + Stellar Cartography x2

Name: Commandeer Ship
Text: Plays on your unstopped Computer Skill personnel who is unopposed aboard opponent's ship (except any [Bor] Cube). That personnel commandeers ship and, while objective in play, may meet up to three of its staffing icons. OR Seeds or plays on table. Opponent may not return to hand any ship which has your personnel aboard as an intruder or infiltrator.

Name: Examine Singularity
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your ship with SCIENCE, Astrophysics and CUNNING>30 in crew may close {Black Hole} where present. Relocate all ships there to one other location in any quadrant, place Black Hole out-of-play and score points (discard objective). Also, once each turn, you may download (even from discard pile) {Bajoran Wormhole}, {Temporal Wake} or {Deactivation}.

Name: Impersonate Captive
Characteristics/ Keywords: Capturing-related card; Infiltration-related card; Infiltrator; Morph card;
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Place on your Founder present with a non-Borg personnel you've captured. Founder morphs to impersonate captive. Founder's classification, skills, staffing icon, infiltration icon, STRENGTH and CUNNING change to those of captive. Founder has 1 Treachery, loses all Honor and gains infiltration icon(s) for captive's affiliation(s). May morph back at any time (discard objective).

Name: Prepare the Prisoner
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Captives you {Brainwash} are not required to relocate to an outpost. Opponent's {Rescue Captives} card affects only captives at one location where opponent has a crew or Away Team (rescued personnel relocate to that crew or Away Team). Each turn, you may draw one card by placing one capturing-related card from your hand beneath your draw deck or discard pile.

Name: Admiral Ross
Lore: Starfleet veteran. Performed the wedding of Benjamin Sisko and Kassidy Yates. Reluctantly involved in Section 31 plot to discredit Senator Cretak.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy Anthropology Honor OR Section 31 (choose at start of each turn).

Name: Ambassador Tomalak
Lore: Romulan Ambassador in Barash's illusion. Key figure in securing a treaty with the Federation. Commander of the Decius.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Exobiology Computer Skill DL/ {Treaty: Federation/Romulan}

Name: Boone Impersonator
Lore: Cardassian surgically altered to resemble retired Starfleet officer Raymond Boone. Spied on the Federation. Attempted to frame Miles O'Brien.
Text: ENGINEER Treachery Computer Skill Physics DL/ {Counterintelligence}

Name: Chief O'Brien
Lore: Holographic re-creation of U.S.S. Enterprise transporter chief. Used to aid mental reprogramming. Taibak forced Geordi La Forge to "kill" the chief repeatedly.
Text: ENGINEER SECURITY Transporter Skill Navigation Music Once each turn, may download {Brainwash} here.

Name: Dolak
Lore: Officer in the Cardassian militia, unit 41. First Gul to command the Kraxon. Tactical commander of task force sent to kill the Bajoran terrorist Orta.
Text: OFFICER Treachery Navigation Exobiology Your [Car] ships at same location are each WEAPONS +2.

Name: Donald Varley
Lore: Captain of U.S.S. Yamato. Retrieved stellar "Rosetta Stone" artifact from Denius III. Searched for - and unfortunately found - the mythical planet of Iconia.
Text: OFFICER Archaeology Stellar Cartography Computer Skill {Iconia Investigation} and {Reopen Dig} have [FED].

Name: Dr. Koramar
Lore: Brilliant Romulan astro-archaeologist. Member of the Romulan underground. Works closely with Spock for reunification of the Vulcan and Romulan peoples.
Text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Archaeology Honor Stellar Cartography

Name: Duran'Adar
Lore: Sixth. Typical Jem'Hadar alpha. Served under Kudak'Etan. Assisted with repairs to U.S.S. Defiant captured by his away team in 2374.
Text: SECURITY ENGINEER Geology Physics

Name: D'Vin
Lore: Typical graduate of Romulan Astrophysical Academy. Research assistant to Dr. Telek R'Mor during the doctor's last year at the academy.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Navigation Youth

Name: Elim
Lore: Elim Garak forced himself to interrogate Odo in an attempt to regain favor with his father, Enabran Tain.
Text: SECURITY Treachery x 2 Computer Skill x 2 Obsidian Order Random selections here involving only opponent's personnel are instead your choice. DL/ {Interrogation}

Name: Enrique Muniz
Lore: Highly valued assistant to Chief O'Brien. Called "Quique" by his friends. Joked that he wants to grow up to be O'Brien - just not as old and grizzled.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Honor Navigation Geology

Name: Furel
Lore: Strong believer in the Prophets. While with Shakaar resistance cell, lost his left arm saving Kira Nerys from Cardassians. Refuses synthetic replacement.
Text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Biology Geology Resistance DL/ {Sniper}

Name: Gelnon
Lore: Vorta who ordered an attack on the U.S.S. Defiant in 2374. Skeptical of using Kudak'Etan and other Jem'Hadar alphas. His suspicions were justified.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy MEDICAL Stellar Cartography Treachery DL/ {VR Headset} OR {Ketracel-White}

Name: Gul Madred
Lore: Ruthless Obsidian Order officer. Madred's torture of Jean-Luc Picard quickly degenerated into a desperate attempt to break Picard's will. A pitiable man.
Text: OFFICER Obsidian Order SECURITY Treachery Archaeology DL/ {Torture}

Name: Hon'Tihl
Lore: First officer and sole survivor of the I.K.C. Toh'Kaht. Briefly succeeded captain Kee'Bhor. Suffering from the influence of Saltah'na energy spheres.
Text: OFFICER SCIENCE Geology Treachery

Name: Ilon Tandro
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klaestron; Capturing-related card; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
Lore: Klaestron dignitary. Son of Enina and General Ardelon Tandro. In 2369, used Cardassian technology to gain access to Deep Space 9 in order to kidnap Jadzia Dax.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy ENGINEER Treachery Once per game, may capture one personnel present.

Name: Ixtana'Rax
Lore: Jem'Hadar Honored Elder. Became Second under Kudak'Etan when the alpha was promoted above him. Unsure about the new order of things.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Stellar Cartography Other [GQ] Jem'Hadar present are attributes all +1.

Name: Jadzia Dax (Blaze of Glory)
Lore: Trill. Disregarded her commitments to both Starfleet and Trill custom in order to honor a Klingon blood oath sworn by her symbiont's previous host, Curzon Dax.
Text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Diplomacy Anthropology Honor Other (R> personnel present are attributes all +2.

Name: Kang
Lore: Faced Kirk at Beta XII-A. Swore blood oath against the Albino with Kor, Koloth, and Curzon Dax to avenge the death of his firstborn son.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Honor SECURITY Physics DL/ {Blood Oath}

Name: Kavok
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Commanded U.S.S. Enterprise after hijacking it from Starbase 74. Intended to start a war with the Federation and die in glorious battle. Once captained I.K.C. Buruk.
Text: OFFICER Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Commandeer Ship} Physics May report directly to any empty [Fed] ship.

Name: Koloth
Lore: Called d'akturak, "ice man", by Curzon Dax due to his negotiating prowess. Commanded the I.K.C. Gr'oth during the Sherman's Planet sabotage mission in 2267.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Exobiology Honor Klingon Intelligence DL/ {Bat'leth}

Name: Kor
Lore: Dahar master. Legendary warrior. Former ambassador to Vulcan. Victorious at Klach D'Kel Brakt. Swore blood oath against the Albino. Sought the Sword of Kahless.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Anthropology Honor Music Other Klingons present are each STRENGTH +2.

Name: Kudak'Etan
Lore: Arrogant First under Gelnon. Commanded the captured U.S.S. Defiant in 2374. One of the first Jem'Hadar bred in the Alpha Quadrant. Ignored his Second's advice.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Anthropology ENGINEER DL/ {Commandeer Ship} OR {Victory Is Life}

Name: La Forge Impersonator
Lore: Surgically altered Romulan. In 2367, posed as Geordi La Forge so Taibak could brainwash the real La Forge without raising suspicions.
Text: ENGINEER Navigation Computer Skill Treachery May report wherever {Taibak} is present, for free.

Name: Lamat'Ukan
Lore: Jem'Hadar Third. Alpha. Realigned targeting sensors on U.S.S. Defiant captured by Dominion forces in 2374. His initiative pleased First Kudak'Etan.
Text: SECURITY Leadership Computer Skill x 2 Transporter Skill While on your ship, it is WEAPONS +2.

Name: Lupaza
Lore: Friend of Kira Nerys. Romantically involved with Furel. Member of Shakaar resistance cell. Fought provisional government over soil reclamators.
Text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Resistance Smuggling Computer Skill

Name: Miles O'Brien (Blaze of Glory)
Lore: Chief of operations on Deep Space 9. Friend of Julian. Father of Molly and Kirayoshi. Husband of Keiko. Likes kayaking, darts and historical battle simulations.
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill Honor Transporter Skill DL/ {Defense System Upgrade}

Name: Mopak
Lore: Representative of Romulan security personnel. Specializes in biohazard detection. In 2372, helped search the Romulan fleet for Dominion infiltration.
Text: SECURITY Biology

Name: Navok
Lore: Representative of security personnel in the Romulan Star Empire. His detachment accompanied Senator Vreenak to Deep Space 9 in 2374.
Text: SECURITY Navigation Computer Skill Attributes all +2 if with your Romulan V.I.P.

Name: N'Garen
Lore: Typical of young Klingons serving the Empire. Daughter of Tse'Dek. Assigned to tactical/weapons station on I.K.C. Rotarran by General Martok.
Text: SECURITY Astrophysics SCIENCE Youth

Name: Odo Founder
Lore: Changeling who confused the crew of the U.S.S. Defiant by posing as Odo.
Text: SECURITY SECURITY Computer Skill Law Treachery Not exposed by {Blood Screening} or if he morphs.

Name: Oken'alak
Lore: Fifth under Ikat'ika. Guard at Internment Camp 371. Representative of Jem'Hadar assigned to guard and escort Dominion prisoners.
Text: SECURITY Exobiology Computer Skill DL/ {Prisoner Escort}

Name: Parthok
Lore: Technical advisor to Senator Vreenak. Trained by Tal Shiar. In 2374, counseled the senator during his mission to Deep Space 9.
Text: ENGINEER MEDICAL Leadership Tal Shiar Computer Skill

Name: Quark Son of Keldar
Lore: Quark wedded Grilka by brek'tal ritual to head the House of Kozak (as the House of Quark) on Qo'noS. The Ferengi saved his be'nal from financial ruin.
Text: CIVILIAN Leadership Computer Skill x 2 Honor Greed Attributes all +3 if with {Grilka}.

Name: Riker Wil
Lore: In 2370, the human William T. Riker accompanied Ro Laren on a clandestine mission to investigate the Maquis. He posed as a Bajoran freedom fighter.
Text: SECURITY Navigation Treachery Diplomacy Music While at your [FED] mission, adds [BAJ].

Name: R'Mal
Lore: Typical Romulan scientist. Led team of archaeologists on an unsuccessful mission to locate an Iconian gateway in Romulan territory.
Text: SCIENCE Archaeology

Name: Ro Laren (Blaze of Glory)
Lore: Former Starfleet officer. Defected to the Maquis in 2370. Used a low-intensity particle beam to expose a Federation attack force hiding in a nebula.
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Navigation Astrophysics Your other [Maq] personnel here are each CUNNING +2.

Name: Sarita Carson
Lore: Ensign Carson is one of the many talented navigators serving Starfleet. Former member of Nova Squadron. Assigned to bridge duty aboard U.S.S. Defiant.
Text: SECURITY Navigation SCIENCE

Name: Senator Letant
Lore: Romulan military strategist. He studied, and grudgingly approved, Benjamin Sisko's plan for an attack on the Dominion shipyards at Chin'toka.
Text: V.I.P. SECURITY Stellar Cartography Computer Skill x 2 DL/ {Attack Pattern Delta}

Name: Tamarith
Lore: Female nurse. Member of Romulan underground. Supported Ambassador Spock's efforts to reunify Romulus and Vulcan.
Text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Biology Honor Music X=2 if with another Romulan underground member.

Name: Tharket
Lore: Associate of Taibak. Provided security services during the mental reprogramming of Geordi La Forge.
Text: SECURITY MEDICAL Treachery DL/ {Prisoner Escort} Once per game, may nullify {Rescue Captives} here.

Name: The Albino
Lore: Infamous humanoid criminal. Mercenary captain of a spacefaring group of bandits. Engineered a genetic virus that killed firstborn sons of Kor, Kang and Koloth.
Text: CIVILIAN Greed Treachery Leadership MEDICAL Exobiology x 2

Name: Umat'Adan
Lore: Fifth. Jem'Hadar alpha assigned to Kudak'Etan. Well versed in the Alpha Quadrant anomaly. Once guarded prisoners repairing the commandeered U.S.S. Defiant.
Text: SECURITY SCIENCE Navigation Stellar Cartography DL/ {Wormhole Navigation Schematic} (once per turn).

Name: Voktak
Lore: Typical front-line Klingon officer. Engaged Federation forces on Ajilon Prime. Once commanded the I.K.C. K'Ratak while its captain recovered from war injuries.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Stellar Cartography Treachery

Name: Wo'Din
Lore: Typical Klingon inspired by tales of glorious battle against the Dominion. Learned diplomatic skills from his father, a former Klingon negotiator.
Text: SCIENCE Diplomacy Stellar Cartography

Name: Worf Son of Mogh
Lore: Worf resigned his Starfleet commission to join Gowron during the 2367-68 Klingon Civil War. Saved the I.K.C. Bortas from destruction by Duras forces.
Text: SECURITY SECURITY Leadership Honor x 2 DL/ {Qapla'!} If with {Gowron} on {I.K.C. Bortas}, it is all attributes +3.

Name: Zetal
Lore: Typical skilled Klingon serving in the fleet during the war with Cardassia. Her ship took part in a raid which destroyed an outpost on Korma in 2372.
Text: SCIENCE Biology

Name: Alpha Attack Ship
Characteristics/ Keywords: Dominion ship; Invasive Transporters; Jem'hadar Attack Ship; Jem'Hadar Ship;
Lore: Jem'Hadar attack ship produced at Chin'toka shipyard in Alpha Quadrant. Constructed after enemy forces restricted Dominion access to the Bajoran Wormhole.
Text: May avoid being targeted by {Establish Tractor Lock}. Invasive Transporters

Name: Goraxus
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Warbird commanded by Sela. Used to intercept Geordi La Forge's shuttle en route to Risa in 2367, and to mentally reprogram the engineer.
Text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam DL/ {Romulan Ambush}

Name: I.K.C. Koraga
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Klingon Bird-of-Prey briefly commanded by Worf Son of Mogh in 2375. Along with the I.K.C. Rotarran, engaged a Dominion patrol near the Badlands.
Text: If your {I.K.C. Rotarran} in play, both are RANGE +1. Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.C. Lukara
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Bird-of-Prey commanded by Kang. Transported its commander and his comrades to Secarus IV in 2370, to confront the Albino in his stronghold.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.S. Negh'Var
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Flagship of the Klingon Defense Force. Commanded by Gowron when first commissioned, and then by Martok during the 2372 invasion of Cardassia.
Text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: Keldon
Lore: Cardassian warship. More powerful than Galor-class spacecraft. Design commissioned by the Central Command after war with Federation in 2366.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Kraxon
Lore: Cardassian warship sent to intercept the U.S.S. Defiant and the renegade Thomas Riker in 2371.
Text: WEAPONS +3 and SHIELDS +2 vs. Defiant-class ships. Tractor Beam

Name: Locutus' Borg Cube
Lore: Identification: BORG CUBE Task: Eliminate resistance at location designation Wolf 359. Locutus of Borg commands.
Text: WEAPONS and SHIELDS +3 at {Wolf 359}. Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard. Tractor Beam

Name: Romulan Shuttle
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; No staffing requirement; Romulan ship;
Lore: Romulan shuttlecraft. Favored by the Tal Shiar. Senator Vreenak commanded one on his diplomatic mission to Deep Space 9.
Text: Cloaking Device

Name: U.S.S. Thunderchild
Lore: NCC-63549. Helped lead Starfleet forces against invading Borg cube in 2373. Briefly commanded by Fleet Admiral Shanthi during its shakedown cruise.
Text: SHIELDS +4 vs. Borg ships and {Borg Ship} dilemma. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: Security Holding Cell
Text: Has a Brig. Once each turn, player who controls station may download {Brainwash}, {Interrogation} or {Torture} to a captive held in this Brig if that player has a Tal Shiar, Obsidian Order, Resistance or Section 31 personnel (or a personnel who has SECURITY and Treachery) unopposed here. Any Nor: Promenade

Name: Attack Wing
Text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +1 for each of your ships firing. DEFENSE bonus +1 if you have a Jem'Hadar attack ship defending. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -25% Sickbay damaged: randomly kills one MEDICAL, Exobiology or disabled personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Infirmary}).

Name: Borg Cutting Beam
Text: Attack: 1. Defense: 3. If you hit, you may relocate one of target's crew members (random selection; from any one site if on a Nor) to one of your ships in this battle and assimilate that personnel. Hit or direct hit = [Down]. Hull: -40%

Name: Crimson Forcefield
Text: Attack: 0. Defense: 2. Harmless pyrotechnic ruse nullifies opponent's Tactic card unless opponent has an OFFICER with CUNNING>8 aboard a ship or facility in this battle. Hit = [Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip]. Hull: -40% Cloaking Device off line.

Name: Evasive Maneuvers
Text: Attack: -2. Defense: 4. DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a ship with no staffing requirements defending. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -35% Plasma leak: randomly kills one ENGINEER, Astrophysics or Physics personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Ore Processing Unit}).

Name: Full Phaser Spread
Text: Attack: 3. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Galaxy-class ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Science panel destroyed: randomly kills one SCIENCE or Stellar Cartography personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Science Lab}).

Name: Maximum Firepower
Text: Attack: 6. Defense: -3. Hit = [Flip][Flip] (or [Flip][Flip][Flip] if you have {Future Enterprise}, {I.K.C. Chang}, {I.K.C. Fek'lhr}, {Decius}, or any [AU] ship with the word "future" in its lore firing). Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% Transporters off line.

Name: Phased Polaron Beam
Text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Dominion ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

Name: Phaser Banks
Text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Federation ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

Name: Photon Torpedo
Text: Attack: 2. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have an Akira-class ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -35% Tactical panel overload: randomly kills one SECURITY or Computer Skill personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Security Office}).

Name: Picard Maneuver
Text: Attack: 3. Defense: 0. If you initiated ship battle with your matching commander aboard your ship, it appears to be in two places at once and has a 50/50 chance to avoid all damage this battle. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% EPS taps overloaded: Opponent may immediately download to this ship one {Plasma Fire} or {Warp Core Breach} (if possible).

Name: Plasma Torpedo
Text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Romulan ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

Name: Primary Energy Weapon
Text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Borg ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

Name: Pulse Disruptor
Text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Klingon ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

Name: Pulse Phaser Cannons
Text: Attack: 4. Defense: 1. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Defiant-class ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% Tractor beam off line.

Name: Quantum Torpedo
Text: Attack: 5. Defense: 0. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Sovereign-class ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -15% Sensors off line: crew cannot attempt space missions.

Name: Spiral-Wave Disruptor
Text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Cardassian ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

Name: Strafing Run
Text: Attack: 4. Defense: -1. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Hideki-class ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% Bridge damaged: randomly kills one OFFICER, Leadership or Navigation personnel (on a Nor, one personnel in {Ops}).

Name: Target Engines
Text: Attack: 2. Defense: 1. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Dominion ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -25% RANGE enhancements off line.

Name: Target Shields
Text: Attack: 2. Defense: 2. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Otherwise, drains target's SHIELDS ([Down]). SHIELDS enhancements off line.

Name: Target These Coordinates
Text: Attack: 3. Defense: 1. Hit = [Down][Flip] (or [Down][Flip][Flip] if target is affected by {Weak Spot}). Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% Shields fluctuating: opponent's transporters, if operated by Transporter Skill personnel, may beam through SHIELDS.

Name: Target Weapons
Text: Attack: 2. Defense: 1. ATTACK bonus +1 if you have a Dominion ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -25% WEAPONS enhancements off line.

Name: Orb of Wisdom
Lore: Acquired by Zek from one of his contacts on Cardassia III. The Grand Nagus used the Orb to contact the Prophets, then sold it to the Bajoran government at a substantial profit.
Text: Use as Equipment card. Your personnel here are each INTEGRITY +3. Each turn, one of your cards played here plays for free if your [Orb] personnel present. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Phased Cloaking Device
Lore: Phasing cloak prototype created in violation of the Treaty of Algeron, which forbids the Federation from developing cloaking technology. Salvaged from the U.S.S. Pegasus.
Text: May seed under {Pegasus Search}. Use as an Equipment card. While aboard your ship, that ship has a Phasing Cloak (RANGE +4 while phased).

Name: Starry Night
Lore: Famous painting by Dutch impressionist Vincent van Gogh. Painted at Saint-R my in 1889. Dubiously owned by Kivas Fajo 477 years later. A highly prized commodity.
Text: If earned at same location as {Quark's Bar}, a Trading Post or a homeworld, immediately download here (earn) up to two "use as Equipment card" artifacts. Discard Starry Night.

Name: Center of Attention
Lore: After Morn faked his own death, Quark "inherited" the Lurian's stolen latinum fortune. Naturally, this made him quite a hit with Morn's former partners in crime.
Text: Unless 4 SECURITY OR hand weapon and CUNNING>36 OR {any Quark} present, kills one personnel present (opponent's choice) who has Treachery or Greed. Discard dilemma.

Name: Chula: Crossroads
Lore: Caught in a game of chula, Deep Space 9 senior officers divided up to explore different paths. Some paths were dead ends, while others lead to the next shap.
Text: Immediately probe (then draw probe card): [Ref], [Bar], [GQ], [Fer]: "Stops" two personnel (your choice). Otherwise, "Stops" one personnel (opponent's choice).

Name: Chula: The Door
Lore: In the Wadi game of chula, participants are confronted with a virtual labyrinth of doorways. A few seem to permit passage arbitrarily, but most remain closed.
Text: To get past, two personnel must each contribute any one of their attributes to equal a total of 5 or 21. Nullify by placing any doorway out-of-play from hand.

Name: Dangerous Liaisons
Lore: Quark agreed to provide mercenaries for Rao Vantika's attempted theft of a deuridium shipment. Failure to complete his contract would have been a fatal mistake.
Text: To get past requires 3 Treachery and Acquisition OR 2 SCIENCE and 2 SECURITY OR {Ty Kajada}. Nullify by discarding {Recruit Mercenaries} from hand.

Name: Ferengi Bug
Lore: Quark attempted to use a Ferengi eavesdropping device to gather information on Shakaar Edon in 2372. He wanted to sell high-level Bajoran political information.
Text: Unless 3 SECURITY (or {Odo}) and {any tricorder} OR 2 FCA present, place atop mission. While in play, your hand is exposed, face up on table.

Name: In the Pale Moonlight
Lore: In a desperate attempt to spark Romulan participation in the defense of the Alpha Quadrant, Benjamin Sisko enlisted Elim Garak's effective, but questionable, methods.
Text: To get past requires a personnel who has INTEGRITY<4 OR a [Fed] Treachery personnel OR any Garak OR a Founder.

Name: Orion Syndicate Bomb
Lore: Typical explosion device. One was hidden in a floor panel of a runabout carrying Quark to testify before a Federation Grand Jury. Odo's attempt to beam it out accelerated its destruction.
Text: Damages ship unless Transporter Skill OR any Orion Syndicate personnel present. Discard dilemma.

Name: Scientific Method
Lore: Beverly Crusher scanned Jo'Bril's body for tetryon traces during her 2369 "murder" investigation. Her scientific approach eventually revealed that Jo'bril had faked his own death.
Text: To get past requires MEDICAL and 3 SCIENCE.

Name: Strange Bedfellows
Lore: Dukat's disguise as a Bajoran farmer and seer named Anjohl allowed him to forge an alliance with Winn Adami that was both dangerous and disgusting.
Text: If a male and female present, lowest INTEGRITY male and lowest INTEGRITY female are "stopped" (discarded if their INTEGRITY numbers are the same).

Name: Breen CRM114
Lore: Powerful disruptor often brokered by Hagath. Guaranteed to cut through reactive armor up to 15 centimeters and shields up to 4.6 gigajoules. Quick recharge. Expensive, but well worth it.
Text: Reports to your Breen or arms dealer. At start of battle, kills up to 5 {Rogue Borg} present. Once each turn, this Away Team may attack a landed ship or facility on same planet (damaged=[Flip]).

Name: Ferengi Disruptor
Lore: Standard-issue hand weapon used by military personnel in the Ferengi Alliance. Provides accuracy and energy output comparable to those of the Starfleet hand phaser.
Text: Ferengi and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Ferengi Disruptor Rifle
Lore: Powerful energy weapon. Essential protection for particularly dangerous or unusual missions - such as when rescuing one's Moogie from the Dominion.
Text: Ferengi and Non-Aligned use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

Name: Ferengi PADD
Lore: Standard Ferengi Personal Access Display Device for computerized information.
Text: Ferengi use only. Each of your personnel present is CUNNING +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Gold-Pressed Latinum
Lore: Valuable liquid latinum encased in relatively worthless gold dust. Standard of exchange throughout the Ferengi Alliance. Typically traded in bars, strips and slips; 1 bar = 20 strips = 2,000 slips.
Text: Once each turn, on {a Trading Post}, homeworld or {Quark's Bar}, you may discard two Latinum (one if your Acquisition present) to download a non-Latinum Equipment card there.

Name: Kukalaka
Lore: Beloved childhood companion (and first surgical patient) of Julian Bashir. Loaned to, and especially treasured by, Leeta. A timeless symbol of innocence and security.
Text: Your non-Borg personnel present are each INTEGRITY +2, or +3 if {Leeta} present. Also, each player is limited to one {Brain Drain} OR one {Going To The Top} every turn. (Unique.)

Name: Scepter of the Grand Nagus
Lore: Traditional cane of the Grand Nagus of the Ferengi Alliance. Symbol of his power and authority. The gnarled hardwood shaft is crowned by a nagus head made of gold-pressed latinum.
Text: Your Nagus present may allow one [Rule] card to play for free each turn, prevent opponent from nullifying [Rule] cards here and stun one adversary he just engaged in battle. (Unique.)

Name: Small Cloaking Device
Lore: Device obtained by Quark. Illegal under Bajoran law. Quark gave it to Natima Lang so she could elude Cardassian authorities, but warned her it would only work for a short time.
Text: Reports for free if your Smuggling or Acquisition present. While aboard your ship with no staffing requirements, ship has a Cloaking Device. Counts down only while engaged.

Name: The Ferengi Rules of Acquisition
Lore: Ornate book of 285 sayings, attributed to Grand Nagus Gint, which guide Ferengi commerce. They're really only guidelines; calling them "rules" was just a clever marketing ploy.
Text: Once each turn, you may place a [Rule] card beneath draw deck from hand to draw a card (if your Ferengi is present) or to download a [Rule] card to hand (if your Nagus is present).

Name: 1st Rule of Acquisition
Lore: Once you have their money, you never give it back.
Text: Seeds or plays on your freighter, transport or [Fer] facility or ship. {Gold-Pressed Latinum} you download may come from your discard pile. Once per game, you may download to hand one Gold-Pressed Latinum and/or one Ferengi V.I.P.

Name: 211th Rule of Acquisition
Lore: Employees are the rungs on the ladder of success - don't hesitate to step on them.
Text: Plays on {Quark's Bar} or {Ferengi Trading Post}. Each time opponent wishes to play a card during your turn, opponent must first discard X cards, where X = (your dabo girls and Ferengi waiters present) - (opponent's personnel present).

Name: 33rd Rule of Acquisition
Lore: It never hurts to suck up to the boss.
Text: Plays on your Greed personnel at a mission or [Bor] objective opponent completed. Compliment opponent's score. If they say "thank you," score points. If not, draw up to four cards. Discard event. (Limit two per location.)

Name: 34th Rule of Acquisition
Lore: War is good for business.
Text: Plays on your arms dealer or Acquisition personnel. Once every turn, if a non-Rogue-Borg battle was just initiated or opponent's ship was just damaged, download two {Gold-Pressed Latinum} here (three if an arms dealer) OR draw two cards.

Name: 47th Rule of Acquisition
Lore: Don't trust a man wearing a better suit than your own.
Text: Plays on your Acquisition or Greed personnel. Nullifies all {Palor Toff} cards. Whenever at same location as {any Garak} or a personnel who has more [*] icons than this one, may place that personnel atop owner's draw deck; discard event.

Name: 59th Rule of Acquisition
Lore: Free advice is seldom cheap.
Text: Plays on your Nagus. At any time, advise opponent to attempt a specific mission. If opponent does so voluntarily, opponent must first discard two cards from hand and/or top of the draw deck and you may draw up to two; discard event.

Name: 6th Rule Of Acquisition
Lore: Never allow family to stand in the way of opportunity.
Text: Plays on your Ferengi who has Greed or Treachery; place beneath draw deck another Ferengi present who names (or is named by) this one in lore. Download two Equipment cards or {one [Fer] ship} here OR draw up to three cards. Discard event.

Name: 75th Rule of Acquisition
Lore: Home is where the heart is, but the stars are made of latinum.
Text: Plays on your Acquisition personnel in their native quadrant. If that personnel helps solve a mission in another quadrant, score points OR download up to five {Gold-Pressed Latinum} there; discard event. (Once per mission.)

Name: Continuing Committee
Lore: Praetor Neral presides over the Continuing Committee of the Romulan People, the final authority on Romulus.
Text: Seeds or plays on {Romulus}. May coexist with {Office of the Proconsul}. Once per turn, one Tal Shiar personnel OR {any Neral} may report for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Ferengi Outpost
Lore: Ferenginar is the rainy, soggy homeworld of the highly capitalistic Ferengi people. The Ferengi Alliance establishes outposts throughout its territory.
Text: Seed one OR build where you have a Ferengi ENGINEER.

Name: Tower of Commerce
Lore: The Grand Nagus enjoys absolute control over Ferengi business affairs from his Chamber of Petitioners.
Text: Seeds or plays on {Ferenginar}. Once per turn, one Ferengi V.I.P., CIVILIAN or Hupyrian OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Bodyguards
Text: Seeds or plays on table. At start of any personnel battle, each of your bodyguards and leaders who has SECURITY in that battle may exclude from battle one of your V.I.P. or CIVILIAN personnel. If you have a non-Borg Leadership personnel or a [Def] drone remaining in the battle, instead of shuffling your combat pile you may pre-arrange the order in which your personnel will fight. Discard incident.

Name: Bribery
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your Smuggling or Greed personnel may discard one of your {Gold-Pressed Latinum} present to add [FER] to your mission there (except {Ferenginar}) until end of your next turn OR to prevent one entire point loss of up to 9 points just incurred there (discard incident) OR to release (and relocate to that personnel) one of your personnel held captive there.

Name: Dabo
Text: Plays on {Quark's Bar}. Any player who has a personnel here (except {any Quark}) may "wager" 1 to 3 cards from discard pile (except {Kevin Uxbridge}/{Amanda Rogers}) and probe: [Equipment], [Event], [*]: Place wager in point area (2 points per card). Otherwise: Place wager out-of-play; if station's controller has any Quark here, for each dabo girl here that player may draw one card OR download one {Gold-Pressed Latinum} here.

Name: Emergency Evacuation
Text: Seeds or plays on table. If your ship or facility is being destroyed or just encountered {Abandon Ship}, you may place entire crew under that Abandon Ship dilemma OR download {Escape Pod} (ignoring {Computer Crash}) to save entire crew of ship or facility OR relocate entire crew to a planet at that location. Discard incident after use.

Name: HQ: Ferengi Credit Exchange
Text: Seeds or plays on {Ferenginar}, {Ferengi Trading Post} or {Quark's Bar}. Any player who has Acquisition present may, once each turn, discard up to three {Gold-Pressed Latinum} cards present. For each one discarded, score 2 points (place that Latinum card in point area), draw one card or place any one card from discard pile beneath draw deck. May be nullified by {Subspace Interference}.

Name: It's Only a Game
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Limits each non-Borg report with crew action to four total personnel/equipment. Limits {Red Alert} to one Personnel, one Ship and one Equipment card per turn. Limits probing and doubling for {Visit Cochrane Memorial} to once per game per persona. Also, whenever opponent draws three or more cards in one turn, you may download (even from discard pile) {Scorched Hand}, ignoring {Computer Crash}.

Name: Protection Racket
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your Ferengi who has Treachery (or your non-Ferengi who has Treachery x2) may "threaten" (place incident on) any non-Borg personnel at this location. Make any request of opponent. Incident nullified if opponent complies. Threatened personnel loses first-listed skill and opponent must probe each turn: [Doorway], [*]: Assassin strikes. Threatened personnel killed.

Name: Quark's Isolinear Rods
Text: Seeds or plays on table. You may ignore each opponent's {Computer Crash}. Also, you may nullify any or all cards preventing you from playing {Q's Tent} (discard incident after card taken from tent). Once per game, you may download to hand {Intermix Ratio}, {The Big Picture} or a non-OFFICER who has Computer Skill x2 (discard incident). Does not count down while you have {any Quark} in play.

Name: Reactor Overload
Text: Seeds or plays on table. If any player has "processed ore" to draw two cards per turn at any one {Ore Processing Unit}, destroys that site. OR Seeds or plays on table. Place on your ship or facility. EM surge disables each android aboard until Cybernetics present; erases all [Holo] cards aboard; kills each Borg aboard (unless [Com] drone in hive); and kills all {Rogue Borg} aboard. Return incident to your hand after either use.

Name: Writ of Accountability
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once per game, downloads an FCA personnel; discard incident. OR Seeds or plays on table. Place on your [Fer] FCA personnel. If opponent has used {Subspace Schism} or {Brain Drain} more than twice OR played {Static Warp Bubble}, {Anti-Time Anomaly}, or {Black Hole} more than once OR used their own dilemma(s) to score more than 15 points or to discard other dilemmas, they lose the game.

Name: Incoming Message - Ferengi
Lore: Messages and directives are sent, faster than light, on subspace radio signals amplified by networks of relay stations.
Text: Your ship must immediately return to the nearest Ferengi outpost, full speed. Place on one Ferengi ship until outpost reached, then discard.

Name: Vacuum-Desiccated Remains
Lore: When a Ferengi dies, his body is desiccated and apportioned into flat, circular containers to be sold as collectibles. The remains of noteworthy individuals can become quite valuable.
Text: Once per turn, place out-of-play any Ferengi just killed by your opponent's card. Draw cards and/or download {Gold-Pressed Latinum}: up to three total if a V.I.P., two otherwise.

Name: Collect Sample
Lore: Beam volatile sample aboard ship for possible use as a weapon component.
Text: SCIENCE + Astrophysics + Transporter Skill + (Smuggling OR Treachery x2)

Name: Deliver Message
Lore: Convey documents to Grand Nagus Zek on the Ferengi homeworld; beware enemy patrols.
Text: V.I.P. + Diplomacy + Acquisition OR {Quark Son of Keldar} OR {Nog}

Name: Gunrunning
Lore: Get lethal cargo past patrol ship to conclude lucrative arms deal with local interests.
Text: Greed x2 + Smuggling x2 + Anthropology + CUNNING>28 + (hand weapon OR {Echo Papa 607})

Name: Market Research
Lore: Survey remote region; seek out new life and new civilizations to exploit.
Text: Greed x2 + Acquisition + Anthropology + Stellar Cartography + CUNNING>35

Name: Purchase Moon
Lore: Inspect and make offer on moon that just came on the market in this upscale sector.
Text: Greed + Acquisition + Geology + Astrophysics + discard 1 to 4 {Gold-Pressed Latinum} (X = number discarded) Opponent's side: Greed + Acquisition + Geology + Astrophysics + discard 3 Gold-Pressed Latinum Points: [30]

Name: Runabout Search
Lore: Track distress signal; locate survivors of ship sabotaged by Orion Syndicate.
Text: Transporter Skill + MEDICAL + (Honor OR Greed) If you solve, may download {Odo} or {Quark} here.

Name: Tulaberry Wine Negotiations
Affil: Any non-Dominion Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Meet with aggressive Dosi negotiators to discuss lucrative wine contract and distribution rights.
Text: Acquisition x3 + (STRENGTH>30 OR Guramba) OR {Pel} + {any Quark}

Name: Establish Trade Route
Text: Seeds or plays on a space mission with a point box that you seeded. You may attempt it using these requirements: Greed + (freighter OR transport OR [Fer] ship) + Acquisition x3 + CUNNING > (mission points x2) When you solve mission, you may download {Ferengi Trading Post} (plus up to two Equipment cards) here; discard objective.

Name: Ferengi Conference
Text: Seeds or plays on {Quark's Bar}. When you have a Nagus here, you may download one copy of the {75th Rule of Acquisition} to each of your other Ferengi here who has Acquisition. Discard objective. OR Plays on your Nagus at Quark's Bar or aboard a [Fer] facility. Download to that Nagus one Hupyrian or any number of Ferengi CIVILIANs with up to 11 total [*] icons. Discard objective.

Name: Forced-Labor Camp
Text: Seeds or plays on {Cardassia IV}, {Ligos VII} or your planet that has Geology or Archaeology as a requirement. Your [Car] and [Fer] personnel may attempt mission. On Cardassia IV or Ligos VII, changes your mission requirements to these: SECURITY + Geology + STRENGTH>(mission points x2) After you solve, while you escort a captive on this planet, you may draw one additional card at end of each turn.

Name: Aluura
Lore: Humanoid dabo girl. In three months she didn't spill a drink, mix up a food order or short-change a bill. Actually liked by other dabo girls - and even the Ferengi waiters.
Text: CIVILIAN Your other dabo girls and Ferengi waiters here are attributes all +2. Youth Honor Diplomacy

Name: Ambassador Krajensky
Lore: Starfleet dignitary. Scoffs at rumors of his inability to form lasting relationships. Spends much of his free time on Risa.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership ENGINEER Law May report on {Risa}.

Name: Arandis
Lore: Risian chief facilitator of entire Temtibi Lagoon. Romantic partner of Curzon Dax. She welcomes all to Risa.
Text: CIVILIAN Youth Music While on Risa, adds [NON], [non]. Opponent's {Horga'hn} affects all players. May seed (face up) or report on {Risa}. DL/ {Jamaharon}

Name: Benil
Lore: Cardassian Gul of the Eighth Order. Intercepted the U.S.S. Defiant en route to Cardassia Prime. Covert arms dealer with suspected Kressari connections.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Biology Greed Smuggling

Name: Berik
Lore: Officer serving Lurin. Participated in the failed takeover attempt of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Blamed Morta for failing to seize control of the main computer.
Text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Physics Stellar Cartography

Name: Birta
Lore: Ferengi bureaucrat stationed on Ferenginar. Point of control for offworlders. Informed Jean-Luc Picard that Bok had bought his way out of Rog Prison.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Anthropology SECURITY DL/ {Hail} (to any ship "flying by" your ship or facility).

Name: Bractor
Characteristics/ Keywords: Ferengi; DaiMon; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: DaiMon in command of the Kreechta. Observed war games between the U.S.S. Enterprise and the U.S.S. Hathaway. Attempted to claim the latter as salvage.
Text: OFFICER SCIENCE Stellar Cartography DL/ {Commandeer Ship}

Name: Brunt
Lore: Liquidator with the Ferengi Commerce Authority. Rude. Arrogant. Corrupt. Despised and envied by Ferengi everywhere. Strives to ruin Quark.
Text: V.I.P. FCA x 2 Treachery x 2 Navigation Law Greed Computer Skill DL/ {Writ of Accountability}

Name: Calandra
Lore: Attractive young vocalist and part-time nurse. Known as one of "Omag's girls." Overlooks the fat Ferengi's disgusting behavior because of his generosity to her.
Text: CIVILIAN Youth Music MEDICAL DaiMons present are attributes all +1 (cumulative).

Name: Deyos
Lore: Vorta in charge of Internment Camp 371. Responsible for training and equipping Jem'Hadar troops. Accepts nothing less than perfect obedience.
Text: SECURITY May draw a card for each non-Youth Jem'Hadar that enters play here. Treachery x 2 Archaeology

Name: Dr. Borts
Characteristics/ Keywords: Ferengi; Male; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Representative Ferengi scientist. Helped Lurin invade the U.S.S. Enterprise. Paid more attention to Dr. Crusher's molecular models than to his guard duties.
Text: SCIENCE MEDICAL

Name: Edan'Atal
Lore: Representative of Jem'Hadar assigned to guard Dominion operations on Cardassia Prime. Fourth. Bred in the Alpha Quadrant.
Text: SECURITY Astrophysics ENGINEER Honor

Name: Elizabeth Lense
Lore: Female chief medical officer of the U.S.S. Lexington. Julian Bashir's medical-school rival. Able to distinguish a preganglionic fiber from a postganglionic nerve.
Text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Biology Physics

Name: Frool
Lore: Typical Ferengi waiter. Serves his employers as well as can be expected for a young, impatient, aspiring opportunist.
Reports: Tower of Commerce, Ferengi Trading Post
Text: CIVILIAN Greed Youth Reports for free to {Ferengi Trading Post}.

Name: Gaila
Lore: Arms dealer. Owed his cousin Quark a shuttle. Made good on his debt, but booby-trapped the ship. Involved with Hagath. Helped rescue Ishka from the Dominion.
Text: CIVILIAN Treachery Greed x 2 Smuggling ENGINEER SECURITY DL/ {Hidden Fighter}

Name: George Primmin
Lore: Starfleet security officer assigned to Deep Space 9. Annoyed Odo. Discovered a subspace crossover shunt placed on the station by the criminal Rao Vantika in 2369.
Text: SECURITY SECURITY Computer Skill Biology Once per game, may nullify {Computer Crash}.

Name: Goss
Lore: Uninvited participant in the 2366 Barzan wormhole negotiations. DaiMon. Conspired with Devinoni Ral to deceive. Preoccupied with getting his own chair.
Text: OFFICER Greed Treachery x 2 DL/ {Latinum Payoff} MEDICAL {Wormhole Negotiations} has [FER], [fer].

Name: Gral
Lore: Aggressive Ferengi opportunist. Diplomatically, but insistently, threatened Quark with a protection racket while Quark was briefly serving as the Grand Nagus.
Text: CIVILIAN Greed Treachery Acquisition Diplomacy SECURITY DL/ {Protection Racket}

Name: Grand Nagus Gint
Lore: The first Grand Nagus. Credited with writing the Rules of Acquisition. Appeared in Quark's dream; looked a lot like Rom. Told Quark the Rules were a marketing ploy.
Text: V.I.P. Greed x 2 Acquisition Law Archaeology DL/ {Bribery} DL/ {Any [Rule] card}

Name: Grand Nagus Zek
Lore: Aging financial and political leader of the Ferengi Alliance. Romantically - and secretly - involved with Ishka. Admits he's not as greedy as he used to be.
Text: V.I.P. Acquisition Greed Leadership Law Diplomacy DL/ {HQ: Ferengi Credit Exchange}

Name: Hagath
Lore: Humanoid arms dealer. Associate of Quark's cousin Gaila. Ruthless. Treats his business associates like family - until they cross him.
Text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Treachery x 2 Anthropology ENGINEER Your hand weapons may report here.

Name: Hanok
Lore: Karemma Commerce Minister. Helped to defuse a torpedo lodged in the hull of the U.S.S. Defiant. Learned of Ferengi business philosophy from Quark.
Text: V.I.P. Acquisition Diplomacy Smuggling ENGINEER DL/ {Any [Rule] card}

Name: Ikat'ika
Characteristics/ Keywords: Jem'Hadar; Internment Camp 371-related personnel; Jem'Hadar First; Male;
Lore: Jem'Hadar First under Deyos. Leader of detachment assigned to Internment Camp 371. Fought Worf as part of training exercise. Skilled combatant.
Text: OFFICER Honor Leadership Anthropology Your Jem'Hadar present are STRENGTH +1 in battle.

Name: Inglatu
Lore: Typical male Dosi. Violent and impatient negotiator. Threatened to kill Quark because of the Ferengi's annoying tenacity.
Text: CIVILIAN Greed Acquisition MEDICAL Geology

Name: Ishka
Lore: Moogie to Quark and Rom. Financial genius. Wears clothes. Earns profit. Secretly helps Zek run his empire.
Text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Computer Skill Honor Music Your {Gold-Pressed Latinum} may report here, for free. While {Grand Nagus Zek} is here, doubles his skills.

Name: Kasidy Yates
Lore: Freighter captain for Bajoran Ministry of Commerce. Smuggled weapons for the Maquis in 2372. Loves baseball. Romantically involved with Benjamin Sisko.
Text: CIVILIAN Navigation x 2 Smuggling Transporter Skill May add 2 card draws to "{cargo runs}" she completes.

Name: Kazago
Lore: First officer. Shocked by DaiMon Bok's free gift of the derelict U.S.S. Stargazer to the human Picard. Placed Bok under arrest for using an illegal thought maker.
Text: OFFICER Leadership ENGINEER Honor

Name: Krajensky Founder
Characteristics/ Keywords: Changeling; Ambassador; Founder; Infiltrator; Male; Shape-shifter;
Lore: The changeling appearing as Ambassador Krajensky seized the U.S.S. Defiant in an effort to start a war between the Federation and the Tzenkethi.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Law Leadership ENGINEER Treachery DL/ {Issue Secret Orders}

Name: Krax
Lore: Son of Grand Nagus Zek. Missed his chance to show his father he could be a good nagus when he tried to seize power quickly, rather than accumulate it quietly.
Text: V.I.P. Youth Greed MEDICAL May serve as Nagus (if you have no Nagus in play).

Name: Krozh
Lore: Typical Nausicaan bodyguard. Protects FCA Liquidator Brunt. Doesn't mind working for Ferengi cowards as long as the money is good.
Text: SECURITY Navigation Treachery Guramba May report where you have FCA present.

Name: Krunk
Lore: Transporter technician under the command of Lurin. Guarded a U.S.S. Enterprise transporter room during his DaiMon's unsuccessful takeover attempt.
Text: ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill Transporter Skill

Name: Leck
Lore: Professional assassin called an "eliminator." Doesn't crave latinum, but doesn't like being cheated. Brunt called him a psychopath during the 2374 Ishka rescue.
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Exobiology Treachery Once per game, may kill any one personnel present.

Name: Leeta
Lore: Bajoran dabo girl. Formed the Guild of Restaurant and Casino Employees with Rom. Amateur sociologist. Was formally separated from Julian Bashir on Risa in 2373.
Text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Youth Computer Skill Leadership Music DL/ {Dabo} OR {Kukalaka}

Name: Lemec
Lore: Gul in command of the Reklar. Clashed with Captain Edward Jellico over troop and ship movements along the Federation-Cardassian border.
Text: OFFICER Geology MEDICAL Music Transporter Skill

Name: Letek
Lore: Typical first officer in the Ferengi Alliance. Serves under Taar. Tried to find favor with Portal 63 on an ancient Tkon planet.
Text: OFFICER Treachery Geology MEDICAL May nullify {Ferengi Attack} at this location.

Name: Lurin
Characteristics/ Keywords: Ferengi; DaiMon; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: DaiMon who illegally mined vendarite on Ligos VII. Tried to take over the U.S.S. Enterprise. Would've succeeded, too, if it weren't for those meddling kids.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Greed Geology Transporter Skill DL/ {Forced-Labor Camp}

Name: Maihar'du
Lore: Hupyrian servant. Grand Nagus Zek's bodyguard, pilot and handkerchief valet. Took a vow to speak only to his master. As loyal as he is silent.
Text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 DL/ {Bodyguards} OR {Security Sacrifice} Exobiology DL/ {Scepter of the Grand Nagus}
