Name: Mardah
Lore: Bajoran entomology student. Dabo girl. Orphaned by Cardassians. Romantically involved with Jake Sisko. Accepted to the science academy on Regulus III.
Text: CIVILIAN Youth Biology SCIENCE

Name: Margh
Lore: Veteran Klingon warrior. Achieved many glorious victories. Trained in battlefield medicine. Former member of Gowron's elite High Council honor guards.
Text: SECURITY Honor Geology MEDICAL Transporter Skill

Name: Morn
Lore: Lurian. Freighter captain. Frequent patron of Quark's. Part of the infamous Lissepian Mother's Day Heist. Hides a small fortune in latinum in his second stomach.
Text: CIVILIAN Navigation Greed Acquisition Smuggling ENGINEER Biology DL/ {Gold-Pressed Latinum}

Name: Morta
Lore: Security officer. Led an assault team that boarded the U.S.S. Enterprise on Lurin's order. Befuddled by Commander Riker's bogus computer lesson.
Text: SECURITY Computer Skill ENGINEER Geology DL/ {Prepare Assault Teams}

Name: Nava
Lore: Typical Ferengi entrepreneur. Took over the Arcybite gouge-mining refineries in the Clarius system. Plans to introduce synthehol to the Gamma Quadrant.
Text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Geology SCIENCE Anthropology

Name: Nibor
Lore: Security guard aboard the Krayton. Served with Tog during the Lwaxana Troi incident. Played chess with William Riker. Isn't bragging about the outcome.
Text: SECURITY Navigation Computer Skill Transporter Skill

Name: Nilva
Lore: Typical member of Ferengi Commerce Authority. One of 432 FCA commissioners. Chairman of Slug-o-Cola, "the slimiest cola in the galaxy." Lusts after Lumba.
Text: V.I.P. Greed Leadership FCA Biology

Name: Nog
Lore: Dedicated, hardworking ensign. The first Ferengi in Starfleet. Friend of Jake. Briefly served as chief engineer of U.S.S. Valiant under Captain Watters.
Text: ENGINEER Physics Honor Youth Acquisition ENGINEER (if aboard your Defiant-class or [Fer] ship).

Name: Omag
Lore: Ferengi arms dealer. DaiMon. Glutton. Always requests that Amarie play Melor Famagal. Referred to as "the fat Ferengi" by the Qualor II locals.
Text: OFFICER Greed Smuggling Music Archaeology DL/ {Calandra}

Name: Par Lenor
Lore: Emissary of the Ferengi Trade Mission. Sabotaged his own ship to force a rescue by the U.S.S. Enterprise, creating the opportunity to bribe Ambassador Briam.
Text: V.I.P. Greed Diplomacy ENGINEER Astrophysics

Name: Patahk
Lore: Commander of the Pi. Rescued from Galorndon Core by the U.S.S. Enterprise crew. Refused to "pollute his body" with an infusion of Worf's Klingon ribosomes.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Stellar Cartography Physics If aboard {Pi} with {Bochra}, Pi is attributes all +2.

Name: Pel
Lore: Waiter. Female. Used synthetic lobes to appear male. Wore clothes and sought profit in violation of Ferengi law. Romantically involved with Quark - briefly.
Text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Diplomacy Biology May avoid selections that target males or females.

Name: Prak
Lore: Representative DaiMon in the Ferengi Alliance. In exchange for repairs to his ship, provided sensor log readings on missing U.S.S. Fleming to Jean-Luc Picard.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Stellar Cartography

Name: Qol
Characteristics/ Keywords: Ferengi; Male; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Assistant to Par Lenor. Sneaked into a cargo bay on the U.S.S. Enterprise to scan an empathic metamorph. Accidentally triggered premature emergence.
Text: SCIENCE Exobiology

Name: Quark
Lore: Bartender and proprietor of Quark's Bar, Grill, Gaming House and Holosuite Arcade. Longtime nuisance to Odo.
Text: CIVILIAN Greed Treachery Smuggling Acquisition Anthropology Diplomacy X=2 or 7. Computer Skill x 2 DL/ {Small Cloaking Device}

Name: Rom
Lore: Brilliant yet befuddled Ferengi engineer. Works for the Bajorans aboard Deep Space 9. Quark's brother. Nog's father. Gaila's cousin. Has a crush on Leeta.
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Astrophysics Honor Navigation Physics X=4 or 9.

Name: Senator Cretak
Characteristics/ Keywords: Romulan; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Senator;
Lore: Female Romulan. Kimara Cretak was liaison to Deep Space 9 in 2375. Coordinated a fleet of warbirds attempting to deliver weapons to a Bajoran moon.
Text: V.I.P. Honor Law SECURITY Physics Your [Rom] ships at same location are WEAPONS +2.

Name: Solok
Lore: Typical DaiMon. Like most Ferengi, easily manipulated by any female who tickles his lobes. Smuggled humans to the Cardassian planet Celtris III in 2369.
Text: OFFICER Smuggling Archaeology MEDICAL

Name: Sovak
Lore: DaiMon who sought the Tox Uthat. Followed Vash to Risa, only to be deceived by the treacherous human female and facially assaulted by Jean-Luc Picard.
Text: OFFICER Computer Skill Archaeology Greed SCIENCE

Name: Taar
Lore: Representative Ferengi DaiMon. First member of the Ferengi Alliance to make visual contact with humans. Claimed he sought "only what is equitable."
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Astrophysics May double {Ferengi Attack} faced in same quadrant.

Name: Tog
Lore: DaiMon. Presented flowers to Lwaxana Troi. Abducted her from Betazed, hoping to exploit her empathic skills during negotiations. She called him a "toad-faced troll."
Text: OFFICER Greed Anthropology Exobiology Once per game, may capture one Empath present.

Name: Tol
Lore: Unusually calm and intelligent Ferengi. Science officer aboard Bok's marauder. Questioned his commander's actions in the Jason Vigo incident.
Text: SCIENCE Archaeology Astrophysics Stellar Cartography

Name: Apnex
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; No staffing requirement; Prototype; Romulan ship;
Lore: Named for a sea on Romulus. Has a cloaking device prototype based on a phase inverter. Commanded by Mirok after the death of the ship's captain.
Text: Cloaking Device, Phasing Cloak (RANGE +4 while phased).

Name: B'rel
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Ferengi ship; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Old surplus Klingon Bird-of-Prey. Much smaller than K'Vort-class ships. Ferengi bought this one to support a covert vendarite mining operation on Ligos VII.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

Name: D'Kora Marauder
Characteristics/ Keywords: D'Kora-Class; Ferengi ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Ferengi military vessel. Standard D'Kora spaceframe optimized for battle readiness. Most DaiMons enjoy the raw power but lament the minimal cargo space.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: D'Kora Transport
Characteristics/ Keywords: D'Kora-Class; Ferengi ship; Tractor Beam; Transport;
Lore: Ferengi trade vessel. Same spaceframe as the D'Kora-class marauder, but has a smaller crew complement and devotes far more internal volume to cargo capacity.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Ferengi Shuttle
Lore: Common shuttlecraft of Ferengi design. Dr. Arridor commanded one.

Name: Jovis
Lore: Zibalian transport and merchant vessel commanded by Kivas Fajo. Houses his collection of rare and one-of-a-kind objects. Used to imprison Data in 2366.
Text: Once per game, you may capture an android on an undocked ship here. DL/ {Kivas Fajo}

Name: Karemman Vessel
Lore: The Karemma conduct trade operations for the Dominion. Their vessels can be found throughout the Gamma Quadrant. Hanok commanded one.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Krayton
Characteristics/ Keywords: D'Kora-Class; Ferengi ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Marauder commanded by Tog. Briefly imprisoned Lwaxana Troi, whom Tog had abducted from Betazed following the 2366 Trade Agreements Conference.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: Kreechta
Characteristics/ Keywords: D'Kora-Class; Ferengi ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Ferengi marauder. Under the command of Bractor in 2365, interrupted a mysterious battle between the Federation starships Enterprise and Hathaway.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: Naprem
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cardassian ship; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Bird-of-Prey commanded by Dukat. Commandeered near the Cardassian outpost on Korma. Named for Tora Ziyal's mother. Carried Jodmos to Ty'Gokor in 2373.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: Patrol Ship
Lore: Common patrol vessel of the Cardassian Union. Uses the same hull as the Cardassian shuttlecraft, but boasts a much higher performance profile.
Text: Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

Name: Quark's Treasure
Lore: Briefly captained by Quark. Faster than a Romulan interceptor. A belated delivery from its former captain, Gaila, who had owed Quark a ship for some time.

Name: U.S.S. Sao Paulo
Lore: Replacement for the U.S.S. Defiant. NCC-75633. Briefly commanded by Admiral Ross during delivery to Deep Space 9. Captained by Benjamin Sisko.
Text: Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard except shuttlepods).

Name: Cargo Bay
Text: Smuggling, Acquisition and [Non] Navigation personnel may report here (or download here in place of a normal card play; player draws no cards that turn). Once each turn, if a freighter, transport or [Fer] ship's crew member completes a "cargo run" (brings a non-weapon Equipment card here from another facility), for each mission passed (except starting and ending locations) owner may draw a card or download a {Gold-Pressed Latinum} here. (Once per game per Equipment card title.) Any Nor: Docking Ring

Name: Quark's Bar
Requires: Bartender; Dabo Girl; Ferengi; Ferengi ship; Waiter;
Text: {Morn} and Ferengi may report here. Once each turn, a bartender, a dabo girl, a waiter, {any Quark} or {any Rom} may report here for free (or download here in place of a normal card play; player draws no cards that turn). Any player who has Morn unopposed here may draw an additional card at end of each turn. Any player who kills any waiters or dabo girls here in battle must discard two cards for each. Ferengi ships may report, dock, undock and repair at this Nor. {Terok Nor} OR {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

Name: Ferengi Energy Weapon
Text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a Ferengi ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

Name: Plasma Energy Burst
Text: Attack: 0. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +4 and DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a D'Kora-class ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Otherwise, causes electromagnetic disruptions ([Down]). EM burst: until end of your next full turn, WEAPONS disabled and all ENGINEER-classification personnel are "stopped."

Name: Bashir Founder
Lore: Changeling posing as Julian Bashir. Tried to destroy an entire fleet by causing the Bajoran sun to go nova.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology Biology Treachery DL/ {Supernova} ({Tox Uthat} not required; opponent must have total usable WEAPONS>36 at this location).

Name: Jodmos
Lore: The human Benjamin Sisko assumed the identity of Jodmos, son of Kobor, to help rid the Klingon Empire of a suspected changeling at Ty'Gokor.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Navigation Honor May stun adversary without Honor he just engaged.

Name: Koval
Lore: Chairman of the Tal Shiar. Seeks appointment to the Continuing Committee. Suffers from Tuvan Syndrome. Conspired with Sloan to bring down Senator Cretak.
Text: V.I.P. SECURITY Treachery Tal Shiar x2 (when [Rom]). Exobiology Your Tal Shiar may report here.

Name: Legate Damar
Lore: Damar became legate in 2374. Weary of Dominion rule, he led the resistance effort to free Cardassia in 2375. Rumored to have secret mountain stronghold.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Computer Skill Honor SECURITY Physics DL/ {For Cardassia!}

Name: Luther Sloan
Lore: Section 31 operative. Secretive man with seemingly limitless access. Attempted to recruit Julian Bashir. Involved in infecting Odo with the changeling virus.
Text: SECURITY Section 31 x 2 SECURITY Treachery Honor Computer Skill May report anywhere.

Name: Vedek Dax
Characteristics/ Keywords: Trill; Female; The Circle-related personnel; Trill with Symbiont; Vedek;
Lore: Trill with symbiont. Jadzia Dax posed as a vedek to sneak Kira Nerys past members of the Circle and into the Chamber of Ministers. Joked about keeping the nose.
Text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Anthropology Physics Navigation Exobiology

Name: Orb of Time
Lore: Bajoran Orb. Transported U.S.S. Defiant across time and space to encounter starship Enterprise. Also used by Kira Nerys to travel back to the Cardassian occupation to learn of her mother's fate.
Text: Use as Equipment card. Once each turn, your ship or Away Team (if this Orb and your [Orb] personnel present) may time travel (except to board opponent's ship or outpost).

Name: Chula: The Drink
Lore: One chula puzzle places the players in a cocktail party filled with poison gas. The antidote awaits the one who is clever (or foolish) enough to take a chance on a mysterious beverage.
Text: To get past, four personnel present (random selection) must be "tested." All four are "stopped" unless one has CUNNING<6 OR CUNNING>9.

Name: Chula: The Way Home
Lore: Near the end of their chula experience, three Deep Space 9 senior staff members were enticed to follow an image of Julian Bashir. He claimed to have found the way home.
Text: To get past, three personnel (random selection) are chosen. Opponent may relocate one to {Quark's Bar} or your facility if the other two have combined INTEGRITY<15.

Name: Executive Authorization
Requires: Chairman; Chancellor; Counterpart; Founder; General; Governor; High Council Leader; Intendant; Kai; Legate; Minister; Nagus; President; Proconsul; Queen;
Lore: Before Benjamin Sisko and Admiral Leyton could implement extreme security measures on Earth in 2372, they had to obtain authorization from Federation President Jaresh-Inyo.
Text: To get past requires a President, High Council Leader, General, Legate, Chancellor, Proconsul, Chairman, Intendant, Minister, Kai, Founder, Nagus, Governor, Queen, counterpart, or {PADD}.

Name: Ferengi Infestation
Lore: In anticipation of a prisoner exchange, a Dominion delegation boarded Empok Nor in 2374. They found that the Ferengi were already entrenched there.
Text: Opponent may download up to two male Ferengi to a facility at this location (or up to six if facility is {Empok Nor}). To get past requires 2 SECURITY and CUNNING>50.

Name: Lineup
Lore: After a bar fight with Klingons on Station K-7, Captain Kirk ordered a lineup. No crewman claimed responsibility for starting the brawl, but none pointed the finger at Mr. Scott, either.
Text: To get past requires four personnel present (random selection) to "form a lineup." All four are "stopped" unless one has INTEGRITY<5 OR INTEGRITY>8.

Name: Oops!
Lore: In 2374, an ill-prepared band of Ferengi arranged a prisoner exchange aboard Empok Nor. Their profound lack of competence made the process even more difficult than they had expected.
Text: Unless Leadership present, kills one personnel (random selection) and "stops" all others present. To get past requires three [Stf] personnel OR three [Def] drones OR {Nog}.

Name: Palukoo
Lore: Large spider-like creature inhabiting the Bajoran moons. One-time food source for Resistance fighters. Caused Dax concern, since Trill/symbiont biochemistry cannot tolerate insect bites.
Text: Unless Resistance OR ANIMAL present, "bites" a non-android present (random selection). If Trill with symbiont, dies now (discard dilemma); otherwise, disabled until countdown expires.

Name: Q Gets the Point
Lore: Q, stripped of his powers, helped the U.S.S. Enterprise crew develop a plan to save Bre'el IV from destruction. Guinan used a simple serving fork to verify his claim of mortality.
Text: To get past requires 2 Treachery or {Mortal Q}, but one such personnel (opponent's choice) is "forked" ("stopped") if opponent has {any Guinan} in play. Nullified by any Guinan.

Name: Storage Compartment Door
Text: Place one atop Tribble side deck during the seed phase. Side deck is now open and in play. Once each turn, you may draw up to 3 cards from side deck, then play or discard each. OR Stock in deck and play (once each turn) to download from your Tribble side deck one Trouble or Tribble card, or to nullify any card that is closing another Storage Compartment Door; then discard doorway.

Name: Classic Communicator
Lore: Typical 23rd-century personal communications device. Features flip-up antenna grid and multi-band tuning. Such equipment was developed by many races.
Text: Once each turn, one of your [OS] personnel present may add a skill from one of your other compatible [OS] personnel at same location until end of turn. (Unique.)

Name: Classic Medical Tricorder
Lore: General-purpose medical reference and diagnostic tool. Representative of devices used in the latter half of the 23rd century. Such equipment was developed by many races.
Text: Once each turn, you may select MEDICAL OR Biology OR Exobiology. Until re-selected, your MEDICAL- or SCIENCE-classification [OS] personnel present gain that skill. (Unique.)

Name: Classic Tricorder
Lore: Multipurpose hand-held device typical of those employed by many races in the late 23rd century. Jadzia Dax said of this one, "I just love classic 23rd-century design."
Text: Once each turn, you may select ENGINEER OR SCIENCE OR Geology OR Physics. Until re-selected, your ENGINEER- and SCIENCE- classification [OS] personnel present gain that skill. (Unique.)

Name: Classic Type II Phaser
Lore: Starfleet personal defense and security weapon. Styling is typical of those used in the late 23rd and early 24th centuries. The pistol grip cradles and amplifies a Type I phaser.
Text: Federation use only. Each of your [OS] personnel present is STRENGTH +2 (cumulative). Each of your [OS] leaders present adds SECURITY.

Name: VR Headset
Lore: Standard visual interface used by the Dominion. Virtual-reality eyepiece facilitates face-to-face communications and provides an unobstructed 360-by-360 view outside the ship.
Text: Each VR headset aboard your [Dom] ship allows one Vorta, Jem'Hadar, or Cardassian present to enhance WEAPONS and SHIELDS +1 and (if Vorta) to serve as matching commander.

Name: 62nd Rule of Acquisition
Lore: The riskier the road, the greater the profit.
Text: Plays on your unattempted mission. Nullified if you begin an attempt with <3 (or >7) personnel, or if you play (or have played) {Scan} or {Full Planet Scan}. If you solve, score points; opponent loses points (discard event).

Name: Organian Peace Treaty
Lore: Pacifistic energy beings known as Organians imposed upon the United Federation of Planets and the Klingon Empire the treaty that those warring factions were unable to forge for themselves.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Your Federation- and Klingon-affiliation cards that have [OS] icons may mix and cooperate. (Immune to {The Devil}.)

Name: Subspace Transporter
Lore: Bok beamed to and from the U.S.S. Enterprise using a subspace transporter that forced his body into a state of quantum flux. Though dangerous, such devices have greatly extended range.
Text: Plays on your ship. Each turn, ship may beam one of your Treachery personnel to and/or from anywhere at same or adjacent location. Nullified only by {Subspace Interference}.

Name: Temporal Investigations
Lore: The Federation Department of Temporal Investigations regulates and assesses possible damage to the timeline caused by time travel. They're never short of work.
Text: Plays on table. Once every turn, if opponent reports an [AU] personnel or ship to Alpha Quadrant spaceline, you may draw one card OR download {Lucsly} and/or {Dulmer}.

Name: Treaty: Cardassian/Bajoran
Lore: In 2371, the Bajoran and Cardassian peoples finally began to put their long conflict behind them, with the signing of a peace treaty between Legate Turrel and the newly elected Kai Winn.
Text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Bareil Antos}, {Kai Winn}, or {Turrel} in play). Your Cardassian and Bajoran affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

Name: Treaty: Romulan/Bajoran
Lore: After the Romulan Star Empire's entry into the Dominion war in 2374, Senator Cretak established a Romulan military presence on Deep Space 9 - and a fragile trust with Colonel Kira Nerys.
Text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Colonel Kira} or {Senator Cretak} in play). Your Romulan and Bajoran affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

Name: Deep Space Station K-7
Lore: Federation frontier station, circa mid-2260s. Consists mostly of fabrication facilities and storage units.
Text: Plays at {2267 Sherman's Planet}; may be used by all players' compatible cards. Once per turn, one [OS] card reporting at this location may report for free. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Chain Reaction Ricochet
Text: Seeds or plays on table. When your {Chain Reaction Pulsar} hits (but does not destroy) a ship, after applying damage it "ricochets" to other opposing ships present (except those already damaged this battle) in the order of your choice. Second ship's damage = [Flip][Flip], third = [Flip][Flip][Flip], and so on, until one is destroyed. Discard incident.

Name: Homefront
Text: Seeds or plays on any homeworld. In place of a normal card play, a SECURITY personnel matching homeworld's affiliation may download here (owner draws no cards that turn). No player may attempt mission or use {headquarters} game text here unless they have 4 SECURITY on planet. OR Plays on table. Your personnel who have infiltration icons may report (for free) on homeworlds those icons match.

Name: HQ: Orbital Weapons Platform
Text: Plays on any homeworld. Each time opponent initiates battle here against your ship or facility matching this homeworld's affiliation, just after it is targeted each of your Orbital Weapons Platforms here may "fire upon" an opposing ship present. Each ship fired upon is damaged = [Flip][Flip] for each Platform that targets it, and you may exclude that ship from that battle.

Name: Make It So
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, if your staffed ship has its matching commander aboard, you may "unstop" it (once per game per Ship card title) OR download {Ready Room Door} (to download a Captain's Order) OR , if that ship is in battle (even during opponent's turn), download a Tactic card (once per game per Tactic card title). Discard incident after use, unless that matching commander has [Ent-E] icon.

Name: Obelisk of Masaka
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Each time a card provides multiple card draws, only one may be converted to a download. Also, to move or initiate battle, each ship with one or more staffing icons (and each Interceptor) requires at least two crew members aboard. Once each turn (unless opponent has {The Mask of Korgano} in play), you may download {Masaka Transformations} targeting yourself, then discard incident.

Name: Panel Overload
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Discard incident to nullify {Bynars Weapon Enhancement} or {Genetronic Replicator}. You may place incident on any outpost to prevent its {Spacedoors} from re-opening (nullified by 4 ENGINEER aboard).

Name: Q the Referee
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, you may play one {[Ref] card} for free OR discard (or place beneath draw deck) one of your [Ref] cards from hand or in play to draw a card. Also, you may suspend play while you download any other [Ref] card (ignoring {Computer Crash}), then discard incident.

Name: Resistance Is Futile
Text: Plays on your completed {Establish Gateway}, {Assimilate Planet}, or {Salvage Starship} objective. Increases objective's points by 10 while your [Def] Borg at that location. OR Plays on opponent's {Q's Planet}. The 40 additional points it requires are irrelevant to your Borg while your [Com] Borg is at that location. OR Seeds or plays on table. Your [Nav] Borg may report directly to your {Borg spheres}.

Name: Tribble Bomb
Text: Plays for free on your tribble group if your {Barry Waddle} at same location. (Unique.) When countdown expires, kills one personnel present (your choice). Once per turn, any player's personnel present who has {any tricorder} may "search" for Bomb: Shuffle Bomb into all your tribbles present (if any). That player randomly examines half of those cards (round up); Bomb is nullified if so examined.

Name: We Look for Things
Text: Plays on your staffed Pakled ship. May discard incident to "acquire" one artifact, event, or equipment enhancing attribute(s) of an opposing ship present (once per game per card title). Opponent must give you that card (or download a copy of it) for your use. OR Downloads a copy of any artifact (as if earned), event, or equipment enhancing attribute(s) of an opponent's ship. Discard incident.

Name: Burial Ground
Lore: Dukat and Kira Nerys found the wreckage of the Ravinok on Dozaria in 2371. Twelve crash victims, including Dukat's mistress Tora Naprem, were buried there.
Text: Plays once per turn on any player. That player must "bury" (place out-of-play) from their discard pile one card (their choice) and all other cards there of the same card type.

Name: Live Long and Prosper
Lore: Traditional Vulcan greeting and farewell gesture. Originated by Surak, the father of Vulcan philosophy, who led Vulcan into its era of peace some 2,000 years ago.
Text: Saves any Vulcan who was just randomly selected to die. OR Once per turn, returns an opponent's personnel who just died to opponent's hand; draw one card for each of its [*] icons.

Name: Obedience Brings Victory
Lore: First Omet'iklan, can you vouch for the loyalty of your men? "We pledge our loyalty to the Founders from now until death." "Then receive this reward... may it keep you strong."
Text: Plays once per turn if your Vorta just "rationed" {Ketracel-White}. Draw two cards (in place of one draw, may download {Subjugate Planet} to that location or {Victory Is Life} to hand).

Name: Scan Cycle Check
Lore: To protect the integrity of the timeline in 2267, Miles O'Brien monitored starship Enterprise scan cycles to identify when the U.S.S. Defiant could decloak without being detected.
Text: Plays on your Transporter Skill. Your ships there decloak/dephase while that personnel operates transporters, then recloak/rephase. OR Nullifies {Scan} or {Full Planet Scan}.

Name: Suicidal Attack
Lore: During a prison break aboard Dominion Internment Camp 371, a captive Breen and a Jem'Hadar guard obligingly removed each other from existence.
Text: Plays to kill one personnel (your choice) who is escorting your Breen or Romulan as a captive OR who just engaged one of your personnel in combat. Your personnel also dies.

Name: Agricultural Assessment
Lore: Report on long-term progress of quadrotriticale crop introduced here over a century ago.
Text: Geology + Biology OR {any Spock} OR {any Chekov}

Name: Assign Support Personnel
Text: Seeds or plays on table. (Unique.) Your "support personnel" (those who have exactly two skills, but no special skills) may report aboard your compatible ships that have two or more staffing icons. Once each turn, you may discard objective to download a "support personnel" (once per game per Personnel card title) to your matching ship that has two or more staffing icons, or to your matching facility.

Name: Council of Warriors
Text: Plays on your [KLI] mission showing less than 30 points (or on {Qo'noS}), if unattempted. Nullified if you play (or have played) {Scan}, {Full Planet Scan}, or a non-Klingon personnel. If you solve by end of your next turn, place objective in point area; place here all ships your ships destroy in battle and all personnel your Klingons kill in personnel battle to score points equal to WEAPONS or STRENGTH printed on card.

Name: Defend Homeworld
Text: Seeds or plays on table. When opponent voluntarily initiates battle against your card at a homeworld matching that card's affiliation, just after it is targeted you may download there any number of {HQ} cards and compatible ships, leaders, SECURITY personnel, and hand weapons. Once per game, you may discard objective to download a SECURITY personnel OR any HQ card (except {Return Orb to Bajor}).

Name: Hero of the Empire
Text: Seeds or plays on {Deep Space Station K-7}. Download {Captain Kirk} aboard; he may not be moved. If he leaves play because of a {Tribble Bomb} (or an action your opponent initiated), timeline disrupted in 2267: place objective on table; each Alpha Quadrant mission solved this game is -10 points if solved by opponent, or +10 if showing [KLI] icon and solved by your non-Federation crew or Away Team.

Name: Amet'alox
Characteristics/ Keywords: Jem'Hadar; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Jem'Hadar Fourth. Representative of Dominion troops deployed to hold Terok Nor after its capture near the end of 2373.
Text: SECURITY Transporter Skill Stellar Cartography

Name: Arne Darvin
Lore: Klingon saboteur. Disguised undercover operative. Assistant to Nilz Baris on Deep Space Station K-7.
Text: CIVILIAN Treachery Klingon Intelligence Biology If on {K-7}, allows you to draw one card every turn that any [Kli] or opponent's [Fed] card reports here.

Name: B.G. Robinson
Lore: Bronwyn Gail Robinson served on the U.S.S. Enterprise. Romantically involved with Thadiun Okona. Responsible for reporting the daily planet-to-ship transport logs.
Text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill Youth Anthropology DL/ {Pattern Enhancers}

Name: Barry Waddle
Lore: Outcast Klingon agent posing as a human trader. Former alias: Arne Darvin. Plotted to destroy James T. Kirk. Envisioned his statue in the Hall of Warriors.
Text: CIVILIAN Treachery Navigation Computer Skill May nullify {HQ: Return Orb to Bajor}. DL/ {Tribble Bomb}

Name: Broca
Lore: Cardassian officer quickly promoted to legate in the wake of Damar's defection. Says he believes in the Dominion. Strives in vain to please the Founder.
Text: V.I.P. Archaeology Geology ENGINEER Treachery

Name: Captain Kirk
Lore: Legendary starship captain. In 2267, met "Lieutenant" Sisko. 17 temporal violations. "The man was a menace."
Text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 May initiate battle against non-[Fed]. DL/ {Captain's Log} May stun adversary he just engaged. Once every turn, may "stop" one female present.

Name: Captain Koloth
Lore: Commander of I.K.C. Gr'oth. Sent to protect Klingon interests in Sherman's Planet. Dear to Captain Kirk.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Anthropology SCIENCE If on {I.K.C. Gr'oth}, it is attributes all +1 for each Klingon [OS] personnel aboard (up to +3).

Name: Danderdag
Lore: We are Pakleds. We want to be strong.
Text: SECURITY Computer Skill Navigation

Name: Daval
Lore: Klingon field scientist serving under Governor Kor. In 2267, helped establish the Klingon command center on Organia.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Computer Skill

Name: Dr. McCoy
Lore: Leonard H. "Bones" McCoy. Chief medical officer of the starship Enterprise. Awarded the Legion of Honor.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology x 2 Biology Once per game, may nullify a dilemma requiring MEDICAL where present. DL/ Any "{I'm a Doctor, not}..." card

Name: Dulmer
Lore: Agent of the Department of Temporal Investigations. Just wants the truth. Starts at the beginning. Hates jokes. Probably would have talked to Kirk himself.
Text: SCIENCE Anthropology Exobiology SECURITY

Name: Ensign Chekov
Lore: Pavel Andreievich Chekov. Feisty 22-year-old Russian navigator of the starship Enterprise. Protege of Mr. Spock. Considers Klingons "cossacks."
Text: OFFICER Youth Navigation SCIENCE If on {Starship Enterprise}, it is RANGE +2.

Name: Ensign O'Brien
Lore: In 2267, Miles O'Brien beamed his away team aboard the original starship Enterprise to save Captain Kirk from Barry Waddle's assassination attempt.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Physics Honor Transporter Skill DL/ {Classic Communicator}

Name: Falar
Lore: Tactician aboard the Kreechta. Serves under Bractor. Shocked when Jean-Luc Picard "destroyed" the U.S.S. Hathaway. Didn't think the Federation had such iron.
Text: OFFICER Treachery Transporter Skill DL/ {Ferengi Energy Weapon}

Name: First Minister Shakaar
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Male; Minister; Shakaar Resistance Cell;
Lore: Once a farmer and leader of Shakaar resistance cell, Shakaar Edon was elected First Minister in 2371.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Leadership Honor Law Once each turn, allows your Bajoran CIVILIAN to report for free to {Chamber of Ministers} if present.

Name: Gem
Lore: Female Minoran empath. Tested by the Vians as a representative of her planet. Saved Dr. McCoy. Her willingness to sacrifice her own life saved her people.
Text: CIVILIAN Empathy x 2 Honor

Name: Grebnedlog
Lore: We are Pakleds. Our ship is the Mondor. We look for things. We want to be nothing if not persistent.
Text: OFFICER Greed Anthropology DL/ {We Look for Things} Once per game, may capture one ENGINEER here.

Name: Jenok
Lore: Representative of young Romulan scientists trained in frontier exploration. Cited for his work exploring uninhabited planets.
Text: SCIENCE Geology Exobiology Youth

Name: Kalenna
Lore: Female Romulan. Member of task force sent to destroy the Founders. Helped Julian Bashir, Worf, and Elim Garak escape from Internment Camp 371.
Text: SECURITY Anthropology Biology Honor

Name: Keras
Lore: Expert strategist. Followed orders despite misgivings about provoking another war with the Federation. In a different reality, he could have called Kirk friend.
Text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Astrophysics Geology Honor DL/ {Engage Cloak} DL/ {Auto-Destruct Sequence}

Name: Kered
Lore: Klingon soldier reporting to Governor Kor. Stationed on planet Organia in 2267. On Kor's orders, helped round up Organian citizens for execution.
Text: SECURITY MEDICAL Archaeology

Name: Kira
Lore: Ironically, Kira Nerys trained Legate Damar's freedom fighters in Resistance tactics. The Bajoran accepted a Starfleet commission to help ease the racial tensions.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Resistance SECURITY Navigation Honor x 2 X=3 vs. [Dom].

Name: Korax
Lore: First officer of the I.K.C. Gr'oth under Captain Koloth. Klingon expert on Regulan blood worms and Denebian slime devils. Outspoken critic of Captain Kirk.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Physics Exobiology

Name: Kras
Lore: Klingon who tried to acquire topaline mining rights on Capella IV. Interfered in Capellan politics by supporting Maab's attempt to overthrow Teer Akaar.
Text: OFFICER Acquisition Geology Treachery Navigation

Name: Lam
Lore: Breen soldier. One of Thot Gor's bodyguards. Secretly questions the advisability of the Dominion/Breen Alliance. As cold as a winter on his home planet.
Text: SECURITY Anthropology Computer Skill

Name: Liam Bilby
Lore: Low-ranking Orion Syndicate member. Obeys Raimus, his superior, in order to protect his wife and children. Holds that family is "the most important thing."
Text: CIVILIAN Honor Treachery Geology Leadership Orion Syndicate

Name: Lt. Bailey
Lore: Junior navigator of the starship Enterprise. Rapidly promoted by Captain Kirk. Remained on the Fesarius with Balok as an intercultural "exchange student."
Text: OFFICER Navigation Anthropology Diplomacy Stellar Cartography

Name: Lt. Bashir
Lore: When a chance encounter with Lt. Watley in 2267 suggested a predestination paradox, Julian Bashir began to believe he was his own great-grandfather.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology Biology DL/ {Classic Medical Tricorder}

Name: Lt. D'Amato
Lore: Senior geologist aboard the starship Enterprise. Eager to study a mysterious asteroid discovered in 2268.
Text: SCIENCE Geology x 2 Archaeology

Name: Lt. Dax
Lore: Though Jadzia Dax had never met the handsome Mr. Spock, the Trill fondly recalled her symbiont's encounter with Dr. McCoy: "He had the hands of a surgeon."
Text: SCIENCE Archaeology Astrophysics Anthropology DL/ {Classic Tricorder}

Name: Lt. Grant
Lore: Typical security officer aboard the starship Enterprise. Eager to join the landing party to Capella IV, which he hopes will be the first of many such assignments.
Text: SECURITY May replace your [OS] personnel present who was just randomly selected to die. Honor

Name: Lt. Nagata
Lore: Starship Enterprise engineering assistant. Discovered "Ensign" O'Brien incompetently performing a maintenance task.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Geology Honor Youth

Name: Lt. Sisko
Lore: Benjamin Sisko posed as a 23rd-century Starfleet lieutenant to thwart Barry Waddle's plot to kill Captain Kirk. Couldn't resist talking to the legendary captain.
Text: OFFICER Leadership ENGINEER Diplomacy Navigation May report where {Captain Kirk} is present (for free).

Name: Lt. Sulu
Lore: Originally assigned to the starship Enterprise as senior physicist, Hikaru Sulu quickly transferred to the helm. Hobbies include botany, fencing, and antique firearms.
Text: OFFICER Physics Navigation Biology SCIENCE If on {Starship Enterprise}, it is WEAPONS +2.

Name: Lt. Uhura
Lore: Dedicated communications officer of the starship Enterprise. Opened hailing frequencies countless times. In Swahili, her name means "freedom."
Text: OFFICER Youth Computer Skill Music ENGINEER Navigation DL/ {Hail}

Name: Lt. Watley
Lore: Dierdre Watley recently transferred from the Lexington to the starship Enterprise. Plays flute and piccolo. Julian Bashir speculated that she was his great-grandmother.
Text: SCIENCE MEDICAL Youth Music Stellar Cartography

Name: Lucsly
Lore: Agent of the Department of Temporal Investigations. Calculates dates over a century old to the exact day of the week. Hates predestination paradoxes.
Text: SCIENCE Computer Skill MEDICAL Law DL/ {Temporal Investigations}

Name: Lumba
Lore: In a play to convince Nilva to support Grand Nagus Zek's reinstatement, Quark was altered to appear female.
Text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Biology DL/ {Nilva} Doubles first-listed skill of each [Univ] [Fer] male present. May nullify gender-related dilemmas where present.

Name: Mordoc
Lore: Security officer assigned to Taar's marauder. Member of Letek's away team to Portal 63's planet.
Text: SECURITY Astrophysics

Name: Mr. Scott
Lore: Chief engineer of the starship Enterprise. Nicknamed "Scotty." Big enough to take a few insults.
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Leadership Astrophysics Transporter Skill DL/ {Classic Type II Phaser} If on a Constitution-class ship, it is attributes all +2.

Name: Mr. Spock
Lore: Highly logical starship Enterprise first officer. First Vulcan in Starfleet. Suppresses his human half. Fascinating.
Text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Computer Skill Exobiology Music OFFICER Mindmeld x 2 DL/ {Vulcan Nerve Pinch} If with {Captain Kirk}, both are attributes all +2.

Name: Nilz Baris
Lore: Federation undersecretary in charge of Agricultural Affairs. Assigned to oversee development of Sherman's Planet. Misused the priority-one distress channel.
Text: V.I.P. Biology Law OR Diplomacy (change at any time). DL/ {Incoming Message - Federation} (to any location).

Name: Odo (The Trouble with Tribbles)
Lore: Odo donned civilian clothes and went aboard Deep Space Station K-7 in 2267 to search for an explosive tribble. Recently made human by the Great Link.
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY x 2 Computer Skill Honor DL/ {Classic Communicator}

Name: Reginod
Lore: We are Pakleds. We have an engineer. He is Reginod.
Text: ENGINEER Greed Geology Physics DL/ {Plasmadyne Relay} Once per game, may steal one hand weapon present.

Name: Sarish Rez
Lore: Adjutant to First Minister Shakaar. Referred to by the First Minister as his entire "senior staff." Used to tend the gardens outside the Chamber of Ministers.
Text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Transporter Skill Biology DL/ {First Minister Shakaar} OR {Senior Staff Meeting}

Name: Six of Thirteen
Lore: Identification: SCOUT DRONE Task: Implement initial reconnaissance. Evaluate. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Astrophysics Immune to {Thine Own Self}. If present when your {Adapt: Negate Obstruction} is nullified, you may place it beneath draw deck.

Name: The Centurion
Lore: Senior advisor and science officer aboard Gal Gath'thong during 2266 Neutral Zone incursion. Cautioned Keras to proceed carefully against the starship Enterprise.
Text: SCIENCE Exobiology Stellar Cartography Honor Other Romulans at this location are attributes all +1.

Name: Third of Five
Lore: Identification: TACTIC DRONE Task: Survey. Compile tactical data. Encode. Report. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Geology Stellar Cartography Biology If on your {Borg Scout Vessel}, it is attributes all +2 (or +4 in Alpha Quadrant). DL/ {Hugh}

Name: Thopok
Lore: Lady Grilka's bodyguard and would-be suitor. Bad-tempered commander of the guard for the House of Grilka. Despises the Ferengi coward Son of Keldar.
Text: SECURITY Biology Transporter Skill DL/ {Bat'leth}

Name: Thot Gor
Lore: General in the Breen Confederacy. Key figure in forging the Dominion/Breen Alliance. Respects the Founder. Accepts Weyoun. Disregards Damar.
Text: OFFICER Your Breen and Jem'Hadar ships in battle together are each WEAPONS +2. Leadership x 2 MEDICAL

Name: Thot Pran
Lore: Breen general. Successor to Thot Gor. Ordered the installation of Breen weaponry on Jem'Hadar ships. Seeks to secure Romulus and Earth for the Breen.
Text: OFFICER Archaeology Exobiology Transporter Skill

Name: Tumek
Lore: Klingon elder. Longtime advisor and attendant to the House of Kozak. Conducted brek'tal ritual for the Lady Grilka and her Ferengi mate, Quark Son of Keldar.
Text: CIVILIAN Exobiology Honor SCIENCE Law DL/ {Grilka}

Name: Varat'idan
Characteristics/ Keywords: Jem'Hadar; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Typical Jem'Hadar soldier. Fifth. Assigned to Terok Nor while station was occupied by the Dominion. Drilled in station defense tactics.
Text: SECURITY Astrophysics Geology

Name: Velal
Lore: Romulan general. Commander of the Romulan fleet at the close of the Dominion war. Committed the Romulan Star Empire to the final attack on Cardassia.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Transporter Skill Archaeology Captain's Log is +1 on your D'deridex-class ships.

Name: Worf (The Trouble with Tribbles)
Lore: 24th-century Klingon disguised as a 23rd-century trader. Brought back in time by Barry Waddle. Refused to discuss the mystery of the Klingon forehead ridges.
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Navigation Anthropology Once per game, may capture {Barry Waddle} if present.

Name: Yint
Lore: Typical arms dealer. Humanoid who sold three defective Klingon disruptor rifles to Liam Bilby. Refused refund.
Text: CIVILIAN Treachery Stellar Cartography Transporter Skill DL/ {Any Disruptor Rifle}

Name: Q-Type Android
Lore: Think fast, Commander Riker.
Text: Opponent places dilemma on one non-[Holo] Personnel at this location, then chooses: If android, all copies of that card become human (STRENGTH -4); otherwise, becomes Q-type androids (STRENGTH +4) OR if non-[Bor], seed that personnel under an unsolved {Q's Planet}; discard dilemma. (May be nullified only by {Mortal Q} or {any William T. Riker} present.)

Name: Bajoran Raider
Lore: Nimble fighter used by the Bajoran resistance during the occupation. Kira Nerys commanded one in 2370.
Text: Once each turn, may report with 2 personnel, take off, or land. X=4 if moving within a region.

Name: Bok'Nor
Lore: Old freighter suspected of transporting weapons to Cardassian colonies in the Demilitarized Zone. Briefly commanded by Boheeka early in his military career.
Text: Smuggling personnel in crew may use hand weapons to complete "{cargo runs.}"

Name: Breen Warship
Characteristics/ Keywords: Breen ship; Dominion ship; Energy Dampener; Tractor Beam; Warship;
Lore: Employs biological technology. Used in attack on San Francisco in 2375. Thot Gor commanded one.
Text: Your Breen may report aboard. Energy Dampener, Tractor Beam

Name: Brunt's Shuttle
Lore: Personal shuttle commanded by Brunt during his numerous liquidations. Transported Quark's rag-tag negotiation team to Empok Nor to rescue Ishka.
Text: May report with up to 3 personnel to docking site of an {Empok Nor} you don t control.

Name: Columbus
Lore: Typical Starfleet shuttlecraft, circa 2260s. Assisted in the search for the missing Galileo 7.
Text: May be reported, carried, and launched aboard your Constitution-class ships.

Name: Dominion Battleship
Characteristics/ Keywords: Battleship; Dominion ship; Holodeck; Invasive Transporters; Jem'Hadar Ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Massive Jem'Hadar battleship developed during the Alpha Quadrant war. One easily withstood an ill-conceived attack by the U.S.S. Valiant in 2374.
Text: Holodeck, Invasive Transporters, Tractor Beam

Name: Gal Gath'thong
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Commanded by Keras during the incursion of Neutral Zone in 2266. Possibly the first Romulan ship with a cloaking device. Named for the firefalls on Romulus.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ {Any Romulan [OS] personnel}

Name: I.K.C. Gr'oth
Lore: Battle cruiser commanded by Koloth. Dispatched to Federation station K-7, under pretense of shore leave, to further the Empire's plans for Sherman's Planet.
Text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any Klingon [OS] personnel}

Name: I.K.C. Ning'tao
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Bird-of-Prey commanded by Kor in 2375. Held off a fleet of ten pursuing Jem'Hadar warships. Presumed lost in glorious battle. Now the subject of legend.
Text: SHIELDS +2 for each opposing [Dom] ship here. Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: Mondor
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Particle Scattering Device; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Commanded by Grebnedlog. Uses technology stolen from Romulans, Jarada, other races - and Geordi La Forge. "We are strong now. We have better weapons."
Text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Particle Scattering Device, Tractor Beam

Name: Starship Constitution
Lore: Class ship. Heavy cruiser designation. Mainstay of the Federation Starfleet in the 2260s. Registry number NCC-1700.
Text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [Univ] Federation [OS] personnel}

Name: Starship Enterprise
Lore: Original U.S.S. Enterprise. Starfleet registry number NCC-1701. Responded to Deep Space Station K-7 distress call in 2267. Commanded by Captain Kirk.
Text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any Federation [OS] personnel}

Name: Stolen Attack Ship
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian ship; Dominion ship; Energy Dampener; Federation ship; Invasive Transporters; Jem'hadar Attack Ship; Jem'Hadar Ship;
Lore: Jem'Hadar attack ship briefly commanded by Luaran. Upgraded with Breen weapons technology. Stolen by members of Damar's rebellion; commanded by Kira.
Text: Energy Dampener, Invasive Transporters

Name: Weyoun's Warship
Characteristics/ Keywords: Dominion ship; Invasive Transporters; Jem'Hadar Ship; Tractor Beam; Warship;
Lore: Jem'Hadar warship under the command of Weyoun. Stationed at Terok Nor during the Dominion/Cardassian reoccupation of the mining station.
Text: Invasive Transporters, Tractor Beam DL/ {Engage Shuttle Operations: Dominion}

Name: Bajoran Shrine
Requires: disruptor; Kai; Orb artifact; Prylar; Vedek;
Text: Prylars, Vedeks, and Kais may report here. Once each turn, any player who has a Prylar, Vedek, or Kai unopposed here with any other Bajoran may "conduct services": discard one card from hand, place bottom card of discard pile beneath draw deck or out-of-play, then draw one card (or two if any Orb artifact is present). Unless station is under [Baj] or [Fed] control, Shrine is suspended and may be destroyed by any personnel using {a disruptor} at an adjacent site. {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

Name: Bajoran Phaser Banks
Text: Attack: 1. Defense: 1. ATTACK and DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a Bajoran ship firing with Resistance or Navigation aboard (or +4 if one crew member has both skills). Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

Name: Breen Disruptor Burst
Text: Attack: 1. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +3 if you have a Breen ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

Name: Breen Energy-Dampening Weapon
Text: Attack: 3. Defense: 1. Requires a ship with Energy Dampener firing. Hit or direct hit = [Down][Flip] and, unless target is {U.S.S. Sao Paulo}, is {I.K.C. Ki'tang}, or has Energy Dampener, "power surge" also disables RANGE and WEAPONS. Hull: -20% Power surge: special equipment off line. Discard this damage marker at end of opponent's next turn.

Name: Chain Reaction Pulsar
Text: Attack: 5. Defense: 0. Requires a staffed ship which has three or more staffing icons firing. ATTACK bonus +1 if Akira class. Hit or direct hit = [Down] and nullifies one Event card enhancing target's attributes (once per turn). Hull: -35% Scanners off line: you may play {Scan} and {Full Planet Scan} only where you have an undamaged ship.

Name: Sherman's Peak
Lore: 105 years, 1 month, and 12 days ago - a Friday.
Text: Seeds or plays on table; download {Deep Space Station K-7} here. Any players may download {Organian Peace Treaty}. If a {Tribble Bomb} at this location is nullified by being examined, also nullifies {Hero of the Empire}. Native to this timeline: all cards with both [OS] icon and [AU] icon (except [MQ] cards).

Name: 1 Tribble - Bonus
Text: May report anywhere. Each non-Klingon present is CUNNING -1. Once every turn, may "stop" one personnel present (random selection).

Name: 1 Tribble - Discard
Text: May report anywhere. Each non-Klingon present is CUNNING -1. Once every turn, may "stop" one personnel present (random selection).

Name: 1 Tribble - Go
Text: May report anywhere. Each non-Klingon present is CUNNING -1. Once every turn, may "stop" one personnel present (random selection).

Name: 1,000 Tribbles - Bonus
Text: Breeds from {100 tribbles}. Each personnel present loses their first-listed skill. Prevents {Ooby Dooby} card draws at this location.

Name: 1,000 Tribbles - Discard
Text: Breeds from {100 tribbles}. Each personnel present loses their first-listed skill. Prevents {Ooby Dooby} card draws at this location.

Name: 1,000 Tribbles - Rescue
Text: Breeds from {100 tribbles}. Each personnel present loses their first-listed skill. Prevents {Ooby Dooby} card draws at this location.

Name: 10 Tribbles - Bonus
Text: May report anywhere. Each Klingon present is INTEGRITY -1 and, unless {Divok} is present, loses their first-listed skill.

Name: 10 Tribbles - Go
Text: May report anywhere. Each Klingon present is INTEGRITY -1 and, unless {Divok} is present, loses their first-listed skill.

Name: 10 Tribbles - Poison
Text: May report anywhere. Each Klingon present is INTEGRITY -1 and, unless {Divok} is present, loses their first-listed skill.

Name: 10,000 Tribbles - Go
Text: Breeds from {1,000 Tribbles}. Where present, mission attempts require 2 Exobiology. Cancels probing on non-Dilemma cards at (and [BO] cards targeting) this location.

Name: 10,000 Tribbles - Poison
Text: Breeds from {1,000 Tribbles}. Where present, mission attempts require 2 Exobiology. Cancels probing on non-Dilemma cards at (and [BO] cards targeting) this location.

Name: 10,000 Tribbles - Rescue
Text: Breeds from {1,000 Tribbles}. Where present, mission attempts require 2 Exobiology. Cancels probing on non-Dilemma cards at (and [BO] cards targeting) this location.

Name: 100 Tribbles - Bonus
Text: Breeds from {10 Tribbles}. Where present, mission attempts require 2 Leadership. If on a planet, prevents scoring of {Colony} points there.

Name: 100 Tribbles - Poison
Text: Breeds from {10 Tribbles}. Where present, mission attempts require 2 Leadership. If on a planet, prevents scoring of {Colony} points there.

Name: 100 Tribbles - Rescue
Text: Breeds from {10 Tribbles}. Where present, mission attempts require 2 Leadership. If on a planet, prevents scoring of {Colony} points there.

Name: 100,000 Tribbles - Clone
Text: Breeds from {10,000 Tribbles}. Where present, prevents personnel from reporting "for free." If on a planet when that mission solved, reduces its points by 10.

Name: 100,000 Tribbles - Discard
Text: Breeds from {10,000 Tribbles}. Where present, prevents personnel from reporting "for free." If on a planet when that mission solved, reduces its points by 10.

Name: 100,000 Tribbles - Rescue
Text: Breeds from {10,000 Tribbles}. Where present, prevents personnel from reporting "for free." If on a planet when that mission solved, reduces its points by 10.

Name: ... in the Engine Room
Lore: Aye, they're into the machinery, all right. And they're probably into all the food processors, too.
Text: 100: On a ship, reduces WEAPONS -1 and RANGE -1. 1,000: On a ship, it is "stopped" after each of its moves unless 3 ENGINEER aboard. At an {Ore Processing Unit}, suspends {Process Ore}.

Name: ... in the Transporters
Lore: So numerous were tribbles on the starship Enterprise that some were beamed to K-7 along with Captain Kirk and Mr. Spock.
Text: 100 (or {Tribble Bomb}): On a ship or facility, when any personnel present moves away from this group, up to 10 of this group's tribbles (and/or your Tribble Bomb present) may go with that personnel; discard trouble.

Name: ... on the Bridge
Lore: The starship Enterprise crew suffered numerous tribble distractions, not the least of which was Kirk sitting on one.
Text: 100: On a ship, suspends attribute enhancements related to its matching commander. 1,000: Where present, limits each mission attempt to 10 personnel.

Name: ... on the Station
Lore: 1,771,561 tribbles managed to find their way into virtually every part of Deep Space Station K-7 and surrounding ships.
Text: 1,000: Just after this group breeds, up to 100 of its tribbles may "spread" (move) to an adjacent site or into/out of a facility or a landed, docked, or carried ship; discard trouble. 10,000: At {Bajoran Shrine}, prevents "conducting services."

Name: Alien Parasites & REM Fatigue
Text: ALIEN PARASITES: Unless INTEGRITY>32, Away Team (if any) beams back and opponent immediately controls ship and crew until "stopped." REM FATIGUE HALLUCINATIONS: Crew or Away Team dies at end of your third full turn unless cured by 3 MEDICAL OR docking at outpost.

Name: Anaphasic Organism & Nagilum
Text: ANAPHASIC ORGANISM: Unless SECURITY and MEDICAL present, female crew or Away Team member with highest total attributes resigns (is discarded). (Not repeatable.) NAGILUM: Half of crew or Away Team is killed (random selection, round down) unless 3 Diplomacy OR STRENGTH>40 present. Discard dilemma.

Name: Ancient Computer & Microvirus
Characteristics/ Keywords: MEDICAL-related dilemma; SCIENCE-related dilemma; Virus-related dilemma;
Text: ANCIENT COMPUTER: To get past requires 2 Computer Skill OR 3 SCIENCE OR 3 ENGINEER. MICROVIRUS: Unless MEDICAL and SECURITY present, kills one crew or Away Team member (opponent's choice). Discard dilemma.

Name: Computer Weapon & Hyper-Aging
Text: ICONIAN COMPUTER WEAPON: Unless SCIENCE present, re-boot by discarding all non-Personnel cards in hand and replenishing from top of draw deck. (Not repeatable.) [4] HYPER-AGING: Entire crew or Away Team is quarantined (dies when countdown expires). Cure with SCIENCE and 2 MEDICAL.

Name: Female's Love Interest & Garbage Scow
Text: FEMALE'S LOVE INTEREST: Female crew or Away Team member (random selection) runs off with lover to furthest planet. RADIOACTIVE GARBAGE SCOW: Place on mission; mission attempt ends. Mission can't be attempted here. Ship with Tractor Beam and 2 ENGINEER can tow Scow.

Name: Male's Love Interest & Plague Ship
Text: MALE'S LOVE INTEREST: Male crew or Away Team member (random selection) runs off with lover to furthest planet. TARELLIAN PLAGUE SHIP: Entire crew or Away Team immediately dies unless MEDICAL beams over (discarded). Discard dilemma.

Name: Covert Installation II
Lore: Build station.
Text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Treachery WORMHOLE: You may move your staffed ship between here and any other location if that location is a [Wmh] mission OR by playing one {Wormhole} interrupt there. Then flip this mission over.

Name: Excavation II
Lore: Assist new archaeological dig.
Text: Archaeology OR CUNNING>32 WORMHOLE: You may move your staffed ship between here and any other location if that location is a [Wmh] mission OR by playing one {Wormhole} interrupt there. Then flip this mission over.

Name: Explore Black Cluster II
Lore: Study and evaluate collapsed proto-stars.
Text: Stellar Cartography + Leadership OR CUNNING>50 If destroyed, flip mission over.

Name: Explore Typhon Expanse II
Lore: Trace reported time distortion.
Text: Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography OR CUNNING>50 If destroyed, flip mission over.

Name: Investigate Anomaly II
Lore: Trace radiation anomalies.
Text: Exobiology + STRENGTH>35 If destroyed, flip mission over.

Name: Investigate Sighting II
Lore: Investigate sighting of Gomtuu.
Text: Empathy x3 OR Treachery + Exobiology + CUNNING>40 If destroyed, flip mission over.

Name: Relief Mission II
Lore: Alleviate Ice Age conditions.
Text: Geology OR Physics WORMHOLE: You may move your staffed ship between here and any other location if that location is a [Wmh] mission OR by playing one {Wormhole} interrupt there. Then flip this mission over.

Name: Secret Salvage II
Lore: Retrieve wreckage at Borg massacre site.
Text: Treachery x 4 OR Navigation x 2 + Computer Skill If destroyed, flip mission over.

Name: Test Mission II
Lore: Aid helium ignition project.
Text: Physics + INTEGRITY>28 If destroyed, flip mission over.

Name: Beverly and Will
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human/Barkonian; Barkonian; Dual Personnel; Female; Male;
Lore: When Data was lost with amnesia on Barkon IV, his human shipmates Beverly Crusher and William T. Riker disguised themselves as Barkonians to find him.
Text: CIVILIAN+CIVILIAN Beverly: MEDICAL x 2 Biology DL/ {Any tricorder} Will: Navigation Diplomacy Anthropology

Name: Data and Geordi
Characteristics/ Keywords: Android/Human; Dual Personnel; Male; Soong-type android;
Lore: When the Soong-type android Data began feeling emotions secretly generated by Lore, Geordi La Forge performed a series of diagnostics on him.
Text: OFFICER+ENGINEER Data: ENGINEER Music Computer Skill Geordi: ENGINEER Physics DL/ {Tricorder}

Name: Data and Picard
Characteristics/ Keywords: Android/Human/Romulan; Captain; Dual Personnel; Male; Soong-type android;
Lore: To search for Spock on Romulus, the Soong-type android Data and his human captain, Jean-Luc Picard, disguised themselves as Romulan citizens.
Text: CIVILIAN+CIVILIAN Data: ENGINEER Astrophysics Computer Skill Picard: Diplomacy Anthropology Archaeology

Name: Jean-Luc and Beverly
Lore: Escaping from their captors on Kesprytt III, Jean-Luc Picard and Beverly Crusher discovered they had been telepathically linked by psi-wave implants.
Text: OFFICER+MEDICAL Jean-Luc: Diplomacy Archaeology Honor Beverly: MEDICAL Exobiology DL/ {Hypospray}

Name: Sons of Mogh
Lore: Klingon brothers. Kurn and Worf fought together during the Klingon Civil War of 2367-68 to help Gowron restore stability and honor to the Empire.
Text: OFFICER+SECURITY Kurn: Honor Computer Skill Navigation Worf: Honor x 2 Navigation Diplomacy

Name: The Trois
Characteristics/ Keywords: Betazoid/Human; Capturing-related card; Dual Personnel; Female;
Lore: Tog abducted the Betazoid Lwaxana Troi and her half-human daughter Deanna Troi, beamed them out of their clothes, and planned to exploit their skills.
Text: V.I.P.+CIVILIAN Lwaxana: Empathy x 2 Diplomacy DL/ {Wolf} Deanna: Diplomacy Empathy DL/ {Plexing}

Name: Tantalus Field
Lore: Alien device that vaporizes victims at the touch of a button. Used by James Tiberius Kirk to achieve his captaincy. A Kirk not from his universe revealed its secret to First Officer Spock.
Text: Place on your [MQ] ship here. (Unique.) Once each turn, may discard top card of draw deck to kill a [Univ] personnel here OR discard top three to kill a unique personnel here.

Name: A Fast Ship Would Be Nice
Lore: The mirror universe version of Bareil Antos unexpectedly beamed aboard Deep Space 9 and took Kira Nerys hostage. He demanded a ship in exchange for her life.
Text: Kills one personnel (opponent's choice). You may substitute a bodyguard or {Guard Drone} present OR an empty ship here (moved to opponent's side of spaceline; commandeered).

Name: Artillery Attack
Lore: The Gorn attackers responsible for eradicating an outpost on Cestus III turned their deadly weaponry on the Enterprise landing party dispatched to investigate.
Text: Kills X personnel (random selection); immediately probe: [*]: X = number of [*] icons on probe card. [Equipment]: X = 0 (discard probe card). Otherwise: X = 1.

Name: Chula: The Game
Lore: Shortly after discovery of the Bajoran wormhole in 2369, a delegation of Wadi visitors arrived from the Gamma Quadrant. They coerced Quark into playing their unusual game of chula.
Text: Unless one personnel present has Greed and Treachery OR Greed and CUNNING>7, crew or Away Team is "stopped" until end of your next turn. Discard dilemma.

Name: Denevan Neural Parasites
Lore: Deadly flying parasites decimated the populations of Levinius V, Theta Cygni XII, Ingraham B, and finally Deneva, where they killed George Samuel Kirk and his wife, Aurelan.
Text: Attacks half of Away Team (random selection, round up). You may protect one selected personnel for each {phaser}, {disruptor}, or unselected [Def] Borg present; others are killed.

Name: Distraction
Lore: You aren't very persistent, Mr. Sulu. The game has rules; you're ignoring them. I protest... and you come back. You didn't... come... back.
Text: One male or female present (random selection) "distracts" a personnel of the opposite gender (opponent's choice). If neither has Honor, both are "stopped."

Name: Emergency Conversion
Lore: With the field density between the mirror universe and their own closing quickly, Mr. Scott and Dr. McCoy rushed to complete modifications to the transporters.
Text: To get past requires 2 Astrophysics and Transporter Skill.

Name: Gorn Encounter
Lore: Large reptilian humanoid. Pitted against Captain Kirk by the Metrons in a contest of wits and brute strength. Showed no mercy.
Text: Attacks personnel with most Leadership (opponent's choice if tie or none). Killed unless printed (CUNNING or STRENGTH) + (number of [*] icons) > 12. Discard dilemma.

Name: Horta
Lore: Silicon-based life-form native to Janus VI. Every 50,000 years, all Horta die off except one, which must repopulate the species through egg laying. Will kill to protect its young.
Text: Place on planet. Now and end of every player's turn, kills one of that player's personnel present (random selection). Cure with 2 Leadership, 2 Mindmeld, and 2 Exobiology.

Name: Kelvan Show of Force
Lore: Aliens from the Andromeda Galaxy demonstrated their power to Captain Kirk by distilling two crew members to their chemical components. Crushing a container instantly killed the victim.
Text: To get past, two non-android, non-holographic personnel present are selected (opponent's choice). One of those two is "crushed" (killed, random selection).

Name: Quantum Fissure
Lore: A fragile intersection of countless parallel realities. An attempt to scan one using a subspace differential pulse was interrupted by a Bajoran warship - with disastrous results.
Text: To get past requires Astrophysics and Physics. Also, cannot get past if opponent has a ship here with two or more staffing icons that is staffed, undocked, and undamaged.

Name: Royale Casino: Slots
Lore: A U.S.S. Enterprise away team became trapped in an illusory world based on the badly written Hotel Royale, a Todd Matthews novel filled with "endless clich and shallow characters."
Text: Show a personnel from hand; if two of its attributes match, win points (if all three, win double points). Otherwise, lose points.

Name: Bajoran Wormhole: Mirror Universe
Text: Seeds (in any phase) or plays in Mirror Quadrant. Limit one. Inserts into spaceline to create a Bajor Region location (span 1); any player may download {Bajoran Wormhole}. Any ship may move between here and another Bajoran Wormhole if damaged or if ENGINEER and SCIENCE aboard, then is "stopped." OR Plays at any time to nullify any card which is closing or destroying Bajoran Wormhole (discard doorway).

Name: The Guardian of Forever
Text: Plays on planet {Gateway} (limit one). Once per turn, one or more personnel present may time travel to a time location in this quadrant, or may return here from there (with any of owner's other personnel present). OR Plays once each turn to nullify any card that is closing Guardian, or to draw up to four cards if your Archaeology or Anthropology personnel just time traveled back to Guardian; place doorway out-of-play.

Name: Agonizer
Lore: Pain-inflicting device developed by the Terran Empire. Fear of punishment drives crew members to maintain maximum efficiency at all times. Ensures alertness, loyalty, and obedience.
Text: Where present, each of your [MQ] personnel and [OS] Klingons is INTEGRITY and CUNNING +1. (Cumulative up to +3.)

Name: Classic Disruptor
Lore: Standard phase-disruption weapon used in the mid-23rd century. Technology shared between the Klingon and Romulan Empires during their brief alliance in the late 2260s.
Text: Klingon and Romulan use only. Each of your [OS] personnel present is STRENGTH +2 (cumulative). Each of your [OS] leaders present adds SECURITY.

Name: Ferengi Whip
Lore: Unconventional hand weapon. High-energy plasma discharge renders victims unconscious. Difficult to wield, it was phased out of use after a number of embarrassing accidents.
Text: Each of your Ferengi present is STRENGTH +2, and in each battle one of them may stun one adversary they just engaged. (Cumulative.)

Name: Mirror Dagger
Lore: Small blade weapon used for personal protection. Ubiquitous in the mirror universe. Quite handy when an unexpected career-advancement opportunity presents itself.
Text: Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +1. (Cumulative.) May report to a [MQ] facility for free OR to a just-initiated personnel battle involving your [MQ] card(s).

Name: Multidimensional Transport Device
Lore: Modifies transporter function to allow beaming to an alternate universe. Developed in the mirror universe. Used by Smiley, Professor Sisko, the Intendant, and others to cross over.
Text: Reports in Alpha or Mirror Quadrant. Twice each turn, where present, allows transporters to beam to opposite quadrant (anywhere at corresponding location), ignoring all SHIELDS.

Name: Romulan Cloaking Device
Lore: 23rd-century device based on prototype successfully tested on the Gal Gath'thong. After one was lost to a Federation spy operation in 2268, the technology was revised and enhanced.
Text: Reports only aboard your Romulan ship or to {Sherman's Peak}. While on your Romulan ship (or your [OS] ship with 2 ENGINEER aboard), ship has a Cloaking Device.

Name: Self-Sealing Stem Bolts
Lore: Used in producing reverse-ratcheting routing planers. Jake and Nog traded 5,000 wrappages of yamok sauce for 100 gross of stem bolts, which they sold for seven tessipates of Bajoran land.
Text: Once each turn, may be downloaded from draw deck to replace (discard) your other Equipment card at a homeworld (or vice versa if you have {any Jake} or {any Nog} present).

Name: Stolen Cloaking Device
Lore: Regent Worf detained Zek in the mirror universe, demanding a cloaking device as ransom. To save their Nagus, Quark and Rom stole one from a Klingon ship. General Martok was not pleased.
Text: May not report aboard a [MQ] facility. While on your ship with at least one staffing icon, ship has a Cloaking Device. On a [Fed] non-[MQ] ship, to cloak requires [Fed] Treachery aboard.

Name: 35th Rule of Acquisition
Lore: Peace is good for business.
Text: Plays on your Acquisition personnel. End of each turn, if no battles were initiated since end of your last turn, download a {Gold-Pressed Latinum} here OR draw a card. 35th Rule nullifies every {34th Rule}, and vice versa, ignoring {Scepter}.

Name: Blood Screening
Lore: Blood tests are a standard method for exposing changelings. Though infiltrators are eventually found, the random testing engenders distrust among suspicious crew members.
Text: Plays on any shape-shifter who is infiltrating; exposed when countdown expires. Crew or Away Team is quarantined and may not pool their skills. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

Name: Treaty: Federation/Dominion
Lore: Federation and Dominion forces led by Benjamin Sisko and Weyoun worked together in 2372 to attack renegade Jem'Hadar on Vandros IV and destroy their Iconian gateway.
Text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Weyoun} or {Benjamin Sisko} in play). Your Federation and Dominion affiliations recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

Name: Alliance Nor
Lore: Ore mining and processing station representative of facilities used by the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance.
Text: Seeds or plays at any mission in Mirror Quadrant (except in the Badlands Region). [eDS9] {Ops} may not seed or play on this Nor.

Name: Klingon Empire Outpost
Lore: In the mirror universe, the Klingon Empire is a member of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. The Alliance establishes outposts throughout its territory.
Text: Seed one OR build where you have a [KCA] ENGINEER.

Name: Mirror Terok Nor
Lore: Cardassian ore processing facility commandeered by the Terran Rebellion in the mirror universe.
Text: Seeds at {Bajor}. If commandeered, new controller may flip card over. {Quark's Bar} may seed or play here. {Ops} may only seed or play here if [TE] in gametext.

Name: Terran Outpost
Lore: Hidden enclave and meeting place for the Terran rebels of the mirror universe.
Text: Seed one OR build where you have a [TE] ENGINEER. May be seeded or built at {Terran Hideout} if no {headquarters} there.

Name: Terran Rebellion HQ
Lore: Subterranean base of the Terran Rebellion. Hidden on a small planetoid in the treacherous Badlands.
Text: Seeds or plays on {Terran Hideout}; it is now the homeworld of [Fed][TE] cards. Once per turn, one [TE] personnel (except [AU]) OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Agony Booth
Text: Plays on your [MQ] ship. Once every turn, if ship, its crew, or one of its Away Teams solves a mission or wins a battle against opponent's cards, you may draw up to three cards. But whenever they fail a mission attempt or fail to win such a battle, one of your personnel involved (random selection) must do nothing but return to ship (if not already aboard), then is "stopped."

Name: Crossover
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your [MU] personnel may ignore their [MU] icon when reporting OR just after you report {Smiley}, {Benjamin Sisko}, {Professor Sisko}, {Jake Sisko}, {Bareil}, {The Intendant}, {Grand Nagus Zek}, {Maihar'du}, {Ezri}, {Rom}, or {Quark}, you may download a {Multidimensional Transport Device} to that personnel (or vice versa, if you reported Device as your normal card play; discard incident).

Name: Emblem of the Alliance
Text: Seeds or plays on table; you may download {The Art of Diplomacy}. Your [KCA] cards, {Grand Nagus Zek}, {Maihar'du}, {Rom}, and {Quark} may mix and have no affiliation attack restrictions. Once each turn, you may report a [KCA] personnel for free if you have in play a [KCA] leader who names (or is named by) them in lore. {Ore Processing Units} on [MQ] Nors are immune to {Reactor Overload} if 2 ENGINEER present.

Name: Emblem of the Empire
Text: Seeds or plays on table; you may download {The Art of Diplomacy}. Your [TE] cards, {Benjamin Sisko}, {Jake Sisko}, {Rom}, and {Quark} may mix and have no affiliation attack restrictions. Your [TE] facilities and staffed ships are immune to {Navigate Plasma Storms}. {Ore Processing Unit} on {Mirror Terok Nor} is immune to {Reactor Overload} if 2 ENGINEER present, and may {Process Ore} while under [Fed] control.

Name: Hostage Trade
Text: Seeds or plays on table (for free if you hold any captives). (Unique.) {Prisoner Exchange} and {Fajo's Gallery} may each be used only once per turn. Where your personnel are escorting captive(s), you may release any or all of them (relocate to owner's crew or Away Team there) and capture an equal number of other personnel there, then discard incident.

Name: No Way Out
Text: Seeds or plays on table. All personnel must mortally wound and stun their adversaries when possible. Once every turn, if your unique personnel who has 2 Honor or [KW] icon is killed in personnel battle, you may discard incident to place them in your point area (worth points equal to printed INTEGRITY; "in play" for uniqueness only).

Name: The Art of Diplomacy
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [MQ], [Maq], Resistance, and Orion Syndicate personnel who are using a hand weapon may use 2 Treachery as if it were 1 Diplomacy (ignoring reductions from rifles) and, once each turn, may place incident out-of-play to kill one other personnel present. Once per game, you may discard incident to download one hand weapon to one of your personnel who has 2 Treachery.

Name: Transporter Mixup
Text: Seeds or plays on table. (Unique.) If up to four of your personnel are beaming up from a planet in their native quadrant, you may replace (discard) them by downloading an equal number of others to complete the transport. Each [Univ] personnel may be replaced by any [Univ] personnel native to opposite quadrant; others may be replaced only by opposite versions of their personas. Discard incident.

Name: I'm a Doctor, Not a Bricklayer
Lore: Despite his protestations to Captain Kirk, Dr. McCoy treated a grievously wounded Horta. Thermal concrete from the supplies of the starship Enterprise made an excellent wound covering.
Text: Nullifies {Horta}. OR Adds Geology to one MEDICAL personnel until end of turn. OR Once per game, downloads a Geology personnel to your MEDICAL and OFFICER.

Name: Vulcan "Death Grip"
Lore: Vulcan technique which suppresses the life signs of a subject, simulating death until the individual is revived. Spock "killed" his captain in order to prevent Romulans from executing him.
Text: Allows your Vulcan to save your other non-android present who was just mortally wounded or selected to be killed or captured. "Victim" is instead in stasis until end of turn.

Name: Disrupt Alliance
Lore: Conduct sabotage operations on Bajoran homeworld.
Text: SECURITY + CUNNING>30 + 2 [TE] leaders OR {Captain Bashir} When seeded, you may download one {Emblem} card. Opponent's side: No gametext.

Name: Feldomite Rush
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Stake claim and exploit rich feldomite deposits recently struck here.
Text: Geology + Greed + (Treachery x3 OR Law)

Name: Historical Research
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Witness historical events first hand using the Guardian of Forever.
Text: Anthropology x2 + Archaeology x2 + (Honor OR Treachery) When seeded, you may download {The Guardian of Forever}. Opponent's side: No gametext.

Name: Mine Dilithium
Lore: Replenish dilithium supply from world conquered decades ago.
Text: Geology + Transporter Skill Solving player's ships are RANGE +1.

Name: Search for Rebels
Lore: Locate secret base of escaped slaves.
Text: SECURITY + CUNNING>30 + 2 [KCA] leaders OR {Professor Sisko} When seeded, you may download one {Emblem} card. Opponent's side: No gametext.

Name: Construct Starship
Text: Seeds or plays on table. In place of your normal card play, you may download any outpost or {headquarters} (if you have a matching ENGINEER at an appropriate location) OR download {Spacedock} (even to a docking site) OR download a unique ship to your facility that has a Spacedock (if you have an ENGINEER aboard who is that ship's matching commander). Discard objective OR draw no cards this turn.

Name: For Cardassia!
Text: Plays on your Legate (for free if they have Honor). All your Cardassians present are INTEGRITY and STRENGTH +2. When that Legate helps complete {HQ: Secure Homeworld} at {Cardassia Prime}, you may discard objective: download two Cardassians who have Honor OR once per game, place Legate and two other Cardassians who have Honor from that Away Team out-of-play to score points.

Name: The Emperor's New Cloak
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Your Treachery personnel may steal unattended Equipment cards present and, if aboard an opponent's ship that has Cloaking Device, may place objective on ship: it may not be cloaked; steal a {Cloaking Device} Equipment card aboard or download your own aboard. (If you bring Device aboard {any Enterprise} or same ship as {Regent Worf}, discard objective and score points.)

Name: Aramax
Lore: Representative of Cardassians in the mirror universe. Strives to be noticed - without raising the ire of Security Chief Garak. Has done neither thus far.
Text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Greed

Name: Balok
Lore: Humanoid envoy from the First Federation. Gentle, benevolent, and mature adult male, despite his youthful appearance. Enjoys drinking tranya.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Honor Leadership

Name: Bareil
Lore: Skilled thief and decryption expert. Bareil Antos was romantically involved with both the Intendant and Kira Nerys, who gave him an Orb experience.
Text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill x 2 SECURITY Biology Honor Anthropology Treachery DL/ {Any Equipment card}

Name: Captain Bashir
Lore: Hot-headed Terran rebel. Julian Bashir interrogated and tortured the Intendant. One of many "captains" fighting to overthrow the Alliance.
Text: OFFICER Navigation SCIENCE Leadership Biology Smuggling DL/ {Interrogation} OR {Torture}

Name: Captain Dax
Characteristics/ Keywords: Trill; Captain; Female; Trill with symbiont;
Lore: Aggressive, roguish Trill. Host to Dax symbiont. Once the mistress of Mr. Sisko, Jadzia Dax is now romantically involved with Captain Bashir.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Navigation Archaeology Geology Leadership DL/ {Evasive Maneuvers}

Name: Chief Engineer Scott
Lore: Mr. Scott is chief engineer of the I.S.S. Enterprise. Scotty is a relentless taskmaster. His department has the highest rate of turnover on the ship.
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Transporter Skill Stellar Cartography If on a [MQ][OS] ship, it is attributes all +2. Physics

Name: Chief Navigator Chekov
Lore: Ensign Chekov arranged an attack on his captain in the hopes of moving up in rank. Spent time in the I.S.S. Enterprise agony booth for his misguided ambition.
Text: OFFICER Youth Treachery Navigation Astrophysics If on {I.S.S. Enterprise}, it is RANGE and WEAPONS +1.

Name: Chief Surgeon McCoy
Lore: I.S.S. Enterprise chief medical officer. Dr. McCoy runs one of the most feared sickbays in the Empire. Never loses a subject before completing their interrogation.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology Biology Treachery DL/ {Classic Medical Tricorder}

Name: Comm Officer Uhura
Lore: Communications officer aboard the I.S.S. Enterprise. Lt. Uhura is the object of Security Chief Sulu's constant advances. Knows how to handle him.
Text: OFFICER Youth ENGINEER Computer Skill Anthropology Treachery DL/ {Mirror Dagger}

Name: Commander Charvanek
Lore: Female commander of a fleet that intercepted starship Enterprise in 2268. Sought the heart of Mr. Spock.
Text: OFFICER SCIENCE Diplomacy Physics Archaeology Once in play, X = 3 on every {Patrol Neutral Zone} mission (even if already solved).

Name: Commander Leeta
Lore: Leeta is one of the few Bajorans in the mirror universe to join the Terran Rebellion. Responsible for debriefing Ezri following the cloaking device affair.
Text: SECURITY Leadership Diplomacy Youth DL/ {Mission Debriefing}

Name: Crewman Wilson
Lore: Typical crewman on the I.S.S. Enterprise. Seeks any opportunity to be made an officer. Isn't likely to find one on Kirk's ship.
Text: SCIENCE Treachery Stellar Cartography

Name: Dorza
