Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Female; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Female Cardassian in the mirror universe. Science officer aboard Terok Nor. Occasionally keeps high-profile visitors under surveillance for the Intendant.
Text: SCIENCE Biology Stellar Cartography

Name: Dr. Farallon
Lore: Female humanoid from Tyrus VIIA. Scientist who invented the particle fountain mining system. Also developed exocomps.
Text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Physics DL/ {Exocomp} Doubles all {Particle Fountains} in your point area.

Name: Dr. Roger Korby
Lore: The Pasteur of archeological medicine. Christine Chapel's missing fianc . Disappeared on Exo III. Before dying, placed his consciousness in this android body.
Text: MEDICAL Archaeology Computer Skill Cybernetics DL/ {Scorched Hand}

Name: D'vano
Lore: Typical of mid-23rd century Romulan medical staff. Authored several papers studying the effects of cloaking fields and other technology on Romulan physiology.
Text: MEDICAL Computer Skill Transporter Skill Biology

Name: Ensign Davis
Lore: Security guard aboard I.S.S. Enterprise. Easily dispatched by Dr. McCoy and Mr. Scott with the old "you distract him, I'll hit him with the hypo" trick.
Text: SECURITY Treachery

Name: Ensign Gaffney
Lore: Dedicated crewman aboard I.S.S. Enterprise. Abandoned a promising career in the sciences for the greater advancement opportunities in security.
Text: SECURITY Geology Astrophysics

Name: Ezri
Lore: Trill mercenary in the mirror universe. Unlike Ezri Dax, this Ezri is not joined to a symbiont. Partners with Mr. Brunt. Romantically involved with the Intendant.
Text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Transporter Skill Leadership Geology Stellar Cartography DL/ {Crossover}

Name: First Officer Spock
Lore: 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 human. History will record that Mr. Spock rose to command the I.S.S. Enterprise, then reformed the Empire and ultimately caused its downfall.
Text: SCIENCE OFFICER Mindmeld Diplomacy x 2 Honor Transporter Skill DL/ Any [OS] Equipment card

Name: Fontaine
Lore: Enigmatic Terran rebel. In the mirror universe, Vic Fontaine inexplicably fights other Terran rebels. Even more inexplicably, he is not a hologram.
Text: CIVILIAN Navigation Astrophysics MEDICAL Music DL/ Two {disruptors (each must add STRENGTH +2)}.

Name: Gantt
Lore: Typical member of Shakaar resistance cell. Cared for the mortally wounded Kira Taban. Now a part of Kira Nerys' memories of her father's death.
Text: MEDICAL Resistance Anthropology Youth

Name: Gorrus
Lore: Representative security officer serving in the Romulan military, circa 2268. One of two men sent to starship Enterprise in exchange for Captain Kirk and Mr. Spock.
Text: SECURITY Navigation

Name: Jake Sisko
Lore: Federation News Service correspondent - and spy - during the Dominion War. Has his sources.
Text: CIVILIAN Once each turn, if {any PADD} present, may peek at top card of any deck OR file a mission report at any site. Youth Biology DL/ {File Mission Report}

Name: James Tiberius Kirk
Lore: The ruthless Captain Kirk took command of the I.S.S. Enterprise by assassinating Captain Pike. Uses the deadly Tantalus Field to maintain his control.
Text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Treachery x 2 Archaeology DL/ {Tantalus Field} DL/ {Classic Communicator}

Name: Javek Len
Lore: One of many Bajoran nationals living aboard Terok Nor. The Intendant, quite a fan of his talents, often invites him to perform at special functions.
Text: CIVILIAN Music SCIENCE Astrophysics

Name: Korvek
Lore: Typical section head in Regent Worf's crew. Frequent target of the Regent's temperamental outbursts. Finds being a bridge officer to be a mixed blessing.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Transporter Skill Archaeology

Name: Loreva
Lore: Female Klingon representative of medical assistants throughout the Alliance. Sees very few patients, but has assisted in countless interrogations and autopsies.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology

Name: Lt. Kyle
Lore: John Kyle is relief helmsman and transporter technician aboard starship Enterprise. Born in Sheffield, England. Holds level 2 pilot certificate. Studies alien graphology.
Text: ENGINEER Navigation Transporter Skill Anthropology

Name: Lt. Moreau
Lore: Scientist recently assigned to the starship Enterprise. According to Captain Kirk, she seems like a "nice, likeable girl." He thinks they could become friends.
Text: SCIENCE Physics Stellar Cartography

Name: Luaran
Lore: Female Vorta who supervised the installation of Breen weaponry on Dominion ships. Hopes one day her service will bring her to the Founder Leader's attention.
Text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Biology Treachery Physics May report aboard your {Enhanced Attack Ship}.

Name: Marauder
Lore: Terran rebel who faithfully followed Mr. Sisko for many years. Lost an eye in a dangerous stunt.
Text: SECURITY Computer Skill Exobiology

Name: Marlena Moreau
Lore: The mirror version of Lt. Moreau is assigned to the I.S.S. Enterprise chem lab. Romantically involved with James Tiberius Kirk. Likes being a "captain's woman."
Text: SCIENCE Biology Physics Treachery Anthropology DL/ {Classic Tricorder}

Name: Mr. Andrews
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Former Terran slave on Terok Nor in the mirror universe. Liberated when the Rebellion seized control in 2372.
Text: CIVILIAN Biology MEDICAL

Name: Mr. Brunt
Lore: Ferengi mercenary. Very good engineer and cook. Brunt is loyal to his partner, Ezri, with whom he is secretly infatuated. Unfortunately, he's not her type.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Navigation Honor Archaeology When he leaves play, may download {Mr. Quark}.

Name: Mr. Nog
Lore: Nog is thankful to the Intendant for making him the bartender and owner of his uncle's bar. Distrusts tall men. Likes tall women.
Text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Greed Physics Treachery DL/ {Bribery} When he leaves play, may download {Mr. Brunt}.

Name: Mr. Quark
Characteristics/ Keywords: Ferengi; Bartender; Capturing-related card; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Bartender who pretends to work for the Alliance. Quark secretly helps Terran slaves escape from Terok Nor.
Text: CIVILIAN Smuggling Honor Computer Skill x 2 Anthropology Diplomacy DL/ {Rescue Captives} When he leaves play, may download {Mr. Rom}.

Name: Mr. Rom
Lore: Ferengi soldier in the Terran Rebellion. The mirror version of Rom seeks vengeance against the Alliance.
Text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Navigation x 2 Physics Geology When he leaves play, may download {Mr. Nog}.

Name: Mr. Sisko
Lore: After years collecting duties for (and being romantically involved with) the Intendant, the mirror Benjamin Sisko became leader of the Terran Rebellion.
Text: SECURITY Leadership x 2 Biology Navigation Honor Your [TE] personnel (except [AU]) are attributes all +1.

Name: Mr. Tuvok
Lore: Vulcan in the mirror universe. Tuvok is a member of the rebellion that grew from the former Terran Empire. Still doesn't smile.
Text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Mindmeld Exobiology DL/ {Vulcan Mindmeld}

Name: Nurse Chapel
Lore: Christine Chapel is head nurse of the starship Enterprise. Holds degrees in medical archaeology and biological research. Hopelessly attracted to Mr. Spock.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Archaeology Exobiology Reports for free if {Dr. McCoy} or {Mr. Spock} in play.

Name: Overseer Mardel
Lore: Overseer of ore processing on Terok Nor in the mirror universe. Less demanding than his predecessor, Overseer Odo, but just as hated by the Terran slaves.
Text: ENGINEER Exobiology Anthropology Geology

Name: Overseer Odo
Characteristics/ Keywords: Changeling; Male; Shape-shifter; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: The mirror version of Odo supervises ore processing on Terok Nor. Has strict rules of obedience. The only changeling his contemporaries have ever seen.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Geology Computer Skill DL/ {Process Ore}

Name: Professor Sisko
Lore: Scientist who abandoned her work for the Alliance to join the Rebellion at the urging of Benjamin Sisko. Bonded with Jake, the son she would never have.
Text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics {Any Sisko} may report where present (for free if Jake).

Name: Prot
Lore: Ferengi ensign who manned the conn station in Barash's illusion. Riker thought him one of the few elements of the simulation he could get used to.
Text: OFFICER Youth Archaeology Navigation Geology

Name: Regent Worf
Lore: Commander in chief of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance, General Worf rules with an iron fist - often literally.
Text: V.I.P. OFFICER Treachery Leadership Navigation On a [KCA] ship, may select any matching [KCA] personnel aboard as its matching commander. DL/ {Make It So}

Name: Rinox
Lore: Oafish crewman serving Regent Worf. Keeper of the key to Security Chief Garak's restraining collar. Accused the Cardassian of stealing it. Found it in his own boot.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Archaeology Treachery DL/ {Prisoner Escort}

Name: Romara Cal
Lore: Typical of personal physicians employed by important Alliance officials. Assigned to the Intendant. Surprised at how frequently she comes in for an exam.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Physics

Name: Ruk
Lore: Android created millennia ago by the Old Ones of Exo III. Used by Roger Korby as a bodyguard. Occasionally circumvents his programming. Mysterious and spooky.
Text: SECURITY ENGINEER Exobiology Geology

Name: Rukor
Lore: Chief helmsman aboard Regency 1. Survivor of several Badlands expeditions in search of the rebel stronghold - more than any other pilot in the Alliance.
Text: OFFICER Navigation x 2 Astrophysics

Name: Security Chief Garak
Lore: Although the mirror universe Elim Garak hates the Intendant, he is still able to please her now and then. Not Regent Worf's type.
Text: OFFICER Computer Skill SECURITY Biology Treachery x 2 DL/ Any Cardassian Equipment card

Name: Security Chief Sulu
Lore: The mirror universe equivalent of Lt. Sulu is chief of security and second officer aboard I.S.S. Enterprise. Desires command of both the ship and Uhura.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Biology Computer Skill Navigation Treachery DL/ {Classic Type II Phaser}

Name: Smiley
Lore: Second leader of the Terran Rebellion. Miles O'Brien commanded the Defiant, which he helped construct using plans stolen from Deep Space 9.
Text: ENGINEER Navigation Transporter Skill Leadership Anthropology DL/ {Construct Starship} OR {Crossover}

Name: Subcommander Tal
Lore: First officer serving under Commander Charvanek. Traced a communication signal that led to the discovery of Federation spies aboard his ship.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Computer Skill Anthropology DL/ {Intruder Alert!} OR {Classic Disruptor}

Name: Tagus
Lore: Representative security officer serving in the Romulan military. Assigned to bodyguard duties in the capital city on Romulus.
Text: SECURITY Treachery

Name: Taymar Bern
Lore: Representative of security officers serving in the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. Part of the Intendant's elite assault team. Helped track down Professor Sisko.
Text: SECURITY Anthropology Navigation Treachery

Name: Telok
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; Bodyguard; Duras-related; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Served for four years as a bodyguard in the house of Duras. Took a position aboard Terok Nor to escape the unpredictable demands of Lursa and B'Etor.
Text: SECURITY Leadership Computer Skill Treachery Stellar Cartography

Name: The Intendant
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Female; Intendant; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Kira Nerys commands Terok Nor in the mirror universe. Enjoys being intimate with her friends - and enemies.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Navigation Exobiology May replace anyone present who was just targeted by any gender-related dilemma. Treachery x 2

Name: Thomas Paris
Lore: Convicted traitor. Maquis sympathizer. Best pilot Harry Kim has ever seen. In an alternate reality, a bar fight cost Tom Paris his future aboard the U.S.S. Voyager.
Text: CIVILIAN Navigation x 2 Transporter Skill SECURITY Treachery (May convert to Honor for rest of game).

Name: Thrax
Lore: Cardassian forensics expert briefly stationed on Terok Nor during the occupation. Odo's impressions of him were superimposed over a dark memory from his past.
Text: SECURITY Physics Exobiology Law Computer Skill

Name: Transporter Chief Kyle
Lore: Transporter chief aboard the I.S.S. Enterprise. Lt. Kyle was punished by First Officer Spock for failing to compensate for a transporter malfunction in 2267.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Transporter Skill Archaeology DL/ {Agonizer}

Name: T'Vor
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Science officer in the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. Assigned to Terok Nor. Finds the station rife with gossip, backstabbing, and treachery. Likes it that way.
Text: SCIENCE Geology Stellar Cartography

Name: Vartoq
Lore: First officer of the Alliance battle cruiser that intercepted Kira and Bashir's runabout when they first crossed over to the mirror universe.
Text: OFFICER Biology Transporter Skill

Name: Weyoun of Borg
Lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Dominion in a parallel universe. "The knowledge and experience of the Vorta - Weyoun - is part of us now."
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Treachery Law Biology While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Dom].

Name: Wyatt Earp
Lore: Famous lawman, gunfighter, and gambler. Reportedly never passed up an opportunity to earn money. Killed only when he had to. Recreated by the Melkotians.
Text: SECURITY Law Leadership Acquisition DL/ {Captured} (immediately target a Treachery personnel).

Name: Alliance Galor
Lore: Typical Cardassian warship in the mirror universe. Type 3 designation. Part of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance fleet. Stationed at Terok Nor.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Alliance Interceptor
Lore: Bajoran short-range interceptor used in the mirror universe. One of the few military contributions Bajor offers the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance.
Text: May take off or land once each turn. X=4 if moving within a region.

Name: Alliance K'Vort
Lore: Klingon Bird-of-Prey. Standard patrol and pursuit craft of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. One of the most expendable elements of the Regent's fleet.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Alliance Vor'Cha
Lore: Fast and powerful battle cruiser. Backbone of the Alliance fleet. Their only weakness is in their targeting systems; they've been known to chase warp shadows.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Bajoran Warship
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran ship; Cloaking Device; Holodeck; Tractor Beam; Warship;
Lore: In a parallel universe, the Bajorans grew increasingly hostile after overthrowing the Cardassian Empire. This massive ship attacked the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2370.
Text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: Battle Cruiser
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Klingon battle cruiser, circa 2267. Some were provided to the Romulan Star Empire in exchange for cloaking technology. Commander Charvanek captained one.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ Any [Univ] [OS] Klingon or Romulan

Name: Defiant
Lore: Constructed by the Terran Rebellion using stolen plans of the U.S.S. Defiant. Commanded by Benjamin Sisko during the defense of rebel-held Terok Nor.
Text: Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard except shuttlepods)

Name: Enhanced Attack Ship
Characteristics/ Keywords: Dominion ship; Energy Dampener; Invasive Transporters; Jem'hadar Attack Ship; Jem'Hadar Ship;
Lore: Jem'Hadar attack ship constructed in Alpha Quadrant. One of the first Dominion fighter craft upgraded with Breen energy-dampening technology in 2375.
Text: Energy Dampener, Invasive Transporters

Name: Fesarius
Lore: Immense spherical vessel. Flagship of the First Federation. Commanded by Balok.
Text: Your {Balok} may report aboard (for free). Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.C. Ki'tang
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Klingon Bird-of-Prey that fought in the Dominion War. Immune to the Breen energy-dampening weapon due to a fortuitous tritium intermix adjustment.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ {Intermix Ratio}

Name: I.S.S. Constitution
Lore: Typical battle cruiser of the Terran Empire. Outfitted for a variety of mission profiles, including conquest, domination, subjugation, and Imperial enforcement.
Text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [Univ] [TE][OS] personnel}

Name: I.S.S. Enterprise
Lore: Imperial starship. Credited with many successful and profitable missions. I.S.S. Enterprise officers are frequently promoted - usually through assassination.
Text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [TE][OS] personnel}

Name: Mirror Ferengi Shuttle
Lore: Typical Ferengi shuttle in the mirror universe. Used by agents working for the Alliance or the Rebellion - or both. Mr. Brunt commanded one.
Text: Your [MQ] Ferengi and {Ezri} may report aboard (if {Mr. Brunt}, reports for free).

Name: Rebel Interceptor
Lore: Interceptor/fighter used by Terran rebels in the mirror universe. Typically stolen from the Bajorans. Smiley enhanced and commanded this one.
Text: May take off or land once each turn. X=3 if moving within a region.

Name: Regency 1
Lore: Massive flagship of the Klingon/Cardassian Alliance. Commanded by Regent Worf. Has a stolen cloaking device installed - and sabotaged - by Rom.
Text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Stolen Cloaking Device}

Name: Type 18 Shuttlepod
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation ship; No staffing requirement; Shuttlecraft;
Lore: Small shuttlecraft. One commanded by Benjamin Sisko guided a silithium comet through the Bajoran wormhole.
Text: May report with up to 2 Navigation personnel to your Defiant-class ship.

Name: Ops: Mirror Universe
Text: Cards with same [KCA] or [TE] icon as this Nor are considered to match its affiliation for purposes related to its sites. Compatible OFFICER-classification personnel may report here. Any player may, in place of their normal card play, download to an unopposed site on this station one card which may play there (if reporting a ship or personnel, must be of matching affiliation); player draws no cards that turn. Any Computer Skill personnel unopposed here may commandeer station. Any [MQ] Nor: Ops Module

Name: Halkan Council
Lore: Site of dilithium deposits and obstinate inhabitants.
Text: Seeds or plays on table; any players may download one [MQ] Constitution-class ship here. Native to this timeline: all [AU][MU][OS] cards, and all [OS] Equipment cards. Once per turn, one such card reporting at this location may report for free.

Name: Aggressive Behavior
Lore: In 2372, a spaceborne creature attacked U.S.S. Voyager, trying to establish dominance. It perceived the ship as a potential rival.
Text: Unless 2 Anthropology OR Leadership, Anthropology, and CUNNING>35 present, ship is damaged and one crew member is killed (random selection).

Name: Astral Eddy
Lore: Spatial phenomenon created by an intrusion of subspace into normal space. The resulting discharges of plasmatic energy caused the destruction of a Vostigye science station.
Text: Unless Navigation, Physics, and 2 ENGINEER present, one crew member (random selection) is killed.

Name: Civil Unrest
Lore: Civil disobedience can often escalate into full-scale conflict. A peaceful demonstration soon turned violent, entangling Captain Janeway and Tom Paris in a domestic brawl.
Text: Two Away Team members are chosen (random selection). Unless one has Diplomacy, both are "stopped." Mission continues.

Name: Flash Plasma Storm
Lore: Quarantined on a planet due to a viral illness, Janeway and Chakotay were forced to "rough it." They found the sudden plasma storms on the planet as dangerous as their disease.
Text: Kills each Away Team member who has both STRENGTH<6 (ignoring hand weapon enhancements) and CUNNING<9. Nullified if you have {Thermal Deflectors} in play.

Name: Hanonian Land Eel
Lore: While stranded on a savage world by the Kazon-Nistrim, the crew of U.S.S. Voyager encountered a carnivorous creature with an appetite for Starfleet engineers.
Text: Unless SECURITY, SCIENCE, and STRENGTH>50 present, kills Away Team member with lowest CUNNING or fewest [*] icons (opponent's choice).

Name: Hull Breach
Lore: In 2372, a spatial scission caused explosive decompression aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Harry Kim was lost in the incident, and later replaced by a duplicate Harry from a duplicate Voyager.
Text: Unless {Environmental Suit} present, kills one non-android (random selection) and another non-android of same classification (random selection). Mission continues.

Name: Implication
Lore: The manager of a Nekrit Supply Depot arrested Chakotay and Tom Paris on charges of conspiracy and murder, based solely on security footage that showed them conversing with the victim.
Text: To get past requires 3 Diplomacy and INTEGRITY>30 OR Law and CUNNING>30.

Name: Kazon Bomb
Lore: Tierna's "rescue" by the Voyager crew was part of an elaborate ruse. The Kazon was on a suicide mission, carrying a chemical injection that would convert is blood into a powerful explosive.
Text: Unless 3 SECURITY and CUNNING>35 OR 2 SECURITY and {any tricorder} OR 3 [Def] Borg present, kills all personnel present who have printed STRENGTH<7. Discard dilemma.

Name: Komar Possession
Lore: Tuvok was possessed by trianic energy beings known as the Komar. The entities sought to collect neural energy from the U.S.S. Voyager crew members.
Text: Place on one personnel present (random selection). Now and start of each turn, "stops" that personnel and one other personnel present (random selection). Cure with 3 SECURITY.

Name: Macrovirus
Lore: Initially microscopic virus that absorbs growth hormones from host organisms to augment its own mass. After emerging, specimens continue to grow to billions of times their original size.
Text: Place on ship. Now and start of each turn, kills lowest STRENGTH OR lowest CUNNING crew member (opponent's choice). Cure with 2 Exobiology and 2 SCIENCE.

Name: Spatial Rift
Lore: A rupture in space connected U.S.S. Voyager with its duplicate created by a spatial scission. The two crews had to separate their "siamese ships" that shared a single supply of anti-matter.
Text: Two personnel present (random selection) "disappear" (discarded) if their combined CUNNING<15. To get past requires Astrophysics and 2 ENGINEER remaining.

Name: Subspace Fracture
Lore: Instabilities in subspace can cause fractures and chain reactions leading to temporal relocation, death, or worse.
Text: Entire crew or Away Team is killed unless ENGINEER, SCIENCE, Leadership, and CUNNING>28 present. Discard dilemma.

Name: The Cloud
Lore: In 2371, U.S.S. Voyager entered what the crew thought was a nebula rich in omicron particles. It was in fact a massive life-form whose physiology reacted violently to the intrusion.
Text: Unless 2 MEDICAL, 2 ENGINEER, and 2 Astrophysics present, ship is damaged and "stopped" until end of your next turn. Discard dilemma.

Name: The Swarm
Lore: Fiercely territorial species whose small ships disable enemy vessels by emitting interferometric pulses. Dubbed "the Swarm" by those few who have survived their armadas.
Text: Place on ship; WEAPONS are disabled and SHIELDS -2. After start of your next turn, cure with 3 ENGINEER and Physics in crew. If countdown expires, ship destroyed.

Name: Trabe Grenade
Lore: Small incendiary devices can be used to create diversions and gain strategic control. An exploding grenade helped Neelix and Mabus escape an underground Kazon prison.
Text: Kills one Away Team member who has SECURITY or Leadership (random selection) unless that personnel has CUNNING>8. Mission continues.

Name: Twisted
Lore: Intense electromagnetic charges caused Voyager to fall into a state of structural flux. The fluctuations created a warping effect, turning the ship into a constantly shifting maze.
Text: Cannot get past unless at least half of personnel in crew or Away Team (round up) each have CUNNING>7.

Name: Volcanic Eruption
Lore: Many planets suffer from geological instabilities. This can cause problems for unsuspecting - and unprepared - guests.
Text: Place on planet if no facility is on planet. Now and start of every player's turn, randomly kills one of their personnel present. Nullified if {Thermal Deflectors} is in play.

Name: Barzan Wormhole
Text: Seeds (in any phase) or plays in Gamma or Delta Quadrant (limit one). Inserts into spaceline; creates a location (span 2). Any ship may move between {Wormhole Terminus} mission and here, then is "stopped." OR Once each turn, plays to relocate Barzan Wormhole to a new location in Gamma or Delta Quadrant; discard doorway.

Name: Temporal Micro-Wormhole
Text: Seeds or plays on table. You may play [AU] personnel and [Equipment]. Once per game, you may download {Space-Time Portal} OR nullify its "report with" OR download {Dr. Telek R'Mor}. Your personnel may report aboard your ships, regardless of affiliation (limit once each turn, twice per game; discard doorway each time). Personnel played this way are compatible with your cards until they leave play.

Name: Bio-Neural Gel Pack
Lore: Small, easily replaceable package housing synthetic neural cells in a gelatinous organic suspension. Part of the bio-neural computer system used aboard Intrepid-class starships.
Text: May report aboard your Intrepid-class ship (for free on {U.S.S. Voyager}). While on your Intrepid-class ship or {Delta Flyer}, enhances its attributes all +1. (Cumulative up to +3.)

Name: Kazon Disruptor
Lore: Typical sidearm employed by the various Kazon sects. Simple design is slightly less powerful than comparable Starfleet arms, but it easily mass-produced even without replicator technology.
Text: Kazon use only. Reports for free (once each turn). Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Kazon Disruptor Rifle
Lore: Relatively unsophisticated beam weapon used by the Kazon. No-frills design abandons aesthetic features in favor of inexpensive production. As deadly as it is ugly.
Text: Kazon use only. Reports for free (once each turn). Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3, but loses 1 Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

Name: Mobile Holo-Emitter
Lore: Portable holographic projector designed by Henry Starling. Based on 29th-century technology he stole from the Timeship Aeon. Acquired by The Doctor in 2373 - or was it 1996?
Text: May be "worn" by (placed on) one of your [Holo] personnel; you may remove it during your turn. Wearer moves normally. While worn, does not count as an Equipment card.

Name: Transporter Control Module
Lore: Crucial transporter systems component. Kazon of the Nistrim sect stole one from U.S.S. Voyager. First Maje Jal Culluh used this new technology against his enemies, the Kazon-Relora.
Text: While aboard your ship or facility with your ENGINEER or Transporter Skill personnel present, that ship or facility has transporters.

Name: Vidiian Harvester
Lore: Combination disruptor/medical device. A neural resonator stuns potential victims; sophisticated quantum imaging scanners and microtransporters extract live organs from the unwilling donor.
Text: Each of your Vidiians present is STRENGTH +2 and gains 1 MEDICAL, and in each battle one of them may stun one adversary they just engaged. (Cumulative.)

Name: Ancestral Vision
Lore: Tribal lore tells of Sky Spirits who guided the Rubber Tree People in Earth's distant past. When Chakotay found the Spirits' home in the Delta Quadrant, he was beset with visions of his ancestors.
Text: Seeds or plays on a [DQ] planet. End of each turn, if your Honor personnel who has INTEGRITY>7 is present, draw an extra card. (May not be nullified if {Chakotay} present.)

Name: Kal-Toh
Lore: Vulcan game of intricate strategy. Players must find the seeds of order, even in the midst of profound chaos. Tuvok observed that novices often try merely to introduce a spatial balance.
Text: Plays on table. Once each turn, unless {Alien Probe} in play, you may discard one card from hand; opponent must discard one of same type (if they cannot, discard Kal-Toh).

Name: The Next Emanation
Lore: Believing themselves bound for an afterlife, the Vhnori used a device to send their dead through spectral ruptures, unaware the bodies were being sent to decompose on distant asteroids.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Opponent's non- [Univ] personnel discarded from play are placed under here instead of in discard pile.

Name: Villagers With Torches
Lore: After years of poverty, the Takarians were eager to be rid of their Great Sages. Fortunately, Chakotay and Tom Paris were there to keep them from being sent away on "wings of fire."
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Whenever opponent begins a planet mission attempt with fewer than three personnel, all are killed unless opponent has {Thermal Deflectors} in play.

Name: Kazon Outpost
Lore: Since losing its homeworld, the Kazon Collective raids others, establishing outposts throughout its territory.
Text: Seed one at a [KAZ] or [NON] mission OR build at such a mission where you have a Kazon ENGINEER. Has no transporters. DL/ {The Kazon Collective}

Name: Nekrit Supply Depot
Lore: Trade center for mining and commercial vessels. Located on the border of the Nekrit Expanse.
Text: Seed one at any mission that is in (or adjacent to) the Nekrit Expanse Region OR build at such a mission where you have a Non-Aligned [DQ] ENGINEER.

Name: Vidiian Outpost
Lore: The Vidiian Sodality establishes outposts throughout its territory, often hiding them inside barren planetoids.
Text: Seed one at a [VID] or [NON] mission OR build at such a mission where you have a Vidiian ENGINEER. DL/ {The Vidiian Sodality}

Name: Blue Alert
Requires: Intrepid Class; No staffing requirement; Shuttlecraft; Tractor Beam;
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Each of your Intrepid-class ships and ships with no staffing requirements may use 2 RANGE to land or take off once each turn. Also, your shuttlecraft may be carried aboard and launched from your ships that have Tractor Beam. (Captain's Order.)

Name: Caretaker's Array
Text: Seeds at {Ocampa planet} (limit one here). Each player may seed a non-Borg [DQ] ship here. OR Plays once each turn to relocate your ship in the Badlands Region to Caretaker's Array. OR Plays at any time, for free, if a ship is about to be destroyed by {Navigate Plasma Storms}. Instead relocate ship to Ocampa planet or owner's hand.

Name: Containment Field
Text: Seeds or plays on table. May not leave play. Nullifies each {Destroy Radioactive Garbage Scow} (its owner loses its points), {Telepathic Alien Kidnappers}, and {Static Warp Bubble}. Players must place a card from hand face up here to use a DL/ or {Hidden Fighter}. Start of each player's turn, they return up to two of those cards to hand; if they still have any cards here, they skip that turn. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Delta Quadrant Spatial Scission
Text: Seeds or plays on table. You may have up to two copies of each unique [DQ] Personnel and Ship card in play. Also, once each turn, you may place a unique [DQ] Personnel or Ship card from your hand out-of-play if you have a copy of that card in play (once per game per card title): all copies in play are attributes all +2 until start of your next turn, and you may play a personnel or draw a card.

Name: Handshake
Text: Plays once each turn (for free) if you have played no cards this turn and have fewer in hand than opponent; they must choose to discard three cards or allow you to draw three. OR Plays to look at top five cards in any draw deck or discard pile for ten seconds; rearrange as desired. OR Plays if you have at least three other cards in hand; discard entire hand and draw seven cards. Discard incident after any use.

Name: Home Away From Home
Text: Seeds or plays on your ship with one or more staffing icons. If a [DQ] ship with "Alpha Quadrant" in lore: while not in Alpha Quadrant, your equipment and matching [DQ] personnel may report aboard; once each turn, one who has [Stf] icon may do so for free. If any other non-Borg ship: while not in its native quadrant, your personnel who match ship's affiliation and native quadrant (and your equipment) may report aboard.

Name: The Kazon Collective
Requires: Kazon-Hobii; Kazon-Mostral; Kazon-Nistrim; Kazon-Ogla; Kazon-Oglamar; Kazon-Pommar; Kazon-Relora; Maje;
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Your Kazon affiliation is immune to assimilation. Once each turn, if you have a Maje in play, you may report another Kazon of his sect for free. OR Plays on your {Kazon Warship}. Your [Kaz] Personnel and Ship cards (except other Warships) may report aboard.

Name: The Vidiian Sodality
Lore: For over two millennia, Vidiian society has been structured around their battle against a disease called the phage.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, you may report either a MEDICAL-classification [Vid] personnel or an [Equipment] with "MEDICAL" in gametext for free. OR Plays on your [Vid] cruiser. Your [Vid] personnel may report aboard.

Name: Vidiian Boarding Claw
Text: Plays on any undocked ship present with your staffed, unstopped [Vid] cruiser (discard if you lose control of cruiser). Those ships may not fire WEAPONS at each other; yours may not move. Your personnel may walk through Claw to and from other ship. If other ship moves, both ships are first damaged (discard Claw). You may discard Claw during your turn.

Name: War Council
Text: Seeds or plays on your [Neu] or [Non] facility (except {Colony} or a Nor). Your [Non] cards do not work with aligned cards and have standard attack restrictions. Each of your [Non] CIVILIAN and V.I.P. personnel native to this quadrant is CUNNING +2; once each turn, one such personnel reporting aboard may do so for free. OR Plays on your crew or Away Team that has 4 Treachery. Draw up to three cards; discard incident.

Name: Beyond the Subatomic
Lore: In 2374, Kes' mental abilities began to grow at an astonishing rate. Soon she was able to perceive and control a new level of reality that exists in the space between subatomic particles.
Text: Name a card type. Reveal cards from top of draw deck until you reveal a card of selected type; take it into hand, remove other revealed cards from game. (If you exhaust draw deck, lose the game.)

Name: Mutation
Lore: Tom Paris underwent a horrifying evolution after a transwarp test flight. His mutating DNA caused internal organs to shift, atrophy, and reform. His outward transformation was no less disturbing.
Text: Plays to shuffle top two cards of any discard pile into owner's draw deck. OR Plays once each turn; discard one card to draw two.

Name: Nanoprobe Resuscitation
Lore: Seven of Nine used a Borg procedure to resuscitate Neelix in 2374, nearly nineteen hours after his death. The Collective has restored drones after almost four times that duration.
Text: Plays once every turn to return top card of your discard pile to hand. If it is a Personnel card and you have any [Com] Borg in play, you may report it to that Borg's location.

Name: Quinn
Lore: Member of the Q who felt immortal life had become futile, meaningless, and unendurable. Lobbied to be made mortal so he could commit suicide and upset the Continuum's status quo.
Text: Thrice per game, nullifies an interrupt or event just played or revealed (even {a Treaty}), unless immune to {Kevin Uxbridge} or {Amanda Rogers}.

Name: The Gift
Lore: Distortions from Kes' expanding powers threatened to destroy Voyager. To save her friends, she permanently left the ship. To thank them, she pushed them 9,500 light-years closer to home.
Text: If you have {Kes} aboard your ship at a spaceline location, place her out-of-play and relocate that ship to another spaceline location in same quadrant. Ship is "stopped."

Name: The Phage
Lore: Highly adaptive, deadly virus that has plagued the Vidiians for over two millennia. Destroys genetic codes and cellular structure, requiring constant replacement of decaying organs and tissue.
Text: Plays at start of mission attempt or personnel battle to kill any one Vidiian present. OR Kills any one of your Vidiians; place that Vidiian beneath draw deck or in hand.

Name: The Power
Lore: Tanis taught Kes to reach out with her mind, embrace the essence of life, and then transform it into death. "Hurt people, help them... give life, kill. It's all the same."
Text: Plays once each turn to draw a card OR draw two and discard one of them (your choice) OR draw three and discard one (opponent's choice). (May not be converted to downloads.)

Name: Acquire Technology
Lore: Obtain trajector transport system from society with strict laws against trading technology with outsiders.
Text: ENGINEER + Physics + (Acquisition OR Diplomacy x3 OR Treachery x2 OR Pakled)

Name: Aftermath
Lore: Determine cause of a disaster that obliterated all life on this once-thriving planet.
Text: ENGINEER + Physics x2 + (Honor OR Treachery)

Name: Ambush Ship
Affil: Any non-Federation crew  may attempt mission.
Lore: Lure enemy ship to tactically advantageous space and launch an attack.
Text: Leadership x2 + WEAPONS>9 X=30 (or 45 if opponent's occupied ship here).

Name: Answer Distress Signal
Lore: Respond to call for help from malfunctioning isomorphic projection alone on alien ship.
Text: ENGINEER + OFFICER + MEDICAL * +10 if a [Holo] personnel in crew.

Name: Assist Cooperative
Lore: Help group of former Borg to unite and end anarchy.
Text: ENGINEER + SCIENCE + Computer Skill x2 * +10 if you have a [Com] personnel present.

Name: Catalog Phenomena
Lore: Map dust clouds and other hazards in the Expanse.
Text: SCIENCE + Astrophysics + Stellar Cartography + Computer Skill

Name: Combat Training
Lore: Survive training exercises at this formidable Kazon-Ogla base.
Text: STRENGTH>50 + any Maje * +5 for each Kazon-Ogla present, up to four.

Name: Contact Resistance
Lore: Seek aid from the Alsaurian resistance in freeing prisoners taken by the Mokra.
Text: SECURITY + Leadership + STRENGTH>40 OR Resistance + CUNNING>30

Name: Cure Deadly Virus
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Develop anti-viral agent for fatal disease that lies dormant in its natural environment.
Text: Exobiology x3 + Biology x2 OR {Danara Pel} Until solved, personnel on planet are quarantined.

Name: Expose Plot
Lore: Exonerate crewman framed for murder, and reveal conspiracy to commit scientific espionage.
Text: Diplomacy + Computer Skill + Exobiology x2 OR Law + Mindmeld

Name: Heal Life-form
Lore: Provide medical aid to spaceborne life-form injured by starship.
Text: MEDICAL + Physics + Biology + Navigation

Name: Inversion Mystery
Lore: Determine how plasma strands - typically unstable - have survived here for centuries.
Text: ENGINEER + Astrophysics + Diplomacy

Name: Investigate Quantum Singularity
Lore: Investigate unidentified transmission emanating from this type-four quantum singularity.
Text: Navigation x2 + CUNNING>40 + (ENGINEER x3 OR {B'Elanna Torres})

Name: Kazon Conference
Lore: Attend meeting of rival Kazon sects.
Text: OFFICER x3 + SECURITY + Diplomacy * +5 for each different Maje present.

Name: Liberation
Lore: Liberate prisoner being held by Kazon sect on the surface of this desert planet.
Text: SECURITY + (Transporter Skill OR {Neelix}) Ocampa may report on planet (for free).

Name: Prevent Annihilation
Lore: Stop malfunctioning Cardassian warhead from attacking defenseless, highly populated planet.
Text: ENGINEER x2 + Leadership x2 + Computer Skill x2 OR {B'Elanna Torres}

Name: Prison Break
Lore: Locate secret alien prison facility and rescue wrongfully incarcerated crew members.
Text: Diplomacy + Navigation + Computer Skill May seed up to two [DQ] personnel under here.

Name: Reinitialize Warp Reaction
Lore: Collect radiogenic particles from the rings of this gas giant to fully restore warp efficiency.
Text: Astrophysics + Physics + (SCIENCE OR ENGINEER) Restores solving ship's RANGE used this turn.

Name: Research Phage
Lore: Conduct genetic research on lethal virus that destroys Vidiian cellular structures.
Text: Vidiian + MEDICAL x2 + Exobiology x2 + SCIENCE + Physics OR Think Tank personnel

Name: Restock Supplies
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Search for fuel and food sources on this world with an inhospitable atmosphere.
Text: Geology + Anthropology + (Biology OR cook) Transporter Skill required to beam up/down here.

Name: Restore Victims
Lore: Attempt to restore civilians killed by metreon cascade weapon on the Talaxian moon of Rinax.
Text: SCIENCE x2 + Physics x3 + Transporter Skill x2 Talaxians may report on planet (for free).

Name: Return Life-form
Lore: Communicate with electromagnetic life-form on ship and return it to its native environment.
Text: Computer Skill x2 + Astrophysics + Exobiology + Diplomacy OR {Kathryn Janeway}

Name: Revive Settlers
Lore: Awaken people trapped in cryonic hibernation on this planet recovering from a glacial freeze.
Text: Computer Skill + Diplomacy + CUNNING>35 + ({[Holo] personnel} OR discard one unique personnel)

Name: Salvage Operation
Affil: Any crew may attempt mission. Your {Salvage Starship} objective may target this location.
Lore: Survey wreckage for recyclable ship systems and other items of value.
Text: ENGINEER OR Archaeology OR Greed X=20 if one skill present, 30 if two, 40 if all three. Opponent's side: Any crew

Name: Stop Bombardment
Lore: Discover cause of repeated asteroid impacts on this resource-abundant planet.
Text: Astrophysics + ENGINEER + Geology + Leadership

Name: Study Interment Site
Lore: Investigate appearance of humanoid remains on the asteroids of this planet's ring system.
Text: SCIENCE + Astrophysics + Honor + Anthropology OR {Harry Kim}

Name: Study Interstellar Colony
Lore: Study the behavior patterns of this colony of space-dwelling life-forms.
Text: SCIENCE + Anthropology + Exobiology Ocampa are disabled while here.

Name: Tak Tak Negotiation
Lore: Obtain information and supplies from culture with highly ritualistic and gestural language.
Text: Diplomacy x3 + CUNNING>35 OR {Neelix}

Name: Unseat Dictator
Lore: Retrieve crewman possessed by the consciousness of a despotic ruler and restore rightful leader.
Text: MEDICAL + SECURITY + (Empathy OR Mindmeld OR STRENGTH>55)

Name: Boarding Party
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your Boarding Pod may move to "ram" any ship present. Personnel on Pod go aboard; discard Pod. Also, once each turn, your Kazon aboard opponent's ship may use its transporters (ignoring its SHIELDS) OR steal an Equipment card aboard (score points; discard objective) OR download {Commandeer Ship} there (score double points; discard objective).

Name: Divert Power
Text: Plays on table. At start of each of your turns, one of your ships with ENGINEER (or [Nav] Borg) aboard may "transfer power" until start of your next turn; subtract 1 from two of its attributes and add 2 to the remaining attribute. OR Plays on your ship with ENGINEER (or [Def] Borg) and Computer Skill aboard. WEAPONS or SHIELDS are +4 until start of your next turn, then discard objective. (Captain's Order.)

Name: Organ Theft
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, stop your Vidiian using {Vidiian Harvester} to "steal organs" from any non-[Holo] personnel present (except an android or shape-shifter). Discard victim; you may report two [Univ] Vidiians (or download one) and, until end of your next turn, your Vidiians may ignore {The Phage}. If victim belonged to opponent, you may discard objective (thrice per game) to score points.

Name: Arturis
Lore: Gifted linguist. Built the Dauntless to deceive and punish the Voyager crew. Blames them for the recent assimilation of his people, "Species 116," by the Borg.
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Diplomacy Anthropology Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Construct Starship}

Name: Ayala
Lore: Versatile Maquis who has served exceptionally aboard U.S.S. Voyager. His many assignments have included tactical, ops, and guarding the brig.
Text: SECURITY Astrophysics

Name: B'Elanna Torres
Lore: Former Maquis who became chief engineer of U.S.S. Voyager. Her Klingon and human halves are often at odds with each other. Married Tom Paris in 2377.
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Astrophysics Cybernetics Transporter Skill

Name: Cavit
Lore: Lieutenant commander typical of executive officers stationed on smaller Starfleet ships. Posted to U.S.S. Voyager. Scornful of Maquis soldiers and sympathizers.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Anthropology Transporter Skill

Name: Chakotay
Lore: Former Maquis leader now serving as first officer on U.S.S. Voyager. Deeply spiritual. Honors the heritage of his grandfathers, though far from their sacred places.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Diplomacy Anthropology x 2 Archaeology Honor

Name: Chell
Lore: Talkative Bolian. Underwent field training soon after coming aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Has been a model - though somewhat paranoid - crewman ever since.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Anthropology Biology Navigation

Name: Corez
Lore: Representative of Kazon aligned with the Pommar sect. Has served as bodyguard to Minnis. Stood watch over a group of Trabe being held prisoner on Sobras.
Text: SECURITY Treachery Geology DL/ {Kazon Disruptor Rifle}

Name: Culluh
Lore: First maje of the Kazon-Nistrim. Romantically involved with Seska. Commands a Kazon Raider. Seeks to capture U.S.S. Voyager and its technology at any cost.
Text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 ENGINEER Treachery Greed Archaeology Diplomacy DL/ {Boarding Party}

Name: Danara Pel
Lore: Hematologist who treated a phage outbreak on Fina Prime. Became romantically involved with The Doctor when she spent nearly three weeks on U.S.S. Voyager.
Text: MEDICAL Biology x 2 Computer Skill Honor Navigation Stellar Cartography

Name: Dereth
Lore: Vidiian honatta to Motura. Tasked with obtaining new organs for his charge's survival. Duty-bound to take them from the living if a dead "donor" is unavailable.
Text: MEDICAL Navigation x 2 ENGINEER Geology Exobiology DL/ {Organ Theft} OR {Vidiian Harvester}

Name: Dr. Arridor
Lore: Served under Goss. While trapped with Kol in the Delta Quadrant, set up a lucrative exploitation of the Takarians by posing as one of their "Great Sages."
Text: MEDICAL Treachery Exobiology Anthropology Physics Leadership Acquisition

Name: Dr. Fitzgerald
Lore: Typical of chief medical officers assigned to starships on short tours of duty. Stationed on Caldik Prime during the accident resulting in Tom Paris' discharge from Starfleet.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology

Name: Dr. Ma'Bor Jetrel
Lore: Haakonian who developed the metreon cascade weapon. Deeply regretful of the hundreds of thousands of Talaxians killed by his invention. Dying of metremia.
Text: SCIENCE MEDICAL Exobiology Physics Honor

Name: Dr. Neria
Lore: Vhnori thanatologist. Studied Harry Kim in the hopes of learning more about his people's afterlife. Believes the truth is out there.
Text: MEDICAL Anthropology Biology Physics

Name: Dr. Telek R'Mor
Lore: Romulan Astrophysical Academy member on deep space duty in 2351. Beamed to the present via a micro-wormhole to the U.S.S. Voyager.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics x 2 Stellar Cartography Honor ENGINEER May report directly to any ship.

Name: Drenol
Lore: Planned to ambush U.S.S. Voyager in 2371 in a region filled with subspace vacuoles. A vengeful version of Kes from five years in the future tried to aid his efforts.
Text: OFFICER Treachery Diplomacy Stellar Cartography

Name: Haliz
Lore: One of the greatest Kazon-Ogla warriors. Serves under Razik. Admired by many young Ogla, including Karden. Killed a Relora with his bare hands to earn his name.
Text: OFFICER Biology SCIENCE Leadership Stellar Cartography

Name: Halok
Lore: Kazon-Nistrim representative of technicians in Culluh's crew. Gained knowledge of bio-neural technology in his time aboard the commandeered U.S.S. Voyager.
Text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Biology DL/ Any ENGINEER-related Equipment card

Name: Haron
Lore: First maje of the powerful Kazon-Relora, blood enemies of the Nistrim. Commands countless soldiers and a vast fleet of ships - including his own Kazon Raider.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Exobiology MEDICAL Greed Stellar Cartography

Name: Harry Kim
Lore: U.S.S. Voyager operations officer, his first posting out of the Academy. Until then, had never missed calling home every week. Plays reed instruments. Unlucky at love.
Text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography ENGINEER Music Youth May volunteer for random selections (if applicable).

Name: Hophalin
Lore: Representative of technicians serving the Vidiian Sodality. Posted to the Avery III installation. Confident in the sophistication of his data encryption routines.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Archaeology Physics Treachery

Name: Jabin
Lore: First maje of the Kazon-Ogla in 2371. Has laid claim to the Ocampa planet. His efforts to tap its subterranean resources have been thwarted by the Caretaker.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Astrophysics Geology Treachery Greed

Name: Joseph Carey
Lore: Representative of staff in engineering. Has a wife and two sons. Is building a model of U.S.S. Voyager. Doubts he'll finish before the real one returns home.
Text: ENGINEER Physics

Name: Karden
Lore: Young Kazon-Ogla now come of age. Bravely earned his name like his brother, Kinell, before him. The only Kazon to ever form a real bond with a "Federation."
Text: OFFICER Youth Navigation x 2 Physics Anthropology Biology Honor

Name: Kathryn Janeway
Lore: Former science officer of U.S.S. Al-Batani. Dog lover. Inspired by Amelia Earhart, Leonardo da Vinci, and her father. Has promised herself to get her crew home.
Text: OFFICER SCIENCE Diplomacy Leadership Computer Skill Physics Astrophysics

Name: Kes
Lore: Four-year-old Ocampa. Mentored by The Doctor and Tuvok. Has begun to tap latent abilities few others of her species have. Was romantically involved with Neelix.
Text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Exobiology Biology Empathy DL/ {The Gift} OR {Beyond the Subatomic}

Name: Kol
Lore: Piloted a shuttle sent into the Barzan wormhole by Goss in 2366. After posing as the Takarians' "Lesser Sage," returned to the Alpha Quadrant via the same wormhole.
Text: SCIENCE Navigation Treachery Greed Computer Skill Stellar Cartography

Name: Kurros
Lore: Humanoid leader of the Think Tank, an elite group that solves problems - for a price. Brilliant tactician. Often does the exact opposite of what an adversary expects.
Text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Treachery x 2 Diplomacy Acquisition Leadership

Name: Lon Suder
Lore: Dangerous, violent Betazoid. Unable to sense even his own emotions. Murdered Crewman Darwin. Sought to atone after a mindmeld with Tuvok. Skilled floriculturist.
Text: ENGINEER Physics Biology Treachery Honor May initiate personnel battle, against any affiliation.

Name: Loran
Lore: First maje of the Kazon-Hobii. Has twice attended meetings with rivals in the hopes of ending skirmishes his small sect lacks the reserves to defend against.
Text: OFFICER Leadership MEDICAL Physics Archaeology

Name: Losarus
Lore: Typical Vidiian researcher of astronomical and planetary sciences. Has a cardiovascular system highly susceptible to the phage. Has had 17 heart replacement surgeries.
Text: SCIENCE Geology Astrophysics Stellar Cartography

Name: Magistrate Drang
Lore: Nechani official and chairman of his planet's judicial committee. Though his people divide spiritual matters from government, his faith is quite strong.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Archaeology Law Anthropology

Name: Maniz
Lore: Typical of warriors loyal to the Kazon-Nistrim sect. Supervised repairs to U.S.S. Voyager after its capture in 2372. Resents Seska's hold over Culluh.
Text: OFFICER Archaeology Navigation Leadership

Name: Mariah Henley
Lore: Typical of Maquis who initially had difficulty fitting in aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Her home colony was ceded to Cardassia in the formation of the Demilitarized Zone.
Text: OFFICER Geology Computer Skill

Name: Marla Gilmore
Lore: Senior engineer on U.S.S. Equinox. Frequent attacks by the Ankari "spirits" have made her claustrophobic. Eventually became part of the U.S.S. Voyager crew.
Text: ENGINEER Physics Computer Skill Transporter Skill

Name: Maxwell Burke
Lore: First officer of U.S.S. Equinox. Almost dropped out of Starfleet. Was once romantically involved with B'Elanna Torres. Still the p'tak she claimed him to be.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Treachery Computer Skill x 2

Name: Minnis
Lore: First maje of the Kazon-Pommar sect. Agreed to host negotiations between the Trabe and several Kazon sects in 2372. Gained little prestige from the debacle.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Diplomacy Navigation Biology Computer Skill x 2

Name: Mitchell
Lore: Operator of the junction room on deck 16 of U.S.S. Voyager. Knows the bowels of the ship better than almost anyone aboard - including Captain Janeway.
Text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Navigation Astrophysics

Name: Mortimer Harren
Lore: Solitary theoretician. Signed aboard U.S.S. Voyager to meet an admissions requirement at a cosmological institute. Not even his mother called him Mortimer.
Text: ENGINEER Astrophysics x 2 Stellar Cartography

Name: Motura
Lore: Vidiian sculptor. Would have died of the phage if not for lungs stolen from Neelix. Willing to be punished. When shown mercy instead, responded in kind to save Neelix.
Text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy x 2 SCIENCE Honor Anthropology Music DL/ {Dereth}

Name: Nadirum
Lore: Commanded a Vidiian Cruiser. Attempted to harvest organs from the U.S.S. Voyager crew in 2372. Dozens like him are on the same single-minded mission.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Computer Skill Navigation DL/ {Organ Theft}

Name: Narret
Lore: Loyal Kazon-Nistrim typical of Culluh's soldiers. Stood proudly with his maje as a bridge officer on the captured U.S.S. Voyager.
Text: SCIENCE Honor Computer Skill Stellar Cartography

Name: Neelix
Lore: Talaxian jack-of-all-trades. Has served on a Trabalian freighter, mining colony, and Voyager. Serves as cook, morale officer, guide, and sometimes ambassador.
Text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Navigation Diplomacy ENGINEER Geology

Name: Nevala
Lore: Skilled pilot serving under Rekar. Her family's brushes with the Tal Shiar have left her highly suspicious and distrustful of others - even by Romulan standards.
Text: ENGINEER Navigation Computer Skill x 2 Physics Astrophysics DL/ {Romulan PADD}

Name: Nimira
Lore: Telepathic Mari. Chief Examiner of the Constabulary. The unusual laws of her species have reduced crime, but created a black market for illicit violent thoughts.
Text: SECURITY Empathy Law MEDICAL

Name: Nirata
Lore: Representative of Vidiian general medical practitioners. Chose to enter military service rather than pledge himself as honatta to a single individual.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology Biology

Name: Noah Lessing
Lore: Acting science officer of U.S.S. Equinox. Fiercely loyal to Rudolph Ransom. Demoted to crewman by Kathryn Janeway when he joined U.S.S. Voyager.
Text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Geology Biology

Name: Paxim
Lore: Talaxian commander of a squadron garrisoned at the mining colony on Prema II. Tom Paris enlisted his help to reclaim Voyager from the Kazon-Nistrim in 2373.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Astrophysics Exobiology

Name: Penk
Lore: Norcadian entertainment producer. Arrogant. Corrupt. Abducts aliens from all over the sector and forces them to fight in the Tsunkatse matches.
Text: CIVILIAN Acquisition SECURITY Treachery x 2 Greed DL/ Any other card that has "Tsunkatse" in title or lore

Name: Rabek
Lore: Kazon-Nistrim physician. Typical of personal attendants often retained by a first maje. Seska did not find his abilities particularly impressive.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology Physics

Name: Razik
Lore: First maje of the Kazon-Ogla. Personally oversees the training of new Ogla warriors. Intimately familiar with the base on Tarok. Commands a Kazon Warship.
Text: OFFICER Treachery Leadership Anthropology Geology SECURITY

Name: Rekar
Lore: Seized and commanded the U.S.S. Prometheus. Planned to deliver it to the Tal Shiar. Didn't anticipate the resourcefulness of two Starfleet holograms.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Treachery Exobiology Leadership Geology DL/ {Commandeer Ship}

Name: Rettick
Lore: Kazon-Nistrim serving under Culluh. Accompanied him at the Sobras conference. Received files from Jonas on Tom Paris' experimental transwarp flight.
Text: ENGINEER SCIENCE Computer Skill Physics Treachery

Name: Ril
Lore: Representative of females throughout Kazon society. Has few rights, little power. Part of the Ogla sect. One of several women romantically involved with Jabin.
Text: CIVILIAN Anthropology MEDICAL Geology

Name: Rollins
Lore: Served at tactical aboard U.S.S. Voyager during Tuvok's absence in 2371. Received a promotion to lieutenant for exceptional service during the Caretaker incident.
Text: SECURITY Leadership Geology Archaeology

Name: Rudolph Ransom
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Equinox-related personnel;
Lore: Accomplished exobiologist and diplomat. Captain of U.S.S. Equinox. Called "Rudy" by his crew. Lost in Delta Quadrant, has relaxed Starfleet protocols and principles.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Exobiology SCIENCE Diplomacy Transporter Skill Treachery

Name: Saldin
Lore: Representative of non-military Kazon. Pledged to the Pommar sect. Bartender and cook at the dive frequented by Tersa. Remembers Neelix's last visit there all too well.
Text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill SECURITY Archaeology

Name: Samantha Wildman
Lore: Separated from her husband Greskrendtregk by the Caretaker's actions. Their child, Naomi Wildman, has been raised on U.S.S. Voyager. Head of xenobiology.
Text: SCIENCE Exobiology x 2 Computer Skill DL/ {Naomi Wildman} Anthropology DL/ Any SCIENCE-related Equipment card

Name: Seska
Lore: Devious Cardassian operative. Broke her cover after becoming trapped in the Delta Quadrant aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Formed an alliance with the Kazon-Nistrim.
Text: ENGINEER Leadership Treachery x 2 Transporter Skill SECURITY Exobiology Computer Skill

Name: Sethis
Lore: Overseer typical of Vidiians in charge of slave labor at large facilities like that on Avery III. Gets the most from his captives before sending them to Organ Processing.
Text: SECURITY Archaeology Exobiology Leadership

Name: Seven of Nine
Lore: Borg freed from the Collective. Slowly reclaiming her human past and individuality, guided by Kathryn Janeway, The Doctor, and the rest of the U.S.S. Voyager crew.
Text: ENGINEER SCIENCE Stellar Cartography x 2 Physics Exobiology Computer Skill x 2 Music

Name: Sorum
Lore: Typical prison worker and bodyguard serving aboard Vidiian ships and installations. Fears the phage will soon leave him too weak to continue in his duties.
Text: SECURITY Anthropology Biology Geology DL/ {Lower Decks}

Name: Stadi
Lore: Female Betazoid representative of Starfleet helm officers. Has piloted a wide variety of Federation ships, most notably the prototype U.S.S. Intrepid.
Text: OFFICER Empathy Navigation Honor If on a [Fed] ship, it is RANGE +1 (+2 if Intrepid class).

Name: Sulan
Lore: Chief Surgeon of the Vidiian Sodality. Divided B'Elanna Torres into two beings - fully human and fully Klingon - to study the phage's effects on Klingon genetic material.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Transporter Skill Exobiology x 2 Treachery Computer Skill x 2 Physics

Name: Tabor
Lore: Bajoran whose brother and grandfather were killed in Crell Moset's grisly experiments. Under Teero's influence, helped his fellow Maquis seize U.S.S. Voyager in 2377.
Text: ENGINEER Honor Youth SECURITY Resistance Stellar Cartography

Name: Tanis
Lore: Unusually old Ocampa male with strong psychokinetic powers. Follower of Suspiria. Delivered Voyager to her so she could avenge the death of her mate, the Caretaker.
Text: CIVILIAN Empathy x 2 SCIENCE Biology Leadership Treachery

Name: Telari
Lore: Medical aide aboard a Vidiian Cruiser. When not assisting in surgery or harvesting, serves as relief science officer.
Text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Anthropology Physics DL/ {Vidiian Harvester}

Name: Tersa
Lore: Kazon-Pommar well connected with Minnis. Has had prior dealings with Neelix. Infatuated with a dancer who works at a bar on Sobras. Not her type.
Text: OFFICER Anthropology Diplomacy Treachery Exobiology

Name: Thaden
Lore: Representative of surgical technicians on Vidiian ships. Well versed in medical procedures and ship systems; supervises both repairs and organ harvesting missions.
Text: MEDICAL ENGINEER Astrophysics Navigation Transporter Skill

Name: The Doctor
Lore: E.M.H. on U.S.S. Voyager. Years of continuous use have expanded his program to include a vast knowledge of Delta Quadrant species and a love of opera.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology x 2 Biology x 2 MEDICAL Music Computer Skill DL/ {Mobile Holo-Emitter} (ignoring [AU]).

Name: The Pendari Champion
Lore: Crowd favorite in the Tsunkatse matches broadcast by Penk. Electrifying Pendari known for his superior strength, bad temper, and keen sense of smell.
Text: SECURITY Leadership Geology In battle, may pair first (and select his adversary).

Name: Thompson
Lore: Typical U.S.S. Equinox crewman corrupted by Ransom and Burke's leadership. Science department head. Has also manned tactical since the security chief's death.
Text: SCIENCE Archaeology Treachery Physics

Name: Tierna
Lore: Kazon-Nistrim serving as Seska's aide. Assigned a suicide mission by Culluh as part of an elaborate plan to take U.S.S. Voyager. Determined to succeed.
Text: SECURITY Navigation Honor Stellar Cartography DL/ {Kazon Bomb} (as an interrupt, where Tierna present).

Name: Tom Paris
Lore: Best pilot aboard U.S.S. Voyager. Also acts as medical assistant. Led design and construction of the Delta Flyer. Prolific holodeck programmer. 20th-century history buff.
Text: OFFICER Navigation x 3 ENGINEER Astrophysics Computer Skill MEDICAL Biology

Name: Tuvok
Lore: Vulcan security chief of U.S.S. Voyager. Janeway's tactical officer and confidant for many years. Former instructor at Starfleet Academy. Breeds prize orchids.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Computer Skill Mindmeld Biology Music Law

Name: Valek
Lore: First maje of the Kazon-Oglamar. Expertly uses the slim resources of his sect in hit-and-run attacks, often staged near nebulae and other astronomical phenomena.
Text: OFFICER Leadership SCIENCE Astrophysics Navigation Greed

Name: Vorik
Lore: Vulcan serving on U.S.S. Voyager. Twin of Taurik. Tried to bond with B'Elanna Torres when enduring Pon farr in 2373. Purged the blood fever in ritual Koon-ut-kal-if-fee.
Text: ENGINEER Mindmeld Physics Geology Anthropology

Name: William Telfer
Lore: One of several crewmen serving in the science labs on U.S.S. Voyager. Billy Telfer is a hypochondriac. Also afraid of medication and counseling. Friend of Tal Celes.
Text: SCIENCE Biology Stellar Cartography

Name: Bothan Vessel
Lore: Standard ship design used by a reclusive, territorial race with powerful psionic abilities. Possesses technology which allows it to seem invisible to enemy vessels.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: Delta Flyer
Lore: Designed and often commanded by Tom Paris. Sports an ultra-aerodynamic tetraburnium alloy hull, retractable nacelles, unimatrix shielding, and photonic missiles.
Text: May report aboard your {U.S.S. Voyager} (for free). DL/ {Evasive Maneuvers}

Name: Kazon Raider
Lore: Ship design stolen when the Trabe were overthrown in 2346. Favored by sects with more limited resources.
Text: Kazon shuttlecraft may report, be carried, and launch aboard. Tractor Beam

Name: Kazon Shuttle
Characteristics/ Keywords: Boarding Pod; No staffing requirement; Shuttlecraft;
Lore: Kazon shuttlecraft. Equipped with bow modifications designed to puncture a starship hull.
Text: Once each turn, may take off or land. DL/ {Boarding Party}

Name: Kazon Warship
Lore: Enormous Kazon vessel used as a mobile base of operations. Dwarfs even D'deridex-class ships.
Text: [Univ] [Kaz] ships (except Warships) may be carried and launched aboard. Tractor Beam

Name: Type 9 Shuttlecraft
Lore: Typical shuttlecraft carried aboard Intrepid-class starships. U.S.S. Voyager carries an unusually large compliment.
Text: May report aboard your Intrepid- and Nova-class ships.

Name: U.S.S. Equinox
Characteristics/ Keywords: Alpha Quadrant-related [DQ] ship; Federation ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
Lore: NCC-72381. Science vessel pulled from Alpha Quadrant by the Caretaker. Its rogue crew designed an enhanced warp drive, killing nucleogenic life-forms for fuel.
Text: X=4 if any crew member has "U.S.S. Equinox" in lore. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Intrepid
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation ship; Holodeck; Prototype; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Prototype introduced in the early 2370s. Its bio-neural circuits respond faster than optical relays. Average crew complement of 140. Capable of a sustained warp 9.975.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Voyager
Characteristics/ Keywords: Alpha Quadrant-related [DQ] ship; Federation ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
Lore: NCC-74656. Commanded by Kathryn Janeway. Pulled 70,000 light years from the Alpha Quadrant. Its crew has spent nearly seven years on a long trek home.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam DL/ {Bio-Neural Gel Pack} DL/ {Blue Alert}

Name: Vidiian Cruiser
Lore: Largest starship in the Vidiian fleet. Capable of grappling onto an enemy ship, subduing it for boarding. Drenol commanded one.
Text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Vidiian Boarding Claw}

Name: Vidiian Interceptor
Lore: Formidable ship favored for agility in battle. Suited to hit-and-fade attacks. Sulan commanded one prior to his promotion to Chief Surgeon of the Sodality.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Vidiian Scout Vessel
Lore: Small, non-military Vidiian ship, still powerfully equipped in case of urgent medical needs. Both Dereth and Danara Pel have commanded one.

Name: Ankari "Spirits"
Lore: Nucleogenic life-forms that relentlessly assaulted U.S.S. Equinox in retaliation for the crew's actions. Their attack causes a thermolytic reaction, desiccating every cell in a victim's body.
Text: Unless 3 Honor and INTEGRITY>35 present, place on ship. Now and start of each turn, kills two crew members (random selection). Cure with 3 ENGINEER and Exobiology.

Name: Impressive Trophies
Lore: Hirogen hunters always search for prey that provide the greatest challenge - and the most unique relics to adorn their ships.
Text: Unless CUNNING>50, crew or Away Team member with the most [*] icons OR highest CUNNING + STRENGTH (opponent's choice) is captured. Discard dilemma.

Name: Invasive Procedures
Lore: Srivani researchers covertly boarded U.S.S. Voyager in 2374. Using a phase variance to avoid detection, they performed invasive, and sometimes fatal, medical tests on the crew.
Text: Unless a [Def] Borg OR MEDICAL, CUNNING>35, and a {phaser} or {disruptor} present, place on ship; quarantined. Each crew member loses first-listed skill and is attributes all -2.

Name: Photonic Energy Being
Lore: A noncorporeal life-form took hostages when another of its kind was unknowingly captured and experimented on by the Voyager crew. The Doctor ultimately negotiated their safe return.
Text: Three crew members (random selection) are held with dilemma atop mission; discard all when countdown expires. Cure with [Holo] personnel OR Anthropology and Diplomacy.

Name: Replicator Accident
Lore: Nucleonic radiation from the explosion of a stolen - and incorrectly installed - food replicator mutated the cells of a Kazon-Nistrim crew, fusing them with inorganic matter.
Text: Ship is damaged and entire crew is killed unless ENGINEER, Physics, and CUNNING>30 present. Discard dilemma.

Name: Sabotaged Negotiations
Lore: Kathryn Janeway convinced several Kazon majes to hold a peace conference with the Trabe leader Mabus. He in turn betrayed her trust and attempted to massacre the Kazon leadership.
Text: To get past, four personnel present (random selection) "attend a conference." If their total INTEGRITY<24, each one without Treachery x2 is killed.

Name: The Clown: Beneath the Mask
Lore: The Clown was most interested in the minds of those who had truly known fear and could appreciate what he represented. He was most unreasonable when dealing with anyone less.
Text: To get past, one personnel must have total attributes>23.

Name: The Clown: My Festival
Lore: The subconscious world of the Kohl settlers turned nightmarish when a character arrived to embody their anxiety and fears, playing games with them according to his own malicious rules.
Text: To get past, crew or Away Team must have no fewer personnel than lowest INTEGRITY present and no more personnel than highest INTEGRITY present.

Name: The Weak Will Perish
Lore: During brief telepathic connections, Kes learned the purpose of Species 8472's invasion of the Delta Quadrant. As the Borg discovered, they were quite capable of carrying out their threats.
Text: Kills five [Univ] Borg drones present (random selection) and each personnel present who has printed STRENGTH<5. (Immune to {Adapt: Negate Obstruction}.)

Name: Borg Data Node
Lore: Borg information storage unit containing assimilation logistics, sensor telemetry, and vessel movements. Voyager salvaged these from the wreckage of a destroyed probe in 2375.
Text: If present with a [Com] Borg, once each turn, may download one {Adapt} card to hand OR glance for 10 seconds at crew of any one ship or top card of any player's draw deck.

Name: Borg Nanoprobes
Lore: Submicroscopic robots saturating a Borg's bloodstream. Injected into potential new drones, beginning their assimilation. Modified by the Voyager crew to use as a weapon against Species 8472.
Text: Once per turn, where present, may abduct and assimilate one personnel just stunned by your [Def] drone OR nullify a Species 8472-related dilemma (except {Gravimetric Distortion}).

Name: Borg Vinculum
Lore: Functions: Process and disseminate information relevant to the collective. Established transneural connections between drones. Purge individuality; bring order to chaos.
Text: If your [Com] Borg present, all your Borg at this location present with a [Com] Borg share regular skills (each has every such skill at highest level). (Immune to {Disruptor Overload}.)

Name: Hirogen Disruptor Rifle
Lore: Extremely high-powered weapon favored by Hirogen hunters. Constructed of solid monotanium. Over one meter in length. Equipped with a short-range tactical scanner for tracking prey.
Text: Hirogen use only. Each of your Hirogen present is STRENGTH +4 and CUNNING +2, but loses all Diplomacy unless aboard your ship. (Cumulative.)

Name: Hirogen Talon
Lore: After cornering or capturing their prey, many Hirogen hunters prefer to use a simple blade weapon to prolong the exhilaration of making the kill.
Text: Hirogen use only. Reports for free. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +1. (Cumulative.) May report to a just-initiated personnel battle involving your [Hir] card(s).

Name: Maturation Chamber
Lore: Functions: Prepare neonatal drones for integration into the collective. Protect and accelerate development. Restructure synaptic pathways; facilitate formation of thoracic nodes.
Text: Once each turn, you may download to Chamber one [Univ] drone in place of one card draw OR report to Chamber one [Univ] drone (for free).

Name: Alas, Poor Drone
Lore: The Borg Queen searched tenaciously for the interlink frequency connecting the errant drones of Unimatrix Zero. Analyzing those she had discovered brought her closer to finding them all.
Text: Plays on table. Once each turn, you may discard a [Com] or [Def] drone from hand or in play to draw one card (or two if drone was present with your {Borg Queen}).

Name: Cranial Transceiver Implant
Lore: Borg implant that interprets and logs all instructions sent to a drone. Operates on an array of transpectral frequencies capable of transmission across hundreds of light-years.
Text: Plays on your drone; it is CUNNING +2. If a [Com] Borg, once each turn, you may download any [BO] objective OR discard your current objective.

Name: Meditation
Lore: A-koo-chee-moya... to my father... Kolopak... if you can hear me among these unnamed stars, I ask you to continue to watch over me as you've always done... A-koo-chee-moya.
Text: Plays on table. At any time, you may discard one card from hand. For rest of that turn, each time you draw a card, you may do so from the bottom of your draw deck.

Name: Omega Particle
Lore: Unstable molecule that can power an entire planet - or render warp travel impossible in the wake of its explosion. Designated Particle 010 by the Borg, who regard it as harmonious perfection.
Text: Plays on your outpost; any player may download {Omega Directive} or {Harness Particle 010}. When countdown expires, destroys outpost and all ships here; mission is span +3.

Name: Quantum Slipstream Drive
Lore: Advanced technology that can propel a ship many times faster than warp drive. Though the Voyager crew never reliably adapted the system, the Think Tank still took interest in the theory.
Text: Plays on your ship that has full RANGE available (for free if {U.S.S. Dauntless}). Move ship to end of another spaceline OR elsewhere on same spaceline. RANGE is used; discard event.

Name: Hirogen Outpost
Lore: For 100,000 years, the nomadic Hirogen have hunted prey, establishing outposts throughout their territory.
Text: Seed one at a [HIR] mission or any [S] mission with no affiliation icons OR build at such a mission where you have a Hirogen ENGINEER. Has a Holodeck. DL/ {Hirogen Hunt}

Name: Unicomplex
Lore: Identification: BORG UNICOMPLEX Task: Centralize all collective operations. Coordinate.
Text: Seeds or plays at any [S] mission with no affiliation icons. Once each turn, {Borg Queen} OR one unique drone OR one unique ship may report for free here.

Name: Cortical Node Implant
Text: Plays on your Borg. If a [Com] Borg, once each turn, may "transfer data" if present with a {Borg Data Node}: draw one card (may not be converted to a download). Also, each of your Borg with a Cortical Node Implant may, once every turn, suspend play to "regulate implants": subtract 2 from any attribute and add 2 to any other attribute until end of turn.

Name: Feedback Surge
Text: Seeds or plays on table. If opponent completes {Establish Gateway} targeting a mission they did not seed, you score those points (instead of opponent). Also, if opponent discards any seed cards using {Ajur}, {Boratus}, {Senior Staff Meeting}, or their own dilemma, you may immediately re-seed them under any mission(s); opponent loses 10 points for each such card.

Name: Hirogen Hunt
Text: Seeds or plays on table. In place of your normal card draw, you may download {Rituals of the Hunt}, {Hirogen Hunt}, or any [Hir] ship. Also, once each turn, you may report an Alpha-Hirogen (or any [Hir] card that names in its lore an Alpha-Hirogen you already have in play) for free. OR Plays on your [Hir] ship; its transporters may be used to beam through SHIELDS of any damaged ship here (even if landed).

Name: Relics of the Chase
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once per battle, your Hirogen may capture an opposing personnel he just stunned. Also, once each turn, your Hirogen using a {Hirogen Talon} may place in point area one opponent's personnel he just killed in personnel battle (or, if he is an Alpha-Hirogen, one captive he is escorting); score points equal to that personnel's highest printed attribute.

Name: Rituals of the Hunt
Text: Plays on your prey (any opponent's personnel); you may return incident to hand at any time. (Unique.) Know your prey. Your Hirogen who have Anthropology add prey's printed regular skills. Stalk your prey. Your equipment and [Hir] personnel may report aboard your [Hir] ships. Capture your prey. If present with prey, your Hirogen using {Hirogen Talon} may capture them (discard incident).

Name: Multivector Assault Mode
Lore: New technology designed for the U.S.S. Prometheus, allowing it to split into three separate ships during battle. Programmed with hundreds of computer-controlled attack patterns.
Text: Plays at start of battle (once per battle) involving your {U.S.S. Prometheus} OR at least three of your ships. One of those ships is WEAPONS and SHIELDS +5 until end of battle.

Name: Narrow Escape
Lore: The writings of ancient Chinese philosopher Sun Tzu on the art of warfare are still taught at Starfleet Academy. "He will triumph who knows when to fight... and when not to fight."
Text: Plays on your staffed, undocked ship if its SHIELDS are less than half of opponent's total usable WEAPONS here. You may immediately move ship up to its total RANGE.

Name: Corner Enemy Ship
Lore: Flush out enemy hiding amidst the radiation of this anomaly.
Text: Leadership + Navigation + Stellar Cartography May attempt only if your total WEAPONS>15 here.

Name: Establish Settlement
Lore: Help Klingon pioneers begin a new Empire on this world very much like Qo'noS.
Text: Diplomacy + Anthropology + Honor OR {Miral Paris} * Discard up to five [DQ] Klingons for +5 each.

Name: Hunt Alien
Lore: Stalk and kill wounded member of Species 8472.
Text: Anthropology + Exobiology + Leadership + (STRENGTH>40 OR {Borg Nanoprobes})

Name: Maintenance Overhaul
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Set down on this world to perform complete repairs and upgrades on ship systems.
Text: Landed ship + ENGINEER + Computer Skill When you solve, you may download {Divert Power}.

Name: Repair Null Space Catapult
Lore: Stabilize and make use of high-speed propulsion device built by alien explorer.
Text: ENGINEER + Physics + (Diplomacy OR Treachery) May relocate solving ship to any spaceline location.

Name: Secure Station
Lore: Guard against violations of Hirogen property.
Text: Alpha-Hirogen + total WEAPONS>opponent's total WEAPONS here

Name: Assimilate Species
Text: Plays on table; target (name) a species. Your Borg may beam to and battle a crew or Away Team containing a personnel of that species, but may not mortally wound. At end of battle, immediately probe (draw probe card, discard objective): [Def]: Distinctiveness added. If you won battle, and your {Borg Nanoprobes} or {Assimilation Table} present, all stunned personnel of target species present are assimilated.

Name: Harness Particle 010
Text: Plays on table. Target {Omega Particle} (download if needed; it is immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}) at your mission with no [BO] objective on it. Your Borg may scout that location. After scouting complete, if your staffed Borg cube there, you may probe: [Enigma], [Incident], [Objective]: Perfection achieved. Place on mission; discard Particle. Doubles point boxes of your subsequently completed [BO] objectives.

Name: Omega Directive
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Place on your ship with matching commander aboard. (Nullified if no [Cmd] personnel aboard.) While ship is at same location as an {Omega Particle}, it may ignore affiliation attack restrictions, and end of each turn you must probe: DL/ : Threat eliminated. Discard Particle; draw two cards and score points; discard objective.

Name: Reassimilate Lost Drone
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Target an opponent's non-[Bor] Borg. If you have {Borg Queen} in play, you may probe: [Def]: Coercion. If your Borg ship is at same location, target is abducted and relocated to that ship. [Com]: Collaboration. If abducted target is present with Borg Queen, place on target (assimilated); worth 5 points per [*] while objective on target (10 points per [*] if target is {One}).

Name: Angelo Tassoni
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Male; Mission Specialist; U.S.S. Equinox-related personnel;
Lore: One of the U.S.S. Equinox crewmen stripped of rank by Kathryn Janeway upon joining U.S.S. Voyager. Fit in with his new crew without major incident.
Text: SECURITY Navigation

Name: B'Elanna
