Lore: An aggressive 1/2 Klingon, 1/2 human, B'Elanna Torres left Starfleet Academy during her second year. Joined the Maquis after Captain Chakotay saved her life.
Text: ENGINEER SECURITY Computer Skill x 2 Astrophysics If aboard a [Maq] ship, it is attributes all +2.

Name: Borg Queen (The Borg)
Lore: We all originated from lesser species. I myself came from Species 125. But that's irrelevant now. We are Borg... Our thoughts are one... One order, one voice.
Text: When reported, selects any skill; may change skill at start of each turn. May download any [BO] Event or Interrupt card in place of your normal card play.

Name: Captain Chakotay
Lore: Former Starfleet officer who resigned to defend his home colony. Chakotay leads a loyal group of Maquis rebels in raids on Cardassian targets near the Badlands.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Anthropology Honor Your other [Maq] personnel here are attributes all +2.

Name: Ch'Regha
Lore: I.K.C. Voq'leng crew member. After an initial attraction to Harry Kim, became romantically involved with Neelix. She was his little par'machkai; he, her fearless warrior.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology Archaeology Honor

Name: Davar
Lore: Reckless hunter who tired of participating in holographic scenarios aboard the commandeered Voyager. Joined Turanj in hunting prey, against express orders from Karr.
Text: SCIENCE Archaeology Biology Treachery

Name: Deanna Troi (The Borg)
Lore: 1/2 Betazoid, 1/2 human counselor of U.S.S. Enterprise-E - and Reginald Barclay. After years of friendship, is once again romantically involved with William T. Riker.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Empathy Anthropology All your [Ent-E] personnel add [Cmd].

Name: Decaren
Lore: Alpha-Hirogen who agreed to hunt alongside the crew of Voyager. A master in tracking, but overly prone to the fervor of an imminent kill. Commands a Hunting Vessel.
Text: OFFICER Leadership SCIENCE Honor Anthropology Diplomacy Physics

Name: Dilanum
Lore: Representative of maintenance workers assigned to Avery III. Alien prisoners made to assist him often wish they had instead been put to work digging tunnels.
Text: ENGINEER SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Treachery

Name: Donik
Lore: Technician who programmed enhancements for the Hirogen holograms under orders from Decaren. Later joined Kejal to help build a better life for his creations.
Text: ENGINEER Youth Computer Skill x 2 SCIENCE Physics Honor Your [Hir][Holo] personnel may report here.

Name: Eight of Eighteen
Lore: Identification: ANNEXATION DRONE Task: Facilitate assimilation of enemy vessels. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Transporter Skill Computer Skill SECURITY Where present, allows your transporters to beam through opponent's SHIELDS.

Name: Eight of Fifteen
Lore: Identification: ANTITOXIN DRONE Task: Analyze biological and chemical weapons. Adapt. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology May download {Borg Nanoprobes} in place of your normal card play.

Name: Eleven of Eighteen
Lore: Identification: AUGMENTATION DRONE Task: Equip drones with cybernetic components. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Where present, your {Implant} cards play for free and may be "reabsorbed" (placed beneath draw deck) if discarded. Cybernetics MEDICAL

Name: Eleven of Twelve
Lore: Identification: CONNECTIVITY DRONE Task: Monitor interlink aboard Borg vessels. Maintain. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Computer Skill ENGINEER Biology May download {Borg Vinculum} here in place of a card draw. DL/ {Borg Data Node}

Name: Equinox Doctor
Lore: E.M.H. on U.S.S. Equinox. Designed and performed criminal experiments on alien life after his ethical subroutines were deleted by the ship's crew.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology x 2 Treachery x 2 Computer Skill DL/ {Medical Kit} OR {Starfleet Type II Phaser}

Name: Fennim
Lore: One of only two humanoid members of the Think Tank. Instrumental in the mercenary group's discovery of a cure for the Vidiian Phage.
Text: SCIENCE MEDICAL x 2 Exobiology Anthropology Your Vidiians are immune to {The Phage}.

Name: Fifth
Lore: Immature drone of Species 689, Norcadian; irrelevant designation: Mezoti. Detected Harry Kim's presence aboard her ship by the trail of playing cards he'd left.
Text: Youth Computer Skill Biology SECURITY Once each turn, may return to hand one of your [BO] Incident, Event, or Objective cards in play.

Name: First
Lore: Immature, humanoid drone. Hostile and irrational. Self-designated leader of a group of neonatal drones activated prematurely by malfunctions aboard his cube.
Text: Youth Treachery Navigation Biology May initiate battle against intruders. Your Borg present are each STRENGTH +3 in battle.

Name: Four of Nine
Lore: Identification: HEURISTICS DRONE Task: Secondary adjunct of unimatrix zero one. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid; Species 571.
Text: Computer Skill Honor MEDICAL Once each turn, may place one drone present beneath draw deck, then download another.

Name: Gann
Lore: Belligerent Beta-Hirogen. Clashed with Decaren, Netek, and Kathryn Janeway during the hologram hunt. Finally came to respect the Voyager crew as worthy prey.
Text: SECURITY Computer Skill Navigation Biology Transporter Skill Astrophysics

Name: Gegis
Lore: DaiMon who reprogrammed the Federation hologram intercepted by Nunk. "Mastermind" of a plan to return Voyager to the Alpha Quadrant through a geodesic fold.
Text: OFFICER Computer Skill SCIENCE Acquisition Greed Your [Holo] and [Fer] cards may mix at this location.

Name: Hajur
Lore: Hirogen captured by Penk on his son's first hunt. Has fought at Tsunkatse for nearly two decades. Trained Seven of Nine, hoping she could end his captivity.
Text: CIVILIAN Leadership Biology MEDICAL Anthropology Geology Archaeology

Name: Harkan
Lore: Typical mentor of fledgling hunters. Stationed at the training facility near the Ovion system. Prepares young Hirogen to join Decaren's hunting group.
Text: SECURITY Anthropology Exobiology

Name: Hogan
Lore: Maquis crewman who thought briefly of rebelling against Captain Janeway after a close friend's death in 2372. Ultimately found his place in the Voyager crew.
Text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill

Name: Icheb
Lore: Borg rescued from the collective and his own people, the Brunali. Protege of Seven of Nine. Is taking Starfleet Academy's core classes, taught by Voyager's senior staff.
Text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics Youth Stellar Cartography Biology

Name: Idrin
Lore: Massive Alpha-Hirogen in command of a solitary Hunting Vessel. Less interested in the hunt than the spoils of his conquests, envy of his peers, and fear of his captives.
Text: OFFICER Exobiology Archaeology Greed ENGINEER Treachery DL/ {Hirogen Talon}

Name: Jetarn
Lore: Hunter ordered by Karr to assist in triage on Voyager crew members wounded on the holodeck. Like Jorik, performed cursorily at best.
Text: SECURITY MEDICAL Computer Skill

Name: Jorik
Lore: Medic who built neural interfaces to subdue the Voyager crew. Patched them up after hunters stabbed, shot, beat, phasered, and bat'lethed them in Karr's holoscenarios.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology Biology Computer Skill x 2 Treachery

Name: Kamok
Lore: Typical crewman of I.K.C. Voq'leng. Has low regard for Kohlar. Eagerly aided T'Greth's bid to seize a new ship after the captain foolishly destroyed their battle cruiser.
Text: SECURITY Computer Skill

Name: Karon
Lore: Diligent Alpha-Hirogen. Commanded a Hunting Vessel that stalked a member of Species 8472. Has an unrivaled understanding of the behavior of prey.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Treachery Anthropology x 2 Navigation Exobiology DL/ {Hirogen Disruptor Rifle}

Name: Karr
Lore: Alpha-Hirogen who captured Voyager in 2374. Used its holodecks to study his prey's history. Hoped for lessons to save his own culture from stagnation and extinction.
Text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Honor Law Computer Skill Anthropology Astrophysics

Name: Kes (The Borg)
Lore: In 2376, a vengeful Kes returned to Voyager, an outcast with powers far beyond any other Ocampa. Angry with Janeway, who encouraged her to unlock these abilities.
Text: CIVILIAN Empathy x 2 Physics Navigation Treachery MEDICAL May not be stunned.

Name: Kohlar
Lore: Captain of I.K.C. Voq'leng. Seized a chance to end his crew's long journey of hardship and isolation, casting the unborn child of B'Elanna Torres as the Kuvah'Magh.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Honor Anthropology Leadership Stellar Cartography DL/ {Auto-Destruct Sequence}

Name: Konuric
Lore: Representative of headstrong hunters. Once punished by Netek with months of remedial training. Never believed holograms to be worthy prey.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Geology

Name: Lagren
Lore: Kazan-Ogla who maintains the settlement on the Ocampa planet. Has searched unsuccessfully for a way to penetrate the Caretaker's subterranean shield.
Text: ENGINEER Physics Geology Exobiology

Name: Lansor
Lore: Humanoid mathematician once assimilated as the Borg, Two of Nine. Still linked with Marika and P'Chan.
Text: SCIENCE When reported, may download {Marika} and {P'Chan} (if not in play). Physics SECURITY

Name: Mabus
Lore: Trabe governor. Constantly plotting vengeance on the Kazon sects that killed his parents, continuing a cycle of hatred and persecution between their peoples.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Diplomacy SECURITY Once per game, may kill one Maje present.

Name: Marika
Lore: Bajoran assimilated as a Borg while on U.S.S. Excalibur. Became Three of Nine. She escaped the Borg in 2375.
Text: ENGINEER When reported, may download {Lansor} and {P'Chan} (if not in play). Astrophysics Stellar Cartography

Name: Mezoti
Lore: Norcadian girl being raised on Voyager. Of the four Borg children rescued from a damaged cube, was quickest in reclaiming her individuality. Likes sculpting and bugs.
Text: CIVILIAN Youth Computer Skill Biology Once each turn, may "unstop" your Borg present.

Name: Morak
Lore: Tactical officer of I.K.C. Voq'leng. Devout believer in the prophecies of the Sacred Scrolls. Banded with T'Greth in an attempt to commandeer U.S.S. Voyager.
Text: SCIENCE Transporter Skill Astrophysics Physics If on {I.K.C. Voq'leng}, it is attributes all +1.

Name: Netek
Lore: Impatient Alpha-Hirogen who took over the hunt for the escaped Hirogen holograms. Appreciated the irony of their prowess, but underestimated them nevertheless.
Text: OFFICER Transporter Skill Navigation Geology Stellar Cartography Exobiology

Name: Nine of Fifteen
Lore: Identification: ISOTOPE DRONE Task: Study Particle 010. Disseminate findings. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: SCIENCE Physics Astrophysics If you have completed {Harness Particle 010}, all your Borg in play are each attributes all +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Nine of Twelve
Lore: Identification: NETWORK DRONE Task: Accelerate construction of transwarp gateways. Biological Distinctiveness: Bolian species.
Text: ENGINEER Physics Navigation If present where probing for {Establish Gateway}, once each turn, you may discard probe card to probe again.

Name: Nunk
Lore: Ferengi romantically involved with Leosa. Sent her to get information from Reginald Barclay on the Pathfinder Project. Plans to spend his payoff on lobe enlargements.
Text: ENGINEER Greed Stellar Cartography Anthropology Once per game, may capture one [Holo] personnel present.

Name: One
Lore: Futuristic Borg created when The Doctor's holo-emitter accidentally fused with nanoprobes. His unique systems include reactive body armor and internal transporters.
Text: SCIENCE Youth May beam himself through any SHIELDS. Shares all regular skills from all Borg at this location.

Name: Orum
Lore: Romulan medic. Borg, liberated in 2368. Since then has worked with Riley Frazier, trying to forge cooperation among warring factions of Borg from his former cube.
Text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Cybernetics Computer Skill Exobiology Anthropology

Name: P'Chan
Lore: Humanoid who cared for his parents, Dornar and Ansha, until the Borg assimilated him as Four of Nine.
Text: CIVILIAN When reported, may download {Lansor} and {Marika} (if not in play). Computer Skill Honor MEDICAL

Name: Ranjen
Lore: Typical of Hirogen whose first loyalty is to a hunting group. Skilled pilot. Served as Beta-Hirogen under Idrin; challenged his obsession with collecting relics.
Text: ENGINEER Navigation x 2 Physics

Name: Rebi and Azan
Lore: Wysanti twins living under Seven of Nine's guidance. Freed from the Borg in 2376. Can still use their neural interfaces to share information - and cheat at Kadis-Kot.
Text: CIVILIAN+CIVILIAN Rebi: Youth Exobiology Computer Skill Azan: Youth SCIENCE Transporter Skill

Name: Reginald Barclay (The Borg)
Lore: Dedicated member of the Pathfinder Project. Established a means for Voyager to regularly communicate with Earth from tens of thousands of light-years away.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Astrophysics Honor Delta Quadrant [FED] missions you solve are +5 points.

Name: Riley Frazier
Lore: Human science officer of U.S.S. Roosevelt. Assimilated as a Borg at Wolf 359. Freed a year later when her ship was damaged. Romantically involved with Chakotay.
Text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Astrophysics Geology Your other Borg present are each CUNNING +2.

Name: Second
Lore: Immature drone of Brunali species; irrelevant designation: Icheb. A model of efficiency, yet failed to establish order among the young drones of his hive.
Text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics Youth Stellar Cartography DL/ {Divert Power} Doubles regular skills of other drones present.

Name: Seven of Nine (The Borg)
Lore: Identification: PROFICIENCY DRONE Task: Tertiary adjunct of unimatrix zero one. Biological Distinctiveness: Human species.
Text: ENGINEER Stellar Cartography Computer Skill Physics May apply [Com], [Nav], and [Def] to staffing. May draw a card in place of your normal card play.

Name: Seventeen of Eighteen
Lore: Identification: PURIFICATION DRONE Task: Process acquired resources. Optimize consumption. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Geology Stellar Cartography SCIENCE While on your ship in the Delta Quadrant, it is RANGE +2. (Cumulative.)

Name: Sinaren
Lore: Vidiian researcher. Among many who believe a cure for the phage might be found by scrutinizing extinct civilizations who were wiped out by plague.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Geology Archaeology

Name: Six of Twelve
Lore: Identification: SENTINEL DRONE Task: Assess defensive measures. Classify. Overcome. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: SECURITY Where present, your Borg are each CUNNING and STRENGTH +1. (Cumulative.)

Name: Sullin
Lore: Female, coelenterate life-form. Regarded by Kurros as perhaps the most gifted member of the Think Tank. Expert on temporal physics and tectonic instabilities.
Text: SCIENCE SCIENCE ENGINEER Geology x 2 Physics x 2

Name: Surat
Lore: First maje of the Kazon-Mostral. Has slyly arranged brief - but effective - alliances with other majes against larger sects. Commands a Kazon Raider.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Treachery Diplomacy SECURITY Astrophysics

Name: Takirac
Lore: One of the hunters serving with Karr in 2374. Accepted an optronic datacore from Kathryn Janeway in cease-fire talks, bringing holographic technology to the Hirogen.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Honor Leadership

Name: Tanar
Lore: Kazon of the Nistrim sect. Has served aboard Culluh's ship for many years. His opinions have come to carry a bit more weight with his maje than most.
Text: SCIENCE Archaeology Biology Anthropology

Name: T'Greth
Lore: Kohlar's first officer; scorned his reading of the Scrolls. Defeated in combat by Tom Paris when the Nehret set in. Cured by the Kuvah'Magh - with The Doctor's help.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Geology Navigation ENGINEER

Name: The Artificial Intelligence
Lore: Inorganic, genderless Think Tank member. Has the mind of a mathematician and the soul of an artist. Interviewed Seven of Nine to assess her worthiness as a recruit.
Text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Biology Stellar Cartography Computer Skill x 2

Name: Thenelak
Lore: Romulan female who assisted in the capture of U.S.S. Prometheus. Majored in warp theory at an academy located on a colony world 31 light-years from Romulus.
Text: ENGINEER Physics

Name: Third and Fourth
Lore: Immature drones of Wysanti species; irrelevant designations: Rebi and Azan. Assigned by the First to accelerate the development of new drones in their hive.
Text: Third: Youth SCIENCE Transporter Skill Fourth: Youth Exobiology Computer Skill DL/ {Maturation Chamber}

Name: Three of Nine
Lore: Identification: TACTICIAN DRONE Task: Auxiliary processor of unimatrix zero one. Biological Distinctiveness: Bajoran species.
Text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Once each turn, may place one card from hand beneath draw deck, then draw a card.

Name: Turanj
Lore: Rash hunter. Grudgingly took part in a holodeck scenario of Nazi Germany's 20th-century occupation of France. Never grasped Karr's aims in studying the Voyager prey.
Text: SECURITY Treachery x 2 Leadership Geology Stellar Cartography

Name: Two of Nine
Lore: Identification: TRANSTATOR DRONE Task: Primary adjunct of unimatrix zero one. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: SCIENCE Physics SECURITY Once each turn, may discard a card from hand to place bottom two cards of discard pile beneath draw deck.

Name: Two of Twelve
Lore: Identification: XENOLOGY DRONE Task: Assess suitability of alien cultures for assimilation. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Archaeology Anthropology Exobiology If present where probing for {Assimilate Planet}, once each turn, you may discard probe card to probe again.

Name: Vurond
Lore: Typical of relatively inexperienced hunters still learning more advanced techniques of stalking prey. Has pursued further training as Beta-Hirogen for Karon.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Stellar Cartography

Name: Yeggie
Lore: Avaricious Ferengi. Plotted with Gegis and Nunk to extract the 3.6 million Borg nanoprobes from Seven of Nine's body and sell them at six bars of latinum per unit.
Text: MEDICAL Greed Biology Cybernetics Treachery DL/ {Borg Nanoprobes} (if present with any Borg personnel).

Name: Borg Probe
Lore: Identification: BORG PROBE Task: Explore unimatricies at the borders of Borg space. Locate biological and technological distinctiveness.
Text: May report with up to 3 personnel to any Delta Quadrant location if your {Borg Queen} in play. Tractor Beam

Name: Borg Queen's Ship
Lore: Identification: BORG QUEEN'S SHIP Task: Execute assignments under personal command of the Borg Queen.
Text: May be fully staffed by {Borg Queen}. Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard. Tractor Beam

Name: Borg Tactical Cube
Lore: Identification: CLASS-4 TACTICAL CUBE Task: Respond to incursions into Borg space. Eliminate resistance.
Text: Your equipment and Borg personnel may report aboard (for free, once each turn, if a [Def] personnel). Tractor Beam

Name: Hunting Vessel
Lore: Small ship usually manned by a hunting pair. Often travels in groups like that which subdued Voyager in 2374. Its monotanium armor scatters enemy targeting scanners.
Text: X=7+ number of your other staffed [Hir] ships here. Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.C. Voq'leng
Characteristics/ Keywords: Alpha Quadrant-related [DQ] ship; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: 23rd-century battle cruiser. Believing the Empire had lost its way, the original crew set out over a century ago from the Alpha Quadrant on a quest to find the Kuvah'Magh.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ {Home Away From Home}

Name: Kazon Fighter
Lore: Small fighter based on the same design as the larger Raider. Karden commanded one when battling to earn his name.
Text: May report for free aboard your {Kazon Raider} if no ships aboard. DL/ {Blue Alert}

Name: Liberty
Lore: Maquis ship commanded by Captain Chakotay in 2371. 30-year old vessel - with a 39-year old engine that has been rebuilt and modified many times over.
Text: Your [Maq] personnel may report aboard. May be your seed at {Caretaker's Array}.

Name: The Think Tank's Ship
Lore: Advanced ship boasting technology designed by its crew, including a neutronium alloy hull, isomorphic projectors, and subspace cloaking device. Commanded by Kurros.
Text: Cloaking Device, Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Dauntless
Lore: Unique ship constructed and commanded by Arturis. Equipped with an operational quantum slipstream drive. Designed to appear as an experimental Starfleet vessel.
Text: May be fully staffed by {Arturis}. Holodeck DL/ {Quantum Slipstream Drive}

Name: U.S.S. Prometheus
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation ship; Holodeck; Prototype; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Prototype Starfleet vessel, NX-59650. Boasts ablative armor, regenerative shielding, and multivector assault mode. Captured by Romulans during a test flight.
Text: May download {Multivector Assault Mode} when in battle. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: Venatic Hunter
Lore: Large ship shunned by most hunters - there is a blind spot in its engines' ion wake, and its heavy armaments reduce the challenge of a hunt. Netek commanded one.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: The City of B'hala
Lore: 20,000-year-old depiction of an ancient Bajoran city. Among the most revered icons of their faith. Some thought B'hala a legend until this painting helped The Emissary find its underground ruins.
Text: May seed only at {Bajor}. Use as Equipment card. If present where attempting a [BAJ] mission, encounter seed cards in reverse order. (Immune to {Disruptor Overload}.)

Name: Alice
Lore: Alien shuttle with an interface that restructures its pilot's neural pathways. Manifested in Tom Paris' mind as an Academy crush, forcing him to take the ship to her particle fountain "home."
Text: Unless 2 Computer Skill and Biology present, personnel with most Navigation (opponent's choice if tie or none) is captured. Discard dilemma.

Name: Chula: Echoes
Lore: The echoing voice of the "fallen" Julian Bashir attempted to separate Sisko, Dax, and Kira before they reached the final challenge in their game of chula.
Text: To get past, three personnel present (random selection) are chosen. If the highest CUNNING among them is odd, all three are "stopped."

Name: Chula: Trickery
Lore: Most chula puzzles play upon a participant's initial instincts - open doors are not always to be taken. Those who remember lessons from earlier shaps will fare better in the endgame.
Text: Opponent conceals your personnel, randomly selects one, and recites their attribute numbers. Unless you can name the selected personnel, all are "stopped." Discard dilemma.

Name: Cytoplasmic Life-form
Lore: Even a knowledge as vast as The Doctor's has limitations. In 2375, he called upon a holographic "consultant" to assist in removing a parasitic alien that had attacked B'Elanna Torres.
Text: Unless 3 Exobiology present, place on mission. Each of its skill requirements must be met by a different personnel when solving it.

Name: Dejaren
Lore: Alien hologram with a deranged hatred of organic life. Murdered all the filthy animals aboard his ship, then attacked The Doctor and B'Elanna Torres when they responded to his distress call.
Text: Two personnel (one [Holo] and one non-[Holo]) are killed (random selection) if their individual CUNNING<9. To get past requires 2 Computer Skill remaining.

Name: Emergent Life-form
Lore: An emerging intelligence seized control of the Enterprise in 2370 to seek out particles it needed to evolve. The crew interacted with it on the holodeck, helping to find this nourishment more quickly.
Text: Place on ship. Now and start of each turn, opponent may move ship to another location (using its RANGE). If ship has Holodeck, cure with 2 ENGINEER and Astrophysics aboard.

Name: Primitive Humanoids
Lore: Humanoids inhabiting a desolate planted captured Neelix and Kes while the two crewmen were searching for food. The cave-dwellers particularly like Kes' golden locks.
Text: Unless 2 Leadership and Anthropology present, place two Away Team members (random selection) with dilemma atop mission until solved (or planet assimilated).

Name: Talosian Cage
Lore: Telepathic aliens with the power to create illusory worlds, often based on the memories of life-forms they've captured. Starfleet General Order 7 forbids contact with their homeworld, Talos IV.
Text: Unless 3 Empathy OR {Christopher Pike} present, opponent may choose to discard two females (random selection) OR male with most [*] icons. Discard dilemma.

Name: The Clown: Guillotine
Lore: Though The Clown existed only through the minds linked to his system, he was willing to execute one to ensure the obedience of the others, perpetuating his role as fear personified.
Text: Unless 2 Diplomacy present, kills one personnel (random selection) and "stops" each personnel whose total attributes are lower than killed personnel until end of your next turn.

Name: The Clown: Playing Doctor
Lore: Linked directly to the minds of his "guests," The Clown could use their deepest fears to torment them. The Doctor's timely arrival spared Harry Kim a violent reenactment of a childhood trauma.
Text: One personnel (random selection) and all others present who have the same first-listed skill are killed (only "stopped" if a [Holo] personnel present).

Name: Your Galaxy Is Impure
Lore: The genetic density of Species 8472 is superior to all known forms of life. Any wound inflicted by them will spread infection throughout a victim's body, consuming it from the inside out.
Text: Randomly select a personnel to be killed. Place on mission. At the start of each mission or scouting attempt here, kills one personnel present (your choice). (Immune to {Adapt: Negate Obstruction}.)

Name: Holodeck Door
Text: Seeds (during facility phase) or plays on your ship (limit one per ship) or outpost, or on any {headquarters}. Adds Holodeck, and your compatible [Holo] cards may report aboard. OR Plays once each turn to download a {Holoprogram} or any [Holo] or [Bar] card; place doorway out-of-play. OR Plays at any time to prevent the deactivation of any one [Holo] personnel; discard doorway.

Name: '45 Dom Perignon
Lore: Champagne of a respected 20th-century vintage. Traditionally used to christen new ships. In the holographic world of Secret Agent Julian Bashir, also serves as an effective hand weapon.
Text: May discard to download a unique ship to replace (discard) your [Univ] ship of same class here. Once per battle, your personnel present may stun an adversary they just engaged.

Name: Ablative Armor
Lore: Early 25th-century technology brought from an alternate future to the year 2377 by Admiral Janeway. Quickly adapted for use on Voyager, enabling it to withstand the attack of a Borg cube.
Text: While aboard your ship or facility, opponent's ATTACK total must be more than double that ship or facility's DEFENSE total to score a hit, and more than triple to score a direct hit.

Name: Satan's Robot
Lore: Robotic minion of Chaotica. Warns of invaders and deals with intruders. Nearly conquered the world in the final chapter of one of The Adventures of Captain Proton.
Text: Participates in battle like a personnel; has NO STRENGTH vs. a Borg or android adversary, otherwise STRENGTH=8. May capture any female or [Holo] adversary it stuns. (Unique.)

Name: Bynars Data Transfer
Lore: A star in the Bynars' system went nova in 2364. Only their expertise with computers allowed them to transfer information from their main computer in time to save their world.
Text: Plays on table. Glance at the top five cards of your draw deck. Place them in any order on top of and/or beneath your draw deck, then place event beneath draw deck.

Name: Dominion War Efforts
Lore: The Dominion has the ability to produce Jem'Hadar in massive numbers with incredible ease. Losses taken in their war with the Alpha Quadrant meant as little to them as their Cardassian allies.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Your {Assign Support Personnel} card is not discarded when used to download a [Dom] or [Car] "support personnel." (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}).

Name: Ferengi Financial Data Net
Lore: Galactic service providing up-to-the-second reports on market fluctuations, currency values, and commodity prices - all for a reasonable usage fee. Essential for any serious entrepreneur.
Text: Plays to discard your hand. Draw a card for each unique [Fer] Greed personnel you have in play. Discard event.

Name: Oo-mox
Lore: The bestseller Oo-mox for Fun and Profit guides a female around the highly erogenous Ferengi ear, from the tympanic tickle and eustachian tube rub to the infamous auditory canal nibble.
Text: Plays on table, "stopping" all male Ferengi in play. Until countdown expires, doubles regular skills of all male Ferengi in play, and they are attributes all +2.

Name: Transwarp Hub
Lore: Identification: TRANSWARP HUB Task: Dispatch Borg vessels throughout the galaxy.
Text: Seeds or plays at any nebula. Once each turn, your ship may move from here to any {Transwarp Network Gateway}, or vice versa.

Name: Children of Light
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Your [Holo] personnel may mix and have no affiliation attack restrictions. OR Plays to capture all [Holo] personnel present with {Iden}, or (if he is aboard {Olarra}) all [Holo] personnel aboard one damaged ship at his location; discard incident.

Name: Clone Machine
Text: Seeds or plays on {Mariposa}, {Boreth}, a [Dom] facility, or an {Infirmary}. Your unique personnel (except a [Holo], android, or dual personnel) may report here if a copy is already in play (limit once each turn; requires {Koroth} OR a personnel with INTEGRITY<6 and MEDICAL, Biology, or Exobiology present). Once every turn, if your Vorta just died, you may download any version of that persona here, ignoring uniqueness.

Name: Cybernetics Expertise
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your android may report for free if Cybernetics present and may report to your personnel who has Cybernetics x2. Also, once each turn, you may exchange a card from hand for an android in your discard pile.

Name: Holoprogram: 221B Baker Street
Text: Seeds or plays on your ship or facility with a Holodeck. In place of your normal card play, you may download {Sherlock Holmes} (or any personnel with his name in lore) aboard. OR Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, you may place a personnel here from hand. Personnel placed here add [Holo] icon to your copies of same personnel in play. You may discard any cards placed here at any time.

Name: Holoprogram: Deadwood
Text: Seeds or plays on your ship with a Holodeck. {Sheriff Worf} and {Deputy Rozhenko} may report aboard. If both aboard: location here is span+X for opponent (where X=number of your SECURITY personnel aboard, maximum 4), opponent must have more SECURITY here than you to initiate battle here, and, once each turn, Sheriff Worf may nullify any dilemma requiring SECURITY he just encountered here.

Name: Holoprogram: Fortress of Doom
Text: Seeds or plays on your ship with a Holodeck. In place of your normal card play, you may download {Chaotica} (or any card with his name in lore) aboard. While Chaotica is aboard (and {Captain Proton} is not at same location), opponent must discard two cards to attempt mission at this location unless they have a [Holo] personnel participating in the attempt.

Name: Holoprogram: Noah's Mountain Retreat
Requires: Dr. Noah-related personnel; Holodeck; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
Text: Seeds or plays on any ship or facility with a Holodeck. You may report {Secret Agent Julian Bashir} (or any personnel with his name in lore) aboard. In place of your normal card play, you may download such a personnel aboard. Also, if your Transporter Skill aboard, at start of turn you may replace (discard) your {Dr. Noah} (or personnel with his name in lore) present by downloading a version of same persona.

Name: Holoprogram: The Office of Dixon Hill
Text: Seeds or plays on your ship with a Holodeck. In place of a card draw, you may download {Felix Leech} aboard. Also, your {Cyrus Redblock} may report aboard and, if he is aboard, once each turn you may request "the item." Place a card from hand face down on table. Opponent must choose: you may play it for free and draw a card OR you must place it out-of-play and score 5 points.

Name: In the Zone
Text: Seeds or plays on table. If a non-Borg player scores more than 50 points during a single turn (including this turn), those points in excess of 50 do not count toward winning. While your score is exactly 50 points, each of your ships has double RANGE and SHIELDS. Also, nullifies {End Transmission} and {Preparation}, and each player may call "{Devidian Door}" during their turn (and only once per turn).

Name: Jem'Hadar Shrouding
Text: Seeds or plays on table. During your turn, you may place here one or two Jem'Hadar from hand or in play, then draw a card. (These Jem'Hadar are not in play.) OR Plays once every turn (for free) on an opponent's Away Team (unless it is on a homeworld). Initiate battle against that Away Team by playing up to an equal number of personnel to it from your Jem'Hadar Shrouding on table. Discard incident.

Name: Tongo
Text: Plays on table. Once each turn, you may declare a move from the list below. Each player simultaneously reveals a bet from hand (a personnel card; yours must be Ferengi). Player with highest total attributes on bet is winner. Acquire. Winner: discard bet, then draw up to two cards. Confront. Winner: report bet. Loser: place bet on draw deck. Evade. Winner: place bet under draw deck. Loser: discard bet.

Name: White Deprivation
Text: Seeds or plays on table. At start of every player's turn, all of that player's [KW] personnel present together must battle (and stun or mortally wound when able) opposing non-changelings present, or (if none) any non-changelings present, or (if none) each other (split randomly into two equal groups). Also, one [KW] personnel in each of that player's crews and Away Teams dies (random selection).

Name: All Threes
Lore: While trapped in a temporal causality loop, Data's dealing at the regular poker game was influenced by a posthypnotic suggestion sent from an earlier repetition of events.
Text: Plays once each turn to reveal two sets of three cards from top of your draw deck. Take one set into hand; discard the other (opponent's choice unless you have {any Data} in play).

Name: Data, Keep Dealing
Lore: Data could shuffle playing cards as if they were isolinear chips removed by an intoxicated engineer. Will Riker often quipped, "Sometimes I wonder if he's stacking the deck."
Text: If you have in play {any Data} or {any Hollander}, look at the top two and bottom two cards of your draw deck. Replace in any order, two on top and two on bottom.

Name: I'm a Doctor, Not a Bartender
Lore: Though happy to celebrate Kes' second birthday, The Doctor's mood soured when he became trapped in the Chez Sandrine holoprogram during an encounter with a spatial distortion ring.
Text: Adds Anthropology to one MEDICAL personnel until end of turn. OR Downloads a bartender to replace (discard) your MEDICAL personnel in play (or vice versa).

Name: I've Been Waiting for You
Lore: Upon learning of Quark's plan to feature her in a lascivious holoscenario, Kira Nerys enlisted Odo's help in making a small change to the program. The client got far more than he paid for.
Text: Once every turn, plays to exchange your unique [Holo] personnel in play with a [Holo] personnel from your hand.

Name: Remember the Alamo
Lore: Miles O'Brien's fascination with the famous 1836 battle led him to create this massive scale model. Kira and Worf teased him about his toy. Molly noted she let him play with her toys.
Text: Randomly kills an opposing personnel in a personnel battle you just lost (limit once per battle). OR Once per game, plays on a planet to randomly kill a SECURITY personnel.

Name: Small Oversight
Lore: Holographic technology is notoriously finicky. Before The Doctor acquired his mobile emitter, attempts to project him outside of sickbay or the holodeck invariably met with problems.
Text: Plays on a [Holo] personnel who is not wearing a {Mobile Holo-Emitter}. [Holo] and [Cmd] personnel present are each attributes all -3 and lose first-listed skill for rest of turn.

Name: Establish Home Planet
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Help found a new "Home of Light" for holograms liberated from Hirogen training facilities.
Text: Leadership + ENGINEER x2 + Computer Skill x2 * +25 if all personnel in Away Team are [Holo].

Name: Mine Gallicite
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Collect valuable material from the tunnels beneath this apparently abandoned world.
Text: ENGINEER + Geology + (Diplomacy OR Treachery + STRENGTH>40)

Name: Repair Memorial
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Recharge power cells of a monument built to commemorate a Nakan massacre.
Text: ENGINEER + Computer Skill + Honor x2 Personnel here are each attributes all -2.

Name: Seal Rift
Lore: Use an anti-tachyon pulse to implode this artificially-created temporal phenomenon.
Text: SCIENCE x2 + ENGINEER x2 OR {Admiral Janeway} Until solved, [AU] ships may report here.

Name: Study Protonebula
Lore: Monitor emerging phenomenon and record the effects of its radiation on the crew.
Text: Astrophysics + Biology + Navigation x2 Once per game, you may download {One} to your ship here. Opponent's side: Once per game, you may download a [BO] objective.

Name: Transport Colonists
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Convey members of a telepathic species from the Fima system to their home planet.
Text: Diplomacy + Honor + INTEGRITY>40 * +5 if Empathy or Mindmeld present.

Name: Bajoran Resistance Cell
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your [Baj] Resistance personnel may report for free to your [Baj] facility or ship or to any Bajor Region planet. Also, your Bajoran espionage cards may not be nullified. Once each turn, you may download a Bajoran espionage card to one of your unsolved missions (limit one per mission), then draw two cards if you have at least two [Baj] Resistance personnel in play.

Name: Hunting Group
Text: Seeds or plays on your non-[HIR] space mission with a point box. You may attempt it using these requirements: Alpha-Hirogen + [Hir] ship + (CUNNING + STRENGTH) > mission points x3 When you solve mission, you may commandeer an opposing ship present (capturing opposing personnel aboard) if your total WEAPONS there > twice its SHIELDS. Discard objective.

Name: Orbital Bombardment
Text: Plays on your non-[Fed] ship. It is WEAPONS +4 against planet facilities, and may target landed ships in battle (those ships may not return fire). Also, if this ship is at a planet location at end of your turn (and has not battled this turn), you may probe: [*]: Targets hit. Kills up to two opposing personnel on planet (random selection). Opponent may counter-attack next turn.

Name: Admiral J. P. Hanson
Lore: Head of Borg research and strategic planning at Starfleet Tactical. Friend of Jean-Luc Picard for over 40 years. Amassed an armada to face a Borg cube at Wolf 359.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Honor SECURITY Your [Fed] ships may report here (unless [AU]).

Name: Ah-Kel and Ro-Kel
Lore: Miradorn twins, bonded as if two halves of one being. Attacked and plundered transports for valuable objets d'art. Negotiated with Quark to sell one such item.
Text: OFFICER+OFFICER Ah-Kel: Archaeology Smuggling Treachery Ro-Kel: Acquisition Biology Greed

Name: Anastasia Komananov
Characteristics/ Keywords: Hologram; Dr. Noah-related personnel; Female; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
Lore: KGB agent. Kira Nerys, with a Russian accent. Brought orders to pursue Dr. Noah. Romantically involved with Secret Agent Julian Bashir. Wears exploding earrings.
Text: OFFICER Honor Diplomacy DL/ {Smoke Bomb} May {Issue Secret Orders} as if she were an infiltrator.

Name: Arachnia
Lore: Impetuous Queen of the Spider People, as portrayed by Kathryn Janeway. Forced Chaotica to lower his lightning shield after uncorking her pheromones on his henchman.
Text: V.I.P. Opposing ships here are SHIELDS -4 unless a female is aboard. Diplomacy Treachery Honor

Name: Barash
Lore: Humanoid child orphaned by his homeworld's invasion. Secreted on Alpha Onias III in a cavern equipped with advanced holotechnology. Bonded with William T. Riker.
Text: CIVILIAN Your [Bar] personnel may report here (for free, once each turn). Doubles {Hologram Ruse}. Youth

Name: B'Elanna Daughter of Miral
Lore: The half-human B'Elanna Torres embraced her Klingon heritage in dealing with the Voq'leng crew. With Kohlar's help, she convinced them her child was the Kuvah'Magh.
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Leadership Diplomacy Honor Computer Skill x 2

Name: Boothby
Lore: Groundskeeper at Starfleet Academy for more than 50 years. Has mentored countless cadets. Half the captains in Starfleet wouldn't be where they are without him.
Text: CIVILIAN Your [Fed] Youth personnel may report where present and are each attributes all +2 while here. Biology

Name: Buster Kincaid
Lore: Harry Kim played the role of Captain Proton's trusty sidekick through fiery volcanoes, crash landings, killer robots, alien invasions, and the Den of Crocodiles.
Text: OFFICER If with {Captain Proton}, you may discard two cards from hand to draw one. Navigation

Name: Captain Proton
Lore: Spaceman First Class, Protector of Earth, Scourge of Intergalactic Evil. Tom Paris played the adventurous hero in his re-creation of the original 1930's sci-fi serials.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation DL/ {Buster Kincaid} Your other [eHA] personnel present are attributes all +2.

Name: Carlos
Lore: Identity adapted by the Soong-type android Data in the fictional world of Dixon Hill. Snappy dresser with a nice tan. From South America. "Can't you tell?"
Text: CIVILIAN If with {Dixon Hill}, your draw deck is "on ice": draw cards from discard pile instead. Computer Skill x 2

Name: Chancellor Gowron
Lore: Beginning with his invasion of Cardassia in 2372, Gowron became increasingly prideful and paranoid. Nearly destroyed the Empire in his quest for glory.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Anthropology Law DL/ {HQ: War Room} DL/ {Council of Warriors}

Name: Chaotica
Lore: Evil ruler of Planet X, enemy of Captain Proton. Lusts after Arachnia. In 2375, waged war on photonic aliens from "the Fifth Dimension" with his fiendish Death Ray.
Text: V.I.P. Once each turn, may return one [Holo] personnel here to owner's hand. Treachery x 2 Leadership

Name: Cravic Unit 122
Lore: Standard Automated Commander built by the Cravic to wage war on the Pralor. It is among the oldest of their androids still in operation. Commands a Cravic Warship.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Computer Skill Navigation

Name: Crell Moset
Lore: Re-creation of notorious exobiologist. Cured the Fostossa virus through cruel experiments on Bajoran prisoners.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology x 2 Treachery Once each turn, may discard a personnel present to play a [Car] personnel and/or draw up to two cards.

Name: Cyrus Redblock
Lore: Civil but dangerous gangster. Believes in killing when for a purpose. Is resolved to obtain "the item" he believes was entrusted to Dixon Hill by Jessica Bradley.
Text: CIVILIAN When revealed, your dilemmas with "murder" or "crime" in title kill a personnel (random selection). Leadership x 2

Name: Dar
Lore: The Hirogen created relatively few Breen holograms, given the limited and conflicting information about their species gleaned from the Voyager databanks.
Text: SECURITY Biology Stellar Cartography

Name: Deputy Rozhenko
Lore: With some help from Reginald Barclay, the 3/4 Klingon, 1/4 human Alexander Rozhenko created a holodeck program of the Ancient West for himself and his father.
Text: SECURITY Scores 5 points when {Sheriff Worf} stuns an opposing personnel who has Treachery. Youth Law

Name: Dixon Hill
Lore: Fictional private detective. Solved dozens of cases. Jean-Luc Picard is an aficionado of the original 1930s stories and the latest holonovels by Broht and Forrester.
Text: CIVILIAN Once per game, when solving a mission where present, may ignore non-attribute requirements. DL/ {Any Business Card}

Name: Doran
Lore: Typical Hirogen hologram based on information taken from Voyager. His memories of the hunt were transferred to The Doctor in the hopes of gaining his understanding.
Text: SECURITY Archaeology Transporter Skill

Name: Dr. Noah
Characteristics/ Keywords: Hologram; Capturing-related card; Male; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
Lore: Archenemy of Secret Agent Julian Bashir, replaced by the transporter pattern of Benjamin Sisko. Gathered the world's finest minds to start a new human race.
Text: CIVILIAN Once each turn, may capture most CUNNING personnel present. Leadership Treachery

Name: Duchamps
Characteristics/ Keywords: Hologram; Dr. Noah-related personnel; Male; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
Lore: Dr. Noah's associate. Skilled baccarat player, but less so than Secret Agent Julian Bashir. Carries a cigar rigged with a knockout agent. Transformed to appear as Worf.
Text: CIVILIAN At start of battle, may stun up to three adversaries present (your choice). SECURITY Treachery

Name: Durango
Lore: While most in touch with her Betazoid heritage, Deanna Troi loved her human father's tales of the Ancient West. She always wanted to play the "mysterious stranger."
Text: CIVILIAN Empathy Honor SECURITY If with {Sheriff Worf}, both are STRENGTH +2.

Name: E.M.H.-Mark II
Lore: Emergency Medical Hologram. More sophisticated - and more eccentric - than the earlier Mark I version.
Text: MEDICAL Biology OR Exobiology (may use only one per turn). May report aboard {U.S.S. Prometheus} (for free).

Name: Edward Jellico
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Take-charge captain of U.S.S. Enterprise during Picard's Celtris III mission. Negotiated first Cardassian armistice. When he gives an order, expects his crew to get it done.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy ENGINEER Stellar Cartography Leadership DL/ {Treaty: Federation/Cardassian}

Name: Ekoor
Lore: Former soldier in a Jem'Hadar security detail. Outraged by the destruction of Lakarian City, he pledged his life to the resistance against the Dominion.
Text: OFFICER Once each turn, your [Univ] [Car] SECURITY may report for free where present. Leadership Honor

Name: Eli Hollander
Lore: The Butcher of Bozeman, meanest gunslinger in the West. Frank's boy. Assumed Data's traits in a holodeck glitch - including his dexterity with a deck of cards.
Text: CIVILIAN Treachery DL/ {Prisoner Exchange} Opponent may not use SECURITY skill where present.

Name: Els Renora
Lore: Wry, 100-year-old judge who presided over Jadzia Dax's Klaestron extradition hearing in 2369. Shows no signs of slowing down, despite her advanced age.
Text: V.I.P. Law x 2 MEDICAL Anthropology

Name: Ezri Dax
Characteristics/ Keywords: Trill; Counselor; Female; Trill with symbiont;
Lore: Trill. Ship's counselor. Succeeded Jadzia Dax as ninth symbiont host. Unprepared for her emergency joining. Romantically involved with Julian Bashir. Gets spacesick.
Text: OFFICER SCIENCE Anthropology Diplomacy Youth Geology Reports for free if {Jadzia Dax} has died.

Name: Falcon
Characteristics/ Keywords: Hologram; Assassin; Dr. Noah-related personnel; Male; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
Lore: Deadly assassin hired by Dr. Noah to deal with problems like Secret Agent Julian Bashir. The character took on the appearance of Miles O'Brien after an accident in 2372.
Text: SECURITY May place in your point area when he mortally wounds an adversary. Treachery

Name: Felix Leech
Lore: Hit man from the Dixon Hill stories. Never strays far from his boss, Cyrus Redblock. Held several Enterprise crew members at gunpoint during a holodeck malfunction.
Text: CIVILIAN Opposing personnel present may not use classifications. DL/ {Cyrus Redblock} (if opponent attacked you this game).

Name: Frank Hollander
Lore: Main "bad guy" in Alexander's Deadwood program. Eli's pa. A computer malfunction caused the character to take on the appearance and physical abilities of Data.
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Leadership Treachery DL/ {Captured} {Holoprogram: Deadwood} here is suspended.

Name: Garren
Lore: Because of their cloaking technology and precise strategic planning, re-creations of Romulans were often used by the Hirogen in ship-to-ship hunting simulations.
Text: SCIENCE Geology Navigation

Name: Harath
Lore: Representative of the Hirogen's holographic prey. The Cardassians' deceptive nature - and unpredictability when cornered - made them a worthy challenge.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Computer Skill

Name: Iden
Lore: Charismatic but megalomaniacal hologram. Escaped the Hirogen. Seeks to create a new religion based on his deliverance of holograms from oppression and slavery.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Anthropology Diplomacy Treachery Astrophysics DL/ {Children of Light}

Name: John Watson
Lore: London physician and companion of Sherlock Holmes. Recounted a full five dozen of the sleuth's cases. On the holodeck, Geordi La Forge was Data's Watson.
Text: MEDICAL If with {Sherlock Holmes}, you may discard your hand at start of turn. ENGINEER Physics

Name: Kar'meth
Lore: One of the secondary bridge officers on I.K.C. Voq'leng. Has already begun training his successor; the Nehret has been known to claim his family quickly.
Text: SCIENCE Biology Stellar Cartography

Name: Kejal
Lore: Cardassian hologram created by the Hirogen. Self-taught engineer of advanced skill. Her name, the Bajoran word for "freedom," was given to her by Iden.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Transporter Skill Honor DL/ {Holo-projectors}

Name: Leonardo da Vinci
Lore: Renaissance man whose accomplishments as a scientist, artist, mathematician, philosopher, astronomer, inventor, anatomist, and geologist dwarfed all his contemporaries.
Text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Astrophysics Biology Geology Physics DL/ {Mona Lisa}

Name: Lewis Zimmerman
Lore: Father of modern holography. Designed the E.M.H. series. Was briefly romantically involved with Leeta in 2373. Suffering from acute subcellular degradation.
Text: ENGINEER Your compatible [Holo] cards may report here (for free, once each turn). ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2

Name: Lily
Lore: In her time aboard U.S.S. Enterprise-E, Lily Sloane adjusted admirably to rayguns, force fields, bionic zombies, and the holographic world of Dixon Hill.
Text: CIVILIAN If with {Dixon Hill}, once per game may cancel a personnel battle here. ENGINEER Physics

Name: Lonzak
Characteristics/ Keywords: Hologram; Bodyguard; Capturing-related card; Chaotica-related card; Male;
Lore: Inferior serving as bodyguard to Chaotica. Enforces his liege's rule, imprisoning infidels in the Dungeon of Pain or Mines of Mercury. Often seizes Constance Goodheart.
Text: SECURITY Worth 5 points for each female captive present (double if {Chaotica} also present). Law

Name: Madam Pulaski
Lore: Katherine Pulaski entered the holodeck on a bet that Data could not solve a Sherlock Holmes-style mystery without already knowing the outcome.
Text: CIVILIAN Unique missions seeded by both players are worth +10 points if you complete them. MEDICAL

Name: Maleth
Lore: Typical chief of security for large Vidiian bases. Head of perimeter defense for the Avery III installation. Captured Tom Paris, B'Elanna Torres, and Peter Durst in 2371.
Text: SECURITY Leadership Physics Transporter Skill Opposing personnel are STRENGTH -1 where present.

Name: Mila
Lore: Former housekeeper and confidante of Enabran Tain. Hid members of Damar's resistance in her basement. Procured a com unit and other equipment for their use.
Text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Computer Skill Honor DL/ {Any Equipment card}

Name: Minuet
Lore: Knockout brunette in a computer-generated gin joint. Programmed by the Bynars to distract William T. Riker. His feelings for her remained quite passionate for years.
Text: CIVILIAN Once each turn, your {Bynars} card may play for free. Once every turn, may "stop" up to two males present.

Name: Mona Luvsitt
Characteristics/ Keywords: Hologram; Female; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
Lore: Capable valet to Secret Agent Julian Bashir. She speaks seven languages, has degrees in biology, chemistry, and physics, and can fly anything from a jet to a helicopter.
Text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Biology Physics Navigation Anthropology

Name: Mr. Garak
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Male; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
Lore: The Cardassian Elim Garak taught Secret Agent Julian Bashir: "There comes a point when the odds are against you and the only reasonable course of action is to quit."
Text: CIVILIAN May end a mission attempt he is involved in just after any dilemma killed your personnel. Treachery

Name: Naomi Wildman
Lore: 1/2 Ktarian, 1/2 human born on Voyager; raised by its crew. Daughter of Samantha. Goddaughter of Neelix. Mentored by Seven of Nine. Official captain's assistant.
Text: CIVILIAN While aboard {U.S.S. Voyager}, doubles first-listed skill of other personnel present. Youth

Name: Nicki the Nose
Lore: Nefarious gangster and arms dealer. Infrequent patron of a highbrow San Francisco restaurant. Featured in several Dixon Hill stories, including The Big Goodbye.
Text: CIVILIAN Leadership Treachery Greed DL/ {Tommygun}

Name: Nirok
Lore: Chief of security aboard I.K.C. Voq'leng. His great-grandfather was the ship's original captain when it first set out over 100 years ago.
Text: SECURITY Exobiology Navigation Astrophysics

Name: Praetor Neral
Lore: Neral is the president of the Continuing Committee and Praetor of the glorious Romulan Star Empire. Has not aged well under the mantle of leadership.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Treachery Diplomacy Biology Adds SECURITY to each of your Tal Shiar personnel.

Name: Pralor Unit 3947
Lore: Automated Personnel Unit built by the Pralor. Found adrift in space by Voyager. Abducted B'Elanna Torres in the hopes she could build more androids of its kind.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Astrophysics Geology Navigation

Name: Pralor Unit 6263
Lore: Standard Automated Personnel Unit built by the Pralor. Its creators were annihilated when they tried to shut the androids down after reaching peace with the Cravic.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Computer Skill Navigation

Name: Professor Honey Bare
Characteristics/ Keywords: Hologram; Capturing-related card; Dr. Noah-related personnel; Female; Professor; SA Julian Bashir-related personnel;
Lore: Seismologist replaced by an image of Jadzia Dax. Built the lasers Dr. Noah planned to use to destroy the world. Romantically involved with Secret Agent Julian Bashir.
Text: SCIENCE Geology Physics DL/ {Rescue Captives} May play {Volcanic Eruption} as an event at her location.

Name: Professor Moriarty
Characteristics/ Keywords: Hologram; Male; Professor; Sherlock Holmes-related personnel;
Lore: Sherlock Holmes' enemy. Accidentally made sentient in 2365. Built a simulation of the Enterprise and its crew.
Text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Leadership Computer Skill Treachery Once each turn, you may place an additional personnel under {Holoprogram: 221B Baker Street}.

Name: Regina Barthalomew
Lore: Fictional character inspired by the Sherlock Holmes stories. Romantically involved with Professor Moriarty.
Text: V.I.P. If with {Professor Moriarty}, copies of your unique personnel under {Holoprogram: 221B Baker Street} may report for free (twice each turn).

Name: Rulat
Lore: Kazon-Nistrim bodyguard reporting directly to Seska. Instrumental in planning the assault to take Voyager in 2372.
Text: SECURITY Navigation Computer Skill Geology Your other [Kaz] SECURITY present are attributes all +1.

Name: Rusot
Lore: Arrogant Gul. Gathered support in the early stages of the anti-Dominion resistance, despite his disdain for covert tactics. His Cardassia's dead, and won't be coming back.
Text: OFFICER Your [Car] personnel with resistance in lore may report where present. Treachery Astrophysics

Name: Sam Lavelle
Lore: Typical Starfleet ensign eagerly chasing a promotion. Served aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2370. Decent poker player. His grandfather was Canadian.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Computer Skill DL/ {Lower Decks}

Name: Secret Agent Julian Bashir
Lore: Bashir... Julian Bashir. Role in a holoprogram created by his friend Felix, of a spy for Great Britain in the Cold War of 20th-century Earth. Has escaped countless traps.
Text: OFFICER Geology MEDICAL Biology DL/ {'45 Dom Perignon} Your personnel may not be captured where present.

Name: Seskal
Lore: Abrasive Gul. Loyal to Damar, though he believes the resistance movement would do better without the interference of the former terrorist, Kira Nerys.
Text: OFFICER SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Anthropology

Name: Sheriff Worf
Lore: Sheriff of Deadwood, South Dakota, as played by Worf. Though initially reluctant to spend time with his son, the Klingon soon saw the appeal of Alexander's scenario.
Text: SECURITY STRENGTH +1 for each opposing SECURITY personnel present. Leadership Computer Skill Law

Name: Sherlock Holmes
Lore: The role of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's brilliant detective was often assumed by the Soong-type android Data.
Text: CIVILIAN Biology Physics Music Computer Skill At start of your turn, you may draw a card if your opponent has more cards in hand than you.

Name: Sigmund Freud
Lore: Neurologist who founded the science of psychoanalysis on Earth in the late 19th century. Data looked to this re-creation for interpretations of his first nightmares.
Text: MEDICAL Your personnel and equipment may report where present (if [AU]). Biology DL/ {Alternate Universe Door}

Name: Sumek
Lore: Initially produced en masse for their logic and strength, Vulcan holograms were soon abandoned by the Hirogen for showing no lust for the hunt or fear of being hunted.
Text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Stellar Cartography

Name: Teero Anaydis
Lore: Excommunicated Vedek. Worked in counterintelligence for the Maquis. Experimented with using mind control to recruit agents. Honed his techniques on Tuvok.
Text: CIVILIAN Treachery Exobiology MEDICAL Anthropology Computer Skill

Name: The E.C.H.
Lore: Emergency Command Hologram. At his request, The Doctor was granted the privilege in 2376 to command U.S.S. Voyager in emergencies like the Quarren incident.
Text: OFFICER Computer Skill Navigation Physics MEDICAL DL/ Any Maneuver card

Name: The President of Earth
Lore: The Doctor gave an unimpeachable performance on the holodeck in 2375, negotiating with transdimensional aliens who mistook a Captain Proton program for reality.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy x 2 MEDICAL Personnel present with {Chaotica} are attributes all -3.

Name: The Twin Mistresses of Evil
Lore: Captain Proton villains portrayed by the Delaney sisters, Megan and Jenny. Threatened to use their Brain Probe to make Buster Kincaid their slave. He didn't mind.
Text: SCIENCE+SCIENCE Demonica: Doubles skills of {any Harry Kim} present. Malicia: Doubles skills of {any Tom Paris} present.

Name: Vic Fontaine
Lore: Self-aware holoprogram of a 20th-century Las Vegas singer. His keen insights helped Bashir, Odo, Kira, Worf, Nog, and others aboard Deep Space 9 through difficult times.
Text: CIVILIAN DL/ Any card (if an opponent's dilemma just "stopped" a personnel present). Music

Name: Vornar
Lore: Guard stationed at a facility in the Kelvas system. Characteristic of the many Cardassians, resentful of the Dominion, who embraced Damar's resistance effort.
Text: SECURITY Transporter Skill Biology Honor

Name: Weiss
Lore: Bloodthirsty hologram programmed to be Hirogen prey. Turned the tables, leading the slaughter of 43 hunters during his escape. Became Iden's tactical officer.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Treachery Anthropology Geology Opposing personnel are STRENGTH -1 where present.

Name: Wodek'idan
Lore: One of dozens of holograms freed by Iden. The Jem'Hadar reputation for raw prowess in battle made re-creations of them favorites among Hirogen hunters.
Text: OFFICER Physics Exobiology

Name: Ar-Q-ologist
Lore: How can you write about something that you've never seen? I know! Why don't I take you there?
Text: Opponent may place up to X cards from their discard pile on top of their draw deck, where X=total number of [*] and DL/ icons on lowest INTEGRITY personnel present. Nullify with Archaeology and Honor present.

Name: Q's Fantasy Women
Lore: My good fortune is your good fortune.
Text: Plays on a male present (opponent's choice) until any {Q-Flash}. If he helps you solve a mission, opponent scores points. Discard event.

Name: Quandary
Lore: It's so unlike you, Jean-Luc, to have a sense of humor. Especially about getting stabbed through the back... So if you had to do it all over again... ?
Text: Restore one personnel from your discard pile (there may not be a version of the same persona in play) and shuffle into crew or Away Team. Opponent then selects one personnel (random selection). If it is not "restored" personnel, discard it and lose points.

Name: Baxial
Characteristics/ Keywords: Freighter; No staffing requirement; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Small ship owned and commanded by Neelix. Ugliest thing he ever saw, though its appearance grew on him.
Text: Tractor Beam May report for free to {Neelix}'s location.

Name: Cravic Warship
Lore: Powerful ship built decades ago by the Cravic. Still used by their androids to continue war on the Pralor units.
Text: Tractor Beam Your {Cravic Units} may report aboard.

Name: Olarra
Lore: Stolen Hirogen ship. Commanded by Iden on his quest to free "Children of Light" from the Hirogen, Nuu'bari, and other Delta Quadrant civilizations.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam Your [Holo] cards may report aboard.

Name: Pralor Warship
Lore: Part of the large armada left behind by the now-extinct Pralor. Commanded by Pralor Unit 6263.
Text: Tractor Beam Your {Pralor Units} may report aboard.

Name: Trullux
Characteristics/ Keywords: D'Kora-Class; Ferengi ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam; Transport;
Lore: Modified transport commanded by Gegis, who planned to use his profit from stolen Borg nanoprobes to install multiphasic shielding and a gold-pressed latinum hull.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: Holosuite
Text: This site must be placed adjacent to {Quark's Bar} (or another Holosuite). Has a Holodeck. {Holoprogram} cards may be played here (limit one; station controller may discard it during their turn). [Holo] Equipment cards and compatible [Holo] personnel may report here, and may be transferred directly to/from owner's ship docked at this station. {Terok Nor} OR {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

Name: The Genesis Device
Lore: Torpedo created by Project Genesis. Reorganizes matter at the subatomic level to achieve rapid terraforming on a planetary scale. Its matrix utilized dangerously unstable protomatter.
Text: Use as [Equipment] (until placed). On your turn, if not playing [Fed], may place on [P] mission here. If unsolved at start of your next turn, choose: worth double OR zero points. (Unique.)

Name: Engine Imbalance
Lore: An improperly balanced warp drive system poses a serious hazard. Even a minor misalignment can propel a ship into an artificial wormhole.
Text: Place on ship. It may not fly by a location without stopping, and its RANGE is exhausted each time it moves. Cure with 2 ENGINEER, Computer Skill, and Physics.

Name: God
Lore: This starship. Could it carry my wisdom beyond the Barrier? ...Then I shall make use of this starship... bring it closer, so that I might... join with it.
Text: Unless two Away Team members each have INTEGRITY>7, place on mission; destroys one ship here (opponent's choice). You must have a ship here to attempt mission.

Name: Hero Worship
Lore: Doctor Cochrane, I know this sounds silly, but can I shake your hand?
Text: Stops non-Borg crew or Away Team members with the most and fewest [*] icons. (In case of ties, stops all tied personnel.)

Name: I Hate You
Lore: The sins of all our fathers, being dumped on us - the sons. The only choice we're given is HOW MANY MEGATONS? And, I eschew you! And I say SCREW YOU! And I hope you're blue too.
Text: To get past requires Anthropology, Youth, and no Music present. Nullified by {Vulcan Nerve Pinch}.

Name: Linguistic Legerdemain
Lore: We must respond personally. The universal translator would be recognized.
Text: Unless Anthropology and Exobiology present, X=1+number of affiliation icons on this mission with no matching personnel present; place on mission; it cannot be attempted.

Name: Now Would Be a Good Time
Lore: With insufficient transporter power for Scotty to beam him off the aircraft carrier Enterprise, Chekov was captured and interrogated by the U.S. Navy. Being Russian didn't help him.
Text: Your Transporter Skill here with transporters may beam up Away Team. Otherwise, one personnel present (opponent's choice) is captured; others stopped. Discard dilemma.

Name: Subspace Shock Wave
Lore: Dangerous aftermath of a stellar, planetary, or lunar explosion. The shock wave created by the "incident" on Praxis was felt even beyond the boundaries of Klingon space.
Text: Ship is damaged and two crew members are killed (random selection) unless a Navigation personnel who has CUNNING>7 present. Discard dilemma.

Name: The Whale Probe
Lore: Alien space probe of unknown origin. Traveled to Earth to contact the extinct humpback whale. Its powerful transmission caused total power loss aboard nearby ships and starbases.
Text: Place on mission. End of every turn, moves one location toward and off far end of spaceline. All ships, personnel, and facilities are in stasis while here. (Unique.)

Name: V'Ger
Lore: Massive living machine created by an unknown race around the lost NASA space probe Voyager VI. Left a trail of destruction during its return to Earth in search of its creator.
Text: Ship is destroyed unless 2 Empathy OR Diplomacy, Anthropology, and Computer Skill present. Discard dilemma.

Name: The Nexus
Text: Seeds like a [S/P] dilemma. When encountered, place on far end of spaceline. End of every turn, moves one location toward other end. (Not duplicatable.) All personnel here are placed under Nexus (in play for uniqueness only). Destroys all ships here. At end of spaceline, place on table. At any time, players may relocate their personnel here to a [P] mission or time location. (Immune to {Revolving Door}.)

Name: Transport Inhibitor
Lore: Device that emits an energy field preventing the operation of transporters within a radius of several meters. Used by the U.S.S. Enterprise-E crew in their defense against the Son'a.
Text: If your personnel present, you may prevent any beaming to or from this equipment. Opponent may destroy equipment if their personnel are present and unopposed.

Name: Transporter Drones
Lore: Typical reconnaissance devices modified by the Son'a to fire isolinear tags. Transporters can lock onto a tagged object, overcoming any interference with normal targeting scanners.
Text: Participates in battle like a personnel, using STRENGTH=8 (may not be modified) vs. adversary's CUNNING. May capture, and beam to your ship here, an adversary it stuns.

Name: Duj Saq
Lore: Klingon for "land the ship." Though K'Vort-class ships were larger and more heavily armed than the B'rel design they were based upon, only the 23rd-century original had this ability.
Text: Plays on table. Your B'rel-class ships may report on planets that have a matching affiliation icon. Each may use 1 RANGE to land or take off once each turn. (Captain's Order.)

Name: Fal-tor-pan
Lore: Vulcan refusion of the body and katra. The ritual was performed successfully for the first time since ancient legend between Leonard H. McCoy, son of David, and Spock, son of Sarek.
Text: Plays on table. At any time, if top card of your discard pile is a Vulcan personnel, you may place it here. Personnel here may report to the {planet Vulcan} as if from your hand.

Name: I Just Love Scanning for Life-forms
Lore: Life-forms... you tiny little life-forms... you precious little life-forms... where are you?
Text: Plays to reveal up to three cards from the top of any draw deck (six if your own). Discard all non-personnel cards; replace remaining cards in any order. Discard event.

Name: Isomagnetic Disintegrator
Lore: Don't give an isomagnetic disintegrator to a Klingon showing signs of jak'tahla unless you want him to use it.
Text: Plays on table. Shuffle your hand into your discard pile, then exchange your discard pile for your draw deck. Draw four cards (may not be converted to downloads). Discard event.

Name: To Be or Not to Be
Lore: taH pagh taHbe'. DaH mu'tlheghvam vlqelnlS. quv'a', yabDaq San vaQ cha, pu' je SIQDI'? pagh, Seng blQ'a'Hey SuvmeH nuHmey SuqDI', 'ej, Suvmo', rlnmoHDI'?
Text: Plays on table. May discard event just after a battle your opponent initiated to damage all opposing ships (including cloaked ships) in that battle. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

Name: Ceti Eel
Text: Plays on table (once each turn, for free). On your turn, you may place on a personnel present with {Khan}. Personnel becomes [Non], is under your control, is attributes all 3, and is not discarded at end of turn by {Revenge Is A Dish Best Served Cold}. Nullified if personnel is an android or [Holo]. You may not place more than two Ceti Eels on personnel during any turn (even with {Mas'ud}).

Name: Release This Pain
Lore: Share your pain with me and gain strength from the sharing.
Text: Plays once each turn (for free) on a personnel present with your {Sybok}. Personnel loses all Treachery, is under your control, gains [SKR], and is compatible with your [SKR] cards.

Name: I Do Not Take Orders From You!
Lore: Admiral Dougherty knew the Son'a were devious and dangerous, but never imagined how far Ru'afo would go until it was too late. "The Federation will never know what happened here."
Text: Plays at start of a personnel battle you initiated (once per battle). Each of your personnel who has Treachery x2 may kill an opposing personnel who has lower CUNNING.

Name: Lure of the Nexus
Lore: Though exiting the nexus is as simple as wishing it so, its temptations are so great that few desire to leave. Those pulled away against their will are forever changed by their experience.
Text: Prevent a personnel from leaving {The Nexus}. OR Relocate all personnel under The Nexus aboard a ship about to be destroyed by it; relocate ship to adjacent location. Discard interrupt.

Name: No, Kirk ... The Game's Not Over
Lore: From hell's heart, I stab at thee! For hate's sake... I spit my last breath at thee!
Text: Plays if you just changed a mission's point value using {The Genesis Device}. Discard all planet facilities, landed ships, and ships in orbit there, and all personnel on planet.

Name: Prefix Code Transmission
Lore: Each starship is assigned a unique security code to prevent remote access to its vital systems. With knowledge of the code, a ship can be ordered to lower its own shields.
Text: Plays on your ship when firing on a target that has a matching affiliation or faction icon or that your infiltrator is aboard. Opposing DEFENSE total reduced by half (round down).

Name: Smooth As an Android's Bottom?
Lore: Geordi once told Data that technological perfection can shave too close. That, of course, depends on the desired results.
Text: Once every turn, plays to reveal the bottom three cards of your draw deck. Take any non-personnel into hand; discard others. OR Prevents the death of any one Youth personnel.

Name: The Needs of the Many ...
Lore: ...outweigh... "The needs of the few." "Or the one." Captain Spock made the ultimate sacrifice not because it was noble, but because it was logical.
Text: Nullifies a dilemma or damage marker if it would destroy your ship. Discard one of that ship's crew members (opponent's choice).

Name: What Does God Need With a Starship?
Lore: Excuse me. I'd... just like to ask a question.
Text: Nullifies {"God}." OR Plays once per game. Opponent chooses: you may download a ship to any location or you may stop or unstop (your choice) any ship in play.

Name: Analyze Radiation
Lore: Conduct analysis of the metaphasic particles in this nebula.
Text: Astrophysics + Biology + Navigation Span -2 for all Son'a ships.

Name: Insurrection
Lore: Prevent the Son'a attempt to forcibly relocate the Ba'ku race.
Text: Leadership x2 + Diplomacy + STRENGTH>50 Ba'ku may report on planet (for free).

Name: Observe Ritual
Lore: Transport crew member to Vulcan homeworld to participate in a cultural ceremony.
Text: Vulcan + Diplomacy + Anthropology Vulcans and {Amanda Grayson} may report on planet.

Name: The Discovery of Sha Ka Ree
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: ...to undertake the greatest adventure of all time...
Text: {Sybok} X=number of non-{Sybok} [SKR] personnel present (limit 6).

Name: Collect Metaphasic Particles
Text: Seeds or plays on {Ba'ku Planet}. Your personnel may attempt it using these requirements: Any Son'a personnel + {Injector Assembly One} in orbit + Treachery x2 + no opposing ships or personnel here When you solve, you may skip opponent's next turn and, for rest of game, all your personnel are STRENGTH +2, add Youth, and you may unstop them each once each turn.

Name: Revenge Is a Dish Best Served Cold
Text: Seeds on table during facility phase; you may download {U.S.S. Reliant}. Once each turn, your Khan (or personnel with "Khan" in lore) may report for free aboard U.S.S. Reliant; at end of every turn, you must discard all other personnel you have in play. At start of each of your turns, if your {Khan} and {The Genesis Device} are aboard your U.S.S. Reliant, score 30 points (only 15 if opponent has {any Kirk} in play).

Name: Admiral Cartwright
Lore: Militant admiral opposed to Chancellor Gorkon's peace initiative. Used his covert contacts in mounting a conspiracy to assassinate the Klingon leader.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership SECURITY Treachery Section 31 Once per game, may nullify a [Fed] Treaty.

Name: Admiral Kirk
Lore: While Captain Kirk regretted accepting promotion, he commanded the Starship Enterprise in later crises. Time away from the center seat did not diminish his ingenuity.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership x 3 Diplomacy DL/ {Commandeer Ship} Once each turn, you may discard a card to draw a card.

Name: Amanda Grayson
Lore: Human wife of Ambassador Sarek. Admires the Vulcan way, but taught her son Captain Spock that the capacity of human emotion is just as great.
Text: CIVILIAN {Any Spock} or {any Sarek} may report where present (for free). Anthropology Diplomacy Honor

Name: Ambassador Sarek
Lore: Vulcan ambassador. Sent Admiral Kirk to recover the body of his son Captain Spock. Reciprocated Kirk's effort by defending him to the Federation Council.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Mindmeld Law DL/ Any [Fed] Treaty.

Name: Azetbur
Lore: Daughter of Chancellor Gorkon; became chancellor herself in 2293. Pursued his dream of peace with the Federation, signing the historic Khitomer Accords.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy Exobiology DL/ {Treaty: Federation/Klingon}

Name: Brigadier Kerla
Lore: Military advisor to the High Council leader. Loyally served both Chancellor Gorkon and Azetbur, though bitterly opposed to peace with the Federation.
Text: SECURITY Stellar Cartography Navigation Transporter Skill DL/ Any [Films] Klingon Chancellor

Name: Caithlin Dar
Lore: Ambassador to Nimbus III. Hides disdain for the position with overeagerness. Released the pain of her deception when Sybok enlisted her help in the search for Vorta Vor.
Text: V.I.P. Youth Honor Diplomacy Exobiology Compatible with {[SKR] cards}.

Name: Captain Kang
Lore: Respected warrior. Named his firstborn son in honor of Curzon Dax. Watched the careers of the Starship Enterprise crew since encountering them in 2268.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Diplomacy Honor Physics If on a ship at a [KLI] mission, it is WEAPONS +2.

Name: Captain Spock
Lore: 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 human. Mr. Spock was restored from death by the Genesis wave - and his friends' resolve.
Text: OFFICER SCIENCE Leadership Computer Skill Physics Mindmeld Diplomacy Honor Music Once per game, may be taken from discard pile to hand.

Name: Captain Styles
Lore: Overconfident captain of the Starship Excelsior for a failed transwarp test. Planned to break old Starship Enterprise speed records. Was really in for a shock.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Leadership Physics

Name: Captain Sulu
Lore: After moving through the ranks aboard the Starship Enterprise, Lt. Sulu earned a captaincy in 2290. Holds loyalty in high regard, his crew as dear as family.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Honor Physics SCIENCE

Name: Carol Marcus
Lore: Molecular biologist. Head of Project Genesis. Once romantically involved with Admiral Kirk. Asked that he leave her to raise David Marcus in her world, not his.
Text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Leadership Biology x 2 Physics

Name: Chancellor Gorkon
Lore: Klingon leader who first embraced the notion of peace with the Federation. His vision mapped the way to the undiscovered country - the future.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy x 2 Honor Anthropology Protects your [Kli] Treaties from nullification.

Name: Ch'dak
Lore: Characteristic member of the I.K.S. Kla'Diyus crew. A pilot rated on many designs, he enjoyed the new tactics enabled by the ability to attack while cloaked.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Physics If on a [Kli] [Films] ship, it is RANGE +1.

Name: Clark Terrell
Lore: Captain of U.S.S. Reliant. Has a strong sense of duty. Has never met Admiral Kirk, but knows something of him from a few stories told by Commander Chekov.
Text: OFFICER Honor x 2 Leadership Biology May replace any V.I.P. present selected to die.

Name: Colonel Worf
Lore: Warrior and father of Mogh. He represented Captain Kirk and Dr. McCoy at their trial. His low political standing improved once they were proved innocent.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Law Honor Archaeology Astrophysics

Name: Commander Chekov
Lore: Over the years, Ensign Chekov's distinguished career would include many promotions, and positions as acting science officer, security chief, navigator, and first officer.
Text: OFFICER Navigation SECURITY Astrophysics Biology If on {Starship Enterprise}, it is WEAPONS +2.

Name: Commander Rand
Lore: After serving on the Starship Enterprise, Yeoman Rand desired greater duties. She rose to transporter chief and Starship Excelsior's communications officer.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Transporter Skill Biology Leadership

Name: Commander Uhura
Lore: While Lt. Uhura had promotions and transfers, she seized each chance to return to Starship Enterprise. Got to play for a captive audience on Nimbus III.
Text: OFFICER Once per game, may capture an all-male Away Team present. Computer Skill ENGINEER Music

Name: David Marcus
Lore: Gifted scientist. Like his father, often bends the rules. His impatience was Project Genesis' breakthrough and downfall. Proud - very proud - to be Admiral Kirk's son.
Text: SCIENCE Biology Computer Skill Physics Geology Ignore {The Genesis Device}'s [Fed] restriction on your [P] here.

Name: Demora Sulu
Lore: Daughter of Captain Sulu. Helmsman of the U.S.S. Enterprise-B. James T. Kirk declared: "It wouldn't be the Enterprise without a Sulu at the helm."
Text: OFFICER Navigation Exobiology Stellar Cartography If on {any Enterprise}, it is RANGE +1.

Name: Dmitri Valtane
Lore: Starship Excelsior science officer. Monitored the 2293 disaster on the Klingon moon Praxis. Host of a parasitic memory virus. Thinks Vulcans need to relax.
Text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Geology Computer Skill

Name: Dr. Chapel
Lore: After her first tour aboard the Starship Enterprise, Nurse Chapel earned a medical doctorate. She later accepted a post at Starfleet Command.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Biology Archaeology Computer Skill

Name: Dr. Gillian Taylor
