Lore: 20th-century marine biologist. Helped Admiral Kirk safely bring George and Gracie to the 23rd century, where she then signed on aboard a Starfleet science vessel.
Text: CIVILIAN May exclude {George and Gracie} from any personnel battle or random selection here. Biology SCIENCE

Name: Dr. McCoy (The Motion Pictures)
Lore: Leonard H. "Bones" McCoy. Retired from Starfleet in 2270, but returned a year later on Admiral Kirk's request. Retired again in 2293. Would again return.
Text: MEDICAL Twice per game, may take topmost personnel of discard pile into hand. MEDICAL Exobiology Biology

Name: Dr. Tolian Soran
Lore: El-Aurian refugee "rescued" from the Nexus in 2293 by the U.S.S. Enterprise-B. Spent the next 78 years obsessed with returning there, no matter the cost.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Treachery Worth points while placed under {The Nexus}.

Name: Ensign Tuvok
Lore: 29-year-old Vulcan on first deep space assignment aboard Captain Sulu's Starship Excelsior in 2293. Joined Starfleet under pressure from his parents.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Mindmeld Youth Once per game, may cancel ship battle at same nebula.

Name: Gallatin
Lore: Ru'afo's first officer. Once the most vengeance-minded of the Son'a, recent time with the Ba'ku - and a persuasive Federation captain - has softened his hatred.
Text: OFFICER Anthropology SCIENCE Computer Skill Honor Transporter Skill

Name: General Chang
Lore: Chief of staff of the High Council leader. Conspired to assassinate Chancellor Gorkon and ensure no peace. Likes Shakespeare, especially in the original Klingon.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Treachery Anthropology Law SECURITY DL/ {To Be Or Not To Be}

Name: General Korrd
Lore: Once-renowned military strategist exiled to Nimbus III by the High Council. Released the pain of his dishonor when Sybok enlisted his help in the search for Qui'tu.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Physics Navigation Compatible with {[SKR] cards}.

Name: George and Gracie
Characteristics/ Keywords: Humpback Whales; Dual Personnel; Female; Male;
Lore: Two humpback whales, male and female, raised in captivity on 20th-century Earth. Gracie is pregnant.
Text: ANIMAL+ANIMAL George: Nullifies {The Whale Probe} at this location. Gracie: Worth points on Earth (except time locations).

Name: Henreid
Lore: Typical first officer. Assigned to Starship Excelsior in 2285. Stood in for the helmsman, who was on leave when Admiral Kirk stole the Starship Enterprise.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Astrophysics Navigation

Name: Ilia
Lore: Deltan navigator assigned to the Starship Enterprise. Her Oath of Celibacy is on record. Was romantically involved with Willard Decker while posted to Delta IV.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Biology Anthropology Astrophysics

Name: J. T. Esteban
Lore: Captain of the U.S.S. Grissom. Has served as such for over four years without serious incident, due largely to his cautious, "by the book" command style.
Text: OFFICER Geology Exobiology Astrophysics

Name: Jacobson
Lore: Typical member of the medical staff aboard the Starship Enterprise, serving under Dr. McCoy and Dr. Chapel. Specialist in microcellular biology.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Honor

Name: James T. Kirk
Lore: Famous captain thought lost in 2293. Returned from the Nexus 78 years later to make a difference once more.
Text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Computer Skill Honor DL/ Any Captain's Order card Scores 5 points each time he helps solve a mission.

Name: Joachim
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Augment; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
Lore: Khan's lieutenant and most trusted friend. Augment who acted as first officer on the U.S.S. Reliant when, after nearly two decades, they escaped Ceti Alpha V.
Reports: Revenge Is A Dish Best Served Cold, War Council
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Astrophysics Navigation Physics Treachery If on {U.S.S. Reliant}, it is WEAPONS +3.

Name: John Harriman
Lore: Son of a respected Federation official. Captain of U.S.S. Enterprise-B. Usually confident in dealing with reporters, but on the ship's maiden voyage was having an off day.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Diplomacy Geology Honor

Name: J'Onn
Lore: Humanoid settler of Nimbus III. Released the pain of his impoverishment when Sybok enlisted his help in the search for the knowledge sought by all since time began.
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY While with your {Sybok}, you may play {Release This Pain} (for free) one additional time each turn.

Name: Kamarag
Lore: Ambassador to the Federation. Believed Admiral Kirk wanted Project Genesis as a weapon against Qo'noS. Predicted there would be no peace while Kirk lived.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Law Archaeology

Name: Karnog
Lore: Science officer aboard the I.K.S. Amar. Tried to analyze the sensor data from the intruder V'Ger. Unfortunately, his expertise was in the planetary sciences.
Text: SCIENCE Geology

Name: Khan
Lore: Genetically engineered augment exiled to Ceti Alpha V by Admiral Kirk. Seeks to avenge his wife's death.
Reports: Revenge Is A Dish Best Served Cold, War Council
Text: V.I.P. [Fed] opponents need {any Kirk} present to solve mission here. Leadership Treachery x 2 Computer Skill

Name: Klaa
Lore: Aggressive captain. He hunted the U.S.S. Enterprise-A without authorization in 2287. Later demoted and assigned menial translation duties on Qo'noS.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Anthropology Biology Greed Treachery

Name: Komal
Lore: Typical chief surgeon of a K't'inga-class ship. Friend of Krase. Strongly opinionated, he often provided his captain with advice, whether asked to or not.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Archaeology Honor

Name: Kor'choth
Lore: Typical bodyguard of the High Council leader. Lost an arm defending Chancellor Gorkon. Refused prosthetic replacement. Gave evidence at the subsequent trial.
Text: SECURITY Leadership Honor Transporter Skill

Name: Koth
Lore: Warden of the penal asteroid Rura Penthe. His greatest pleasures are watching fights among his inmates and delivering his welcoming speech to new prisoners.
Text: SECURITY Exobiology Geology Treachery DL/ {Forced-Labor Camp} (your [Kli] may attempt.)

Name: Krase
Lore: Captain of the I.K.S. Amar. His tendency to rash behavior has earned him a ruthless reputation even by Klingon standards.
Text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Astrophysics MEDICAL Your [Kli] [Films] ships here are each SHIELDS +2.

Name: Kruge
Lore: Klingon commander with a festering hatred of the Federation. Attempted to seize the secret of the Genesis weapon - the secret of ultimate power.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Treachery Biology Physics Worth 15 points while {The Genesis Device} on his ship.

Name: Lojur
Lore: Conservative helmsman of the Starship Excelsior. Serves adequately in the position, but is less knowledgeable about the ship and its limitations than Captain Sulu.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Transporter Skill

Name: Maltz
Lore: Klingon serving under Kruge. Prefers the night shift. Captured when his ship was commandeered. Willing to die for this dishonor. Admiral Kirk saw otherwise.
Text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill Astrophysics Geology

Name: Mark Tobiaston
Lore: Communications officer, fully rated on Excelsior-class ships. Linguistics expert who has authored an analysis on similarities of the Vulcan and Romulan languages.
Text: ENGINEER Anthropology Exobiology

Name: Martia
Characteristics/ Keywords: Chameloid; Female; Rura Penthe-related personnel; Shape-shifter;
Lore: Chameloid prisoner on Rura Penthe. She helped set up Captain Kirk and Dr. McCoy to get a full pardon. Great shape-shifter, though it takes "a lot of effort."
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Treachery Exobiology Anthropology Greed

Name: Mas'ud
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Augment; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
Lore: Specimen of late 20th-century genetic engineering. Augment who swore loyalty to Khan. Studied the effects of the Ceti eel while trapped on Ceti Alpha V.
Reports: Revenge Is A Dish Best Served Cold, War Council
Text: CIVILIAN May download {Ceti Eel} to place directly on adversary he just stunned. Biology SCIENCE Geology

Name: Matthew Dougherty
Lore: Conflicted admiral under orders from the Federation Council to oversee the Ba'ku relocation. Dislikes working with Ru'afo, but will do it for the Federation.
Text: V.I.P. Scores 10 points if helps complete {Collect Metaphasic Particles}. Leadership Treachery SCIENCE

Name: Mr. Scott (The Motion Pictures)
Lore: Scotty knows his ship like the back of his hand. With his help, a chimpanzee and two trainees could run her.
Text: ENGINEER Miracle Worker ENGINEER Astrophysics Computer Skill x 2 Transporter Skill DL/ {Divert Power} Removes one staffing requirement from ship while aboard.

Name: Nanclus
Lore: Romulan Ambassador to the Federation in 2293. Conspired with Admiral Cartwright and General Chang in the assassination of Chancellor Gorkon.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Treachery Tal Shiar Geology May work with [Fed] and [Kli] cards if no Honor present.

Name: Pa'rena
Lore: Son'a female. Chief science officer of the Li'seria. Part of the team that perfected mass production of ketracel-white for trade with the Dominion.
Text: SCIENCE Physics Exobiology Your {Ketracel-White} may report here, for free.

Name: Rae'alin
Lore: One of the Son'a assigned to the Ba'ku duck blind operation. Has been secretly looking for opportunities to steal technology from the Federation installation.
Text: ENGINEER Geology Anthropology Archaeology

Name: Regnor
Lore: Trained medic serving under Kruge. Like most serving aboard smaller Klingon vessels, is more often called upon as a soldier.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology Anthropology

Name: Ru'afo
Lore: Leader of the Son'a, a people banished from their home planet by the Ba'ku. Will let nothing stand in the way of his revenge upon them, least of all his Federation allies.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Biology Leadership Treachery x 2 Astrophysics DL/ {Injector Assembly One}

Name: Saavik
Lore: Vulcan cadet mentored by Captain Spock. She prefers to do things "by the book." Was determined to learn how Admiral Kirk beat the Kobayashi Maru.
Text: OFFICER SCIENCE Exobiology Stellar Cartography Mindmeld DL/ {Any [Ref] card} OR {Kobayashi Maru Scenario}

Name: Sam'po
Lore: Tactical officer aboard the Li'seria. Among the most far gone of the Son'a - will likely die within a few months unless he receives metaphasic treatment.
Text: SECURITY Navigation Treachery Stellar Cartography

Name: Sarod
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Augment; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
Lore: Loyal augment follower of Khan. He served as the group's physician. With healthy "supermen" rarely taxing him, he knew of nothing to save Lt. McGivers.
Reports: Revenge Is A Dish Best Served Cold, War Council
Text: CIVILIAN Draw a card when you place a {Ceti Eel} on a personnel here. Exobiology Anthropology MEDICAL

Name: Sharic
Lore: Typical Tarlac, born into indentured servitude of the Son'a. Ru'afo's personal body sculpture attendant. Very good at what she does.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Computer Skill If on your Son'a ship, cancels its restriction box.

Name: St. John Talbot
Lore: Ambassador to the worthless lump of rock known as Nimbus III. Released the pain of his cynicism when Sybok enlisted his help in the search for Eden.
Text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Computer Skill Law Compatible with {[SKR] cards}.

Name: Sybok
Lore: Vulcan son of Ambassador Sarek and half-brother to Captain Spock. Banished for his belief in Sha Ka Ree.
Text: CIVILIAN Leadership Treachery Mindmeld Empathy Anthropology DL/ {Release This Pain} (to hand).

Name: Tahglio
Lore: Typical guard for Federation Security. Given a low-priority post on Earth after a poor performance review at his last assignment. His next review showed no improvement.
Text: SECURITY Computer Skill

Name: T'Lar
Lore: Revered elder. High priestess of the ancient temple at Mount Seleya. The only Vulcan known to have actually performed a successful fal-tor-pan ceremony.
Text: V.I.P. MEDICAL Mindmeld x 2 Anthropology Leadership DL/ {Fal-tor-pan}

Name: Torg
Lore: Kruge's first officer. Led the boarding party sent to secure the Starship Enterprise. His promotions came slowly. Doesn't know when he's being spoken to.
Text: OFFICER Leadership SCIENCE Navigation Computer Skill

Name: Valeris
Lore: Vulcan prot g of Captain Spock whom he intended as his replacement. She made a choice to sabotage negotiations with the untrustworthy Klingon Empire.
Text: SCIENCE Navigation Mindmeld Treachery Diplomacy -3 (while infiltrating).

Name: Valkris
Lore: Klingon operative romantically involved with Kruge. Obtained top secret documents on Project Genesis. It was the pinnacle of her career in espionage.
Text: SCIENCE Klingon Intelligence Smuggling Physics Computer Skill

Name: Vixis
Lore: Klaa's first officer. Tracked the U.S.S. Enterprise-A by intercepting their distress signal and impersonating Starfleet Command. She has wonderful muscles.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Computer Skill Astrophysics DL/ {Incoming Message - Federation}

Name: Voight
Lore: Science officer aboard U.S.S. Enterprise-B. Joined Starfleet to pursue her interest in alien environments. Has Irish lineage dating back nearly four centuries.
Text: SCIENCE Physics Geology

Name: Wajahut
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Augment; Female; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel;
Lore: Eugenics Wars augment. Escaped on the Botany Bay with Khan. With superior intellect and knowledge of that ship, she quickly adapted to the U.S.S. Reliant.
Reports: Revenge Is A Dish Best Served Cold, War Council
Text: CIVILIAN Once per game, if aboard {U.S.S. Reliant}, may relocate it to {any Kirk}'s location. Navigation ENGINEER

Name: Willard Decker
Lore: Son of Commodore Decker. Succeeded Admiral Kirk as captain of the Starship Enterprise, at Kirk's recommendation. Personally oversaw its refit.
Text: OFFICER SCIENCE Computer Skill Diplomacy Leadership Anthropology

Name: Woteln
Lore: Technician at the Morska listening post. Representative of those performing less glorious duties in service of the Klingon Empire. "Dujvetlh'e' nuq? ...rln."
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Stellar Cartography While on your outpost, opponent's span here is +2.

Name: H.M.S. Bounty
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Bird-of-prey captained by Kruge on a covert mission to the Genesis Planet. Stolen and commanded by Admiral Kirk; re-christened with historical irony by Dr. McCoy.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

Name: I.K.S. Amar
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: One of the first K't'inga-class ships. Leader of the battle group dispatched to escort an unidentified intruder out of Klingon space in 2271.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.S. Chontay
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Bird-of-prey captained by Klaa. The highlight of its mission was shooting space garbage until its pursuit of the U.S.S. Enterprise-A through the Great Barrier.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

Name: I.K.S. K'elric
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: One of three ships that ended The Albino's raids on Klingon colonies. Intercepted the Starship Excelsior in the Azure Nebula. Commanded by Captain Kang.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: I.K.S. Kla'Diyus
Characteristics/ Keywords: B'rel Class; Cloaking Device; Klingon ship;
Lore: Unique vessel able to fire while cloaked. Commissioned and commanded by General Chang, who ordered the designers killed to preserve the secret of its existence.
Text: Cloaking Device (while cloaked, may initiate battle but may not be fired upon).

Name: I.K.S. K't'inga
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Though the basic form of the Klingon cruiser had been the same since the 22nd century, this design introduced in the 2270s boasted upgrades to all major systems.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [Univ] [Kli] [Films] personnel}

Name: Injector Assembly One
Lore: Specialized ship designed to collect metaphasic radiation particles from the ring system of the Ba'ku planet - a procedure tested extensively by Ru'afo in simulations.
Text: May report to location of your Son'a ship. DL/ {Collect Metaphasic Particles}

Name: Kronos One
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Battle cruiser of the Klingon Chancellor in the late 23rd century. Under command of Chancellor Gorkon, had a fateful rendezvous with the U.S.S. Enterprise-A.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [Kli] [Films] personnel}

Name: Li'seria
Lore: Flagship of the small Son'a fleet and base of operations for the entire race. Commanded by Ru'afo.
Text: Son'a shuttlecraft may report, be carried, and launch aboard. Tractor Beam

Name: Son'a Battleship
Lore: Fast and deadly, the largest of Son'a ships carry isolytic subspace weapons banned by the Khitomer Accord.
Text: Son'a shuttlecraft may report, be carried, and launch aboard. Tractor Beam

Name: Son'a Shuttle
Characteristics/ Keywords: No staffing requirement; Shuttlecraft; Son'a ship;
Lore: Small craft capable of atmospheric flight. Used to strafe the Ba'ku village and launch Son'a transporter drones.
Text: {Transporter Drones} may report aboard (for free, once each turn).

Name: Starship Constitution (The Motion Pictures)
Lore: With new modifications, ships of this class were built long after the original's launch. Starfleet continued this practice of refitting older designs into the 24th century.
Text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [Univ][Fed][Films] personnel}

Name: Starship Enterprise (The Motion Pictures)
Lore: Venerable Starfleet ship refit in 2270. Completed many successful missions before being transferred to Captain Spock's command and retired for use as a training vessel.
Text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Crew Reassignment}

Name: Starship Excelsior
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation ship; Prototype; Ship with a Skill; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Unsuccessful transwarp test ship later refitted as the prototype for one of Starfleet's most durable and ubiquitous classes of ship. Commanded by Captain Sulu.
Text: Tractor Beam, Stellar Cartography

Name: U.S.S. Enterprise-A
Lore: Specially commissioned in 2286 to replace the famous ship lost one year earlier. Proudly continued the mission of its predecessor under the command of James T. Kirk.
Text: DL/ {Any [Fed] [Films] personnel} OR {James T. Kirk} Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Enterprise-B
Lore: Third Federation ship so christened, launched on stardate 9715. Became fully operational the following Tuesday.
Text: Tractor Beam (unless any attribute is reduced). El-Aurians may report aboard.

Name: U.S.S. Reliant
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation ship; Khan-related card; Tractor Beam;
Lore: NCC-1864. Placed at the disposal of Project Genesis to locate a suitable Stage Three testing site. Captured at Ceti Alpha V and subsequently commanded by Khan.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Isolytic Burst
Text: Attack: 3. Defense: 0. Requires a {Son'a Battleship} or {Li'seria} firing. If you hit, randomly kills one additional personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice). Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Casualties: randomly kills one personnel (on a Nor, one personnel at site of opponent's choice).

Name: Riker Maneuver
Text: Attack: 4. Defense: -1. Requires a ship at a nebula firing; ATTACK bonus +3 if {William T. Riker} aboard. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip], and another opposing ship present (your choice) is also hit = [Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Plasma containment rupture: opponent may immediately download {Plasma Fire} to this ship.

Name: Target Warp Field Coils
Text: Attack: 2. Defense: 2. May not be used to fire upon a facility. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -30% Warp drive off line: opponent may immediately download {Engine Imbalance} to this ship as an interrupt (immune to {Amanda Rogers}).

Name: Camp Khitomer
Lore: Site of the ground-breaking peace talks between the Federation and the Klingon Empire.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Native to this timeline: all cards with both [Films] and [AU] icon. Once per turn, one such card reporting at this location may report for free.

Name: Cetacean Institute
Lore: Marine biology research laboratory and public aquarium located in Sausalito, California.
Text: Seeds or plays on table; download {George and Gracie} here. Native to this timeline: {Dr. Gillian Taylor} and George and Gracie.

Name: Environmental Suit
Lore: Self-contained garment for protecting personnel in a hostile environment. A variable magnetic field can be activated in the boots when working in zero-gravity.
Text: You may discard this equipment to prevent a personnel present from being killed by a dilemma or a Tactic card (that personnel is stopped instead).

Name: Espionage: Bajoran on Dominion
Lore: No strangers to oppression, many Bajorans fought the 2374 Dominion occupation from within. With Odo's help, Kira's small "resistance cell" paved the way for the Dominion withdrawal.
Text: Plays on any Dominion mission (for free if you have {Odo} there). Your Bajoran personnel may now attempt this mission. Discard after mission completed.

Name: Shape-Shift Inhibitor
Lore: Prototype device developed by the Obsidian Order. Emits a quantum stasis field that prevents a changeling from altering its biomolecular structure.
Text: Plays on table. Each player must first discard a personnel card in order to download a non-[Bor] personnel. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

Name: Timepod Ring
Lore: Small device used to monitor the auto-timer on the time travel pod appropriated by Berlinghoff Rasmussen. As he was uncertain how to reprogram the timer, the ring was very precious to him.
Text: Plays on table. Once each turn, you may peek at the top card of your deck. Also, you may discard this event and the top card of your draw deck to nullify an [AU] dilemma.

Name: Treacherous Advice
Lore: For many months, a changeling posing as General Martok manipulated the Klingon Empire through choice lies whispered in the ear of Chancellor Gowron.
Text: Peek at an opponent's hand. You may discard one of those cards for each Leadership personnel present with one of your infiltrators who is infiltrating. Discard event after use.

Name: Bluegill Infestation
Text: Seeds on table; place up to seven unique personnel face up beneath here from outside the game. Your copies of those personnel in play are STRENGTH +5, considered Bluegills, and may not be stunned. Also, when one of your Bluegills is killed, you must randomly select a personnel from here; if it matches one who was killed, that personnel was considered to be the Bluegill Queen. (Unique.)

Name: Kobayashi Maru Scenario
Text: Seeds or plays on a mission; adds Computer Skill to mission requirements. At the start of each mission attempt here, one attempting personnel (random selection) is placed beneath this incident ("in play" for uniqueness only). When a player solves this mission, all of their compatible personnel beneath this incident join the solving crew or Away Team (any other personnel are discarded). (Unique.)

Name: Strategema
Text: Seeds or plays on table. {Ooby Dooby} and {Rogue Borg Mercenaries} are nullified. {Q's Planet} may not enter play. Your opponent may not initiate battle or play {Outgunned} at a homeworld against your force containing a card matching that homeworld's affiliation.

Name: Changeling Sweep
Lore: Changelings will be forced into a gelatinous state by a mid-level phaser stun. In 2372, special units were placed in many Starfleet facilities to ensure that empty rooms were in fact truly so.
Text: Plays to "sweep" an opponent's discard pile: examine it and place any interrupt cards (except [BO] or [Ref] cards) out-of-play.

Name: Dimensional Shifting
Lore: Powerful form of folded space transport, capable of penetrating all known shields and forcefields. Repeated use of the technology causes a fatal degradation of the subject's cellular chemistry.
Text: During your turn, discard a random card from hand to place any number of your personnel and equipment at one mission aboard any ship at the same mission.

Name: Empathic Touch
Lore: It's accelerating. You have no more time for games.
Text: When your personnel is about to be killed, if your Empathy personnel is present, stop both personnel to prevent that.

Name: Aid Clone Colony
Lore: Help small population of clones who are suffering from replicative fading of their DNA.
Text: Biology + Diplomacy + MEDICAL x2 + CUNNING>36 When you solve, may download a copy of a personnel in play.

Name: In for a Trim
Text: Seeds or plays on table. {Barber Pole} and {Mot's Advice} play for free. Once each turn, if you have Barber Pole in play, you may "take a little off the top": peek at the top X cards of opponent's draw deck, where X is the number of your non-[Bor] Barbering personnel in play. You may discard any events, incidents, or interrupts (except [BO] and [Ref] cards), then replace the rest in any order.

Name: Admiral Janeway
Lore: In an alternate future where Voyager had remained lost for 23 years, Kathryn Janeway decided to travel back in time and guide her younger self to a faster route home.
Text: V.I.P. SCIENCE ENGINEER Leadership Computer Skill Physics DL/ {Ablative Armor}

Name: Admiral Riker
Lore: Commander of Starbase 247 in an alternate future. At odds with Governor Worf. Battled Klingons near Devron.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership x 2 Diplomacy Navigation Music Your leaders here may initiate battle against [Kli]. DL/ {Any Enterprise} (if aboard your matching facility).

Name: Anij
Lore: Ba'ku female who became romantically involved with Jean-Luc Picard. In her 300 years, learned to sustain a perfect moment in time - but never learned to swim.
Text: CIVILIAN Twice per game, may nullify a non-[Ref] interrupt and place it atop owner's draw deck. Anthropology

Name: Artim
Lore: Twelve-year-old Ba'ku child. Son of Sojef. Taught Data the importance of play and having a little fun every day.
Text: CIVILIAN Youth Your non-Treachery personnel present are each attributes all +1 (or +2 if they also have Youth).

Name: Christopher Pike
Lore: Noted captain. Succeeded Robert April and commanded the Starship Enterprise for 13 years. Accepted promotion in 2263 and relinquished command to James T. Kirk.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Honor Diplomacy Leadership Your other [OS] personnel here are attributes all +1.

Name: Colonel Kira
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Colonel; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female;
Lore: During Captain Sisko's absence after the death of Jadzia Dax, Kira Nerys was promoted to command DS9. She soon learned the responsibilities of the captain's chair.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Honor Diplomacy Leadership Computer Skill X=2 if a [Rom] personnel in play.

Name: Gideon Seyetik
Lore: Gifted terraformer who in 2370 planned to crown his career by reigniting the burned-out star Epsilon 119. Failure - and modesty - do not agree well with him.
Text: SCIENCE Each time he helps solve a mission requiring SCIENCE, you may draw a card. Astrophysics Physics x 2

Name: K'Temoc
Lore: Captain of the sleeper ship I.K.S. T'Ong, on a crucial mission ordered by the High Command in the late 23rd century. Awoke 75 years later in a much-changed galaxy.
Text: OFFICER Astrophysics Transporter Skill Geology DL/ {Engage Cloak}

Name: Lt. Palmer
Lore: Representative of relief officers serving on Federation starships. Such officers routinely fill in for crewmembers on shore leave or restricted duty.
Text: ENGINEER Anthropology Computer Skill

Name: Miral Paris
Lore: 1/4 Klingon, 3/4 human daughter of B'Elanna Torres and Tom Paris. Has her father's charm and mother's temper. In a possible future, helped Janeway negotiate with Korath.
Text: OFFICER Youth Honor Anthropology ENGINEER Diplomacy (x2 if {Treaty: Federation/Klingon} is in play).

Name: Raimus
Lore: Farian crime lord and thief. Oversees a significant Orion Syndicate operation based on Farius Prime. When he tells you to do something, you just do it.
Text: ENGINEER Acquisition Leadership Treachery x 2 Orion Syndicate

Name: Raymond Boone
Lore: Starfleet officer who served on the U.S.S. Rutledge in the Federation/Cardassian war. Captured at Setlik III in 2347 and subsequently killed while in captivity.
Text: ENGINEER Attributes all +2 if with {Miles O'Brien} or {Benjamin Maxwell}. Computer Skill Physics

Name: Robert DeSoto
Lore: Captain of the U.S.S. Hood and former commanding officer of William T. Riker. Years ago, he and Jean-Luc Picard served together as lieutenants on the same ship.
Text: OFFICER If on {U.S.S. Hood}, your compatible V.I.P.s may report aboard. Leadership Honor Exobiology

Name: Shandor
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male; Prylar;
Lore: Prylar representative of members of the Bajoran clergy. Maintains the shrine aboard Deep Space 9.
Text: CIVILIAN Archaeology Diplomacy Honor

Name: Sojef
Lore: Leader of the small community of Ba'ku that settled a new world in the Briar Patch. Ardent supporter of a simple way of life, free of advanced technology.
Text: CIVILIAN Leadership Diplomacy Biology Archaeology

Name: Sunad
Lore: Zalkonian captain. Sought to capture criminals undergoing a dangerous mutation before they could further disrupt society.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Physics Law

Name: Tournel
Lore: Chief engineer of the ship that first brought the Ba'ku to their new home in 2066. Now one of the more respected "elders" in their idyllic community.
Text: CIVILIAN Leadership ENGINEER Computer Skill Physics

Name: Uri'lash
Lore: Typical Hupyrian. Hired by Brunt as a bodyguard during his brief stint as Grand Nagus in 2374.
Text: SECURITY Honor Biology

Name: Weyoun 6
Lore: Activated after his predecessor's suspicious death, this clone of the Vorta Weyoun had subtle errors. He hoped to end the Dominion War by defecting to Odo's side.
Text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy x 2 Leadership Honor Law Biology May replace any changeling present selected to die.

Name: Yeoman Rand
Lore: Janice Rand is yeoman to Captain Kirk aboard the Enterprise. Captain of the Academy Diving Team in 2264-65. Student of horticulture and xenobotany.
Text: OFFICER Youth Biology ENGINEER DL/ {File Mission Report} [OS] personnel may file mission reports aboard her ship.

Name: Calondon
Lore: Independent freighter commanded by Zef'No. In 2370, ran weapons supplied by the Cardassians to the Bajoran isolationists of the Circle.
Text: Smuggling personnel in crew may use hand weapons to complete "{cargo runs.}"

Name: Lokirrim Vessel
Lore: The Lokirrim, at war with photonic insurgents, forbid the use of holograms in their space. Their ships can emit a disruption field that decompiles holographic matrices.
Text: Tractor Beam All [Holo] cards here are deactivated.

Name: Reklar
Characteristics/ Keywords: Capturing-related card; Cardassian ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: In response to tensions along the Cardassian/Federation border, this ship was sent to attend diplomatic talks with the U.S.S. Enterprise.
Text: WEAPONS +2 and SHIELDS +1 while you have a captive. Tractor Beam

Name: Tsunkatse Ship
Lore: Formidable vessel commanded by Penk, from which he broadcasts his popular fighting circuit. Heavily shielded to prevent anyone from abducting his competitors.
Text: Your personnel with "Tsunkatse" in lore may report aboard. Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Drake
Lore: Starfleet vessel, registry NCC-20381. In 2364, was assigned a routine mission of exploration in and around the Lorenze Cluster under the command of Paul Rice.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Grissom
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation ship; Ship with a Skill; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Science vessel assigned to survey and investigate the Genesis Planet in 2285. Named for one of Earth's earliest space explorers.
Text: Tractor Beam, SCIENCE

Name: U.S.S. Pegasus
Lore: Modified prototype on which an experimental cloak was secretly tested in 2358. Some of the crew mutinied against Captain Erik Pressman for his violation of treaty.
Text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Phased Cloaking Device}

Name: Starfleet Phaser Pistol
Lore: They have two settings, stun and kill. It would be best not to confuse them.
Text: [Sta] use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +2 (or +3 if that personnel has SECURITY). (Cumulative.)

Name: Revisionist History
Lore: One might meet an unfortunate end if the timeline were to be altered.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn (thrice per game), you may discard a card from hand to search your discard pile for an [AU] Event and take it into hand.

Name: Temporal Shifting
Lore: Time travel can afford the user certain abilities that might not be available to those native to the current time.
Text: Plays on a player. That player must choose to either discard three cards from hand or discard one [AU] card. If that player discards an [AU] card, he/she may draw up to four cards. Discard event.

Name: Seat of Starfleet
Lore: The place that started it all. Changed the galaxy as we know it.
Text: Seeds or plays on {2154 Earth}. Once per turn, one [Sta] personnel may report for free here. (Not duplicatable.) DL/ {UFP: One Small Step}

Name: Charles Tucker III
Lore: Self-taught chief engineer of Enterprise. Best friend and confidant to Jonathan Archer. From Panama City, Florida. Enjoys pecan pie.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Honor Computer Skill x 2 Diplomacy Transporter Skill x 2 DL/ {Any tricorder}

Name: Elizabeth Cutler
Lore: Hard working scientist, gourmet cook, and amateur bartender. Always eager to be selected for special assignments.
Text: SCIENCE Biology Exobiology Geology May volunteer for random selections (if applicable).

Name: Emory Erickson
Lore: Inventor of the transporter and father figure to Jonathan Archer. Dreams big. Honorary president of the Association of Transporter Technicians.
Text: V.I.P. ENGINEER Transporter Skill x 3 Physics Computer Skill x 2

Name: Ethan Novakovich
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Bartender; Cook; Male; President; Senator; Waiter;
Lore: Tends to leave jobs quickly. Tried working as a cook, bartender, waiter, fan club president, and even student senator before joining Starfleet.
Text: SCIENCE Biology Computer Skill Physics

Name: Hoshi Sato
Lore: Communications officer on board Enterprise, NX-01. Didn't want to come along, but after listening to some Klingon, she felt motivated.
Text: OFFICER Music Anthropology DL/ {Hail} May nullify Female-related dilemmas where present.

Name: Jeremy Lucas
Lore: Chairman of research at Cold Station 12. Close friend of Phlox. His optimism sometimes leads him to jump to dangerous conclusions.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Exobiology Honor DL/ Any MEDICAL-related Equipment card

Name: Jonathan Archer
Lore: Captain of Enterprise, NX-01. Leaped into deep space to make the future quantifiably better for all mankind.
Text: OFFICER Honor Diplomacy Navigation Leadership x 2 Anthropology DL/ {Porthos} DL/ {Captain's Log}

Name: Malcolm Reed
Lore: Head of security aboard Enterprise. Experienced weapons expert, qualified bodyguard and crack shot.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Honor Law Leadership Transporter Skill Other SECURITY personnel present are attributes all +1.

Name: Maxwell Forrest
Lore: Respected admiral. Friend of Soval. Sent the crew of Enterprise out into the final frontier to go where no man had gone before.
Text: V.I.P. SECURITY Leadership x 2 Astrophysics DL/ Any NX-class ship

Name: Phlox
Lore: Denobulan miracle worker. Former chairman of immunology at his alma mater. Has a great smile.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Biology Honor Exobiology If a [Sta] personnel present dies, you may discard two cards to return that personnel to hand.

Name: T'Pol
Lore: Female Vulcan first officer of Enterprise, NX-01. Finds humans to be fascinating. Dislikes the smell of dogs.
Text: OFFICER SCIENCE Mindmeld Diplomacy Leadership Anthropology DL/ Any Interrupt with "Vulcan" in title or gametext

Name: Travis Mayweather
Lore: Crack pilot aboard Enterprise, NX-01. Itching to get into deep space. Loves the sweet spot.
Text: OFFICER Honor Diplomacy Astrophysics Navigation x 2 Computer Skill Once every turn, may nullify {Full Planet Scan}.

Name: Enterprise
Lore: Legendary prototype designed for deep space travel. Commanded by Jonathan Archer. First Starfleet vessel to bear the name that would symbolize Starfleet's elite.
Text: Attributes all +1 for each [Sta][Cmd] aboard (limit 5).

Name: T'Pol/Soong Maneuver
Text: Attack: 0. Defense: 2. ATTACK bonus +3 and DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a NX-class ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Burn and Turn: until the end of your next full turn, this ship may not move to a mission where an opponent has a ship.

Name: Persistent Individuality
Lore: The Borg Queen uses deadly force and extreme measures to protect the hive mind. The sense of identity found in residents of Unimatrix Zero was both a threat and a means to resist.
Text: Kills 7 - X personnel (random selection), where X = the number of different classifications present. To get past requires ENGINEER.

Name: Personal Duty
Lore: Commodore Decker, driven to the edge of madness by the loss of his entire crew, sacrificed himself in a vain attempt to destroy the "Planet Killer."
Text: To get past requires Leadership OR OFFICER. All such personnel are "stopped," but if two or more present, one must continue (random selection).

Name: Tactical Disadvantage
Lore: Khan's battle experience was significant but limited to terrestrial combat. Three-dimensional thinking gave Captain Kirk and the Enterprise a clear advantage.
Text: Players show their hands and examine revealed ships. Unless your total SHIELDS > opponent's total WEAPONS, kill one personnel (random selection). Discard dilemma.

Name: The Caretaker's "Guests"
Lore: Harry Kim and B'Elanna Torres were abducted by the Caretaker and exiled to the subterranean Ocampan society.
Text: One personnel present (opponent's choice) is placed atop draw deck. You may place a different personnel of the same affiliation from your discard pile with this crew or Away Team.

Name: The Clown: Bitter Medicine
Lore: Linked into the Kohl mental preservation network, Harry Kim endured searing confrontations of his deepest fears.
Text: Place on mission. Now and start of each mission or scouting attempt here, opponent names a skill. All your personnel with that skill are attributes -2 until end of turn.

Name: Up Yer Shaft!
Lore: After some selective sabotage by Mr. Scott, the crew of the Starship Excelsior discovered that their new transwarp drive was not going to be breaking any speed records.
Text: One Computer Skill present (random selection) is placed atop draw deck. To get past requires ENGINEER>Leadership present. Nullify with {Transwarp Conduit}.

Name: Battle Bridge Door: Auxiliary Control
Text: Seeds on (opens) Battle Bridge side deck (at least 13 [Tactic], all different); may download {Emergency Evacuation} OR {Make It So}. When your ship or facility battles, you may draw up to 3 cards from here: play 1; discard others. Whenever amount of damage to opponent s card not stated, [Flip][Flip] (for direct hits, [Flip][Flip] again). When [Tactic] leave play, place them face up here only; when side deck empty, shuffle to replenish it.

Name: Q's Tent: Civil War
Text: Seeds on (opens) Q's Tent side deck (up to 13 different cards face down and up to 13 different [Ref] cards face up). You may examine cards in this side deck. Your Q-Continuum side deck is closed and cannot be opened. You may not play Q's Tent. You may not begin mission attempts with less than four personnel.

Name: Celebratory Toast
Lore: Many occasions are often marked by raising a glass to acknowledge either great joy or tearful sadness. "To absent friends..."
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, if not playing Borg, you may examine the top card of your draw deck, then place that card on the top or bottom of that deck. (Cumulative.)

Name: Friction
Lore: The steadfast obedience of the Jem'Hadar to their leaders often made working with other species difficult.
Text: Plays on table if you control three [Dom] personnel. Each non-Jem'Hadar personnel enters play "stopped."

Name: Getting Under Your Skin
Lore: When it comes to logic and emotions, Romulan women may differ from Vulcan women, but that is not the only thing Spock finds distracting about Commander Charvanek.
Text: Plays on table if you control three [Rom] personnel. Once each turn, when you play an event on table, opponent reveals top card of deck. If it is a personnel, score 5 points. (Unique.)

Name: Prison Compound
Lore: Often housing political prisoners, clandestine Cardassian camps use hard labor as punishment.
Text: Plays if you control three [Car] personnel to score points. X=the total number of [*] on all your captives.

Name: So'wI' taH!
Lore: Brute strength is not the most important asset in a fight. Suvlu'taHvIS yapbe' HoS neH.
Text: Seeds or plays on your {Q's Tent}. If playing only [Kli], you may play any [Event], [Interrupt], or [Objective] with "Klingon" or [Kli] in gametext (and no point box) from here as if from your hand.

Name: Surprise Party
Lore: Planning Lt. Worf's party was easy; translating "For He's A Jolly Good Fellow" into Klingon was hard. There didn't seem to be a Klingon word for "jolly."
Text: Plays on table. Your opponent may immediately draw up to two cards. At the end of each of your turns, you may draw an extra card. (Unique.)

Name: You Know I'd Like to Help
Lore: Starbase 247 commander Admiral Riker could request a ship for his old captain but hesitated to anger the Klingon Empire.
Text: Seeds or plays on your facility. If your facility commander aboard, your matching ship reporting here may do so for free (once per game per facility commander). (Unique.)

Name: Tribunal of Q
Text: Seeds on table. You may download [Ref] cards from your discard pile. While you are downloading or playing a [Ref] card, you may ignore any effect and no action may suspend play. In place of a card draw you may download a [Ref] card (once per game per card title) OR {Q the Referee} (limit once every turn). At the start of the first turn, if it is not your turn, you may download a [Ref] card.

Name: Research Rapid Rotation
Lore: Study cultural evolution via time differential.
Text: (Astrophysics + ENGINEER x2) on planet + (Honor + SCIENCE x2) on ship

Name: Study Cultural Evolution
Text: Seeds or plays on {Weird Planet Displaced in Time}. Any Away Team and crew may attempt mission. When solved, each ship here is damaged and all non-[Holo], non-android personnel on planet are killed. Then, for each personnel killed, their controller may download a non-[Holo], non-android personnel who is different from all their personnel killed this way.

Name: Data (Things Past)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Android; Dissident; Male; Romulan underground; Soong-type android;
Lore: Soong-type android in disguise as a Dissident and member of the Romulan Underground. Claimed to be from the city of Rateg.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Exobiology Transporter Skill Cannot be killed by dilemmas ("stopped" instead).

Name: Dukat (Things Past)
Lore: Treacherous, scheming Cardassian. Closed the Bajoran Wormhole as a Pah-Wraith puppet.
Text: CIVILIAN Once per turn, may place two non-[Ref] cards from any one discard pile out of play. Treachery x 2 Transporter Skill DL/ {Kosst Amojan}

Name: Founder Architect
Lore: Male Shape-shifter serving as a representative of the Founder population. Greeted Odo when he returned to the Great Link.
Text: V.I.P. While attempting a mission, X=number of different events in play. Astrophysics Law

Name: Gabriel Bell
Lore: Human male who visited 2024 San Francisco. To preserve the timeline, Benjamin Sisko took Bell's place and protected the hostages in Sanctuary District A.
Text: V.I.P. Honor Leadership x 2 DL/ {The Name is Bell} If he time travelled this turn: Honor, Anthropology.

Name: Jadzia Dax (Sanctuary)
Lore: Trill with symbiont who visited 2024 San Francisco. She was lucky to be found by Chris Brynner, who assumed her markings were tattoos.
Text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy SCIENCE DL/ {Generate Fake ID} If she time travelled this turn: Computer Skill, SECURITY.

Name: Jim Shimoda
Lore: Engineer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Acted drunk while afflicted by the Tsiolkovsky infection in 2364. www.trekcc.org
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Astrophysics Adds 2 to each printed number on {Isolinear Puzzle}.

Name: Julian Bashir (Sanctuary)
Lore: Human who visited 2024 San Francisco. Assigned to Sanctuary District A. He won over residents with his medical talents. Concealing the truth came easily.
Text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL x 2 DL/ {Let Me Take a Look} If he time travelled this turn: Biology, Exobiology.

Name: Malik
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Augment; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
Lore: Devious augment from the time of Khan. Kept as a frozen human embryo until grown by Arik Soong.
Text: SECURITY Leadership OFFICER Treachery x 2 When "stopped" by a dilemma, draw a card. When killed by a dilemma, discard your hand.

Name: Mr. and Mrs. Troi
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human/Betazoid; Captain; Dual Personnel; Female; Male;
Lore: Newly promoted human captain William T. Riker married his imzadi, the 1/2 Betazoid, 1/2 human Deanna Troi, before she transferred to join him.
Text: OFFICER+OFFICER Riker: Leadership x 2 Honor SECURITY Troi: Empathy Diplomacy Anthropology

Name: O'Brien and Kira
Lore: Human Miles O'Brien used polarized chronitons to transport himself and the Bajoran Kira Nerys to 2024 San Francisco. She concealed her nose.
Text: ENGINEER+SECURITY O'Brien: Transporter Skill x 2 DL/ {Polarized Chronitons} Kira: Gains any skill during a turn she time traveled.

Name: Rusot (Things Past)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Cardassian resistance; Dissident; Gul; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: A proud nationalist, Gul Rusot joined Damar's underground resistance movement. Served on Terok Nor. Dissident.
Text: OFFICER Biology Geology Treachery If with {Damar}, gains Leadership and SECURITY.

Name: Seven of Nine (League Promo)
Lore: Former Borg coerced into Tsunkatse competition. Trained by Hajur. Imperfect. Reaffirmed her humanity in the arena.
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Exobiology Computer Skill Honor STRENGTH +5 in battle.

Name: Slar
Lore: Vicious Gorn Slavemaster of the Tholian Assembly who was assigned to gut the Starship Defiant in the Mirror Universe. He does not trust Terrans.
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER SECURITY Computer Skill Physics Treachery x 2 X = number of [MU] personnel present

Name: Solbor
Lore: The Bajoran Prylar worried about Kai Winn's interest in the Pah-Wraiths but remained a faithful attendant.
Text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Honor Exobiology Once per mission, scores 5 points if your Vedek, Prylar, or Kai helps solve a mission where present.

Name: The Viceroy
Lore: Telepathic Reman advisor to the Praetor, Shinzon. Dominion War veteran. General of a Reman Army.
Text: MEDICAL Diplomacy Empathy Treachery Biology When an opponent plays an event, you may discard a card to download an event to hand.

Name: Dominion Battleship (Things Past)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Battleship; Dominion ship; Holodeck; Invasive Transporters; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Twice the size of a Galaxy-class starship, battleships of this design served in the Alpha Quadrant war.
Text: Attributes all +3 if Founder, Vorta, and Jem'Hadar aboard. Holodeck, Tractor Beam, Invasive Transporters

Name: Where No Man Has Gone Before
Lore: Going boldly into the unknown frontiers of the galaxy, brave captains and crews cheat death in search of new life.
Text: Plays on table. At start of turn, your undocked ships at any spaceline end are RANGE +3 until end of turn. Once per turn, when your ship moves from one spaceline to another, you may draw a card OR report an [AU] card aboard.

Name: Benjamin Sisko (Chain of Command)
Lore: Lieutenant Commander Benjamin Sisko was the executive officer of the U.S.S. Saratoga in 2366 during the Borg attack at Wolf 359.
Text: OFFICER Leadership ENGINEER Honor DL/ {Any Jake} DL/ {Emergency Evacuation}

Name: Captain Kirk (Chain of Command)
Lore: Kirk relied heavily on his senior officers and closest friends in his command of the Starship Enterprise.
Text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 DL/ Any Captain's Order card If with {any Spock} and {any McCoy}, all three are attributes all +1.

Name: Jean-Luc Picard (Chain of Command)
Lore: Rescued Borg counterpart. After returning to his command of the U.S.S. Enterprise, Picard developed a violent vendetta against the Borg.
Text: OFFICER Leadership x 2 Archaeology Navigation While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Bor].

Name: Kathryn Janeway (Chain of Command)
Lore: Commander of the U.S.S. Voyager on a mission to retrieve her undercover security officer, Tuvok. Bailed Tom Paris out of jail. Likes dogs.
Text: OFFICER SCIENCE Astrophysics Computer Skill {Tuvok} may report here. DL/ {Rescue Captives}

Name: K'mpec (Chain of Command)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; Chancellor; High Council; High Council Leader; Male;
Lore: Chancellor and leader of the Klingon High Council. Willing to dishonor Worf in order to avoid political division. Fat.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Law Diplomacy DL/ {Kle'eg} DL/ {HQ: Secure Homeworld}

Name: Shinzon (Chain of Command)
Lore: Human clone of Jean-Luc Picard. General of a Reman Army. Possibly the worst Praetor in the history of the Romulan Star Empire.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Treachery x 2 Diplomacy ENGINEER {Any Jean-Luc Picard} gains (G>.

Name: William T. Riker (Chain of Command)
Lore: While in command of the U.S.S. Enterprise-E, Riker defended the ship against attack by the Son'a. Reminded Picard, "No uniform, no orders."
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation x 2 Honor DL/ {Federation Flagship: Renewed} DL/ {Riker Maneuver}

Name: I.K.C. Qam-Chee (Chain of Command)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Klingon ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Flagship commanded by the Klingon Chancellor, K'mpec. Met with U.S.S. Enterprise to arbitrate the selection of a new Chancellor for the Klingon Empire.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam Opposing cards here are attributes -1.

Name: Scimitar (Chain of Command)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Massive predator of a ship commanded by Shinzon. Its brief contact with the U.S.S. Enterprise-E would leave a lasting impression.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam DL/ Any Tactic DL/ {Engage Cloak}

Name: Starship Enterprise (Chain of Command)
Lore: Its five year mission: to explore strange new worlds, to seek out new life and new civilizations, to boldly go where no man has gone before.
Text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Where No Man Has Gone Before}

Name: U.S.S. Defiant (Chain of Command)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Riker dubbed the U.S.S. Defiant a "tough little ship." Commanded by Worf when the Borg attacked Earth.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam WEAPONS and SHIELDS +3 vs. [Bor].

Name: U.S.S. Enterprise (Chain of Command)
Lore: Encountered the U.S.S. Enterprise-C in an alternate reality. Became the Future Enterprise in an alternate future. Visited by crew from the Starship Enterprise.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam DL/ {Wall of Ships}

Name: U.S.S. Enterprise-E (Chain of Command)
Lore: The latest in the Enterprise line, it gets "all the easy assignments." Commanded by William T. Riker in the Briar Patch incident with the Son'a.
Text: WEAPONS and SHIELDS +1 for each [Ent-E] aboard. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Voyager (Chain of Command)
Lore: U.S.S. Voyager employed a tricyclic input manifold of the warp core, variable-geometry pylons and a rather large complement of shuttlecraft.
Text: Shuttlecraft you download may come from discard pile. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: Off-Zel Vase
Lore: Kivas Fajo kept one of the few surviving pottery vases created by Mark Off-Zel, a native of Sirrie IV. Former Klingon Chancellor K'mpec also owned a similar treasure.
Text: Place in your point area. Z changes, where Z=the number of quadrants in which you have completed a mission (beyond the first).

Name: Damaged Reputation
Lore: I'm Captain Kathryn Janeway. This is Commander Tuvok. We're from the Federation starship Voyager.
Text: If INTEGRITY>50, lose 5 points. To get past requires 2 Diplomacy OR any Intelligence and 2 Treachery OR STRENGTH>30 (STRENGTH>50 if this is a [DQ] mission).

Name: Displaced
Lore: In 2373, Nyrians beamed aboard U.S.S. Voyager, attempting to hijack the ship by replacing her crew. Eventually, Captain Janeway and her crew reversed the process.
Text: One personnel present (random selection) relocated to nearest planet. To get past requires CUNNING>30 (CUNNING>50 if this is a [DQ] mission).

Name: Distracted by Thoughts of Home
Lore: After an encounter with the Timeship Aeon, Captain Janeway and her crew found themselves on Earth in 1996. The appeal of being on Earth - even in the past - was intense.
Text: Place on mission. All personnel here are attributes all -1. Any player must discard a card from hand to attempt this mission. X=4 if this is a [DQ] mission, otherwise 2.

Name: Important Guests
Lore: Ambassadors used to luxury accommodations are difficult to please while in the field. Commanding officers routinely assign their staff to placate the visiting dignitaries.
Text: To get past requires V.I.P OR CIVILIAN. For each of your V.I.P.s and CIVILIANS present, randomly select an OFFICER OR SECURITY personnel to be "stopped."

Name: Medical Crisis
Lore: In the farthest reaches of the Delta Quadrant, medical supplies and those trained in their use are equally rare. Without them, even a minor injury can become lethal.
Text: Randomly select a MEDICAL personnel. Killed if [Kaz] or [Vid], "stopped" otherwise. To get past requires 2 Biology and (2 MEDICAL OR a Nurse).

Name: Oh No!
Lore: Desperate to prevent the inevitable collapse of the universe, Jack and Patrick spent considerable time on a solution. After all, they only had seventy trillion years - at most.
Text: If CUNNING>60, lose 5 points. To get past requires 3 Astrophysics OR {any PADD} and {any tricorder} OR INTEGRITY>30 (INTEGRITY>50 if this is a [DQ] mission).

Name: Skeleton Crew
Lore: With Deep Space 9 evacuated of non-critical personnel during a local plasma disruption, it was an easy matter for a mercenary team to overwhelm those left behind.
Text: Place on mission. You may not begin a mission attempt here with fewer than six personnel.

Name: The Arsenal: Separated
Lore: While investigating the Arsenal of Freedom on Minos, a sudden attack separated the crew of the Enterprise.
Text: Divide your unique personnel into two face-down piles. One pile is "stopped" (opponent's choice). To get past requires CUNNING>27 remaining.

Name: Vastly Outnumbered
Lore: The internal security net has been sabotaged... which suggests someone didn't want to be that easily found.
Text: If STRENGTH>55, lose 5 points. To get past requires Anthropology and 2 Honor OR two hand weapons OR INTEGRITY>28 (INTEGRITY>48 if this is a [DQ] mission).

Name: Virus
Lore: Ancient Iconian computer programs transmitted to the U.S.S. Yamato, U.S.S. Enterprise, and Haakona attempted to overwrite the ships' computer systems.
Text: Unless you have 4 Computer Skill present, place on ship. This ship, and all your other ships of the same class, are attributes all -2. Cure with 6 Computer Skill.

Name: Body Armor
Lore: Hirogen body armor can resist injuries from battle and environmental hazards. Such equipment has been developed by many races.
Text: While present with your SECURITY-classification personnel, all hand weapons present lose cumulative. (Immune to {Disruptor Overload}.)

Name: 45th Rule of Acquisition
Lore: Expand or die.
Text: Plays on your [Fer] ship. Once per turn, your {Gold-Pressed Latinum} may report aboard (for free). Each time your [Fer] personnel aboard is killed by an opponent's dilemma you may download one Gold-Pressed Latinum aboard or draw a card.

Name: Romulan "Reunification"
Lore: Restore the ancestral homeworld to the glory of the Empire.
Text: Plays to report a [Rom] SECURITY personnel to {Vulcan} if you have an unopposed [Rom] ship in orbit (discard event). OR Plays on {Vulcan}; worth points if your opponent has fewer personnel here than you have [Rom] personnel here.

Name: For the Sisko
Text: Plays on table if you have three [Baj] personnel in play. In place of your normal card play, discard a non-personnel card from hand to place two [Baj] personnel from your discard pile on top of your draw deck.

Name: Inspection
Text: Plays on table. Your ships native to the Alpha Quadrant (and each personnel aboard) are attributes all +1 while three Admirals and/or V.I.P.s aboard. At the start of each of your turns, you may exchange an OFFICER personnel aboard your staffed ship with an Admiral or V.I.P. in your discard pile.

Name: The Genesis Effect
Text: Plays on your unexamined mission. When you play this incident, name a dilemma. If your personnel encounter that dilemma while attempting this mission, and they began with more than 2 and fewer than 8 personnel, nullify it. (Unique.)

Name: Critical Assistance
Lore: Trained nurses like Alyssa Ogawa are vital aids in life-threatening situations.
Text: Once per turn, stops your Nurse to download a MEDICAL-related equipment to his or her location OR unstops a MEDICAL-classification personnel present.

Name: Driven
Lore: The strain experienced by Lt. Bailey during his encounter with the Fesarius pushed him to the brink of mental breakdown.
Text: When your [OS] OFFICER is facing a dilemma, discard an [OS] OFFICER from hand to make him or her attributes all +5 until the end of that dilemma.

Name: I Feel Young
Lore: Kirk felt renewed in the face of new life, in spite of the death of Spock. "He's really not dead. As long as we remember him."
Text: Adds Youth to one [Films] personnel until end of turn. OR Downloads any [Films] Kirk if {any Spock} was just discarded from play.

Name: Aftermath II
Lore: Determine cause of disaster.
Text: ENGINEER + Physics x2 + (Honor OR Treachery) Wormhole: You may move your staffed ship between here and any other location if that location is a [Wmh] mission OR by playing one {Wormhole} interrupt there. Then flip this mission over.

Name: Changeling Research II
Lore: Investigate possible changeling life signs.
Text: SCIENCE x3 + Exobiology x2 + Geology Each {Seismic Quake} here affects two personnel. WORMHOLE: You may move your staffed ship between here and any other location if that location is a [Wmh] mission OR by playing one {Wormhole} interrupt there. Then flip this mission over.

Name: Find Hidden Base
Lore: Eliminate primary Maquis base of operations.
Text: SECURITY x3 + Leadership x2 + 2 hand weapons *+10 if no [Maq] in Badlands Region.

Name: 0413-Theta
Lore: Typical Terran in the mirror universe. Caught trying to escape Terok Nor. Brought to The Intendant for sentencing by Security Chief Garak and Telok.
Text: ENGINEER Geology Computer Skill DL/ {Lower Decks}

Name: Admiral Kirk (Life From Lifelessness)
Lore: An original thinker, Captain Kirk took command of the Starship Enterprise as an admiral. He felt young.
Text: OFFICER Honor x 2 Diplomacy Leadership DL/ {Khan!} DL/ {The Genesis Effect}

Name: Agent Garak
Lore: Elim Garak joined the Federation it its fight against the Dominion. Served as a code breaker in spite of his fear he was betraying his homeworld.
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Treachery Anthropology Computer Skill x 2 DL/ {Any Garak} (discards this one)

Name: Allamill
Lore: Alien pilot that frequented a Starfleet bar in San Francisco. Offered to help Leonard McCoy, but would not go to the restricted Mutara sector.
Text: CIVILIAN Greed Smuggling Navigation DL/ Any [NA] [Films] card

Name: Brunt of Borg
Lore: Assimilated counterpart who spoke to the Alliance in a parallel universe. "The knowledge and experience of the Ferengi - Brunt - is part of us now."
Text: Treachery x 2 Computer Skill Navigation Greed Law V.I.P. While on your ship, WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 against [Fer].

Name: Captain B'Etor
Lore: B'Etor is the younger sister of Captain Lursa. Seeks to bring Security Chief Garak and The Intendant to trial for negligence and fraternizing with the enemy.
Text: OFFICER Honor Leadership Law Physics SCIENCE Youth

Name: Captain Nog
Lore: In an alternate timeline, Nog served as captain of the U.S.S. Defiant. Aided Jake Sisko in an effort to reverse a time-altering subspace inversion.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Diplomacy Honor Physics DL/ {Ready Room Door}

Name: Carol Marcus (Life From Lifelessness)
Lore: Intelligent scientist in charge of the Genesis Project. When showing off her results, she quipped, "Can I cook or can't I?"
Text: SCIENCE Exobiology x 2 Honor Physics X = number of cards in opponent's hand (limit 5).

Name: Danica Erickson
Lore: Devoted to her father, Emory Erickson. Spent fifteen years serving as his nurse after the loss of her brother, Quinn. Childhood friend of Jonathan Archer.
Text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL

Name: David Marcus (Life From Lifelessness)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
Lore: Young scientist involved with the creation of the Genesis Device. Son of Carol Marcus and James T. Kirk. Survived an encounter with Khan.
Text: SCIENCE SCIENCE Biology x 2 Exobiology Physics Computer Skill

Name: Delanh
Lore: Typical Vidiian seeking to steal organs from live "donors." Remembered as a serious threat by Kathryn Janeway during a near-death experience.
Text: CIVILIAN Greed SECURITY Physics

Name: Dexter Remmick
Lore: Male human serving in the Inspector General's office. Found no evidence of wrong-doing aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise, in spite of his best efforts.
Text: SECURITY OFFICER Section 31 DL/ {Inspection} May report aboard your [Fed] ship in the Alpha Quadrant.

Name: Dr. Reyga (Life From Lifelessness)
Lore: Invited aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise to demonstrate his innovative technology. The ensuing murder mystery proved it successful, but at a high cost.
Text: SCIENCE ENGINEER Astrophysics Physics Stellar Cartography DL/ {Metaphasic Shields}

Name: Duras (Life From Lifelessness)
Lore: Son of a traitor, Ja'rod, and a traitor himself. Member of the Klingon High Council.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership Law Diplomacy Computer Skill Once each turn, may kill an opponent's personnel here that just completed a mission.

Name: Emok
Lore: Typical Obsidian Order operative trained in exobiology and medical interrogation. Expert at surgically altering operatives for long-term assignments.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology Obsidian Order

Name: Falow
Lore: Wadi head of the delegation from the Gamma Quadrant that visited station Deep Space 9 in 2369. After being cheated at dabo, made Quark play chula.
Text: V.I.P. Greed x 2 Computer Skill Honor Once per game, may nullify {a Chula} dilemma where present.

Name: Ilandra
Lore: Female Wadi. Part of Falow's delegation sent to Deep Space 9 to make first contact with the Alpha Quadrant. Skilled gambler and lover of games.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Greed DL/ {Any Treaty} OR {Espionage} card

Name: Kazat
Lore: Typical male member of the Kazon-Relora sect. Assistant to Haron. Spaced by Culluh and Seska for his master's refusal of an alliance against Voyager.
Text: CIVILIAN Law Youth Honor

Name: Kurn (Life From Lifelessness)
Lore: Klingon living in exile. Brother of Worf. Son of Mogh. Recently deputized by Odo. Has a death wish.
Text: SECURITY SECURITY Navigation Law Must replace your personnel present selected to die. SECURITY personnel present are attributes all +1.

Name: Porthos
Lore: Captain Archer's pet beagle. Likes cheese. T'Pol thinks he smells worse than even the humans do.
Text: ANIMAL [Sta] Humans present are INTEGRITY +1. Once every turn, may "chase" (stop) one ANIMAL present.

Name: Sela (Life From Lifelessness)
Lore: Half-Human, half-Romulan female. Failed to subvert the Klingon Empire by assisting Lursa and B'Etor. Her future seemed dim after her failure to conquer Vulcan.
Text: V.I.P. Tal Shiar Treachery Diplomacy Youth DL/ {Romulan "Reunification"}

Name: Sergey and Helena
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Dual Personnel; Female; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: Retired chief petty officer Sergey Rozhenko is married to Helena Rozhenko. They have two sons, Nikolai and Worf, and one grandson, Alexander.
Text: CIVILIAN+CIVILIAN Sergey: ENGINEER Honor Helena: Exobiology DL/ {Nikolai Rozhenko}

Name: Subcommander Decius
Lore: Officer in service aboard the Gal Gath'thong during the attack against the Federation in 2266. Reduced two steps in rank for an unauthorized transmission.
Text: OFFICER Navigation SCIENCE Once per turn, may place a discarded event on bottom of draw deck.

Name: Tholun
Lore: Vorta advisor sent to Deep Space 9 by the Founders. Replaced Weyoun. Witnessed the surrender of the Dominion to the Alpha Quadrant alliance.
Text: MEDICAL Archaeology Computer Skill Treachery Law

Name: Turan'Ekan
Lore: Jem'Hadar bred in the Alpha Quadrant. Ordered by Weyoun to hunt for the traitor Damar. Killed Mila. Betrayed and killed by one of his Cardassian allies.
Text: SECURITY Geology Navigation Physics Computer Skill

Name: Vash (Life From Lifelessness)
Lore: Human. Former partner of Q. Marooned in Gamma Quadrant but rescued by Jadzia Dax. Brought a dangerous crystal artifact aboard Deep Space 9.
Text: CIVILIAN Greed x 2 Archaeology x 2 Treachery Anthropology May report at any [GQ] facility.

Name: Zivan
Lore: Male Hirogen representative of inexperienced, overeager hunters. Trained by Harkan, who judged him to be too reliant on defense. Killed by Weiss.
Text: MEDICAL Physics DL/ {Body Armor}

Name: Renegade Borg Sphere
Lore: Once freed from the Borg hive mind, General Korok commanded this vessel. Assisted the U.S.S. Voyager in the destruction of Tactical Cube 138.
Text: [Non] Borg may report aboard. WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 vs. [Bor].

Name: Sarajevo
Lore: Small transport vessel used in the mid-22nd century to carry passengers to and from their destinations.
Text: Attributes all +1 for each Transporter Skill aboard (limit 3). DL/ {Emory Erickson}

Name: Vetar
Lore: Cardassian warship that surveyed Dorvan V. Pursued the Liberty into the Badlands. Commanded by Evek.
Text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Any [Pursuit] card} WEAPONS +2 vs. [Maq].

Name: Determined Assault
Text: Attack: 2. Defense: 1. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a [Non] ship firing. May not be used to fire upon a facility. Hit = [Down]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -25% Invasive Strike: If an opponent's ship here, one random non-[BO] equipment card aboard is relocated there and stolen.

Name: Flim-Flam Artist
Lore: The universe is full of hucksters, charlatans, swindlers, confidence men, and Ferengi.
Text: Your opponent may immediately draw a card. To get past requires Diplomacy and 2 Computer Skill OR Law and CUNNING>32 (CUNNING>50 if this is a [DQ] mission).

Name: Murder Investigation
Lore: Tuvok was forced to question many of U.S.S. Voyager's crew to solve a mystery. The efforts took focus away from his other duties.
Text: Randomly select three personnel (or six personnel if more than nine personnel present). If any of those personnel has SECURITY, all of them are "stopped."

Name: Picking Up the Pieces
Lore: Parts of B-4's assembly were found strewn across the Kolaran system. Many planetary scans were required to locate all the positronic signatures.
Text: To get past requires Geology or Computer Skill. All such personnel are "stopped," but if two or more present, one must continue (random selection).

Name: Restricted Area
Lore: To disable a station's deflector array (which has been turned into an anti-graviton beam), one could access the EPS feed and overload the waveguide. But there are alarms.
Text: If nine or fewer personnel in crew or Away Team, one is "stopped" (random selection). If more than nine personnel in crew or away team, three are captured (random selection).

Name: Cargo Pirates
Lore: Slower Earth cargo ships such as the E.C.S. Horizon and the E.C.S. Fortunate often fell victim to faster pirates.
Text: One personnel (random selection) is "stopped." Then, if you have a [DQ] personnel in play OR if your opponent has three thieves, one personnel (opponent's choice) is "stopped."

Name: Dial-Up
Lore: In 1996, the warp signature of a stranded U.S.S. Voyager was detected by SETI engineer Rain Robinson. The ship's crew monitored her call to alert Henry Starling.
Text: All personnel with DL/ in Away Team are "stopped." Place this dilemma on this mission; you may not download cards. Nullify with 3 Computer Skill and Anthropology.

Name: Difference of Opinion
Lore: Andorians despised Tellarites. Vulcans distrusted Andorians. Tellarites disliked everyone. Until they found a common ally in humankind, conflict in the region was inevitable.
Text: All [Non] personnel in crew or Away Team are "stopped" until end of your next turn. Discard dilemma.

Name: Mimetic Simbiot
Lore: In 2153, Phlox created Sim from a Lyssarrian desert larva. Archer and his crew chose to end Sim's life to save Trip's.
Text: To get past requires 3 MEDICAL OR INTEGRITY>30. Then, choose two personnel (random selection). One of those personnel dies (your choice).

Name: Rumplestiltskin
Lore: Gamma Quadrant alien in the form of a fairy tale character taken from the mind of Molly O'Brien. Distracted the crew of Deep Space 9 as an attempt to study its inhabitants.
Text: X personnel are "stopped" (random selection), where X = the number of personnel in Away Team with five or more [*] icons. Discard dilemma.

Name: Topological Anomaly 4747
Lore: Invasive program created in 2368 by Data and Geordi La Forge to cause the total system failure of the Borg Collective.
Text: Borg and [Holo] personnel, androids, and one ENGINEER here (random selection) are placed in stasis. Cure on your next turn with new SCIENCE arriving or when countdown expires.

Name: Grappler
Lore: Sturdy metallic shaft tipped with magnetic claws. Used for towing by Starfleet's 22nd-century starships.
Text: Plays aboard your NX-class ship. Adds Tractor Beam. When crew completes a space mission that requires an attribute, discard to score points.

Name: Vulcan Tricorder
Lore: Representative of scanning devices used by 22nd-century space-faring civilizations. Used aboard Enterprise as a complement to standard-issue devices.
Text: Once each turn, you may select SCIENCE OR Biology OR Geology. Until re-selected, your ENGINEER- and SCIENCE-classification [22] personnel present gain that skill. (Unique.)

Name: Finally Ready to Swim
Lore: Today we're about to cross a new threshold. For nearly a century, we've waded ankle-deep in the ocean of space.
Text: Seeds on table. Once every turn, when you play a [22] card, you may draw a card. When you play a non-[22] personnel or ship, you must discard a card from hand.

Name: Secondary Market
Lore: Though they say that one man's trash is another man's treasure, nothing is worth more on the black market than a fast ship.
Text: Plays to return a ship that you have commandeered to its owner's hand. Score points and draw up to five cards.

Name: Treaty: Starfleet/Klingon
Lore: In the 22nd-century, brief periods of peaceful cooperation existed between Starfleet and the Klingon Empire, such as the effort to stop the Qu'vat Colony virus.
Text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Antaak} or {Phlox} in play). Your [Sta] cards and your [Kli][22] cards recognize this treaty. They can now mix and cooperate.

Name: We're Ready
Lore: Ensign Sato felt she had much in common with Sluggo: out of place, far from home, and unsure if she could survive. But, she soon realized, "It's not that hard to adapt."
Text: Plays on table if you have three [Sta] personnel in play. At the end of each of your turns, if you do not have a [Non] card in play, you may draw an additional card.

Name: Out of Time
Text: Plays for free at any time to take up to three temporal agents in your discard pile into hand OR to allow your temporal agent, any number of your personnel present, and/or your ship he or she is aboard to time travel between a time location and the corresponding spaceline location. Discard incident OR "stop" your temporal agent to place this on top of your draw deck.

Name: Absolute Power
Lore: Genetically-enhanced ability often breeds enhanced ambition. Love, trust, and friendship are sacrificed in the name of power.
Text: Once per game, kill your personnel to "unstop" all your augments of the same affiliation as that personnel. OR Once each turn, kill your augment to draw three cards.

Name: Diverse Experiences
Lore: The crew of Enterprise paved the way for interstellar cooperation because of their willingness to embrace alien cultures and knowledge.
Text: Once each turn, when you complete a mission, draw a card for each [22] personnel in crew or Away Team (maximum 5).

Name: Automated Repair Station
Lore: Repair severe damage at automated facility.
Text: Physics + Computer Skill + ENGINEER + CUNNING>30 Solving player may download and use {Spacedock} here.

Name: Control Plague
Lore: Prevent the spread of a lethal disfiguring virus - at any cost.
Text: Biology + Exobiology + MEDICAL x2 + CUNNING>34

Name: Free Orion Slaves
Lore: Rescue or purchase captive crew members kidnapped in pirate raids.
Text: Leadership + SECURITY x2 + STRENGTH>40 Orions may report here (for free, once each turn).

Name: Observe Stellar Rebirth
Lore: Observe cycle of rebirth with devout pilgrims.
Text: Navigation + Anthropology + Stellar Cartography + INTEGRITY>28

Name: Prevent Rebellion
Lore: Intercede on restless local planet to stabilize local space.
Text: Anthropology + Honor + SECURITY + INTEGRITY>29

Name: File Annual Report
Text: Seeds or plays on your {Earth}. If you have completed a different mission, your [Sta] personnel may attempt Earth with the following requirements: OFFICER + any staffed [Sta] ship in orbit + INTEGRIY>30 When you solve, mission is worth 30 points (instead of printed value), and you may download one {[Univ][Sta] personnel}.

Name: Remote Interference
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Twice each turn, when you move your [Rom] Drone-class ship to a location where an opponent has a ship, you may draw a card. At start of each of your turns, you may return an empty [Rom] Drone-class ship to hand OR discard a card to download a [Rom] Drone-class ship to hand. (Unique.)

Name: Straight and Steady
Text: Seeds or plays on table. When your [22] card is attacked, you may discard objective to make each [22] card involved attributes all +5 until the end of that battle. At the end of your opponent's turn, you may discard objective to move your [22] ship one spaceline location toward your homeworld or facility. (Unique. Captain's Order.)

Name: Admiral Valdore
Lore: Brilliant military strategist behind most of the campaigns of the Earth-Romulan War. A former senator expelled for challenging Imperial doctrine.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Gareb} DL/ {Remote Interference}

Name: Akorem Laan
Lore: Bajoran poet from the 22nd century. Believed he was the Emissary of the Prophets sent to restore his people's d'jarras.
Text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Navigation Physics Law DL/ {D'jarras}

Name: Antaak
Lore: Physician responsible, albeit accidentally, for creating the disfiguring Klingon augment virus. Found a future in cranial reconstruction. Had a knack for diplomacy.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL SCIENCE Honor Exobiology DL/ {Any Targ} DL/ {maH nIv}

Name: Dallas
Lore: Representative of one of the many young female officers stationed on Enterprise. Their experiences aboard would be invaluable in their careers.
Text: SCIENCE Physics

Name: Daniel Leonard
Lore: Cautious admiral responsible for overseeing portions of the NX project and removing "dead wood" from Starfleet's ranks.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Navigation x 2 DL/ Any [Sta] ship

Name: Daniels
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human/Alien; 31st-century; Male; Temporal Agent; Temporal agent-related card;
Lore: Resourceful temporal agent from the 31st-century. Frequently "assisted" the Enterprise crew in preventing alterations to the timeline. More or less human.
Text: SECURITY ENGINEER Archaeology Physics Anthropology DL/ {Out of Time}

Name: D'Nesh
Lore: Manipulative gift given to Jonathan Archer by Harrad-Sar. Beautiful Orion slave girl and thief. Seduced Kelby in a plot to capture Enterprise.
Text: ENGINEER Diplomacy Treachery Computer Skill Anthropology Orion Syndicate

Name: Ensign Jameson
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human/Borg; Female; Temporal Agent; Temporal agent-related card;
Lore: Recruited as a temporal agent by the crew of the U.S.S. Relativity. Former Borg Seven of Nine saved Voyager from being erased from the timeline.
Text: ENGINEER SCIENCE Exobiology Physics x 2 Computer Skill Astrophysics DL/ {Out of Time}

Name: Erika Hernandez
Lore: Comparable captain of Columbia, the second Warp 5 ship. Romantically involved with Jonathan Archer.
Text: OFFICER Anthropology Diplomacy Leadership SECURITY DL/ Any Captain's Order card

Name: Gareb
Lore: Blind Aenar male captured by Romulan agents. Told he was the last surviving Aenar. Manipulated into telepathically piloting the drone ships.
Text: CIVILIAN Empathy x 2 Geology

Name: Garrid
Lore: Representative Starfleet officer serving aboard the NX-class ships in the 2150s. The crew routinely faced illness and injury in the line of duty.
Text: MEDICAL Biology SCIENCE

Name: General K'Vagh
Lore: Military director of the Klingon augment project. Judged Phlox to be weak-willed.
Text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Treachery Once each turn, may draw a card when you report an augment here.

Name: Harrad-Sar
Lore: Slave of the situation created by D'Nesh, Maras, and Navaar. Orion captain of the Devna-Lev. A thief at heart, but a gracious host.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Smuggling Orion Syndicate DL/ Any slave girl

Name: Hoshi Sato (Straight and Steady)
Lore: Uneasy educator recruited to be Captain Archer's communications officer. Fluent in countless languages. Capable relief cook.
Text: SCIENCE Music Anthropology Geology Computer Skill Exobiology DL/ {We're Ready}

Name: Jeffrey Pierce
Lore: On the edge of known space, he was one of many Enterprise crew captured by Orion slavers. Did not sell well. Held it together long enough to be rescued.
Text: SECURITY Anthropology Computer Skill Diplomacy

Name: Laneth
Lore: Representative of female Klingon augments. Relished the results of increased strength, speed, and stamina, but despised the new feelings of fear.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Transporter Skill Biology

Name: Malcolm Reed (Straight and Steady)
Lore: Disciplined NX-01 senior armory officer. Recruited into a covert operations unit authorized by Article 14, Section 31, of the Starfleet Charter.
Text: SECURITY OFFICER Law Section 31 Computer Skill DL/ {Starfleet Phaser Pistol}

Name: Marab
Lore: Klingon augment. Son of General K'Vagh. As a test of his augmented abilities, led the team that boarded Enterprise - but was left behind.
Text: SECURITY Treachery Leadership Youth Stellar Cartography

Name: Maras
Characteristics/ Keywords: Orion; Female; Slave Girl; Support Personnel; Thief;
Lore: Representative Orion slave girl. Secretly manipulates the Orion Syndicate, as many in her line of work do. Valued for her skills as a thief.
Text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Orion Syndicate

Name: McDermott
