Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Treachery Geology

Name: T'Jev
Lore: Typical field nurse assigned to a damage control team on the Haakona in 2365. Was tending injured crew members when Jean-Luc Picard appeared.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Greed Anthropology

Name: Toraan
Lore: Tal Shiar officer assigned to the Office of the Proconsul in 2368. Often works alongside his twin brother Telak. Likes viinerine with Romulan ale.
Text: SECURITY Tal Shiar Exobiology Treachery Transporter Skill DL/ {Romulan Disruptor}

Name: Deranas
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Warbird commanded by Tomalak. Often assigned to the Neutral Zone. Encountered the U.S.S. Enterprise twice in 2366.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam Attributes all +2 in Neutral Zone.

Name: U.S.S. Excalibur
Lore: Refitted vessel captained by William T. Riker during Starfleet's blockade of the Klingon-Romulan border in 2368. Underwent further refit in 2373.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Voyager
Characteristics/ Keywords: Alpha Quadrant-related [DQ] ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
Lore: In 2372, Culluh and Seska took command of the Alpha Quadrant vessel U.S.S. Voyager and its technology for the benefit of the Kazon-Nistrim sect.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam DL/ {Home Away from Home}

Name: Assimilated Vessel
Lore: Revived Borg drones found in Earth's Arctic Circle assimilated the nearest ship in an attempt to rejoin the Collective.
Text: End of every turn: Attacks one ship (random selection), then moves. Opponent scores points if dilemma moves off spaceline (even if [Bor]).

Name: Cybernetic Homing Device
Lore: Data and his brother Lore each contained a homing device. When Dr. Soong activated them in 2367, Data took control of the U.S.S. Enterprise to reach his creator.
Text: If android or non-[Bor] Borg aboard, opponent may move ship up to printed RANGE (ship is "stopped"), then discard dilemma. Otherwise, to get past requires CUNNING>36.

Name: Data Has Some Issues
Lore: Under Lore's emotional influence, Data felt a sense of brutal pleasure after killing a Borg on Ohniaka III. He pursued those feelings until his ethical subroutines were reinitialized.
Text: Place on ("stops") a personnel present (random selection). End of each turn, they kill another personnel present with lower STRENGTH (opponent's choice). Cure with 3 ENGINEER.

Name: Hunter Probe
Lore: Silaran Prin used hunter probes to exact vengeance against several Shakaar resistance cell members including Latha Mabrin, Furel, and Lupaza.
Text: Unless 2 SECURITY and 2 Anthropology present, opponent chooses two personnel. Both die at end of turn. Mission continues.

Name: Irrational Commander
Lore: After Worf's suggestion to activate the U.S.S. Enterprise-E's self-destruct sequence, Jean-Luc Picard's outburst surprised his crew. They carried out his orders nonetheless.
Text: Unless you have two leaders with Honor OR two leaders with Treachery, place on mission. Crew must have any attribute>double mission points to solve. (Unique.)

Name: Murasaki Effect
Lore: Electromagnetic phenomenon that surrounded Taurus II in 2267. Damaged the shuttlecraft Galileo and left transporters temporarily unreliable.
Text: Damages all unstaffed ships in orbit. Place on mission. Each time transporters used here, one just-beamed personnel is killed (random selection).

Name: Osaarian Pirates
Lore: Heavily armed Osaarian merchant ship. Its crew turned to piracy after being stranded in the Delphic Expanse.
Text: End of every turn: Destroys one equipment (random selection) on each facility (except a Nor) and ship here without Smuggling aboard, then moves.

Name: Paralyzed by Fear
Lore: The untested junior engineers assigned to salvage Empok Nor were frozen with terror after Cardassian killers gradually began eliminating them.
Text: Stops each personnel in crew or Away Team with printed CUNNING+INTEGRITY<13. Nullify with {Miles O'Brien}.

Name: Regime Change
Lore: Shinzon's elimination of the Romulan Senate using a thalaron radiation device ensured his ascension to the pinnacle of power in the Star Empire.
Text: Opponent chooses: kills three personnel (random selection) who report for free using game text on planet (or planet facility here) OR kills one V.I.P. (random selection).

Name: Remat Detonator
Lore: Black market device of Romulan origin which scrambles transporter beams on rematerialization. Silaran Prin used one to kill Shakaar resistance cell informant Trentin Fala in 2373.
Text: Unless 2 Transporter Skill present, place on table. Whenever your personnel have just beamed, opponent may discard dilemma to kill one (their choice).

Name: Spaceborne Entity
Lore: Angry life-form transformed into a massive and powerful vessel. Nothing like it in Starfleet records - not even close.
Text: No personnel may report "for free" at this location. End of every turn: Attacks all ships matching mission's affiliation icons, then moves.

Name: Brace for Impact
Lore: In 2371, a warp core breach forced the crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise to land the saucer section on Veridian III, bringing the ship's mission to an end.
Text: Plays to land your damaged ship at a planet location. If Galaxy-class, X=landed ship's lowest printed attribute. Otherwise, X=0.

Name: Stone Knives and Bearskins
Lore: Stranded on Earth in the 1930s, Spock struggled to construct a mnemonic memory circuit using the comparatively primitive equipment of the era.
Text: Plays on any planet mission. Suspends gametext of all non-unique Equipment present (except blade weapons, [Rule] cards, {Ketracel-White}, and {Gold-Pressed Latinum}).

Name: Repurposed Outpost
Lore: As the power of a spacefaring culture declines, outposts established throughout its former territory are often occupied by independent groups.
Text: Seed one OR build where you have a Non-Aligned ENGINEER. Does not allow aligned cards to report.

Name: Followers of the One
Text: Plays on {Varria III}. [Non] androids and [Non] Borg cards may report to planet or in orbit; once each turn, {The One} (or a personnel with his name in lore) may do so for free. Your [Non] androids and [Non] Borg may beam through shields of an opponent's ship at the same mission as your Borg ship, but may only battle once that turn. Your [Non] Borg are immune to {Reactor Overload}.

Name: Taken Prisoner
Text: Plays on table. Once each turn, you may report a [TNG][Car] personnel (for free) to your [Car] outpost or to your [TNG][Car] ship at a mission an opponent seeded or that is worth 40 or more points. Once each turn (thrice per game), if an opponent's personnel present with your [TNG][Car] personnel is about to be killed, you may capture that personnel instead.

Name: A Missing Day
Lore: The isolationist Paxan race hid their existence by erasing explorers' memories. The Paxans failed to remove all clues to their encounter with the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2367.
Text: Plays once each turn to count down an opponent's dilemma, interrupt, or event (except {Omega Particle}).

Name: Fitting In
Lore: To prevent the assassination of Captain Kirk in 2268, the crew of the U.S.S. Defiant needed to blend into the background of daily life aboard the Starship Enterprise.
Text: Plays once each turn to give your non-[AU] personnel a skill from an [AU] personnel present until end of turn.

Name: Your Place is on the Bridge
Lore: In times of crisis, a captain needs to be able to coordinate crew activities. James T. Kirk reminded John Harriman of this during the maiden voyage of the U.S.S. Enterprise-B.
Text: Plays on your damaged ship OR your ship just targeted in a battle you did not initiate. Download its matching commander aboard. Discard interrupt.

Name: Evade Borg Vessel
Lore: Hide from pursuing Borg cube in dense, hazardous nebula.
Text: Stellar Cartography + Navigation + Leadership + CUNNING>36 Only one of your ships may battle here every turn.

Name: Foster New Collective
Lore: Help separated and disoriented Borg regain order.
Text: SECURITY x3 + STRENGTH>36 + ([Com] OR [Nav] OR [Def]) Opponent's side: Your <Y) and (Y> may report on planet (for free).

Name: Install Emotion Chip
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Install new android hardware at remote laboratory.
Text: Cybernetics x2 + INTEGRITY>34 *+5 for each unique Soong-type android present, up to three.

Name: Locate Terrorist Leader
Lore: Find Bajoran terrorist's resistance cell.
Text: Anthropology + SECURITY + Computer Skill + (Honor OR Treachery OR Resistance)

Name: Redirect Energy Ribbon
Text: Seeds on {Veridian III}. Your El-Aurian personnel may attempt it using these requirements: Treachery + Astrophysics + {Trilithium Weapon} + {Trilithium Weapon Control PADD} When you solve, download or relocate {The Nexus} (even from on table) to any of your planet missions and you may convert Veridian III to a space mission.

Name: B'Etor (The Sky's the Limit)
Lore: Since failing to seize control of the Klingon Empire, B'Etor, sister of Duras, had been seeking to acquire powerful weapons. Still the prettier sister.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery Youth DL/ {Lursa} Once per game, may steal an Artifact present.

Name: Bosus
Lore: Typical disconnected Borg disciple of The One. Participated in the raid on Ohniaka III. Swore to avenge the death of his friend Torsus.
Text: SECURITY Astrophysics Treachery Navigation

Name: Captain Spock (The Sky's the Limit)
Lore: Trainee instructor at Starfleet Academy, Mr. Spock supervised the Kobayashi Maru scenario. 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 human mentor of Saavik.
Text: OFFICER Biology Honor Leadership Physics SCIENCE Mindmeld DL/ {The Needs of the Many}

Name: D.C. Franklin
Lore: Human tactical officer typical of those serving in the late 23rd century. Directed efforts to transport the S.S. Lakul survivors aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-B.
Text: SECURITY Astrophysics Transporter Skill

Name: Data (The Sky's the Limit)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Android; Male; Soong-type android; The One-related personnel;
Lore: Loyal brother of Lore. The Soong-type android was swayed by emotions to join The One's cause.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Exobiology Biology Treachery Mortally wounds each opponent he stuns in battle.

Name: Dokar
Lore: Characteristic of male Klingon warriors supporting attempts by the House of Duras to regain power after their defeat in the Klingon Civil War.
Text: OFFICER Biology Treachery Transporter Skill

Name: Dr. Farek (The Sky's the Limit)
Lore: Typical Ferengi physician. Served aboard the Krayton in 2366. Distrusted Lwaxana Troi. Tried to study her empathic powers with a mind probe.
Text: MEDICAL Exobiology Treachery Computer Skill

Name: Goran
Lore: Representative of espionage specialists serving in the Cardassian military. Posed as a monk to attack a Maquis cell at the Juhraya colony in 2370.
Text: MEDICAL Transporter Skill Anthropology Obsidian Order DL/ {Cardassian Disruptor}

Name: Goval
Lore: Representative of lost Borg who found a new sense of purpose with The One. Temporarily separated himself from his new collective.
Text: SCIENCE Biology Archaeology Exobiology

Name: Kamala
Lore: The perfect mate, an empathic metamorph. Kriosian mutant romantically involved with Jean-Luc Picard. Dutifully married Alrik despite her bond to Jean-Luc.
Text: V.I.P. Anthropology x 2 Archaeology Empathy When reported, select any skill present.

Name: Kathryn Janeway (The Sky's the Limit)
Lore: Promoted to vice-admiral after seven years in the Delta Quadrant. Dispatched the U.S.S. Enterprise-E to Romulus on an "easy" diplomatic assignment.
Text: V.I.P. SCIENCE Diplomacy Computer Skill Physics While on {Earth}, your [Fed] ships are RANGE +1.

Name: K'Vit
Lore: Klingon helmsman serving the Sisters of Duras. Briefly worked as a bounty hunter. Warrior at heart. Surprised when his ship began to cloak at Veridian III.
Text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 Anthropology Treachery If on {Cha'Joh}, it is RANGE +2.

Name: Lieutenant Crosis
Lore: Renegade Borg who commanded the initial phase of raids on Federation outposts. Loyal aide to The One. Recruited Data to their cause.
Text: OFFICER Treachery Computer Skill SECURITY {Investigate Raid} has [NON], [non].

Name: Lursa (The Sky's the Limit)
Lore: Ambitious sister of Duras and B'Etor. Working to restore her family's previous position of power. Named her newborn son after her father, Ja'rod.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery Leadership DL/ {B'Etor} Treachery Klingons present are attributes all +1.

Name: Lwaxana Troi (The Sky's the Limit)
Lore: Betazoid ambassador held captive by Tog. Misled him about her willingness to cooperate. Later described Tog as slightly repulsive, but with a certain charm.
Text: V.I.P. Empathy x 2 Anthropology Computer Skill

Name: Marruu
Lore: Human navigator typical of U.S.S. Enterprise-B staff officers. Befriended Demora Sulu. Enjoys strategy games and tales of the ancient American West.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Computer Skill

Name: Martinez
Lore: Typical nurse who served under Beverly Crusher for many years. Helped evacuate sickbay when the Borg boarded the U.S.S. Enterprise-E.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Transporter Skill

Name: Millin
Lore: Male El-Aurian representative of refugees rescued by the U.S.S. Enterprise-B from the S.S. Lakul before it was destroyed by the Nexus.
Text: CIVILIAN Honor Anthropology

Name: Morik
Lore: One of many Borg disconnected from the Collective who became loyal to The One. Guarded the Federation prisoners but was easily tricked by them.
Text: ENGINEER Anthropology Transporter Skill Geology X=number of different [NA] Borg present (limit 6).

Name: Nador
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Gul; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Elder gul encountered by the U.S.S. Enterprise in multiple realities. Commanded the Rokassa. Investigated espionage uses of the Argus Array.
Text: OFFICER Treachery Stellar Cartography Law Leadership Anthropology

Name: Relam
Lore: Complex strategist affected by temporal irregularities in 2369. Once captained a D'deridex. Has a family tradition of military service.
Text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Treachery SCIENCE

Name: Tarvang
Characteristics/ Keywords: Romulan; Male; Support Personnel; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Typical Romulan pilot. Beamed aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise during an encounter with quantum singularity lifeforms in 2369. Enjoys chess.
Text: ENGINEER Navigation Physics

Name: The One
Characteristics/ Keywords: Android; Male; Soong-type android; The One-related personnel;
Lore: The Soong-type android Lore found his calling giving purpose to disconnected Borg drones.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery x 2 Leadership Computer Skill Diplomacy Transporter Skill DL/ {Lore's Fingernail}

Name: Third of Five (The Sky's the Limit)
Lore: Borg befriended by Geordi La Forge. Became an individual, "Hugh," fracturing his hive's link to the Collective. Led those resisting Lore's leadership.
Text: ENGINEER Honor Leadership Biology Exobiology DL/ {Group of Individuals}

Name: Twelve of Thirteen
Lore: Identification: TOPOLOGY DRONE Task: Analyze planetary surface features. Secure. Biological Distinctiveness: Humanoid.
Text: Geology Allows each scout ship in this hive to take off or land once each turn.

Name: William T. Riker (The Sky's the Limit)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Duras-related; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Experienced officer who often commanded the U.S.S. Enterprise. Defeated the Sisters of Duras at Veridian III. Well versed in saucer separations.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Music DL/ {Brace for Impact}

Name: Assimilator
Lore: Large Borg ship operated by a group of renegade Borg. First encountered the U.S.S. Enterprise while raiding the Federation outpost on Ohniaka III.
Text: Tractor Beam DL/ {Transwarp Conduit}

Name: Cha'Joh (The Sky's the Limit)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bird-of-Prey; Cloaking Device; Duras-related; Klingon ship; No staffing requirement; Scout;
Lore: Bird-of-Prey commanded by Lursa and B'Etor, the Sisters of Duras. Fought at Veridian III.
Text: May report to location of {Dr. Tolian Soran}. Cloaking Device

Name: Stolen Ship
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation ship; Merchant vessel; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam; Vulcan ship;
Lore: One of many decommissioned Vulcan merchant vessels. Several were stolen by the Romulans in a ploy to conquer Vulcan for the Star Empire.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Supply Ship
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian ship; Freighter; Long-Range Scan Shielding; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Typical Cardassian freighter. Carries anything from research equipment to disruptors to taspar eggs. Uses high-energy subspace fields to mask its cargo.
Text: Long-Range Scan Shielding, Tractor Beam

Name: Starting Over
Lore: Kathryn Janeway offered the disconnected drone Seven of Nine a new life free from the Borg Collective and the chance to rediscover her humanity as Annika Hansen.
Text: Discard your hand, then draw the same number of cards. If you have a Borg personnel in play, draw two extra cards. (No draws may be converted to downloads.) Discard event.

Name: Unstable Matrix
Lore: David Marcus used dangerously unpredictable protomatter to build the Genesis Device, inadvertently dooming the Genesis Planet.
Text: Seeds on {Genesis}. If mission complete, you may lose points (discard event) to convert to a space mission. (Immune to {Kevin Uxbridge}.)

Name: Attack at Rare Phenomenon
Lore: Ambush enemy ship while it conducts delicate research.
Text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Computer Skill + SECURITY

Name: Battle Reconnaissance
Lore: Investigate unusual bio-readings.
Text: ENGINEER + Computer Skill + Transporter Skill + STRENGTH>32

Name: Clash at Chin'toka
Lore: Battle over strategically significant system.
Text: ENGINEER + Navigation + two leaders + CUNNING>36

Name: Collect Omicron Particles
Lore: Harvest rare substance for use as replacement power source.
Text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Astrophysics + Navigation Adjacent missions are span -1.

Name: Destroy Iconian Gateway
Lore: Permanently close ancient portal held by renegade Jem'Hadar.
Text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Physics + STRENGTH>34

Name: Evade Dominion Squadron
Lore: Maneuver among icy comet fragments during hot pursuit.
Text: Stellar Cartography + Navigation x2 + CUNNING>34 + (Geology OR Leadership)

Name: Genesis Planet
Lore: Study final collapse of unstable and formerly forbidden planet.
Text: Geology + CUNNING>42 + (Biology + Exobiology + SCIENCE OR SECURITY + Transporter Skill + Treachery)

Name: Investigate Derelict
Lore: Study remains of antique Vulcan ship.
Text: ENGINEER + Exobiology + Navigation + SECURITY When you solve, restores RANGE of all ships in region.

Name: Investigate Maquis Activity
Lore: Confer with colonial leaders about recent tensions.
Text: Diplomacy + Leadership x2 + STRENGTH>37 + no [Maq] *+5 if this is your first completed mission.

Name: Navigate Argolis Cluster
Lore: Engage enemy near vital sensor array.
Text: Stellar Cartography + Navigation x2 + Physics OR OFFICER + Leadership + SECURITY + STRENGTH>36

Name: Protect The Escapees
Lore: Defend civilian government from Klingon patrols.
Text: ENGINEER + Honor + Navigation + INTEGRITY>30 Solving player may initiate battle against [Kli].

Name: Renovate Starbase
Lore: Refurbish outpost established in the earliest days of space exploration.
Text: ENGINEER x2 + OFFICER When you solve, download a facility here.

Name: Resupply Marauder
Lore: Restock Ferengi vessels for operations in adjacent sectors.
Text: OFFICER + ENGINEER x2 + Acquisition Solving player's D'Kora-class ships are RANGE +1.

Name: Signal for Rescue
Lore: Quickly repair damaged communication system; call for help.
Text: Biology + ENGINEER + Computer Skill + SECURITY + STRENGTH>42

Name: Study Rare Phenomenon
Lore: Evaluate subspace abnormality for possible transwarp applications.
Text: ENGINEER + Navigation + Physics + SCIENCE

Name: Surgery Under Fire
Lore: Assist with triage of heavy combat casualties.
Text: Biology + MEDICAL + OFFICER + STRENGTH>36

Name: The Siege of AR-558
Lore: Fight for control of critical communications array.
Text: ENGINEER + Leadership + Physics + Computer Skill + SECURITY + STRENGTH>38

Name: Back Room Dealings
Lore: Conducting illicit negotiations with a pair of volatile Klingons requires an experienced eye and careful haggling, much like the day-to-day life of a tailor.
Text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you "stop" a personnel with Treachery or INTEGRITY<4. To get past requires STRENGTH>24 remaining.

Name: Chula: Unfortunate Roll
Lore: In the game of chula, even choosing the less profitable but safer path does not guarantee that all of your players will continue to the next shap.
Text: To get past, three personnel present (random selection) are chosen. If their total INTEGRITY is odd, all three are "stopped." Otherwise, discard dilemma.

Name: Cultural Differences
Lore: Klingon honor and Ferengi greed are not a natural match. To win the heart of Grilka, Quark had to dispel many Klingon prejudices against the Ferengi.
Text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you "stop" a personnel with Acquisition or Anthropology. To get past requires CUNNING>24 remaining.

Name: Difficult Disposal
Characteristics/ Keywords: Harvester Virus-related card; MEDICAL-related dilemma; Virus-related dilemma;
Lore: Julian Bashir found the harvester virus remarkably resistant to most forms of radiation, making the disease difficult to destroy. It only took 375 attempts.
Text: To get past requires 2 ENGINEER and MEDICAL OR ENGINEER and 2 MEDICAL.

Name: Encased in Crystal
Lore: With Kira Nerys' life seemingly in danger from an expanding crystal, Odo tried everything from brute force to harmonic vibrations in an attempt to free his friend.
Text: To get past requires 2 Geology and SECURITY OR Geology and 2 SECURITY OR 2 Music.

Name: Ferengi Locator Bomb
Lore: Pheromone-guided assassination device used unsuccessfully against Grand Nagus Quark in 2369. Very difficult to avoid. Can be identified by the telltale sorium and argine traces.
Text: Unless Computer Skill, Navigation, and Physics OR Acquisition, Treachery, and CUNNING>32 present, one personnel (random selection) is placed on bottom of draw deck.

Name: Fly by the Seat of your Pants
Lore: With limited resources and outdated technology, the Bajoran resistance had to rely on their instincts rather than navigational sensors to pilot their vessels.
Text: To get past requires 2 Navigation and OFFICER OR Navigation and 2 OFFICER.

Name: Hard Time
Lore: Argrathi criminal remediation relies on false memories of imprisonment. After being accused of espionage, Miles O'Brien received a memory of a 20-year incarceration.
Text: One personnel (random selection) is returned to hand; X = the number of [*] on that personnel. To get past requires at least X personnel remaining.

Name: More of Your Kind
Lore: The Prophets living in the Bajoran wormhole found their existence was disrupted each time a vessel entered the Celestial Temple. The Sisko negotiated for safe passage.
Text: Randomly stops half of your crew (round down). Nullify with any [Orb] personnel.

Name: Precision Piloting
Lore: Jadzia Dax and Arjin had to maneuver carefully while transporting a protouniverse, avoiding any verteron nodes that could destabilize their delicate cargo.
Text: To get past requires Navigation with [Cmd] or [Stf]. All such personnel are "stopped," but if two or more present, one must continue (your choice).

Name: Secret Identity
Lore: Pel posed as a male waiter in order to bypass Ferengi commerce laws and earn profit. Rom exposed her secret, jealous that she had usurped his position at Quark's side.
Text: One personnel (opponent's choice) is discarded. If you did not seed this dilemma, you may download a personnel of the same affiliation to join crew or Away Team.

Name: Socializing with the Staff
Lore: Julian Bashir made sure to meet all of the dabo girls working at Quark's Bar. Jadzia Dax took a perverse pleasure in making sure those meetings were awkward.
Text: To get past requires a female. All female personnel are "stopped," but if two are more present, one must continue (random selection).

Name: Too Many Chiefs
Lore: The assignment of two chiefs of security aboard Deep Space 9 inevitably muddled the chain of command. Benjamin Sisko reassured Odo that George Primmin was not in charge.
Text: One SECURITY-classification personnel (random selection) is "stopped." If that personnel has Leadership, two additional SECURITY personnel are "stopped" (random selection).

Name: Unlikely Pair
Lore: The bombing of Garak's tailor shop led Odo and Garak to investigate the whereabouts of Enabran Tain. However, their investigation also caught the eye of the Tal Shiar.
Text: Choose to "stop" until countdown expires: two personnel not of the same species (your choice) OR two personnel (random selection).

Name: The First Stable Wormhole
Text: Seeds on table. You may download {Bajoran Wormhole}(s) (even from outside the game). When your ship travels through Bajoran Wormhole, you may discard a card from hand to download {Wormhole Navigation Schematic} (even from discard pile). Your [GQ] missions are span -1 for your [DS9] ships. Doubles point boxes of your {File Mission Report} (for [GQ] missions) and {Rescue Personnel} (if Away Team on a [GQ] planet).

Name: Bajor for Bajorans
Lore: After the Cardassian occupation, many Bajorans wished to rid themselves of all alien influence. The Circle's isolationist attitude led to acts of violence against non-Bajorans.
Text: Plays on table (for free if you have {Jaro Essa} in play). At the end of each of your turns, if you have no non-[Baj] personnel in play, you may draw an extra card.

Name: Internment
Lore: Julian Bashir was captured by Dominion operatives at a conference. Like General Martok, he was imprisoned in the Gamma Quadrant and replaced by a changeling.
Text: Plays to relocate a captive held by your trap card to your brig (in same quadrant or Alpha Quadrant). OR Plays to download a capturing-related card to hand. Discard event.

Name: New Frontiers
Lore: The discovery of the Bajoran wormhole created new opportunities for inter-quadrant exploration, commerce, and colonization.
Text: Plays to draw two cards. If you have four [DS9] personnel at a mission not in their native quadrant, draw two additional cards. Discard event.

Name: Raktajino
Lore: The stimulating Klingon coffee is a staple of Benjamin Sisko's morning routine. He isn't awake until he's had his first cup.
Text: Plays to make a unique personnel attributes +2 until end of turn OR shuffle the bottom three personnel and/or ships from your discard pile into your draw deck. Discard event.

Name: Shipwright
Lore: In 2371, Benjamin Sisko used an ancient Bajoran spacecraft to prove Bajorans were capable of interstellar travel before many other races.
Text: Plays on table. Your [Baj] ships are RANGE +1. (Cumulative.) OR Lose points to make your ship with Solar Sail RANGE +10 this turn.

Name: Alliance for Global Unity
Text: Plays on table. Your [Baj] personnel lose Resistance (even if not in play). Once each turn, your [DS9][Baj] personnel with "the Circle" in lore reporting to a compatible facility in the Bajor Region may do so for free. Each time you solve a mission, you may download a [DS9][Baj] card to that mission, {an HQ} card, {Bajoran Civil War}, or {Bajor For Bajorans}. Discard this card if you play or have played a personnel that is not [Baj], [Non], or [Neu].

Name: Articles of Jurisprudence
Text: Plays on your escorted captive on {Cardassia Prime}; you may discard captive at any time. (Unique.) Each of your [Car] Law personnel add captive's skills. [Car] personnel without Honor are each attributes all +2. OR Plays once each turn to draw a card for each captive you are escorting or have in your brig (limit four).

Name: Call for Reinforcements
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once per game, in place of your normal card play, you may download a [Univ] ship. Once per game, in place of your normal card play, you may fully repair your ship if you have a matching facility (or compatible {Nor}) in play.

Name: Gagh Tek Or?
Text: Plays to download {Lursa} and {B'Etor} OR {Yeto} and {T'Kar} OR {Quark Son of Keldar} and {Grilka} OR once per game, download {Klingon Restaurant} and one [DS9] Klingon (may report to that site); when reporting and for rest of game, personnel downloaded with this incident may mix and cooperate with your [DS9] cards regardless of affiliation. Draw no cards this turn. Discard incident.

Name: Here by Invitation
Text: Plays on table; you may download {Treaty: Federation/Bajoran}. Once each turn, your [DS9][Baj] or [DS9][Fed] personnel with "DS9" or "Deep Space 9" in lore may report (for free) aboard {Deep Space 9} (to an appropriate site) OR to your {U.S.S. Defiant}. Once per game, if your facility commander is at {Commander's Office}, you may download an objective. Nullified if you have {Bajoran Resistance Cell} in play.

Name: I Miss This Office
Lore: Dukat desired to pry Terok Nor away from Benjamin Sisko so he could regain control of the Bajor sector.
Text: Plays on table. Once each turn, your [DS9][Car] personnel reporting to {Terok Nor} may do so for free if [Stf] or have "Terok Nor" in lore. If your personnel just commandeered {Deep Space 9}, you may download {Baseball}.

Name: Labor Camp
Text: Plays on an {Ore Processing Unit} or your non-homeworld planet mission (for free if {Forced-Labor Camp} present). Start of each turn, if your [Car] or [Fer] personnel present is escorting a captive, score 5 points. (Unique.)

Name: Nano-Biogenic Disarmament
Text: Seeds or plays on {T'Lani III}. Your cards with "harvester virus" in lore may report here; once each turn, one such personnel may do so for free if you do not have a facility here. When you solve, you may download and seed a dilemma with "harvester virus" in lore beneath any mission OR discard incident to score points.

Name: New Arrivals
Text: Seeds on table. Once each turn, you may play a [Univ] personnel you do not already have in play for free. End of each turn, you may draw an extra card. Discard incident if you play more than one personnel for free on any turn.

Name: Reshape the Quadrant
Text: Seed one on table. You may download one [RC] card. Your Nors, personnel, and ships that have a Star Trek: Deep Space Nine property logo gain [DS9] (even if not in play). Discard incident if you play (or have played) a non-[DS9] personnel or ship.

Name: Establish Interquadrant Communications
Lore: Set up subspace communication array.
Text: ENGINEER + Stellar Cartography + Diplomacy + Anthropology

Name: Host Tournament
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Facilitate high stakes gaming event.
Text: Diplomacy + Honor + Greed x2 [GQ][Non] cards may report on planet.

Name: Pacify Warring Factions
Lore: End centuries of warfare and rescue crash survivors.
Text: (SECURITY x2 OR {Kai Opaka}) + scout ship with 2 ENGINEER aboard

Name: Reopen Trade Discussions
Lore: Renegotiate contract in exchange for information.
Text: Diplomacy + Stellar Cartography + (Acquisition OR CUNNING>35)

Name: Salvage Wrecked Ship
Lore: Recover scrap from crashed vessel.
Text: ENGINEER x2 + Archaeology + Acquisition When you solve, may download {Jem'Hadar Birthing Chamber} here.

Name: Verify Legendary Journey
Lore: Recreate ancient spacefarers' "impossible" journey.
Text: ENGINEER + Navigation + Honor + Stellar Cartography May insert adjacent to Bajor Region OR Cardassia Region.

Name: Altovar (Emissary)
Lore: Vindictive criminal and Lethean thief who assaulted Julian Bashir while stealing bio-mimetic gel in 2371. He was later arrested by Odo.
Text: MEDICAL Empathy Exobiology Treachery x 2 DL/ {Lethean Telepathic Attack} (as an event, where Altovar present).

Name: Anneli
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Support Personnel; The Circle-related personnel;
Lore: Representative of female Bajorans serving in the militia. Dispatched by General Krim to help the Circle secure Deep Space 9.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Biology

Name: Arjin
Lore: Young Trill initiate seeking to be joined with a symbiont. Level five pilot who helped his field docent, Jadzia Dax, transport a protouniverse.
Text: SCIENCE Navigation x 2 Youth Physics May report where {Jadzia Dax} is present (for free).

Name: Belva
Lore: Typical Cardassian dissident. Works at the central medical center on Cardassia Prime. She befriended Legate Damar to obtain information on the Dominion.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Archaeology

Name: Ben Sisko
Lore: Shipwright Benjamin Sisko built and commanded the Baraka, a replica Bajoran lightship. Human. Recreated a legendary interstellar journey.
Text: ENGINEER Honor Navigation Astrophysics Anthropology DL/ {Construct Starship}

Name: Benjamin Sisko (Emissary)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Cook; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
Lore: Officer who reluctantly took command of Deep Space 9 in 2369. Named Emissary of the Prophets by Kai Opaka. Expert cook. Friend of Cal Hudson.
Text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Music Honor If in [GQ]: ENGINEER, Diplomacy, Navigation

Name: Beyor
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Female; Minister; Support Personnel; The Circle-related personnel;
Lore: Representative of Bajoran political aides. Worked with Jaro Essa and, despite her connections to the Circle, later rose to become a minister.
Text: CIVILIAN Law Computer Skill

Name: Bhaduri
Lore: Typical female Kellerun technician. Learned all she could about the harvester virus. Eagerly worked to destroy the devastating weapon in 2370.
Text: CIVILIAN SCIENCE Computer Skill Anthropology

Name: Borum
Lore: Selfless hero held prisoner on Cardassia IV. Bajoran willing to sacrifice himself to rescue Li Nalas. Never gave up hope of returning him to Bajor.
Text: MEDICAL Resistance Honor DL/ {Starfleet Type II Phaser} May exchange for a [Baj] leader in your discard pile.

Name: Chef Kaga
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon; Cook; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Male;
Lore: Owner and cook at the Klingon restaurant aboard Deep Space 9. Often serenades his customers with Klingon folk songs. Makes excellent rokeg blood pie.
Text: CIVILIAN Biology Exobiology Music DL/ Gagh

Name: Danar (Emissary)
Lore: Irascible Gul assigned to pursue Tahna Los. Captain of the Aldara. Has mapped Klingon, Romulan, and Starfleet-patrolled space for the Cardassian Union.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation ENGINEER Stellar Cartography

Name: Darhe'el
Lore: The Butcher of Gallitep. Gul and labor camp commandant during the occupation of Bajor. Later impersonated by former file clerk Aamin Marritza.
Text: ENGINEER Treachery x 2 Exobiology Geology Leadership DL/ {Fajo's Gallery}

Name: Deputy Quark
Lore: Ferengi merchant Quark was deputized by Odo to get information on Kressari weapons movements. Keen participant in the Bajoran gratitude festival.
Text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Anthropology Computer Skill SECURITY (if {Odo} in play). DL/ {Renewal Scroll}

Name: Dohlem
Lore: Typical Bajoran vedek. He collects antique Bajoran mandalas. Tried to acquire one in an auction at Quark's Bar in 2373. Interested in human culture.
Text: CIVILIAN Youth Anthropology Diplomacy Navigation

Name: Dukat (Emissary)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Gul; Male;
Lore: Gul of the Second Order. Abducted by the Maquis from Deep Space 9 in 2370. He easily resisted their interrogation attempts.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Navigation ENGINEER Biology Attributes all +2 if opponent's [Maq] card in play.

Name: Hoya
Characteristics/ Keywords: Benzite; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Support Personnel;
Lore: Benzite female. One of many runabout pilots stationed on DS9. Transported a survey team to Torga IV in 2373. Was married by Benjamin Sisko.
Text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Navigation

Name: Investigator Odo
Characteristics/ Keywords: Changeling; Capturing-related card; Male; Shape-shifter; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Impartial changeling. Served on Terok Nor during the occupation of Bajor. An observer by necessity.
Text: SECURITY Anthropology Honor Law x 2 Once per game, may capture one personnel present.

Name: Jadzia Dax (Emissary)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Trill; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female; Trill with symbiont;
Lore: Science officer who reported to Deep Space 9 in 2369. Female Trill joined with the Dax symbiont in 2367. Very different from Curzon.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Navigation If in [GQ]: Geology, Physics, Archaeology, Exobiology

Name: Jake Sisko (Emissary)
Lore: Son of Benjamin Sisko. Apprenticed under Miles O'Brien. Helped save Deep Space 9 from its counterinsurgency program. Friend of Nog.
Text: ENGINEER Honor Youth Biology DL/ Any ENGINEER-related equipment card

Name: Jakin
Characteristics/ Keywords: T'Lani; Harvester Virus-related card; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: Representative of male T'Lani who worked together with their former Kellerun enemies to destroy the weapon known as the harvester virus.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Navigation

Name: Jasad (Emissary)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Gul; Male;
Lore: Representative Gul of the Cardassian Guard, Seventh Order. Attacked Deep Space 9 in 2369. Eager to stake a claim in the Gamma Quadrant.
Text: OFFICER Physics Navigation Treachery If in [GQ], [Car] ship he is aboard is attributes all +2.

Name: Javed
Characteristics/ Keywords: Kellerun; Bodyguard; Harvester Virus-related card; Male; Support Personnel;
Lore: Male Kellerun bodyguard of E'Tyshra and Sharat. Representative of those who intended to eliminate all knowledge of the harvester virus. Crack shot.
Text: SECURITY Treachery Exobiology

Name: Jerax
Lore: Typical Glinn of the Third Battalion. Psychotropic drug test subject. Revived from stasis on Empok Nor when a Starfleet salvage team arrived in 2373.
Text: SECURITY Biology Geology

Name: Julian Bashir (Emissary)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Deep Space 9-related personnel; genetically enhanced; Harvester Virus-related card; Male;
Lore: Genetically enhanced chief medical officer of DS9. Helped destroy the harvester virus. Once mistook a preganglionic fiber for a postganglionic nerve.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Biology Exobiology If in [GQ]: Biology, SCIENCE, X=2

Name: Kira Meru
Lore: Comfort woman aboard Terok Nor in 2346. Romantically involved with Dukat. Worked all hours in hope of a better life for her family.
Text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Exobiology Geology DL/ {Comfort Women}

Name: Kira Taban
Lore: Husband and father who lived in the Singha refugee camp in 2346. Married to Kira Meru, who he called the bravest woman he'd ever known.
Text: MEDICAL Resistance Biology Honor Physics Scores points if killed.

Name: Makbar (Emissary)
Lore: Chief Archon. She believes efficient execution of Cardassian jurisprudence makes good viewing and is uplifting for the public.
Text: V.I.P. Law x 2 Treachery x 2 DL/ {Any [Pun] card}

Name: Melora Pazlar
Lore: Female Elaysian stellar cartographer. Visited DS9 in 2370. Romantically involved with Julian Bashir, the doctor who helped her walk in standard gravity.
Text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Navigation Astrophysics If in [GQ]: Stellar Cartography, Astrophysics

Name: Miles O'Brien (Emissary)
Lore: Human chief of operations. Irish. He formerly served aboard the U.S.S. Rutledge and the U.S.S. Enterprise.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill x 2 Miracle Worker If in [GQ]: SECURITY, ENGINEER, Navigation Transporter Skill DL/ {Reaction Control Thrusters}

Name: Minister Toran
Lore: Planetary geologist in charge of the Jeraddo energy project in 2369. He ordered the forced relocation of the moon's last three residents.
Text: ENGINEER Geology x 2 Music

Name: Murjo
Lore: Representative of male Bajorans who became disillusioned with the provisional government and joined the Circle. Helped kidnap Kira Nerys.
Text: ENGINEER Treachery Astrophysics Transporter Skill

Name: Oran
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Gul; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Irritable Gul posted on Bajor during the occupation. Took leave on Terok Nor in 2346. Staged an incident to help Dukat win the favor of Kira Meru.
Text: OFFICER MEDICAL SCIENCE Physics When reported, gains any skill until end of turn.

Name: Paulson
Lore: One of many human astrophysicists aboard Deep Space 9 who studies the Bajoran Wormhole. Stayed with her crew during the siege of 2370.
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Transporter Skill

Name: Quark (Emissary)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Ferengi; Bartender; Dissident; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Ferengi bartender romantically involved with Natima Lang. Former dissident who illicitly sold discounted food to oppressed Bajorans on Terok Nor.
Text: CIVILIAN Computer Skill Acquisition Anthropology ENGINEER Smuggling DL/ {Natima Lang}

Name: Rogesh
Lore: Typical low-level member of the Obsidian Order. Captured during Enabran Tain's attack on the Founder homeworld and held at Internment Camp 371.
Text: SCIENCE Obsidian Order Physics Navigation Treachery

Name: Tadim
Lore: Representative of senior Cardassian security experts. Advised the Detapa Council. Became a dissident after observing the trial of Miles O'Brien.
Text: V.I.P. SECURITY Honor Music Stellar Cartography

Name: Tosk
Lore: The hunted species known as Tosk had no identity outside of the hunt. He befriended Miles O'Brien after traveling through the wormhole in 2369.
Text: SECURITY Navigation x 2 Honor ENGINEER Computer Skill Excluded from random selections.

Name: Vedek Kira
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran; Female; The Circle-related personnel; Vedek;
Lore: Hero of Bajor Kira Nerys posed as a vedek to enter the Chamber of Ministers. Exposed Cardassian connections to the Circle.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Navigation Archaeology DL/ {Hidden Fighter}

Name: Yarka
Lore: Former vedek who lost his position in 2371 for protesting against peace with the Cardassians. Misinterpreted Trakor's third prophecy.
Text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Archaeology Physics

Name: Baraka
Characteristics/ Keywords: Bajoran ship; No staffing requirement; Solar Sail;
Lore: Lightship built by Ben Sisko in 2371 from ancient Bajoran designs. Has artificial gravity. Unexpectedly traveled beyond Bajor's Denorios Belt.
Text: Solar Sail DL/ {Shipwright}

Name: T'Lani Cruiser
Lore: Munitions ship originally designed to deploy biological weapons. Used as a laboratory for the obliteration of the harvester virus in 2370.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Ganges
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation ship; Harvester Virus-related card; No staffing requirement;
Lore: One of three runabouts delivered to DS9 by the U.S.S. Enterprise. Often commanded by Miles O'Brien. Carried the harvester virus team in 2370.
Text: DL/ {Magnetic North}

Name: U.S.S. Orinoco
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation ship; No staffing requirement; Scout; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Runabout fitted with an advanced sensor module to serve as a scientific scout vessel. Often commanded by Jadzia Dax. Registry number NCC-72905.
Text: Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard). DL/ {Explore Gamma Quadrant}

Name: Klingon Restaurant
Text: Klingons may report here. Once each turn, any cook may report here for free (or download here in place of a normal card play; player draws no cards that turn). Klingon ships may report, dock, undock and repair at this Nor. {Deep Space 9}: Promenade

Name: The Celestial Temple
Lore: The Prophets of Bajor live outside of linear time.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. At any time, any player may relocate their unique non-Treachery personnel between here and their ship or facility at the Alpha Quadrant {Bajoran Wormhole}. Any player with an [Orb] personnel here may draw an additional card at the end of each turn unless total WEAPONS>9 at any Bajoran Wormhole. No capturing or battles allowed here.

Name: Contain Boarding Parties
Text: Seeds or plays on {Deep Space 9}; you may download {Sisko 197 Subroutine}. Twice per game, when opponent voluntarily initiates battle aboard, you may download up to six [DS9] personnel (each must be [Fed] or [Baj]), and/or one hand weapon to sites aboard where those cards may report. Does not count down during the first turn of the game.

Name: Trust the Prophets
Text: Seeds on table; you may download {The Celestial Temple}. The Celestial Temple ignores WEAPONS of {Deep Space 9} (and any ships docked there). Compatible [DS9] [Fed] (except [OS]) cards are considered to match Deep Space 9's affiliation for purposes related to its sites.

Name: We Need You Here
Text: Seeds or plays on {Commander's Office}. If your {Reshape the Quadrant} is in play, you may ignore restrictions of site(s) on this station which instruct you to "draw no cards that turn." Once each turn, in place of a card draw, you may download a site to this station. (Captain's Order.)

Name: Herbert
Lore: Representative transporter officer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. He held the rank of ensign in the early years of the flagship's mission.
Text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill Biology Stellar Cartography

Name: Lieutenant Ballard
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Female; Support Personnel; Teacher; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Typical scientist and teacher in the U.S.S. Enterprise's primary school. She expressed concern to Data about Lal's ability to fit in.
Text: SCIENCE Exobiology Physics

Name: Riva (Warp Pack: Emissary)
Lore: Respected mediator. Deaf and mute Ramatin male. Taught sign language to warring factions on Solais V. Gave the Klingons a word for "peacemaker."
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy x 2 Honor When reported, each player draws a card.

Name: A Pleasant Surprise
Lore: Brothers Krit and Nahsk were Morn's co-conspirators in the Lissepian Mother's Day Heist. Their run-in with Quark could have been much less pleasant.
Text: To get past, "stop" a personnel with CUNNING>6 and either Diplomacy or Treachery (random selection).

Name: Deliberate Tactical Error
Lore: Keevan ensured his own survival by betraying Remata'Klan and his fellow Jem'Hadar, sending them into a deadly trap.
Text: Half of all [Univ] personnel in Away Team (random selection, round down) are killed (erased if [Holo]). To get past requires two leaders OR two [Cmd] OR two [Def].

Name: Dramatis Personae
Lore: Saltah'na energy spheres caused the crew of DS9 to play out an ancient power struggle: scheming, maneuvering, and plotting to eliminate their former friends.
Text: Stops all personnel in crew or Away Team named in lore by another personnel present. Discard dilemma.

Name: Maquis Vendetta
Lore: As hard to catch as a Norpin falcon, crafty and cunning Maquis leader Michael Eddington was able to stay one step ahead of the dogged pursuit of his former commanding officer.
Text: To get past, "stop" a Leadership personnel (random selection). If that personnel has OFFICER or SECURITY, randomly select two additional personnel to be "stopped."

Name: Protestations of Innocence
Lore: After years of conflict and military aggression, colonists near the Cardassian-Federation border often doubted the sincerity of Cardassian negotiators.
Text: To get past requires INTEGRITY>28 (INTEGRITY>42 if you initiated battle this game; INTEGRITY>63 if you voluntarily initiated battle).

Name: Recurring Injury
Lore: While playing to maintain his darts winning streak at Quark's, Miles O'Brien aggravated an old kayaking injury, necessitating shoulder surgery and forfeiting his darts game.
Text: To get past, one personnel with Biology OR MEDICAL (opponent's choice) must be "stopped." Nullify with a personnel who has either 2 Biology OR 3 MEDICAL.

Name: Sabotaged Plasma Conduit
Lore: To resist her Maquis captors, Kira Nerys blew out two plasma conduits, forcing the U.S.S. Defiant to seek refuge in a nebula until the cloaking device could be repaired.
Text: To get past requires 2 Computer Skill and Physics OR Computer Skill and 2 Physics.

Name: Scapegoat
Lore: To avoid escalating violence between Cardassian and Federation settlers, Cardassian Central Command blamed Gul Dukat for supplying weapons to the Demilitarized Zone.
Text: One personnel (random selection) is killed unless you "stop" a personnel with V.I.P. or Anthropology. To get past requires INTEGRITY>24 remaining.

Name: Unscheduled "Assistance"
Lore: The unexpected arrival of a Klingon fleet to defend DS9 against the changeling threat led to issues with docking schedules, shore leave, and unauthorized "inspections."
Text: Opponent chooses two locations. To get past requires CUNNING>X, where X=15 times the number of your ships at those locations.

Name: Determined to Stay
Lore: Many colonists living in the Demilitarized Zone refused to abandon the worlds they had made their homes, despite pressure from the Federation and Cardassian governments.
Text: Plays on your unattempted Demilitarized Zone Region mission. When your [Maq] personnel solve, if no opposing ship is at this mission, you may draw up to five cards.

Name: Organized Terrorist Activities
Lore: In 2370, the Maquis blew up the Cardassian freighter Bok'Nor to prevent the transportation of additional weapons to Cardassian colonists in the Demilitarized Zone.
Text: Plays if you have eight [DS9][Maq] personnel in play. Damage an undamaged ship in (or adjacent to) a region (once per game per Ship card title). Discard event.

Name: Bleed Resources
Text: Plays on your [Maq], [TNG][Rom], or [DS9][Car] personnel. When this personnel helps solve a mission, you may choose one: Examine opponent's hand and choose two of those cards to be discarded OR Opponent places three cards (random selection) from hand on top of his or her draw deck OR Opponent discards the top four cards of his or her draw deck.

Name: Defending Their Homes
Text: Plays on table; you may download {They Call Themselves the Maquis}. Once each turn, one [TNG][Maq] personnel may report for free OR you may download {For the Cause} to your Demilitarized Zone Region mission. Discard if you have {a Treaty} in play.

Name: Learning Curve
Text: Plays on table. At the end of each of your turns, if you played two or more [Maq] personnel this turn, you may place two cards from the top of your draw deck face down on this incident. You may play [Maq] cards from this incident as though they were in your hand. At any time, you may place this card and each card atop it beneath your draw deck to draw that many cards. (Unique.)

Name: Not So Demilitarized
Text: Plays on table; you may download {They Call Themselves the Maquis}. Once each turn, while all your facilities are [Maq], one [DS9][Maq] personnel may report for free OR you may download {For the Cause} to your Badlands or Demilitarized Zone Region mission. You may not play {Espionage} cards.

Name: They Call Themselves the Maquis
Text: Seeds or plays on table; you may download {The Art of Diplomacy}. Your [Maq] cards may mix and, if ever attacked, have no affiliation attack restrictions. Your [Maq] ships are immune to {Navigate Plasma Storms}. Your equipment, [Maq] personnel, and [Maq] ships may report to your {Liberty} or to a Badlands or Demilitarized Zone Region [P] mission; once each turn, one such unique personnel may do so for free.

Name: Used to Being Outnumbered
Requires: Badlands Region; Condor Class; Demilitarized Zone Region;
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Condor-class ships may be used by [Baj] or [Fed]. In the Badlands or Demilitarized Zone Regions, opponent's ATTACK total must be more than double your Condor-class ship's DEFENSE total to score a hit, and more than triple to score a direct hit. While your Condor-class ship is moving within a region, it is RANGE +2.

Name: You Could Be Invaluable
Text: Seeds or plays on table. At the start of a mission attempt involving only your [DS9][Maq] personnel, you may reveal the top card of opponent's draw deck. If it is a personnel neither player has in play, opponent reports them to your attempting crew or Away Team (under your control; they gain [Maq]). Return personnel to opponent's hand (if still in play) at end of mission attempt. (Unique.)

Name: Stalling for Time
Lore: Ro Laren was able to maintain Jean-Luc Picard's confidence in her loyalty just long enough to conceal her defection to the Maquis and help her new allies evade Starfleet's trap.
Text: Plays once each turn on any location if you have three [TNG][Maq] personnel in play. Opponent chooses one of their personnel here to return to hand.

Name: Break Prisoner
Characteristics/ Keywords: Asymmetric mission; Badlands Region; Capturing-related card;
Lore: Interrogate captured officer at secret base.
Text: SECURITY x2 + Treachery x2 + Biology + CUNNING>30 *+10 if your escorted captive here. Opponent's side: No gametext. Points: [35]

Name: Divert Attention
Lore: Distract adversary to allow equipment theft.
Text: Navigation x2 + Leadership + Treachery + CUNNING>36 Span -2 for [Maq] ships.

Name: Expose Secret Buildup
Lore: Reveal military construction at unsanctioned facility.
Text: Computer Skill + Leadership + Physics + SECURITY + (any Intelligence x2 OR CUNNING>37)

Name: Supply Terrorists
Lore: Broker sale of biogenic storage containers.
Text: Diplomacy + SECURITY + Acquisition + CUNNING>36

Name: For the Cause
Text: Plays on your Badlands or Demilitarized Zone Region mission. Your [Maq] personnel may attempt this mission and may replace all levels of one requirement with: Leadership + SECURITY + CUNNING>30

Name: The Only Way Home
Text: Seeds on table. When your [Maq] personnel solve a [DQ][P] mission, relocate your [Maq] personnel to your [Maq] ship there, then relocate ship to any Alpha Quadrant mission. For the rest of the game, your [Non][DQ] personnel are attributes all +2 and may report to your [Maq] ships.

Name: Bill Samuels
Lore: Maquis saboteur William Patrick Samuels was a farmer from Volan II. Covertly planted a protomatter implosion device aboard the Bok'Nor.
Text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Treachery DL/ {Organized Terrorist Activities}

Name: Brathaw
Lore: Male Bolian engineer. Helped smuggle goods to the Maquis. First officer who often commanded the freighter S.S. Xhosa in Kasidy Yates' absence.
Text: ENGINEER Acquisition Astrophysics Computer Skill Smuggling

Name: Cal Hudson
Lore: Starfleet's attach to the Federation's Demilitarized Zone colonies. Friend of Benjamin Sisko. Widower who found new purpose as leader of a Maquis cell.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership Navigation Treachery Law Smuggling

Name: George Sanders
Lore: Captain dispatched to apprehend Michael Eddington. Asked Benjamin Sisko to save him a seat at Eddington's court-martial. Calls San Francisco home.
Text: OFFICER Leadership SECURITY Honor Allows your cards here to initiate battle against [Maq].

Name: Kalita (The Maquis)
Lore: Typical pilot in Macias' Maquis cell. Suspicious of everyone at first, but impressed by Ro Laren during a supply raid. Later worked with Thomas Riker.
Text: OFFICER Astrophysics Biology Navigation

Name: Kasidy Yates (The Maquis)
Lore: Conflicted captain romantically involved with Benjamin Sisko. Served prison time for transporting medical supplies to the Maquis.
Text: ENGINEER Leadership Navigation x 2 Transporter Skill Each other [Maq] personnel present is STRENGTH +2.

Name: Kobb
Lore: Representative of female colonists living on Volan III in 2370. Skilled administrator and colonial leader. Unlucky in love.
Text: SCIENCE Diplomacy Law Leadership

Name: Macias
Lore: Grizzled leader of a Maquis cell. Former resident of Juhraya. Trusted Ro Laren despite Kalita's caution. Knows someone will take his place. Likes hasperat.
Text: CIVILIAN Leadership MEDICAL Exobiology May exchange for a [Maq] personnel in your discard pile.

Name: M'vil
Lore: One of many Klingons seeking glory outside the Klingon Empire. She sympathized with the grievances of the Maquis.
Text: MEDICAL Archaeology Stellar Cartography Biology

Name: Niles
Lore: Pilot and security officer typical of those who secretly support the Maquis. Captured Gul Dukat on Deep Space 9 on Cal Hudson's orders. Drinks lattes.
Text: SECURITY Navigation Transporter Skill Treachery

Name: Quark (The Maquis)
Lore: Intriguing Ferengi eager to please Sakonna. Became a temporary arms dealer to the Maquis.
Text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Diplomacy Computer Skill If present with [Maq] Treachery, gains SECURITY, Computer Skill, Smuggling, and Biology.

Name: Rebecca Sullivan
Lore: Resistance fighter. One of the few Maquis to survive Jem'Hadar attacks in 2373. Wife of Michael Eddington. Bluffed about a cloaked missile strike.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Honor Music Astrophysics Geology

Name: Reide
Lore: Demilitarized Zone colonist typical of those who joined the Maquis. Enjoys fishing. Believes his family has bad luck.
Text: CIVILIAN Diplomacy Exobiology Physics

Name: Ro Laren (The Maquis)
Lore: Maquis sympathizer and Bajoran officer aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Found a new father figure in Macias. Betrayed Jean-Luc Picard's trust in her.
Text: SECURITY Navigation Leadership Computer Skill Treachery DL/ {Bleed Resources}

Name: Santos
Lore: Freedom fighter who kidnapped and then recruited Ro Laren into the Maquis. Led his squadron in an attack on a Yridian convoy. Friend of Macias.
Text: CIVILIAN Leadership MEDICAL Navigation Transporter Skill Treachery

Name: Sark
Lore: One of many colonists living on Volan III in the Demilitarized Zone. Bolian member of Cal Hudson's Maquis cell. He helped plan Dukat's kidnapping.
Text: SCIENCE Exobiology Transporter Skill

Name: Shankar
Lore: Maquis soldier always prepared to defend against Cardassian attacks. Assigned by Amaros to stand guard over Dukat after the Gul's abduction.
Text: OFFICER Archaeology Biology Geology Treachery DL/ Any phaser or disruptor

Name: Tabor (The Maquis)
Lore: Apoplectic Bajoran haunted by the screams of Crell Moset's victims. Chakotay helped him focus his rage. Skilled holoprogrammer. Friend of Jor.
Text: ENGINEER Physics SCIENCE Computer Skill X=3 if six or more personnel in your discard pile.

Name: Tamal
Lore: Technician and former petty officer aboard the U.S.S. Gandhi. Recruited into the Maquis by Thomas Riker. Enjoys studying early Earth warp technology.
Text: ENGINEER Anthropology SCIENCE Geology

Name: Thomas Riker (The Maquis)
Lore: Defiant leader and starship thief. Posed as William T. Riker. Commanded the Stolen Defiant on raids in Cardassian space. Resents his transporter double.
Text: OFFICER Geology Leadership SECURITY Treachery Music DL/ {Commandeer Ship}

Name: Tom Paris (The Maquis)
Lore: Starfleet observer who helped U.S.S. Voyager track his former Maquis comrades in the Badlands. Talented pilot. Has a mercenary spirit.
Text: SCIENCE Navigation x 2 Geology Biology Draw a card if stopped by an opponent's dilemma.

Name: Tuvok (The Maquis)
Lore: Undercover Vulcan who infiltrated Chakotay's Maquis cell. Former archery teacher at the Vulcan Institute for Defensive Arts. Has three sons and a daughter.
Text: SECURITY SCIENCE Navigation OFFICER Mindmeld DL/ {Learning Curve}

Name: Cosette
Lore: Commanded by Ro Laren under the watchful eye of Kalita. Participated in the theft of medical supplies from the U.S.S. Enterprise in 2370.
Text: Attributes all +2 in Demilitarized Zone Region.

Name: Guingouin
Lore: Maquis raider commanded by Michael Eddington in retaliatory strikes against Cardassian colonies. Uses many components salvaged from ambushed ships.
Text: Once each turn, may land or take off using 1 RANGE.

Name: Maquis Raider
Lore: Versatile class of ship designed early in the 24th century by the Federation. Crew complement can vary widely.
Text: Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard).

Name: S.S. Xhosa
Lore: Independent freighter commanded by Kasidy Yates. Operated under contract for Bajor's Ministry of Commerce in 2372. Smuggled Maquis supplies.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Stolen Defiant
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Federation ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: The U.S.S. Defiant was commandeered by the Maquis in 2371 to attack Cardassian forces.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam WEAPONS and SHIELDS +3 vs. [Car].

Name: Val Jean
Lore: 30-year old vessel commanded by Captain Chakotay. Like many Maquis ships, has borne many names. Also known as the Liberty.
Text: Attributes all +2 in Badlands Region.

Name: Close Quarters Combat
Requires: Badlands Region; Condor Class; Demilitarized Zone Region;
Text: Attack: 0. Defense: 2. ATTACK and DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a Condor-class ship firing in Demilitarized Zone or Badlands Region. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip] Hull: -20% Airlock Malfunction: until end of your next full turn, no free reporting aboard.

Name: Quantum Incursions
Text: Seeds like a [S/P] dilemma. QR Code

Name: Crossover: An Invitation
Lore: In 2372, the Terran Rebellion kidnapped Jake Sisko from Deep Space 9, knowing that Benjamin Sisko would promptly pursue his son to the mirror universe.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, your personnel native to the Alpha Quadrant may report (but not download) as if they were [MQ].

Name: Leader of the Sect
Lore: A factionalized society, Kazon sects rely on the strong and dominant leadership of their Maje. Weakness is never tolerated.
Text: Seeds on your [Kaz] facility. At the start of any player's turn, if you do not have a Maje in play, you may download a Maje here.

Name: Starbase 247
Lore: Federation starbase commanded by Fleet Admiral Shanthi in 2370, where she conducted an inquiry into the U.S.S. Pegasus affair.
Text: Seeds at any [FED][S] mission. DL/ {You Know I'd Like to Help}

Name: Holoprogram: Cafe des Artistes
Text: Seeds or plays on your ship or facility with a Holodeck. Once each turn, you may stop your couple present to draw a card. Once per game, you may download a romantic partner of your personnel present, then discard incident. (Unique.)

Name: Investigate Anti-Time Eruption
Lore: Analyze anomaly in politically delicate location.
Text: ENGINEER x3 + Leadership x3 + Astrophysics x3 + Physics x3

Name: Commodore Decker
Lore: Matt Decker commanded the Starship Constellation. Vowed revenge on the machine that killed his crew. Father of Willard Decker. Dislikes practical jokes.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Exobiology ENGINEER SECURITY

Name: Frederick La Rouque
Lore: Professional gambler on late 19th century Earth. Always looking for an easy mark. French-speaking native of New Orleans. Fond of the waltz.
Text: V.I.P. Greed x 2 Treachery Worth points if he is most CUNNING Greed in play.

Name: Gannet Brooks
Lore: Starfleet Intelligence agent. Posed as a reporter to investigate xenophobic organization Terra Prime. Romantically involved with Travis Mayweather.
Text: CIVILIAN Anthropology Diplomacy Computer Skill SECURITY Biology Treachery

Name: General Korok
Lore: Klingon warrior whose recessive gene allowed him to access Unimatrix Zero. Fought to free himself and his fellow Borg. Known as Six of Ten by his hive.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Navigation Stellar Cartography

Name: Kell Perim
Lore: Trill serving on the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Operations officer during the battle with Son'a warships in the Briar Patch in 2375. Not joined with a symbiont.
Text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Navigation SCIENCE While on your ship, it is RANGE +1 in the Briar Patch Region.

Name: Lwaxana Troi (20th Anniversary)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Betazoid; Ambassador; Deep Space 9-related personnel; Female;
Lore: Female Betazoid ambassador who visited DS9 several times. Suffered the effects of Zanthi fever in 2371. Romantically involved with Jeyal and Odo.
Text: V.I.P. Empathy x 2 Diplomacy Honor DL/ {Odo} (even from your discard pile).

Name: Orderly Mavek
Lore: Typical Tilonian nurse created by Suna as part of a brainwashing scenario. Appeared to enjoy the torment he inflicted on the occupants of Ward 47.
Text: MEDICAL Computer Skill Music DL/ {Frame of Mind} (as an Event, targeting an opposing personnel).

Name: Rak'tazan
Characteristics/ Keywords: Jem'Hadar; Male; Support Personnel; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Jem'Hadar Sixth representative of soldiers stationed aboard Terok Nor during the Dominion occupation of 2374. Struggled to decipher Cardassian egotism.
Text: OFFICER Stellar Cartography Astrophysics

Name: Worf (20th Anniversary)
Lore: Klingon strategic operations officer aboard DS9. Often commanded the U.S.S. Defiant. Romantically involved with Jadzia Dax. Likes prune juice.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Honor x 2 Diplomacy SECURITY Doubles DEFENSE bonus of your Tactic (if involved).

Name: My Ship, My Crew
Lore: I suppose you're worried about your fish, too.
Text: Opponent names a classification. You choose: randomly select a personnel in crew or Away Team with that classification (if any) to be "stopped" OR randomly select three personnel in crew or Away Team without that classification to be "stopped". (May also be seeded as [S/P] .)

Name: U.S.S. Enterprise (20th Anniversary)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation ship; Ferengi ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Federation starship claimed under Ferengi Salvage Code. Captained by Lurin. A mysterious machine.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Enterprise-E (20th Anniversary)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Borg ship; Federation ship; Holodeck; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Identification: FEDERATION SOVEREIGN-CLASS Task: Prevent first contact between humans and Vulcans in 2063. Borg Queen commands.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam. May report to {Earth}. DL/ {Borg Queen}

Name: Close Call
Lore: To outrun the reflexes and agility of his Jem'Hadar captors, Miles O'Brien used the even swifter response time of a transporter's energizing coil.
Text: One personnel present (random selection) is killed if that personnel does not have Computer Skill or Transporter Skill. To get past requires 2 Diplomacy OR 3 SECURITY remaining.

Name: Incentive-Based Economics
Lore: To obtain a rare gift for his father, Jake Sisko and his friend Nog bartered, swapped favors, stole a teddy bear, and even negotiated with Weyoun.
Text: To get past requires Honor and no SECURITY OR CIVILIAN, Anthropology, Diplomacy, Youth, and a personnel with STRENGTH<8.

Name: Inter Arma Enim Silent Leges
Lore: Section 31 went to great lengths to ensure their mole Koval gained a seat on the praetor's Continuing Committee over rival Senator Cretak.
Text: To get past requires V.I.P. and no Treachery OR SECURITY, Exobiology, Computer Skill, and a personnel with INTEGRITY<5.

Name: Nanobiogenic Fugitives
Lore: On the run after a Kellerun attempt to wipe out all knowledge of the harvester virus, Bashir and O'Brien had to repair an old communications system to signal for rescue.
Text: Choose two personnel with ENGINEER (or one personnel with Physics) to be stopped. To get past requires 2 Computer Skill and Physics remaining.

Name: Subspace Accident
Lore: Benjamin Sisko became trapped outside the normal flow of time after an accident caused by the 2372 subspace inversion of the Bajoran Wormhole.
Text: Unless 3 Astrophysics OR 2 Physics and 2 SCIENCE present, personnel with most [*] icons is held with dilemma atop mission. Discard both at end of your next turn.

Name: The New Resistance
Lore: Undermining the new administration of Terok Nor required careful planning, inside information, playing dumb, and plying Damar with kanar.
Text: To get past requires Honor and no OFFICER OR Diplomacy, Leadership, Computer Skill, V.I.P., and a personnel with CUNNING<7.

Name: Underestimating the Founders
Lore: Although Enabran Tain was presumed dead after the failed attack on the Great Link, the spymaster was in fact captured by Dominion forces.
Text: One non-[Holo] personnel is captured (your choice if opponent currently has a captive; otherwise, random selection). Nullify with any 3 Intelligence.

Name: A Better Alternative
Lore: Appealing to Odo's sense of order and justice, Gul Dukat had the changeling investigate the chemist shop murder to avoid executing ten Bajorans at random as reprisal.
Text: Plays on table. Once each turn, may discard a unique non-[Bor] card from hand to draw a card. If the discarded card was a site or a [DS9] [Car] card, draw two additional cards.

Name: Mutual Distrust
Lore: Despite their alliance to destroy the Founders, Tal Shiar and Obsidian Order agents did not trust one another. Watching for signs of betrayal kept them at peak efficiency.
Text: Plays on your personnel (limit one each); target their Intelligence. Once each turn, when you play a personnel with different Intelligence, draw a card. (Cumulative.)

Name: Dosi Trading Post
Lore: Center of enterprise for the Dosi, other Gamma Quadrant citizens, and their associates.
Text: Seeds on {Dosi planet}. Your personnel with Greed or Acquisition, and your Karemma and Dosi personnel, may report here (for free, once each turn).

Name: Internment Camp 371
Lore: Detention and interrogation facility for high-profile prisoners. Commanded by Deyos.
Text: Seeds at {Asteroid Camp}. Has a Brig. Once each turn, you may play a personnel with "Internment Camp 371" in lore for free here. DL/ {Training Ring}

Name: Cross-Quadrant Expansion
Text: Seeds or plays on any facility in the Alpha Quadrant. Just after your [DS9] personnel reports here, you may relocate that personnel to your ship with two or more staffing icons at a Gamma Quadrant location. At the end of each turn, if you have a matching ship at a Gamma Quadrant location, you may draw an extra card. Discard incident if you have a Dominion treaty in play or if you seeded a mission in the Bajor region.

Name: Dominion Hierarchy
Text: Plays on your Founder; once each turn, Dominion Hierarchy plays for free. OR Plays on your Vorta present with a Founder and Jem'Hadar to make that Vorta attributes all +2 and gain a skill of your choice until end of turn, then discard incident. OR Seeds or plays on your [Dom] facility. You may suspend play while you download {Jem'Hadar Sacrifice} or {Security Sacrifice}, then discard incident.

Name: Holographic Communicator
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Just after you report a [DS9] ship with at least one [Cmd] or [Stf] staffing icon to your Alpha Quadrant facility, you may place this incident on that ship. This ship, and all your other ships of the same class, add Holodeck. If ship is destroyed, return incident to table.

Name: Holographic Settlement
Text: Seeds or plays on {Yaderan colony}. [Holo] cards may exist on this planet (and report activated). Your {Rurigan} and your [DS9] [Holo] personnel may report here; once each turn, one such personnel may do so for free if [GQ]. Whenever a [Holo] personnel on a planet is deactivated, it must be returned to its owner's hand (limit once each turn) or placed beneath owner's draw deck.

Name: Joint Operation
Text: Plays on table; you may download {Treaty: Romulan/Cardassian}. Your [DS9][Car] (except [MQ]) and [DS9][Rom] personnel may report to your ship in the {Orias System}. Once each turn, your [DS9][Car] or [DS9][Rom] personnel with any Intelligence may report for free OR nullify {Homefront} where present.

Name: Reward from the Founders
Text: Plays on table. You may report only one Jem'Hadar each turn. Once each turn, you may play a [DS9] Vorta for free, then draw a card if you do not have {Dominion War Efforts} in play. Twice per game, you may download {Ketracel-White} to your Vorta present with your Jem'Hadar. Discard incident if you voluntarily initiate a personnel battle with more than 2 of your Jem'Hadar.

Name: Where Opportunities Are Made
Text: Seeds or plays on your [Fer] facility in the Alpha Quadrant. While your [DS9][Fer] ship is at a Gamma Quadrant location, your [DS9][Fer] cards may mix and cooperate with your Dosi, Karemma, [Dom] ships, and [Dom] facilities; your [DS9][Fer] personnel may report as if [GQ] and may report to {Dosi Trading Post} (as if Dosi). Once per game, you may download {Cross-Quadrant Expansion} to this facility.

Name: Sucking Up to the Boss
Lore: Benjamin Sisko exploited Ferengi loyalty to the Grand Nagus, forcing Quark to use his contacts with the Karemma to help Starfleet's search for the Founders.
Text: Plays once each turn on your [DS9][Fer] personnel. Name a skill. For the rest of turn, while facing a dilemma with your 3 Acquisition present, personnel gains that skill.

Name: Establish Medical Complex
Lore: Build facility for wounded Romulans in allied government territory.
Text: ENGINEER x3 + MEDICAL + SECURITY + CUNNING>35 When you solve, may download {Romulan Outpost} here.

Name: Expand Karemman Operations
Lore: Source new land to increase fleece production and trade potential.
Text: Geology + Leadership + SCIENCE + (Greed x2 OR CUNNING>40)

Name: Further Tulaberry Talks
Lore: Attend Karemma conference hosted by the Dosi to coordinate distribution.
Text: Diplomacy + CUNNING>36 + (Acquisition x2 OR Treachery + Greed)

Name: Internment Operations
Lore: Secure internees and key infiltration targets captured from the Alpha Quadrant.
Text: Treachery x2 + SECURITY x2 + Leadership + Vorta + STRENGTH>40 Opponent's side: [fed][kli][rom] ENGINEER x2 + Computer Skill x2 + Honor + INTEGRITY>40

Name: Investigate Omicron Particles
Affil: Any Away Team may attempt mission.
Lore: Determine source of unusual particle field.
Text: Computer Skill + (3 {[Holo] Personnel} OR {Jadzia Dax}) When seeded, you may download {Holographic Settlement}.

Name: Probe Alpha Quadrant System
Lore: Gather information about distant areas of the galaxy.
Text: Navigation + Stellar Cartography + (Vorta OR Dosi OR Diplomacy x2)

Name: Combined Strike
Text: Plays on your [GQ] mission (for free if [CAR] or [ROM]). Your personnel may report here, to your matching Intelligence personnel aboard your ship native to the Alpha Quadrant. When solved by your non-[GQ] personnel, draw up to 5 cards, then discard objective to score points; if opponent has a [GQ][Dom] facility, you may download {Combined Strike}.

Name: Disguise Encroachment
Text: Plays on your unsolved mission. If at {Derna} or a mission where you have no facility, you may immediately report a [Rom] Treachery personnel here. Once solved, if opponent subsequently solves (or has solved) a mission that is adjacent or in the same region, score points; opponent loses points (discard objective).

Name: Training Ring
Text: Plays on your facility with a Brig. Once each turn, you may target a captive in that Brig; then randomly select your Jem'Hadar or SECURITY personnel present. If your selected personnel has higher printed STRENGTH than captive, place captive in point area; he or she is worth X points, where X = printed STRENGTH of targeted captive.

Name: Administrator Kilana
Lore: Prior to contact with the Alpha Quadrant, the female Vorta Kilana mapped transport and patrol routes.
Text: V.I.P. ENGINEER Leadership Archaeology Stellar Cartography x 2 Once per game, may download {Dominion Hierarchy}.

Name: Administrator Weyoun
Lore: Stalwartly loyal Vorta. Third incarnation of Weyoun. Dutifully directed the destruction of the New Bajor colony in 2370, as ordered by the Founders.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Computer Skill Law Navigation Stellar Cartography

Name: Amar'itak
Lore: Sixth under Ikat'ika. One of many Jem'Hadar guards at Internment Camp 371. Grew to respect Klingons after seeing Worf's endurance in combat.
Text: SECURITY Geology Astrophysics ENGINEER

Name: Colyus
Lore: Village protector investigating recent disappearances but unable to produce results. Unaware that he, and his cloak, are holograms.
Text: SECURITY Law Leadership SECURITY Other [GQ][Non] personnel present are attributes all +1.

Name: Croden
Lore: Inexperienced Rakhari thief who spoke out against his government. Moved to Vulcan with his daughter, Yareth. Carries a morphogenic locket.
Text: CIVILIAN Navigation Biology Stellar Cartography Honor Greed

Name: Enabran Tain (The Gamma Quadrant)
Lore: Retired mastermind planning a dramatic comeback. Working with the Tal Shiar and his fellow Cardassians to destroy the Founders. Mentored Elim Garak.
Text: V.I.P. Obsidian Order Tal Shiar Treachery x 2 SECURITY DL/ {Combined Strike}

Name: Guna'shan
Lore: Typical Jem'Hadar Second aboard Weyoun's Warship. Assisted Weyoun during his encounter with Jake Sisko, Nog, and Elias Giger in 2373.
Text: OFFICER Geology Physics

Name: Jiten'parekh
Characteristics/ Keywords: Jem'Hadar; Ambassador; Bodyguard; Internment Camp 371-related personnel; Jem'Hadar First; Male;
Lore: Jem'Hadar First present at Alpha Quadrant armistice signing; later ambassador to Qo'noS. Former bodyguard at Internment Camp 371.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Transporter Skill Leadership Stellar Cartography SECURITY

Name: Laas
Lore: Changeling of great ability. One of the Hundred sent by the Founders to explore the galaxy. Dislikes monoforms. Linked with Odo. Occasionally fiery.
Text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Physics Exobiology x 2 May report where your changeling is present (for free).

Name: Merruk
Lore: Representative of holograms unaware of their projected nature. Physician and scientist of his small community. Has few patients.
Text: SCIENCE Anthropology MEDICAL Physics

Name: Pimoo
Lore: Typical Dosi bureaucrat. Assigned to audit off-world trade. She specializes in Alpha Quadrant transaction. Formerly first officer on a Dosi Trade Vessel.
Text: OFFICER Anthropology Transporter Skill Computer Skill

Name: Prosar
Lore: Typical Ferengi trade route manager. Secretly an informant for the FCA. He visited DS9 in 2370 to observe the wormhole. Played tongo at Quark's.
Text: CIVILIAN Astrophysics FCA Youth Stellar Cartography

Name: Quark (The Gamma Quadrant)
Lore: Ferengi bartender and trade envoy of Grand Nagus Zek. Assigned to negotiate with the Dominion. Oblivious to Pel's romantic intentions toward him.
Text: CIVILIAN ENGINEER Navigation Acquisition Anthropology Computer Skill If in [GQ]: May serve as Nagus.

Name: Retana'var
Lore: Typical Jem'Hadar Fourth, assigned as a bodyguard on the Founders' homeworld. Assisted Science Advisor Borath with maintenance of his equipment.
Text: OFFICER Honor ENGINEER

Name: Rurigan
Lore: Yaderan chased off his homeworld by the Dominion. Holographically recreated it and its inhabitants on another planet. Very fond of his creations.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill x 3 Honor Anthropology

Name: Science Advisor Borath
Lore: Prior to the invasion of the Alpha Quadrant, the male Vorta Borath oversaw the Dominion research and development divisions.
Text: V.I.P. SCIENCE Exobiology Physics Biology Astrophysics Leadership DL/ {Internment}

Name: Selan
Lore: Typical Romulan scientist serving the Tal Shiar. He programmed an optimal bombardment dispersal pattern to destroy the Founders.
Text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Tal Shiar

Name: Taya
Lore: Yaderan "granddaughter" of Rurigan's imagination. Hologram who bonded with the changeling Odo. Almost ventured too far from the village.
Text: CIVILIAN Youth Geology Archaeology Honor DL/ {Any Odo} OR any [GQ][Non] personnel.

Name: Turo
Lore: Cardassian posted aboard the Serrola as a liaison to the Romulans. Typical transporter forensics specialist. Glinn later interned by the Dominion.
Text: MEDICAL Obsidian Order Transporter Skill

Name: Varen'agor
Lore: Jem'Hadar Third previously assigned to the Dominion relay station on Callinon VII. Administrator Kilana's pilot on several key missions.
Text: OFFICER Biology Navigation Physics

Name: Dosi Trade Vessel
Characteristics/ Keywords: Dominion ship; Ship with a Skill; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Standard commerce ship used by the Dosi. Uses a hull design similar to the ships of the Karemma, but equipped with better weaponry.
Text: Tractor Beam, Acquisition May report to {Dosi planet}.

Name: Ferengi Freighter
Characteristics/ Keywords: D'Kora-Class; Ferengi ship; Freighter; Tractor Beam; Transport;
