Text: If any [Bor] ship or {Borg Ship} dilemma is on this spaceline, opponent (even if playing Borg) scores points (once per game), and you may relocate one such card up to 20 span away from its current location on same spaceline.

Name: Futile Attempt
Lore: If you're attempting to embarrass me, you won't succeed.
Text: Reveal the top card of your draw deck. If it is a personnel, it is placed beneath draw deck; opponent scores 1 point for each [*] and you lose 2 points for each DL/ . May be nullified by {any Seven of Nine}.

Name: I Will Not Promise...
Lore: ...never to appear again.
Text: If played during a Q-Flash: Opponent may end current Q-Flash now (no more [Q] cards are drawn) and immediately seed this interrupt beneath any other mission like a [S/P] dilemma. If encountered seeded beneath a mission: Crew or Away team has a Q-Flash with three [Q] cards.

Name: Hello Computer?
Lore: Any technology, if sufficiently advanced, seems indistinguishable from magic. Obsolete machinery, however, also poses certain challenges. "Just use the keyboard."
Text: Unless Archaeology, Physics, and Computer Skill present, place on table. All your personnel are attributes all -2.

Name: Nuclear Wessels
Lore: Searching in an unfamiliar environment can be challenging. Commander Uhura and Commander Chekov struggled to locate a naval base in ancient San Francisco.
Text: Place on planet. Now and start of each attempt here, cannot get past unless one SECURITY OR Anthropology is stopped (random selection). (Unique.)

Name: Slingshot Effect
Text: Seeds on table. Your [AU][Films] personnel, ships and facilities (and [AU] cards of other card types) may seed and play. Once each turn, your [Films] ship may time travel between a time location and its corresponding spaceline location. {Temporal Investigations} is nullified.

Name: Earth Spacedock
Lore: Large starship service facility commanded by Fleet Admiral Morrow. On a clear night, visible from Earth.
Text: Seeds at a [FED] Sector 001 mission; you may not play cards to {Camp Khitomer}. Once each turn, if all your personnel are [Films], one [Fed][Films] personnel may play for free here.

Name: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
Text: Seeds on {The Great Hall}. Once each turn, your [Kli][Films] personnel reporting here may do so for free. You may play personnel for free only at {Qo'noS}. In place of your normal card draw, you may download to hand one [Films] personnel with "High Council" in lore OR on {HQ} card.

Name: Take Us Out!
Lore: The late 23rd century saw many scientific and technological advancements. New ships were launched and older ships refurbished, each one worthy of celebration.
Text: Seeds on table. If all your ships in play are [Films], they are RANGE and SHIELDS +2 while uncloaked. Nullified if you have in play both {Camp Khitomer} and {a headquarters}.

Name: The Undiscovered Country
Text: Seeds on table. While all your personnel in play are [Films], you may draw an extra card at the end of your turn. Once per game, in place of your normal card play, you may nullify {Homefront}. Nullified if you have in play both {Camp Khitomer} and {a headquarters}.

Name: We Surrender!
Lore: To avoid instigating full scale war on the eve of universal peace, Captain Kirk ordered his crew to yield to the Klingon flagship.
Text: Plays at start of a battle opponent initiated against your card. Cancels and prevents battles there. Up to two of your personnel involved (opponent's choice) are captured.

Name: Overhaul Starship Systems
Lore: Enhance, repair, and upgrade vessel to latest specifications.
Text: ENGINEER x2 + 6 {[Films] personnel}

Name: GIVE ME GENESIS!
Text: Seeds on any [FED][P] mission that requires SCIENCE OR Geology. No player may use {The Genesis Device} on a mission they seeded. In place of your normal card play, you may download {Kruge} here; lose 5 points. When you solve mission, you may download The Genesis Device here. (Unique.)

Name: Reserve Activation Clause
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, just after the end of a mission attempt, you may "retire" one [Fed][Films] personnel who was involved in that attempt when it ended (place atop objective; in play for uniqueness only) and play a different [Films] personnel there (from hand) instead. Once per game, you may play one personnel from here to your crew or Away Team.

Name: Admiral S'rrel
Lore: Typical Caitian diplomat and ambassador serving in Starfleet. Mentor to Lt. M'Ress. Attended the inquiry following the controversial events at Genesis.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Stellar Cartography Geology MEDICAL (if all your personnel present are [Films]).

Name: Bill Toddman
Lore: Fleet admiral and Chief in Command in 2293. Agreed to open negotiations with the Klingon Empire.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy SECURITY Biology If all your personnel are [Films], your [Fed] leaders may play as if Admirals.

Name: Bob Bennett
Lore: Starfleet Chief of Staff. Admiral who sent the U.S.S. Enterprise-A to Nimbus III. Helped write and produce leadership textbooks used at Starfleet Academy.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Archaeology ENGINEER Transporter Skill (if all your personnel present are [Films]).

Name: Brask
Lore: Typical reserve gunner serving in the Klingon Defense Force. Expert marksman. Understood Kruge's order to only target the engines of the Starship Enterprise.
Text: SECURITY Transporter Skill Treachery Greed DL/ {Target Engines}

Name: Captain Alexander
Lore: Decorated Starfleet captain. She commanded the Starship Saratoga in 2286 when it encountered the whale probe. Previously served under Admiral Kirk.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy SECURITY Stellar Cartography Anthropology (if all your personnel present are [Films]).

Name: Captain Kirk (Second Star to the Right)
Lore: Demoted admiral who became captain of the U.S.S. Enterprise-A. Father of David Marcus. His efforts at Khitomer helped build an alliance with the Klingons.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Anthropology Honor Diplomacy Protects all treaties from nullification. DL/ {We Surrender!}

Name: Commander Sonak
Lore: Typical Vulcan science officer. Newly appointed to the refitted Starship Enterprise. He expressed gratitude to Admiral Kirk for the assignment.
Text: SCIENCE Computer Skill Anthropology Mindmeld ENGINEER (if all your personnel present are [Films]).

Name: Fleet Admiral Morrow
Lore: High-ranking admiral who succeeded Admiral Nogura. He commissioned the failed transwarp drive project and tried to decommission the Starship Enterprise.
Text: V.I.P. ENGINEER Diplomacy Physics Once per game, may return your ship here to hand.

Name: Frexor
Lore: One of many Klingon technicians serving in the Klingon Defense Force. Beamed down to Genesis with Kruge and Regnor to investigate the planet.
Text: SCIENCE Navigation Biology ENGINEER (if all your personnel present are [Films]).

Name: Garvock
Lore: Typical Klingon soldier aboard the I.K.S. Chontay. He escorted Captain Kirk to the bridge after beaming up from Sha Ka Ree. Collects antique d'k tahgs.
Text: SECURITY Archaeology Transporter Skill Youth

Name: General Grokh
Lore: Intelligence officer recently promoted to serve on the High Council. Assisted General Chang with developing the I.K.S. Kla'Diyus. Opposed to the peace initiative.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Klingon Intelligence Treachery Navigation (if all your personnel present are [Films]).

Name: General K'Ron
Lore: Characteristic of High Council logistics experts. Encouraged Azetbur to attack the Federation now, rather than becomes slaves under their rule.
Text: V.I.P. ENGINEER Computer Skill Treachery Leadership (if all your personnel present are [Films]).

Name: General Lompoc
Lore: Representative of Klingon scientific advisors to the High Council. Enjoyed the gagh served aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise-A. Not fond of Shakespeare.
Text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Geology Astrophysics (if all your personnel present are [Films]).

Name: Igrilan Kor
Lore: Reprentative of Andorian admirals in the 2280s. Friend of Ambassador Shras. Part of the inquiry group looking into the fallout from Project Genesis.
Text: OFFICER Astrophysics Exobiology Music Law SCIENCE (if all your personnel present are [Films]).

Name: K'mbol
Lore: Typical military surgeon. Expert in Klingon anatomy. Assigned by the High Council to single-handedly oversee the medical needs to Chancellor Gorkon.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Exobiology Geology DL/ {Medical Kit} (if with your [Films] Leadership).

Name: Lt. Slater
Lore: Night shift communications officer aboard Starship Excelsior. Expert in ordnance disposal. Likes archery, vampire stories, and orange sherbet. A true romantic.
Text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill Archaeology Anthropology SECURITY (if all your personnel present are [Films]). DL/ {Hail}

Name: Magistrate K'Rea
Lore: Senior judge for the High Council. Gave Captain Kirk and Dr. McCoy a lenient sentence in the interest of fostering amity for the forthcoming peace talks.
Text: V.I.P. Law Diplomacy Archaeology DL/ {Awaiting Trial} SCIENCE (if all your personnel present are [Films]).

Name: Pavel Chekov
Lore: After a long career, Ensign Chekov was a guest at the U.S.S. Enterprise-B launch. Commander who assisted as a nurse due to a lack of medical staff.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Anthropology Biology Your {[Univ][Fed][Stf][Films] personnel} present gain MEDICAL.

Name: Peter Preston
Lore: Diligent cadet. Nephew of Mr. Scott. Called a tiger by Admiral Kirk. Stayed at his post during the attack by the U.S.S. Reliant, when most other trainees ran.
Text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill Youth Honor Physics (if all your personnel present are [Films]).

Name: President Ra-ghoratreii
Lore: Efrosian who succeeded Hiram Roth. Redefined relations with the Klingons and the Cardassians during his time in office. Not above the law.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Law Leadership Archaeology MEDICAL (if all your personnel present are [Films]).

Name: Prisoner Martia
Characteristics/ Keywords: Chameloid; Female; Male; Prisoner-related personnel; Rura Penthe-related personnel; Shape-shifter;
Lore: Female Chameloid and shape-shifter who posed as a male to access the mines on Rura Penthe. Martia conspired with Koth to stage an execution.
Text: SECURITY Exobiology Geology (if no other Geology present). Greed Treachery DL/ {You Dirty Rat} (to hand).

Name: Prisoner McCoy
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Male; Prisoner-related personnel; Rura Penthe-related personnel;
Lore: The human Dr. McCoy was sentenced to mining duties on Rura Penthe for the remainder of his life. He unsuccessfully tried to save Chancellor Gorkon.
Text: CIVILIAN MEDICAL Exobiology Biology Honor Cantankerousness

Name: Saavik (Second Star to the Right)
Lore: Vulcan science officer aboard U.S.S. Grissom. Friend to David Marcus. She studied the rapid development of both Genesis and a similarly aging Captain Spock.
Text: SCIENCE Geology Computer Skill Mindmeld DL/ {Tricorder} If all your personnel present are [Films]: MEDICAL, Physics.

Name: Spock Son of Sarek
Lore: Half brother to Sybok. Under orders from General Korrd, Klaa allowed the 1/2 Vulcan, 1/2 human Mr. Spock to act as gunner for the I.K.S. Chontay.
Text: OFFICER SCIENCE Diplomacy Mindmeld Honor Compatible with {[SKR] cards}. DL/ {Tactical Console}

Name: Starship Saratoga
Lore: NCC-1887. Commanded by Captain Alexander. Patrolled the Neutral Zone in 2286. Unsuccessfully attempted to communicate with the whale probe.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Kirk's Reading Glasses
Lore: Eighteenth century spectacles. A birthday present from Dr. McCoy in 2285. Admiral Kirk sold them for 100 dollars in 1986. Would have been worth more if the lenses were intact.
Text: Immediately plays on table. Once each turn, you may exchange a card in hand for a card in your discard pile.

Name: Row, Row, Row your Boat
Lore: Even amongst old friends, conflicts can arise. Captain Spock initially struggled to comprehend the meaning behind the lyrics of his compatriots' chosen campfire song.
Text: To get past requires 2 Music OR total attributes > 63 from up to 3 personnel.

Name: This is Ceti Alpha Five!
Lore: Commander Chekov was wrong about one potential test site for Project Genesis being lifeless. "Botany Bay?! ...Oh no!"
Text: If Away Team unopposed, opponent may relocate up to three augments here. Your Transporter Skill here with transporters may beam up one personnel. Place on mission; no downloading personnel here.

Name: Charter a Space Flight
Lore: Visiting a bar in 2285, Dr. McCoy attempted to find a pilot offering passage to the forbidden Genesis planet. He was hoping for no questions asked and no Starfleet entanglements.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. At end of each turn, you may discard a [Non] ship from hand to relocate your Away Team to a planet within the printed RANGE of that ship.

Name: Operation Retrieve
Lore: On the assumption that diplomacy would fail, Colonel West drafted a daring rescue plan to return the captured Starfleet officers being held on Rura Penthe.
Text: Plays on a personnel you own who is a captive OR under opponent's control. Personnel returns to hand. If they are [Films], you may immediately play them (for free). Discard event.

Name: Paradise City
Lore: Capital of the so-called "Planet of Galactic Peace." The dregs of the galaxy were conned into settling on this worthless lump of rock. Many hide their pain.
Text: Seeds at {Nimbus III}. {J'Onn} may seed here. In place of your normal card play, you may download {Sybok} here.

Name: Space Lab Regula I
Lore: Advanced research biolab. Home to stage one testing of Project Genesis. Commanded by Carol Marcus.
Text: Seeds at {Regula I}. Dilemmas that require SCIENCE to overcome, cure, or nullify, when revealed, stop a personnel (random selection). DL/ {Science Kit}

Name: Galactic Army of Light
Text: Seeds on {Nimbus III}. Your personnel may only play here. They must be non-augment [Films] and are disabled unless [Non] or [SKR]. If {Sybok} in play, you may play {Release This Pain} on personnel here (even if Sybok not present) and, twice each turn, you may play one [SKR] OR % personnel here for free. Once per game, you may relocate your Sybok (and any of your personnel present with him) to here.

Name: He Took Away my Pain!
Lore: Dr. McCoy carried the guilt of allowing his father to die shortly before a cure was found. Sybok helped McCoy let go of this burden.
Text: Seeds on table. While {Sybok} in play, when you play a [Univ] personnel, you may download {Release This Pain} to hand (limit twice every turn).

Name: To Rule in Hell
Text: Seeds on {Ceti Alpha V}. Your {Khan} may seed here and your [Non] cards may report here. You may discard two cards from hand to relocate your Khan (and any personnel you control present with your Khan) to here. When your opponent encounters {Augment Aggression}, you may forfeit its download and relocate up to three of your augments to that location instead.

Name: Double Dumbass on You!
Lore: Navigating an unfamiliar culture, with its unique idioms and colorful metaphors, can be quite a challenge.
Text: Plays (once every turn) just after a dilemma has stopped personnel. Choose an Away Team at same location and stop up to two additional personnel (random selection).

Name: He Put Creatures in our Bodies
Lore: Ceti eels leave their victims extremely susceptible to suggestion. However, more challenging orders can be resisted.
Text: Nullify your {Ceti Eel} on one personnel you control that opponent owns (relocate them anywhere; opponent's choice) to add a skill of your choice to all your augments at same location until end of turn.

Name: Analyze Rapid Terraforming
Lore: Assess long-term stability of artificially created habitable areas.
Text: SCIENCE x2 + Physics + Biology OR {Carol Marcus} OR {David Marcus}

Name: Breach Barrier
Lore: My brothers, we have been chosen...
Text: SCIENCE + ENGINEER + Navigation x2 * +20 points if solved using a ship you do not own.

Name: Hostage Crisis
Lore: Recover representatives from jointly-administered world.
Text: Leadership x2 + SECURITY x2 + (Honor OR Treachery) When seeded, may download {Planet of Galactic Peace} here.

Name: We'll Need a Starship
Text: Seeds or plays on a Neutral Zone Region [P]. Your {Sybok} may nullify {Dead End} here. Your [SKR] personnel may attempt with these requirements: SECURITY + Diplomacy x3 + Sybok Once solved, opponent must (if possible) download a ship here; commandeered. Ship adds [Films] and [SKR]. Ship replaces each staffing requirement with [SKR]. (Unique.)

Name: Aranty
Lore: Large humanoid prisoner serving his sentence on Rura Penthe. Friends with Martia. Wanted Captain Kirk's obedience to the Brotherhood of Aliens. And his coat.
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Greed Treachery Geology

Name: Bones
Lore: The katra of Mr. Spock inhabited the body of his human friend Dr. McCoy. Has all their marbles. Needed to go and climb the steps of Mount Seleya.
Text: MEDICAL SCIENCE Exobiology Cantankerousness If replaced by {any Spock} at {Vulcan}, score points.

Name: Clark Terrell (Paradise Lost)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Captain; Infiltrator; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
Lore: Captain of the U.S.S. Reliant. Surrendered his ship while controlled via Ceti eel. Provided Khan with the coordinates to beam up the Genesis Device.
Text: OFFICER Once per game, may relocate your Away Team here to {U.S.S. Reliant} (even if stopped). Computer Skill

Name: Colonel West
Lore: Assassin, master of disguise, and provocateur. He conspired with Admiral Cartwright to incite a war between the Klingon Empire and the Federation.
Text: SECURITY OFFICER Treachery Law DL/ {Assassination Plot} Section 31 DL/ {Operation Retrieve} (at start of turn).

Name: Commander Chekov (Paradise Lost)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Infiltrator; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
Lore: First officer of the U.S.S. Reliant who misidentified Ceti Alpha VI. Khan remembered Ensign Chekov from the Starship Enterprise. Controlled via Ceti eel.
Text: OFFICER Navigation SECURITY Astrophysics Biology If on {U.S.S. Reliant}, it is WEAPONS +2.

Name: Commander Kyle
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel; Male;
Lore: Lt. Kyle earned a promotion while serving aboard U.S.S. Reliant. Marooned on Ceti Alpha V by Khan.
Text: ENGINEER SECURITY Transporter Skill Archaeology Exobiology

Name: Commander Sulu
Lore: Father of Demora Sulu. Lt. Sulu spent years serving under Admiral Kirk. Fell under Sybok's influence.
Text: OFFICER Navigation x 2 Honor Compatible with {[SKR] cards}. SECURITY [Films] ship he is on is RANGE +1. DL/ {Demora Sulu} (if aboard your facility).

Name: Commander Uhura (Paradise Lost)
Lore: Lt. Uhura served aboard the Starship Enterprise for many years. Sybok helped put her in touch with feelings she'd always been afraid to express.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Diplomacy Music DL/ {Seductive Dance} Anthropology Compatible with {[SKR] cards}.

Name: Kjott
Characteristics/ Keywords: Humanoid; Male; Mission Specialist; Rura Penthe-related personnel;
Lore: Humanoid prisoner on Rura Penthe. Overconfident bully. Proudly displays his genitals, in keeping with his cultural norms. Few know they aren't just knees.
Text: CIVILIAN Smuggling

Name: L'Kel
Lore: Typical crewman working under Kruge. Assigned to join Torg's boarding party. Eager to bring glory to his house by capturing the infamous Starship Enterprise.
Text: ENGINEER Transporter Skill Astrophysics Youth

Name: Miss Kendra
Lore: Typical human waitress working in San Francisco in 2285. Old acquaintance of Dr. McCoy. She was surprised when he didn't order his usual poison.
Text: CIVILIAN Biology SCIENCE Honor

Name: Pennett
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Augment; Female; genetically enhanced; Khan-related card; Khan-related personnel;
Lore: Genetically enhanced augment, typical of Khan's followers. Grateful to leave Ceti Alpha V behind. She quickly adapted to 23rd century technology.
Text: CIVILIAN SECURITY Computer Skill Transporter Skill Youth

Name: Professor Scott
Lore: Mr. Scott visited Plexicorp in 1986, posing as a scholar from Edinburgh. Called "the miracle worker" by his friends. Scotty is an old Aberdeen pub crawler.
Text: ENGINEER Miracle Worker Computer Skill Transporter Skill Once per game, may restore used RANGE of a [Films] ship here.

Name: Refugee Guinan
Lore: El-Aurian who fled from the assimilation of her homeworld. Hates the Borg. Was ripped from the Nexus in 2293. Left an echo of herself behind.
Text: CIVILIAN Your [AU] dilemmas may only be nullified using their gametext. Diplomacy Anthropology Honor

Name: Sfreett
Lore: Feline humanoid dancer. She was working on Nimbus III when Sybok took charge of Paradise City. Likes the arid atmosphere of the desolate world.
Text: CIVILIAN Acquisition Greed Anthropology Diplomacy

Name: Chariot of "God"
Lore: n 2287, the Galactic Army of Light commandeered the Federation starship U.S.S. Enterprise-A to traverse the Great Barrier and travel to Sha Ka Ree.
Text: Tractor Beam RANGE +4 in Great Barrier Region.

Name: Merchantman
Lore: Common class of reconfigurable cargo vessel. Sometimes used as a passenger or courier transport.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: Shuttle Galileo
Lore: Large Federation shuttlecraft assigned to the U.S.S. Enterprise-A. Transported Sybok's Army of Light off Nimbus III to begin their quest for Sha Ka Ree.
Text: May take off or land once each turn.

Name: No Tricks
Text: Attack: 0. Defense: 1. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a [Films] ship firing. Hit = [Down][Flip]. Direct hit = [Down][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Otherwise, if [Films] ship firing with matching commander aboard = [Down]. Hull: -15% Emergency Beam Out: relocate one personnel (random selection) to nearest planet; stopped.

Name: Unexpected Torpedo
Text: Attack: 1. Defense: 3. ATTACK bonus +2 if you have a [Films] ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -25% Gravity offline: personnel aboard who use a regular skill are stopped afterward.

Name: A Little Fun Every Day
Lore: While Anij taught Jean-Luc Picard to appreciate the beauty of a single moment, Artim taught Data to enjoy the value of play and to explore with childlike wonder.
Text: Place on mission. Now and start of each attempt here, cannot get past unless three personnel with total attributes < 52 OR 2 CIVILIAN present.

Name: High Ground
Lore: Against direct orders, Jean-Luc Picard led the Ba'ku to climb nearer to kelbonite deposits in the mountains to evade intensive scans by the Son'a and avoid planetary evacuation.
Text: To get past requires STRENGTH>40 if mission shows less than 30 points, STRENGTH>50 if it shows 30 points, or STRENGTH>60 if it shows more than 30 points.

Name: Reman Dagger
Characteristics/ Keywords: blade weapon; hand weapon; Reman title related equipment;
Lore: Traditional blade weapon developed on Remus. Shinzon used such a weapon to provide a blood sample for Beverly Crusher to examine and authenticate his story.
Text: Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +1. (Cumulative.) You may mortally wound your Reman present in personnel battle to mortally wound their adversary.

Name: Reman Disruptor Rifle
Characteristics/ Keywords: disruptor; hand weapon; Reman title related equipment;
Lore: Energy rifle used by Reman assault teams. Has added blades for short range combat and a reduced anti-proton signature compared with standard Romulan disruptor rifles.
Text: Reman use only. Each of your personnel present is STRENGTH +3. (Cumulative.) Your Remans present who have SECURITY or Leadership all add OFFICER.

Name: Reman Scepter
Characteristics/ Keywords: hand weapon; Reman title related equipment;
Lore: Traditional metal mace used by the Remans as a symbol of power and authority. The Viceroy carried such a staff during Shinzon's reign. Can also be used as a hand weapon.
Text: Once every turn, if present with your Reman leader, you may draw a card when you play a Reman or an [Equipment] with "Reman" in title. (Unique.)

Name: Oppression of the Remans
Lore: The Reman miners worked together, doing whatever was required to survive the cruelty of the Romulan guards.
Text: Plays on table. Your Reman personnel with SECURITY classification may meet dilemma requirements as if CIVILIAN or V.I.P. or female, then die. OR Plays to take a card from {Deliberately Discarded} into hand. Discard event.

Name: Personal Demons
Lore: Shinzon felt his existence meaningless while Jean-Luc Picard was still alive. To make his mark, he vowed neither the Romulans nor the Federation would stop his Reman uprising.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. While {Shinzon} is aboard the {Scimitar}, when a [Fed] or [Rom] non-Reman personnel is killed, score one point for each.

Name: Versatile Vessel: Crew Transport
Lore: A backbone of Starfleet during the 2360s and the 2370s, Nebula-class ships performed scientific research, deep space exploration, border patrol, and transportation duties.
Text: Plays on your Nebula- or Military Freighter- class ship; download {Rescue Personnel} to this ship; it may target an Away Team in same quadrant at a different location.

Name: Senate Chamber
Lore: Guile and cunning are needed to survive in the legislative body of the Romulan Star Empire.
Text: Seeds or plays on {Romulus}. Once each turn, one [Rom] V.I.P. OR one [Rom] OFFICER with a Star Trek Nemesis property logo OR one {HQ} card may play for free here. (Not duplicatable.)

Name: Battle Stations: All Hands
Lore: During crisis situations, the whole crew needs to pull together, from the captain to the lowest ranked crewman.
Text: Seeds on table. Once each turn, if you have {Battle Stations: Sovereign Class} in play, you may play up to one unique, one [Enig], and one % personnel for free. You may not otherwise play personnel "for free."

Name: Battle Stations: Core Protection
Lore: During alert situations, warp core integrity can be enhanced with forcefields to help ensure continuous flow of power.
Text: Seeds on table. While you have {Battle Stations: Sovereign Class} in play, you may draw three cards in place of your normal card draw. During your turn, ignore effects from your other cards that allow or require you to draw cards.

Name: Battle Stations: Sovereign Class
Text: Seeds on table. You may not download dilemmas or personnel. At the start of each turn, you must activate or discard each of your face down [HA] cards. Discard this incident if you play (or have played) a personnel or ship that does not have a Star Trek Generations, Star Trek First Contact, Star Trek Insurrection, or Star Trek Nemesis property logo. Nullifies each {Klim Dokachin}.

Name: Deliberately Discarded
Lore: The Remans strategically left B-4's body parts to be found.
Text: Seeds on table. When your % Reman dies, if you have Remus in play, place them here. Once each turn, you may place one card here beneath your draw deck OR discard two cards here to draw a card OR once per game, place three cards here out of play to download a Reman to {Remus}.

Name: Engage the Borg
Lore: Admiral Hayes mobilized the fleet in 2373, summoning all ships to defend Sector 001 against a Borg incursion.
Text: Seeds on table. Your non-[AU][Fed] personnel with a Star Trek Generations, Star Trek Insurrection, or Star Trek Nemesis property logo gain [FC]. Score 5 points each time you destroy {Borg Ship} dilemma or a [Bor] ship in battle.

Name: Formidable Warriors
Lore: Reman troops were used as front line soldiers during the Dominion War, proving their mettle in the fiercest encounters.
Text: Plays on table. Nullified if you have a {time location}, {treaty}, or [Non] card in play. While your {Reshape the Quadrant} in play, your Remans gain [DS9] and, once each turn, you may play a [DS9] Reman or an [Equipment] with "Reman" in title for free.

Name: In Darkness there is Strength
Lore: One side of Remus always faces its sun. Due to the temperature extremes, the Remans live on the dark side of their planet.
Text: Seeds or plays on table. The first time you play a Reman from hand each turn, if played to {Remus} or your {[Rom] outpost}, you may play a % Reman there for free.

Name: Make a Difference Again
Text: Plays on table. Once each turn, when you play {James T. Kirk} or a [Films][TNG] personnel, you may draw a card. You may ignore [AU] when playing [Films][TNG] cards, and once each turn, one such personnel may play for free. You may not draw cards after you begin executing orders (except your normal card draw).

Name: The New Reman Flagship
Text: Seeds on table. Your Remans, {Scimitar}, {any Shinzon}, and [Equipment] may play to {Remus}. Once each turn, if you do not have a headquarters or time location in play, one such personnel may do so for free. Once each turn, you may kill your Reman to download an [Equipment] with "Reman" in title OR kill two of your Remans to download Scimitar. Discard if you play a personnel that is not [Rom] or [Non].

Name: The Reman Mines
Lore: Remus, the third planet of the Romulus system, is rich in dilithium and a base for Romulan heavy weapons production.
Text: Seeds or plays on {Remus}. For each of your [Rom] ships placed in your point area by {Process Ore: Mining} here, your ships are WEAPONS +1 (limit +3). Once solved, your [Rom] ships are RANGE +2.

Name: Workhorses of the Fleet
Requires: Ambassador Class; Constellation Class; Excelsior Class; K't'inga Class; Miranda Class; Oberth Class;
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Once each turn, you may play a % Excelsior-, Miranda-, Oberth-, or K't'inga-class ship for free (once per game per class). While all ships in play that you own are Excelsior-, Miranda-, Oberth-, K't'inga-, Ambassador-, or Constellation-classes, your ships are attributes all +X where X = 1+the total number of missions any player has completed or placed a [BO] objective on.

Name: A Few Loose Ends
Lore: Matthew Dougherty wanted to keep his plans with the Son'a to relocate the Ba'ku a secret. "You've done a terrific job. Now pack your bags and get the hell out of here."
Text: Plays just after opponent solves (or completes a [BO] objective targeting) a mission. If their score is higher than yours, all their personnel are stopped. OR Nullifies {No Loose Ends}.

Name: Change of Heart
Lore: Donatra appealed to Suran for support when she realized that Shinzon's goals did not match theirs, and that his sins would mark them for generations to come.
Text: Plays on your unstopped personnel with Honor and OFFICER to cause a random selection present to be cancelled and re-selected. OR Nullifies {Rules of Obedience}.

Name: Escape
Lore: Pursued by the natives of Kolarus III, Jean-Luc Picard decided that the best course of action was to drive straight off a cliff, into the safety of an awaiting shuttlecraft.
Text: Just after a dilemma targets at least one personnel to die, if you randomly discard cards from hand equal to the total number of targeted personnel, they are all stopped instead.

Name: Confront Duplicate
Lore: Challenge adversary in nebula that disrupts long-range communications.
Text: OFFICER x4 + ({any Shinzon} OR {any Jean-Luc Picard}) *+5 if Empathy present.

Name: Activate Thalaron Weapon
Text: Plays on a homeworld. Target your {Scimitar} in Romulus System Region. If your staffed Scimitar is here, you may probe: [Rom]: Emitters extended. Ignore [Rom] when probing. [Cmd]: If emitters extended, generator primed. [Interrupt]: If generator primed, weapon deployed: All personnel at this mission (or at all missions in this region) not aboard Scimitar are killed. Discard objective.

Name: Investigate Warp Signature
Text: Seeds on {Earth}; you must download {Launch the Phoenix}. Your [Vul] personnel may attempt Earth using these requirements: Astrophysics + Anthropology + ({Vulcan Lander} OR CUNNING>30) When solved, mission worth 30 points (instead of printed value) or 40 points if {Phoenix} in orbit at this mission or {Montana Missile Complex}.

Name: Recover Stolen Material
Text: Seeds at the same mission as {Space Lab Regula I}, {Amargosa Observatory}, or a {Science Lab}. You may immediately seed an [Artifact] here. Your non-[Fed] crew or Away Team may attempt with these requirements: SECURITY x3 + STRENGTH > point value of mission When solved, if you did not earn an [Artifact] here, you may download up to three [Equipment] here. (Unique.)

Name: B-4
Lore: Prototype Soong-type android. Elder brother to Data and Lore, with a less sophisticated positronic brain.
Text: CIVILIAN Youth Computer Skill Treachery X=3 or 7. Once per game, may gain a regular skill if not playing [Fed]. May report aboard your {Scimitar} (if no Tal Shiar aboard).

Name: Beverly Crusher (Nemesis)
Lore: Chief Medical Officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. She helped activate B-4. Confirmed Shinzon was a clone, and that he was dying. Mother of Wesley Crusher.
Text: MEDICAL MEDICAL Biology Cybernetics May expose opponent's infiltrator present.

Name: Data (Nemesis)
Lore: Soong-type android and brother of B-4. He sang at the wedding of William T. Riker and Deanna Troi. Would willingly lay down his life for his shipmates.
Text: OFFICER Computer Skill x 2 Exobiology SECURITY Music DL/ {Security Sacrifice}

Name: Donatra
Lore: Honorable commander and military advisor. Patriot who enlisted as a trooper. Opposed Shinzon when she saw his genocidal plans. Commands the Valdore.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Leadership Physics Honor SECURITY DL/ {Change of Heart}

Name: Geordi La Forge (Nemesis)
Lore: Human engineer. His VISOR made him an unwitting pawn for the Sisters of Duras. Was frustratingly slow to observe his ship's shield frequencies.
Text: ENGINEER ENGINEER Physics Cybernetics DL/ {Prefix Code Transmission}

Name: Guinan (Nemesis)
Lore: Former U.S.S Enterprise El-Aurian bartender. She's been married twenty-three times. Plans to re-open her bar at 10 Forward Avenue in Los Angeles.
Text: CIVILIAN The first time an opponent draws a card every turn (except at end of turn), you may draw a card. Anthropology

Name: Hiren
Lore: Former Romulan admiral who replaced Neral as praetor. Rejected Shinzon's proposed alliance as he has no love for his Reman neighbors.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy Stellar Cartography Law Treachery

Name: Jean-Luc Picard (Nemesis)
Lore: Argo pilot itching to try some unsafe velocities. Human captain of the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. Later discovered he had been cloned by the Romulans.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation Geology Diplomacy DL/ {Escape}

Name: Martin Madden
Lore: Human commander who took over as first officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise-E. He followed some bad advice from William T. Riker. Descendant of Jeremiah Hayes.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy SECURITY Archaeology Law Biology

Name: Mullen
Lore: Romulan tactical officer and aide to Donatra. Served aboard the Valdore during the Battle of Bassen Rift in 2379. He is well-versed in Romulan military history.
Text: OFFICER Archaeology Navigation Computer Skill SECURITY

Name: Noram
Lore: One of many commanders who supports greater integration of Reman troops in the Romulan military. Dissident who conspired with Talvin and Tal'Aura.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Exobiology

Name: Sevek (Nemesis)
Lore: Vulcan expert in planetary development. He served with Solkar in 2063 and was one of the first Vulcans to openly visit Earth. Does not enjoy human music.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Geology Once per location, draws two cards when ship he is aboard lands.

Name: Seventeen of Seventeen
Lore: Identification: PURSUIT DRONE Task: Intercept former shipmates of Hawk. Biological distinctiveness: Human.
Text: Navigation x 2 SECURITY DL/ {Environmental Suit} May report to any {U.S.S. Enterprise-E}. If on your {U.S.S. Enterprise-E}, it is attributes all +3.

Name: Solkar (Nemesis)
Lore: Vulcan explorer who made first contact with humans in 2063. Commands a Vulcan Lander. He found Zefram Cochrane's musical tastes to be fascinating.
Text: OFFICER Honor Anthropology Exobiology Leadership Diplomacy

Name: Suran
Lore: Ambitious commander of the Soterus. Dissident who opposed Hiren's government. He conspired with Shinzon, seeking to strengthen the Romulan military.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Navigation SECURITY Treachery While at a nebula, your [Rom] ships here are WEAPONS +3.

Name: Talvin
Lore: Typical commander. He conspired with Tal'Aura and Noram to wipe out senate opposition to Shinzon. Dissident who sympathises with the Reman cause.
Text: OFFICER Anthropology Geology Stellar Cartography

Name: Thalpet
Lore: Senior Reman scientist who worked on miniaturizing the thalaron radiation generator used by Tal'Aura. Served aboard the Scimitar. Elder brother of Chagrith.
Text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Computer Skill If played from hand, may take a discarded card to hand.

Name: T'Shonra (Nemesis)
Lore: Vulcan sensor specialist who visited Earth in 2063. She politely declined Zefram Cochrane's offer of an alcoholic beverage, even if it was "the good stuff."
Text: SCIENCE Astrophysics Stellar Cartography Music Doubles regular skills granted by ships she is aboard.

Name: Upexi
Lore: Skilled Reman marksman who led many successful campaigns as a trooper. Though proven adept, he has yet to accept a command of his own.
Text: SECURITY OFFICER Exobiology Computer Skill If played from hand, may play an [Equipment] here for free.

Name: Vkruk
Lore: Reman mentor to Young Shinzon in the hellish mines, eventually becoming his viceroy. Looked up to by his fellow Remans, but lacks their beastliness.
Text: ENGINEER Biology Geology Empathy Diplomacy If played from hand, may play a [Rom] leader here for free.

Name: Wesley Crusher (Nemesis)
Lore: Son of Beverly Crusher. Returned to Starfleet briefly while not exploring with The Traveler. Recently assigned to U.S.S. Titan as assistant chief engineer.
Text: ENGINEER Astrophysics Computer Skill x 2 Anthropology Navigation Ship he is on ignores RANGE reductions.

Name: Young Shinzon
Lore: Human clone of Jean-Luc Picard. While still a minor, the original infiltration plan for him was abandoned. He was instead sent to work as a miner on Remus.
Text: CIVILIAN Youth Geology Leadership If played from hand, may play an [Equipment] or [Rom] personnel here for free.

Name: Norexan
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Prototype; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Prototype warbird designed to supersede the aging D'deridex-class and replace the extensive losses the Romulan fleet suffered during the Dominion War.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam

Name: Scorpion One
Lore: Reman shuttlecraft and attack flier often deployed during the Dominion War. Stolen by Jean-Luc Picard and Data to escape captivity aboard the Scimitar.
Text: May report to {Remus} or aboard your {Scimitar}. DL/ {Engage Shuttle Operations}

Name: U.S.S. Farragut
Lore: NCC-60597. Sent to salvage the U.S.S. Enterprise saucer section on Veridian III. Aided the colonists on Ajilon Prime after a Klingon attack in 2373.
Text: Holodeck, Tractor Beam DL/ {Versatile Vessel}

Name: Valdore
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Romulan warbird which turned against the Scimitar and aligned with the U.S.S. Enterprise-E at the Battle of Bassen Rift. Named after a 22nd-century admiral.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam May initiate battle against [Rom].

Name: Vulcan Lander (Nemesis)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Ship with a Skill; Vulcan ship;
Lore: Vulcan vessel in use during the 21st century. Solkar commanded during first contact with Earth.
Text: May take off or land (uses 1 RANGE). Anthropology

Name: Distracting Technology
Lore: The Xyrillian holodeck was centuries ahead of most Alpha Quadrant races' recreational facilities. "If we had one of these on Enterprise, I'd never ask for shore leave."
Text: Place on ship. If ship is [22] or [OS], all crew with that icon are stopped this turn. Any player voluntarily moving or attacking with this ship must first discard 2 cards from hand.

Name: Promethean Quartz
Lore: A mysterious crystal found in the Gamma Quadrant by Vash was later revealed to be an egg of a spaceborne life-form.
Text: Opponent may download and seed a [Self] dilemma here. Unless Exobiology, SCIENCE and CUNNING>40 OR Archaeology, ENGINEER and STRENGTH>40, crew or Away Team stopped. Discard dilemma.

Name: The Arsenal: Weapons Demonstration
Lore: The automated weapons system on Minos also attacked orbiting starships. "The 607 does it all... neutralize ground personnel, even destroy enemy space vessels."
Text: To get past, choose your ship here (even a cloaked or landed ship): opponent may [Flip] [Flip]. You may lose 10 points to prevent one [Flip], or 20 points to prevent both.

Name: 48th Rule of Acquisition
Lore: The bigger the smile, the sharper the knife.
Text: Plays on your {[Fer] ship}. While {Gold-Pressed Latinum} aboard, ship is WEAPONS +1 for each Diplomacy aboard (limit +3).

Name: Astrometrics Lab (Ships of the Line)
Lore: Seven of Nine and Harry Kim combined astrometric technology from Starfleet and the Borg. Their enhanced sensors helped them plot a more efficient route home.
Text: Plays on your ship. Once each turn, if Stellar Cartography aboard, you may discard the top card of your draw deck to make this ship RANGE +3 until end of turn.

Name: Border Checkpoint
Lore: In order for the U.S.S. Defiant to enter Cardassian territory in 2371, Benjamin Sisko used a holofilter to appear as a Kobheerian and allow the ship to pass the Cardassian patrols.
Text: Plays on a mission with "array" or "listening post" in lore. Once each turn, when you play a non-[Fed] ship here, you may draw a card.

Name: Versatile Vessel: Applied Science
Lore: The Romulan scientists aboard the Apnex strategically used an undetected muon feedback wave to destabilize the U.S.S. Enterprise's dilithium chamber.
Text: Plays on your Nebula- or Science- class ship or scout ship. Once each turn, you may select SCIENCE OR Geology OR Stellar Cartography OR Astrophysics. Until re-selected, adds that skill.

Name: Vulcan Observation
Lore: After taking their initial steps into deep space, Jonathan Archer and his crew felt the gaze of their pointy-eared neighbors looking over their shoulder a little too often.
Text: Plays on an opponent's [P] mission. Add the skills of each {[Vul] ship} here to this mission's requirements (add double those skills instead if this mission is [FED] or [STA]).

Name: Cytherian Lure
Lore: Exchange knowledge with advanced race.
Text: Computer Skill x2 + (ENGINEER x2 OR CUNNING>50) {Cytherians} in this quadrant instead force travel here.

Name: Monitor Traffic
Lore: Identify ships crossing busy border.
Text: SECURITY + Astrophysics + (Law OR CUNNING>32) {Border Checkpoint} may seed here.

Name: Assembly Transport
Lore: Bajoran transport used by various dignitaries and members of the Vedek Assembly. This class of transport is named after a forested area on Bajor.
Text: Tractor Beam. RANGE and SHIELDS +1 for each vedek aboard (limit 4).

Name: Klingon Transport
Characteristics/ Keywords: Klingon ship; No staffing requirement; Shuttlecraft; Transport;
Lore: Shuttlecraft of Klingon design. Koral commanded one in 2370. Was intercepted before his rendezvous.
Text: May report with 2 personnel (one must have Smuggling) to any [NON] mission.

Name: Pequod
Lore: Cruiser commanded by Takirac. The first to install holographic projectors. Renamed after a ship from Takirac's favorite hunting simulation, Moby Dick.
Text: WEAPONS and SHIELDS +4 vs. [Self]. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: Soterus (Ships of the Line)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Romulan ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Warbird commanded by Suran during the Battle of Bassen Rift. Survived the conflict but sustained significant damage. Sister ship to the Valdore.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam. While in battle, may draw an extra Tactic.

Name: Type-2 Galor
Characteristics/ Keywords: Capturing-related card; Cardassian ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Vessel used by the Cardassian Union from the outbreak of hostilities with the Federation until the 2360s when it was replaced by the Type-3 Galor.
Text: Tractor Beam. WEAPONS +3 while you have a captive.

Name: U.S.S. Ambassador
Lore: Mainstay Federation vessel of the mid-24th century. NCC-10521. The design had more maneuverability than many of its counterparts of that era.
Text: Tractor Beam

Name: U.S.S. Defiant (Ships of the Line)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cloaking Device; Dominion ship; Federation ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Federation starship commandeered and commanded by Kudak'Etan. Encountered a little problem.
Text: Cloaking Device, Tractor Beam (cannot carry ships aboard except shuttlepods)

Name: U.S.S. Sovereign (Ships of the Line)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Federation ship; Holodeck; Prototype; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Prototype advanced cruiser developed in the early 2370s. First ship of its class. NCC-73811. Part of a special Federation task force in 2384.
Text: Attributes all +1 if [Ent-E] aboard. Holodeck, Tractor Beam

Name: Close That Door!
Lore: A delicate stellar cartography experiment was ruined by Jean-Luc Picard when he opened a door at three o'clock in the morning to find out why he couldn't get his Earl Grey.
Text: To get past requires SCIENCE and Stellar Cartography. Nullify by discarding a [Doorway] from hand.

Name: Dark Matter Pockets
Lore: The Mar Oscura Nebula has an unusually high concentration of dark matter. Intersecting such pockets can temporarily phase bulkheads or entire planets out of existence.
Text: Opponent may download {Gaps in Normal Space} adjacent to here. To get past requires 2 SCIENCE (at [P]) OR Navigation and Stellar Cartography (at [S]).

Name: Stratagem
Lore: To find the Xindi weapon, Jonathan Archer's crew constructed an elaborate simulation in which he and Degra had escaped together from a Xindi-Insectoid prison and stolen a shuttle.
Text: Unless crew or Away Team has all printed skills on an opponent's captive (opponent's choice; nullified if none), opponent may peek at any one card. Discard dilemma.

Name: Taspar Egg
Lore: Boiled taspar egg is a Cardassian delicacy. Raw taspar egg can serve as nourishment during especially desperate times, or be used to debase a prisoner during torture.
Text: While you have a captive, your [Car] personnel present are either INTEGRITY +2 or INTEGRITY -2. You may change this at any time, even when facing a dilemma. (Unique.)

Name: Extracted Confessions
Lore: Skilled interrogators always get the information they seek. "...current assignment?" "Special operations on Celtris III."
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Each time you score points from {Interrogation}, score 1 additional point. (Cumulative.) Your [TNG] guls gain each different regular skill on your captives affected by your copies of {Torture} (at their highest levels).

Name: Secret Prison
Lore: Gul Madred commanded this hidden interrogation facility where Jean-Luc Picard was questioned in 2369.
Text: Seeds or plays at {Celtris III}. Has a Brig.

Name: Know Your Enemy
Lore: Experienced officers can anticipate their opponents' moves.
Text: Seeds on table if your missions are all different and show less than 35 points. End of each turn, if all of your missions share an affiliation icon and you are neither playing that affiliation nor [Borg], draw a card.

Name: Latest Provocation
Lore: A failed covert operation by the Federation allowed the Cardassian Union to gain an advantage in its negotiations.
Text: Seeds on table. At the end of each of your turns, if you are playing only [Car], you may draw one additional card. Discard if you voluntarily initiate battle, attempt a mission, or play a {[Pun] card}.

Name: Covert Incursion
Lore: Hide invasion force amid intense particle flux.
Text: Leadership + Navigation + SCIENCE + CUNNING>30

Name: Mine Enemy Fleet
Lore: Position explosives near hidden ships.
Text: Navigation x2 + (Stellar Cartography OR any shuttlecraft) When solved, may damage opponent's ships in region.

Name: Prevent Military Escalation II
Lore: Investigate unauthorized activity.
Text: OFFICER x2 + Leadership + Honor OR {Miles O'Brien} If destroyed, flip mission over. Opponent's side: OFFICER x3 + Leadership OR {Benjamin Maxwell} {U.S.S. Phoenix} may report with 3 personnel here.

Name: Repair Sabotage
Lore: Evade detection while fixing damaged systems.
Text: ENGINEER + Navigation + (SECURITY OR [Maq] personnel)

Name: Secure Covert Transportation
Lore: Arrange passage into neighboring territory without detection.
Text: Navigation + SECURITY + Computer Skill *+5 if Smuggling in Away Team.

Name: Dispatch Metagenic Experts
Text: Seeds or plays on table. Target an Alpha Quadrant [CAR][P] mission (opponent's if possible). If your non-[Car] Away Team there has Biology, Physics, and 2 SECURITY at end of turn, objective complete: opponent chooses one of those personnel to be captured and relocated to their facility, crew, or Away Team, you may download {Get Him Cleaned Up}, then discard objective (score points).

Name: Get Him Cleaned Up
Text: Plays on table if your {Dispatch Metagenic Experts} is complete. When your crew completes a [CAR] nebula mission, objective complete: you may return one personnel you own who is a captive (your choice) to your facility, draw up to 3 cards, and your [CAR] missions showing 30 points or less solved this game (even those already solved) are worth +5 points if solved by your crew or Away Team.

Name: Admiral Kennelly
Lore: Human who conspired with the Cardassians. He sent Ro Laren to make a secret offer to Orta, but secretly planned to betray and eliminate the terrorist cell.
Text: V.I.P. Treachery At [CAR]: Greed, SECURITY. Leadership At [FED]: Law, INTEGRITY+1.

Name: Andro
Lore: Cardassian pilot serving in Starfleet in a different quantum reality. Worf encountered him aboard an alternate U.S.S. Enterprise in 2370.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Stellar Cartography Anthropology

Name: Ansomah
Lore: One of many Cardassian scientists serving aboard the Bralek. He accompanied Ocett to Vilmor II when the secret of the DNA program was revealed.
Text: SCIENCE Stellar Cartography Archaeology DL/ {Cardassian PADD} If you have a captive: Astrophysics, Diplomacy.

Name: Belcalis
Lore: Typical Cardassian intelligence asset. His undercover team, dressed as monks, attacked a Maquis cell at the Juhraya colony. Later promoted to legate.
Text: OFFICER Leadership Obsidian Order

Name: Beverly Crusher (Showdown: Four Lights)
Lore: Doctor and metagenics expert serving on the U.S.S. Enterprise. She covertly went to Celtris III with Worf and Jean-Luc Picard. Very, very grateful to Solok.
Text: MEDICAL Biology SECURITY At [CAR]: Anthropology. DL/ {Starfleet Type II Phaser} (if at [CAR]).

Name: Data (Showdown: Four Lights)
Lore: Soong-type android appointed as executive officer by Edward Jellico. He viewed Jellico's changes and targets as attainable goals.
Text: OFFICER Computer Skill x 2 Music Exobiology At [CAR]: Leadership, SCIENCE, Stellar Cartography.

Name: Deanna Troi (Showdown: Four Lights)
Lore: 1/2 Betazoid, 1/2 human counselor aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. She started wearing more formal bridge attire at the direction of Edward Jellico.
Text: OFFICER Empathy Anthropology At [CAR]: Once per game, may unstop her ship.

Name: Edward Jellico (Showdown: Four Lights)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Captain; Male; U.S.S. Enterprise-related personnel;
Lore: Efficient human captain of the U.S.S. Enterprise who abrasively reorganized shipboard operations. He is an expert on Cardassian behaviour. Born on Mars.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Leadership DL/ {Get It Done} At [CAR]: Leadership, Stellar Cartography, Physics.

Name: Gates
Lore: One of many human conn officers aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. Amazing pilot. She was a race-winning athlete during her academy days.
Text: OFFICER Navigation Physics At [CAR]: Astrophysics, Diplomacy.

Name: Glinn Telak
Lore: Communications officer aboard the Vetar. He liaised with Gul Evek about a hostage situation on Dorvan V. Injured during a Maquis attack in 2370.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Law Honor Twice per game, you may download {Holding Cell Door}.

Name: Gul Evek
Lore: Cardassian who commands the Vetar. Evek lost two of his three sons in a war with the Federation. He doesn't want to lose the last son the same way.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Leadership Diplomacy At [FED]: Diplomacy, Honor, Law.

Name: Human
Lore: Human interrogated by Gul Madred. Chose to remain imprisoned to protect Beverly Crusher. Near the end, Jean-Luc Picard believed he could see five lights.
Text: CIVILIAN Honor x 2 Archaeology Physics Your cards may not initiate battle against [Fed] here.

Name: Jil Orra
Lore: One of many Cardassian children who admire their parents' military service. Daughter of Gul Madred. Cares for her pet wompat. Curious about humans.
Text: CIVILIAN Youth Exobiology Geology

Name: Lepel
Lore: Representative of Cardassian prison guards serving on Celtris III. Inspired by Gul Madred, he desires to learn about other species and their weaknesses.
Text: SECURITY Treachery Exobiology If you have a captive: Leadership, Music.

Name: Mekar
Lore: Typical Cardassian working for Gul Madred. Cook and field medic. He provides taspar eggs for nutrition: boiled for the officers, live for the prisoners.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Acquisition DL/ {Taspar Egg}

Name: Vengar
Lore: Cardassian crewman on the Vetar. He was briefly taken hostage while assessing buildings and equipment expected to be left behind on Dorvan V.
Text: SCIENCE Navigation Greed Anthropology Leadership

Name: William T. Riker (Showdown: Four Lights)
Lore: Skilled human pilot. U.S.S. Enterprise first officer, until Edward Jellico relieved him of that role after they clashed over Jean-Luc Picard's capture.
Text: OFFICER Navigation x 2 Music Diplomacy Your [TNG] shuttlecraft he is aboard is attributes all +2.

Name: Worf (Showdown: Four Lights)
Lore: Klingon chief of security aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. In 2369, he was assigned to infiltrate Celtris III. Expert in Mok'bara. Father of Alexander Rozhenko.
Text: SECURITY Honor Navigation At [CAR]: SECURITY, Law. At [CAR]: Your other personnel present are STRENGTH +2.

Name: U.S.S. Cairo
Lore: Commanded by Edward Jellico prior to and following his temporary assignment to the U.S.S. Enterprise. Assigned to help defend Minos Korva in 2369.
Text: Tractor Beam At [CAR]: WEAPONS and SHIELDS +2.

Name: Vetar (Showdown: Four Lights)
Characteristics/ Keywords: Capturing-related card; Cardassian ship; Tractor Beam;
Lore: Cardassian warship commanded by Gul Evek. Often patrols the Demilitarized Zone. Attacked by the Maquis in 2370 until the U.S.S. Enterprise arrived.
Text: Tractor Beam. WEAPONS and SHIELDS +2 while you have a captive.

Name: Deadly Donation
Lore: A surprise encounter with the Vidiians can leave you desperately gasping for breath.
Text: Place on mission. Now and at start of each attempt here, stops one personnel present (random selection). [Vid] personnel on ships in this quadrant may "steal organs" from cards on this planet's surface (as if present).

Name: Superior Surgical Knowledge
Text: Seeds or plays on table. You may not draw cards on your turns (except your normal card draw). If you are playing only [Vid]: Each time an opponent draws a card (except their normal card draw), you may draw a card. You may also do this each time an opponent converts a card draw into a download or downloads a personnel.

Name: Superior Surgical Techniques
Text: Seeds or plays on table. If you are playing only [Vid]: When opponent plays a third personnel on their first turn or since the end of their last turn: you may play a [Vid] personnel. A fourth: you may play any card. A fifth (or more): you may play any card OR download a [Vid] personnel.

Name: The Search for Spares
Text: Seed one on an opponent's mission during the mission phase. Personnel you play must be [Vid]. At the start of your first turn, you may download Organ Bank here, with up to {3 % [Vid] personnel} that do not have a DL/ and {Vidiian Harvester} aboard; if you do, draw no cards and play no other ships or personnel that turn. Opponent may initiate battle against {Organ Bank}.

Name: Think Tank Assistance
Lore: By 2375, the Vidiian Sodality had employed the services of the Think Tank to cure the phage which had afflicted them for millennia. "You would hardly recognize them now."
Text: Seeds on {Vidiia}. Your personnel and ships with "Think Tank" in title or lore become [Vid]. Your personnel with "Think Tank" in lore may attempt this mission.

Name: Herd and Harvest
Lore: The Vidiian Sodality tactically coordinates attacks to drive targets toward ambush sites.
Text: Plays on a mission that your opponent just finished attempting. Move one of your [Vid] ships towards this mission (using its RANGE), then opponent's cards here are stopped.

Name: Honatta
Lore: Vidiian tasked with retrieval of the necessary organs to ensure the survival of key cultural figures within the Sodality.
Text: Once every turn, place a personnel from opponent's discard pile out-of-play to add one [*] or DL/ from that personnel to your [Vid] personnel (two if that [Vid] is {Dereth}) until end of turn.

Name: Alter History
Lore: Intercept enemy vessel and transport temporal agent to vessel's past.
Text: Treachery + Archaeology + ENGINEER Once every turn, may ignore [AU] when reporting a card here. Opponent's side: No gametext.

Name: Enhance Treatment Research
Lore: Boost academic resources of hospital complex by providing advanced medical knowledge.
Text: MEDICAL + Exobiology + SCIENCE + Physics *+5 if a Klingon or Think Tank personnel helps solve.

Name: Raid Encampment
Lore: Attack poorly defended settlement to secure vital resources.
Text: SECURITY x2 + Leadership + Exobiology When you solve, may download an [Objective] to hand.

Name: Rebuild Society
Lore: Renew cultural highlights on the Vidiian homeworld, ravaged by the phage for millennia.
Text: Leadership + Anthropology + INTEGRITY>28 * +5 if a Think Tank personnel helps solve.

Name: Respond to Distress Call
Lore: Provide medical assistance while avoiding hostile vessels.
Text: MEDICAL + ENGINEER + (Honor x2 OR Treachery x2) * +10 if solving crew has double mission requirements.

Name: Bridon
Lore: Representative of Vidiian security guards on Avery III. Often worked with Maleth. He briefly encountered Chakotay, Tuvok, and Harry Kim in 2371.
Text: SECURITY Transporter Skill Diplomacy

Name: Chakotay (Lifesigns)
Lore: Disguised human working covertly to locate B'Elanna Torres, Tom Paris, and Peter Durst on Avery III. His freshly grafted face allowed him to pass undetected.
Text: OFFICER Anthropology x 2 Archaeology Honor Law Exobiology

Name: Daughter of Miral
Lore: Searching for a cure to the phage, Sulan reconstituted the genome of B'Elanna Torres, making her a fully Klingon specimen by removing her human half.
Text: V.I.P. Computer Skill Honor SECURITY DL/ {Rescue Captives} May coexist with {Lt. Torres}.

Name: Lt. Torres
Lore: Searching for a cure to the phage, Sulan reconstituted the genome of B'Elanna Torres, making her a fully human specimen by removing her Klingon half.
Text: ENGINEER Computer Skill Astrophysics Transporter Skill Cybernetics May coexist with {Daughter of Miral}.

Name: Monala
Lore: One of many Vidiians exploring new territory in 2377, following the cure of the phage. She was romantically involved with the con artist Gar.
Text: MEDICAL Biology Youth

Name: Saneel
Lore: Typical freelance organ smuggler. Reformed thief, now employed by Nadirum. He extracted postnatal tissue samples from Samantha Wildman.
Text: CIVILIAN Honor Smuggling Computer Skill

Name: Organ Bank
Lore: Vidiian Cruiser retrofitted for long-range organ collection, preservation, and dispatch.
Text: Tractor Beam. You may download {Vidiian Boarding Claw} once.

Name: Hyper-thermic Charges
Text: Attack: 1. Defense: 1. ATTACK and DEFENSE bonus +2 if you have a [Vid] ship firing. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Hull: -20% Harvest organs: Randomly kills one personnel; if unique, opponent may report a % [Vid] personnel.

Name: Help Out a Forty-Niner?
Lore: Data encountered poverty and vagrancy upon arrival in 19th century San Francisco. "I require large amounts of whiskey."
Text: To get past requires exactly 7 personnel at this mission OR a personnel with printed INTEGRITY 7, CUNNING 7, and STRENGTH 7 OR a non-zero score evenly divisible by 7 OR exactly 7 cards in hand. May nullify by losing 7 points.

Name: Q: A Road in a Desert
Lore: An asylum hearing for Quinn resulted in the unusual step of visiting the Q Continuum. This required translating life in the Continuum into something that outsiders could understand.
Text: Away Team has a {Q-Flash} with X cards from opponent's Q-Continuum, where X = 1 + the number of cards in your hand. Discard dilemma. (Immune to {Q2}.)

Name: Unfamiliar Reflection
Lore: A parasite blocked Jonathan Archer forming new memories. Eventually he awoke to a mirror image that was not his own.
Text: Unless you have CUNNING>10X, where X is the number of different card types removed from this game, opponent may download {Humanity's Last Stand} to each of your undamaged ships here. Discard dilemma.

Name: Whisked Away
Lore: Many vessels were suddenly transported across the galaxy to the Delta Quadrant by the Caretaker. Those crews would have to decide between settling down or making a long trek home.
Text: Seeds or plays on your [DQ] outpost (except [Fed] or [Non]). Your matching % personnel and ships native to the Alpha Quadrant and without DL/ must report as if they were [DQ].

Name: Terok Nor (Alternate Universe Twilight)
Lore: Newly constructed ore processing facility built during the Cardassian occupation of Bajor. Frequent target for sabotage and bombing by the Bajoran resistance.
Text: Plays at {2346 Bajor}. Only ships and personnel native to this timeline may report here.

Name: A New Earth
Lore: The 37's' human descendants offered a tempting new home.
Text: Seeds on {Gamma Briori VII}; you must download a % outpost here (ignoring ENGINEER requirement); it gains [AU] and [DQ]; place incident on outpost. Once each turn, a matching personnel reporting aboard may do so for free. You may not play personnel for free with {Home Away From Home}.

Name: The Destruction of Earth
Text: Plays on {2166 Ceti Alpha V}; remove all cards in your discard pile from this game. When you would discard a card, remove it from this game instead. At the start of each of your turns, if you are playing only [Sta] (ignoring [Non]), you may draw a card. Once each turn, if you did not seed a Sector 001 mission, one personnel native to this time location may play for free.

Name: Vorta Scenario Testing
Lore: In 2371, Vorta scientists created scenarios to test how Alpha Quadrant species would respond to Dominion attempts to gain a foothold on the other side of the Bajoran Wormhole.
Text: Seeds or plays on your [Dom] facility. Your [AU][Dom] cards may report here regardless of quadrant. You may download a [AU][Dom] card here once.

Name: Plot Twist
Lore: The novel Hotel Royale was filled with shallow characters caught up in a web of crime, corruption, and deceit.
Text: Plays when a Royale Casino dilemma is revealed. Relocate up to 3 personnel with "Royale" in lore (or, once per game, download one such personnel) there. OR Plays to cancel a just-initiated personnel battle involving such a personnel.

Name: Assist Temporal Disruption
Lore: Support Devidian foragers' efforts to steal human neural energy from 19th century Earth.
Text: Physics + SCIENCE + (Treachery x2 OR temporal agent) You may seed one {Devidian Door} on table in facility phase.

Name: Detain Observer
Lore: Intercept unauthorized presence.
Text: OFFICER x2 + SECURITY OR Leadership x2 + CUNNING>30

Name: Make New Home
Lore: Join colony descended from displaced Alpha Quadrant inhabitants.
Text: Anthropology + Archaeology + 2 Honor

Name: Admiral Nechayev
Lore: Human virtual player in the Vorta scenario testing the resolve of Alpha Quadrant species. She was willing to hand Bajor to the Dominion as the price of peace.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy OFFICER Leadership Opponent's Honor personnel present are attributes all -1.

Name: Axel Melhardt
Lore: Typical human survivor who relocated to Ceti Alpha V in an alternate timeline. He worked with Consultant Phlox to remove Jonathan s parasites. Loves jazz.
Text: ENGINEER Archaeology Music If your discard pile is empty: Diplomacy, MEDICAL.

Name: Basso Tromac
Lore: Bajoran collaborator and aide to Prefect Dukat during the Occupation. He recruited comfort women for the Cardassian officers stationed on Terok Nor.
Text: CIVILIAN Treachery Biology Anthropology SCIENCE May download a [Univ] Bajoran-species female once.

Name: Captain Reed
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Captain; Ceti Alpha V-related card; Male;
Lore: Newly promoted human commander of the Intrepid, taking over from Captain Ramirez. He was Captain Tucker's first officer. Defends the Ceti Alpha V colony.
Text: OFFICER SECURITY Honor DL/ {Question Intruder} If your discard pile is empty: Diplomacy, Leadership.

Name: Captain T'Pol
Characteristics/ Keywords: Vulcan; Captain; Ceti Alpha V-related card; Female; Nurse;
Lore: Vulcan who commanded Enterprise. She settled on Ceti Alpha V and became a nurse for Jonathan.
Text: OFFICER SCIENCE Mindmeld Diplomacy When reported, if your discard pile is empty, gains all skills from requirements of a dilemma removed from this game.

Name: Captain Tucker
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Captain; Ceti Alpha V-related card; Male;
Lore: Former chief engineer who became commander of NX-01 Enterprise. One of the few surviving humans. He swore to protect Ceti Alpha V better than Earth.
Text: OFFICER ENGINEER Leadership May download {Tinkerer} (if your discard pile is empty) twice.

Name: Consultant Phlox
Characteristics/ Keywords: Denobulan; Ceti Alpha V-related card; Male;
Lore: Denobulan doctor. Returned home to research a cure for Jonathan after Earth was destroyed. He travelled to Ceti Alpha V in 2166 with a potential treatment.
Text: V.I.P. MEDICAL Exobiology x 2 X = number of different card types removed from this game.

Name: Founder Borath
Lore: Vorta virtual player in the scenario testing of Alpha Quadrant species, where he posed as a founder.
Text: SCIENCE MEDICAL Computer Skill Treachery Diplomacy Opponent discards top card of draw deck for each [AU][Dom] personnel that enters play here (twice each turn).

Name: Jonathan
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Ceti Alpha V-related card; Male;
Lore: Human living on Ceti Alpha V. Commanded NX-01 Enterprise. Parasites block him forming new memories.
Text: CIVILIAN Honor x 2 When reported, draw a card. Anthropology Reports for free to {any T'Pol}.

Name: Legate Parek
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Gul; Legate; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Former gul visiting Terok Nor in 2346. He has seen Prefect Dukat staging many acts of protection with his preferred Bajoran comfort women.
Text: V.I.P. Diplomacy Archaeology Once each turn, may gain a skill from a female present until end of turn.

Name: Lieutenant Sato
Characteristics/ Keywords: Human; Ceti Alpha V-related card; Female;
Lore: Human who escaped to Ceti Alpha V. She is now one of the most experienced of Captain Tucker's crew.
Text: OFFICER Anthropology Honor SCIENCE Law Navigation Leadership Diplomacy

Name: Prefect Dukat
Characteristics/ Keywords: Cardassian; Gul; Male; Terok Nor-related personnel;
Lore: Gul who took command of Terok Nor in 2346. He was romantically involved with Kira Meru. Asked Investigator Odo to solve the chemist shop murder.
Text: V.I.P. Leadership Diplomacy OFFICER Treachery {A Better Alternative} gains [Shield].

Name: The Assistant Manager
Lore: Employee of the Royale Casino. He previously studied for many careers such as lawyer, cardiologist, and dentist before deciding on management.
Text: CIVILIAN Law Leadership Draw a card when a {Royale Casino} dilemma is revealed.

Name: NX-01 Enterprise
Lore: Starfleet flagship. Failed to prevent the Xindi from destroying Earth. Now leads a rag-tag fugitive fleet defending humanity's settlement on Ceti Alpha V.
Text: X = number of different card types that have been removed from this game.

Name: Humanity's Last Stand
Text: Attack: 2. Defense: 2. DEFENSE bonus +1 for each tactic that has been removed from this game. Hit = [Flip][Flip]. Direct hit = [Flip][Flip][Flip][Flip]. Remove this tactic from this game. Hull: -25% Drive off: May not initiate battle at {Ceti Alpha V}.

Name: Singha Refugee Camp
Lore: The Cardassian Union occupied Bajor, leaving the natives with few resources.
Text: Seeds or plays on table; any player may download [AU] {Terok Nor} here. Any player may seed {Process Ore} on {Ore Processing Unit} here. Personnel affected by {Comfort Women} played on {Bajor} gain [AU]. Native to this timeline: [AU][Baj] and [AU][Car] cards native to the Alpha Quadrant, [DS9][Car] personnel with "Terok Nor" in lore or [Stf], and [Univ][Car] ships.

Name: Survivors' Settlement
Lore: Fewer than 6,000 humans escaped here after the Xindi destroyed Earth.
Text: Seeds or plays on table; any player may download {The Destruction of Earth}. Your [22] personnel may attempt {Ceti Alpha V}. Native to this timeline: all [Univ][22] humans and ships (including [MQ]), unique [22] cards with "Ceti Alpha V" in lore, and [22][Equipment]. All such cards are compatible. Human cards are excluded from battle here (except versus [Xin]).

Name: Dala
Lore: Humanoid con artist, thief, and liar who impersonated Kathryn Janeway. She took advantage of the Federation's trustworthy reputation for personal gain.
Text: OFFICER Diplomacy Computer Skill SCIENCE Treachery Greed Acquisition

Name: Derran Tal
Lore: Varro dissident who became romantically involved with Harry Kim. She designed a synthetic parasite to attack and dismantle the Varro's generational ship.
Text: CIVILIAN Stellar Cartography Biology ENGINEER If with {Harry Kim}, both are attributes all +2.
